jobText: TXT/50657547.txt	§Case Management Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Management Specialist§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§9 Month Fixed Term Contract + Competitive Salary§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19, with our recruitment process now fully conducted virtually. As a business we have moved to a working from home environment until it is safe for all employees to return to our offices.§§Do you have case management background and passion for helping people? §§Establish and maintain effective relationships to support our injured worker§§9 Month Fixed Term Contract§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation and Personal Injury Claims Management business§. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through ongoing support during their return to work journey. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having §over 2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees§ ensuring a long-term career here at EML.§§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Melbourne,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§The purpose of this Case Management Specialist role is to pro-actively and effectively manage claims within the legislation or policy and achieve compliance with the performance measures.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of clients§Ensure that active and timely intervention occurs to help improve return to work outcomes§Provide advice to stakeholders such as clients, employers and providers§Assist the client with the claim process and providing support in the completion of relevant documents§Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome for clients§§ABOUT YOU§§Experience or exposure to personal injury and or case management§Previous allied health background would be advantageous but not essential§High attention to detail and organizational skills§Effective communication and conflict resolution skills§Negotiation and influencing§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals. §EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite Learning and Development Team§End of Month Celebration Events§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. As part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact §Katherine Romano§ on §03 7000 0935§ or on email at §k.romano@eml.com.au§.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50587292.txt	§General Insurance Broker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Insurance Broker§§Advertiser: §Confio Insurance Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§We’re looking for the future insurance broker of the year.§ §Work alongside the Managing Director§ §Modern office environment§ §Competitive salary package§ §About Us§ §At Confio Insurance, we’re in the business of transforming the landscape of insurance advice for fast-growing and innovative small to medium businesses. What sets us apart from our competitors is the human touch we bring to providing clients with technical insurance advice. We are relationship driven and leverage our connections with insurance partners to ensure our clients are provided with a market leading service. We exist to empower Australian business growth by providing market leading value, choice and advice they can trust. We like to end the day knowing we put a smile on a business owner’s face.§ §About You§ §We are looking for an experienced General Insurance Broker who is hungry to pick up new business whilst managing a portfolio of renewal clients. Confidence, leadership qualities, and strong people skills are essential.§ §Experienced§: Has at least 4+ years of insurance experience at a reputable firm or company, with expertise in general insurance products.§ §Business savvy§: Excited to disrupt the insurance game and support business growth with innovative marketing.§ §Efficient§: Prioritises effectively and focuses on what matters; smashes it out, then goes home.§ §Collaboration§: Thrives on collaboration but can work independently.§ §Always positive§: Loves assisting clients and providing an amazing experience every time.§ §Growth mindset§: Values personal and professional development; owns their work; loves responsibility.§ §Reach Out§ §If this sounds like you, send your resume and a cover letter (include why you would like to work for Confio Insurance) to §info@confioinsurance.com§ § § §Please note you must have the right to work in Australia to apply. § §We do not wish to outsource the recruitment of this role.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of insurance broking experience do you have?§Have you completed a qualification in insurance broking?§§§

jobTitle: Client Manager Job in Launceston & North East - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701688.txt	§Client Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Manager§§Advertiser: §Aon Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Launceston & North East§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Client Manager, Launceston § §Do you want to be an integral part of large Tasmanian organisation’s business success?§ §Do you want to develop your skills in bringing innovative risk solutions to large clients?§ §Established team with a broad and varied portfolio of clients§ §The Opportunity§ § § §As a key leader in our Tasmanian business based in Launceston, your role will be focusing on managing existing relationships with large and influential Tasmanian clients across a broad cross section of industries. You will also lead the identification of new client opportunities to drive continued growth and profitability within Tasmania.  As a strong key client manager, you will also mentor and develop a team through providing ongoing training and support.     § § § §Key focus responsibilities will include: § §Key client leadership and management responsibilities including a portfolio of large key Tasmanian organisations.§ §Growing your portfolio through pro-active methods § §Leading, coaching and motivating team members in conjunction with your Hobart peers.§ §Proactively marketing to clients, identifying opportunities and designing appropriate service strategies§ §About you§ § § §A highly motivated, approachable and consultative insurance professional, you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your innovative risk solution skills with large clients, hone your leadership capabilities and have a positive impact as a key risk and insurance adviser within the local area.  To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § § §Demonstrable experience in the commercial and corporate insurance sector, preferably broking, with knowledge across a broad range of product classes § §Excellent networking and relationship management skills allowing you to embed yourself within the local community§ §Sales and business development drive and capability, from lead generation to deal closure§ §Passionate about leading a high performing culture and empowering the team around you§ §Previous key client management experience including any of the following; risk management, insurance program development and experience with presenting to key client stakeholders (including board of directors)§ §Well developed and proven communication skills§ § §Aon Culture & Benefits§ § §With close to 1600 employees, we are the largest organisation of our kind in Australia. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people working across 120 countries. This allows us to gather the best thinking from around the world and deliver solutions locally. We provide colleagues with the support to make an impact, a team that will inspire you to achieve, and on-going opportunities for development.§ § §How to apply§ § §To express your interest in this role, apply online today.§ § §Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.   § § §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50706179.txt	§Claims Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Consultant§§Advertiser: §CHU Underwriting Agencies Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About CHU§ §CHU is part of the Steadfast Group; a top 200 ASX-listed company with $7 billion in total billings is the largest general insurance broker network and group of underwriting agencies in Australasia. Our policies are underwritten by QBE Insurance (Australia) Ltd, one of Australia’s most secure insurance companies.§ §We are one of Australia’s largest and most awarded insurance underwriting agencies. Our point of difference is that we offer comprehensive insurance, so our customers don’t need to purchase ‘optional extras’. We protect almost 1 million apartments, units and townhouses across Australia, with almost half a trillion value insured. We are multi-award winners: back to back winners of the Underwriting Agency of the Year Award 2017 – 2018, Insurance Business Gold Award winner 2016 – 2018, and 2019 winner of ANZIIF Excellence in Workplace Diversity and Inclusion.§ §Working with CHU§ §When you join CHU, you will join a friendly and supportive team, committed to providing our customers with an outstanding service. To reward you, we offer:§ § §An inclusive and flexible work environment. We are currently working from home but our offices are open if required!§ §Competitive salary packaging and excellent benefits.§ §Ongoing coaching and feedback, including bi-monthly formal feedback sessions with your Manager.§ §Offices close to Cafes, Shops and Public Transport.§ §About the role§ §As a Claims Consultant you will work within the QLD Claims Team focusing on end-to-end claims management, driving outstanding customer experience and delivering market leading claims service through quality technical response. § §The position is diverse, and includes the following key elements:§ § §Ensure the delivery of a "Concierge" claims service on every claims (in accordance with company standards.§ §Consistently delivery of  a "phone first" approach to your designated claims.§ §Manage a portfolio of technical first party strata claims.§ §Manage all claims within agreed workflow timeframes.§ §Ensure regular and accurate reporting is provided to the Claims Managers as requested.§ §Assist where possible any overflow of claims matters from other branches (which may occur in circumstances such as CAT).§ §Providing risk insights and guidance to the Underwriting team.§ §The successful applicant will have the following traits and experience:§ § §Minimum 2 years property claims experience, preferably strata.§ §Sound working knowledge of claims operations and understanding of quality service standards.§ §Strong problem solving and ability to think analytically.§ §Comprehensive experience in dealing with loss adjusters, repairers, brokers, strata managers etc.§ §Demonstrated high level of organisational and time management skills.§ §ANZIIF Cert IV or equivalent (or working towards), desirable but not essential.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

This role calls for an individual with strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver high quality service to our brokers, maintain and develop strong business relationships and make quality underwriting decisions around our Mobile Plant and Liability portfolio. §Due to COVID-19 our Melbourne team is currently working from home (WFH), for the foreseeable future. customers are supported through their claim experience.§        §An opportunity now exists within our Retail Distribution division for an experienced Technical Development Manager to join our -General Insurance claims team and play an important role working as part of  the leadership team in enhancing the unit's customer service and cost effective claims management delivery.§        §The General Insurance Technical Development Manager (TDM) Technical Excellence is responsible for driving the units technical knowledge development and providing support in the delivery of accurate, cost effective and timely claims management that includes adhering to relevant codes of conduct, legislation and regulatory requirements, identifying relevant training needs for unit, in particular, Claims Technical Leads.§        §Reporting to the Senior Manager, General Insurance Claims, you will be responsible for:§        §          §Leading, coaching and empowering a claims Technical and Quality implementation of new processes, technology and cost reduction initiatives.§          §Developing and managing a Quality Assurance programme.§        §        §The role will provide you with a significant level of autonomy and in this we are seeking someone with a proactive approach to their work, a relentless focus on providing a quality service to our customers and a real passion and understanding for the effective management of technical claims.§        §Compliance is a further responsibility of this role to ensure adherence to Allianz internal policy/process and relevant legislation. §        §To be successful in this role, you must demonstrate: §‎§        §          §Strong people leadership experience§          §Demonstrated capability in process review and change jobText: TXT/50680811.txt	§Administrative Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrative Assistant§§Advertiser: §Berrill & Watson§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§About the business and the role§ § §We're a law firm in Moonee Ponds of about 30 staff that acts for everyday people in accessing their superannuation and insurance entitlements. The successful candidate will receive on the job training in superannuation and insurance claims by our experienced staff. We want a junior assistant that can work independently and takes a genuine interest in the well-being of the people that they are assisting and takes a genuine interest in being the best they can be. You need to have strong administrative and communication skills.§ § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § §A range of admin duties, including writing letters and filing. Speaking to our clients, as well as to super funds and insurers. You must be a strong communicator, well organised and able to multi-task.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §We want people who can speak to people. We want people that can get on with others and we want people that want to work hard, are organised and have energy and enthusiasm.§ § §Job benefits and perks§ § §Good on the job training . We offer free car-parking nearby, a relaxed "non-corporate" (but professional) workplace, on the job training in superannuation and insurance claims and room for autonomy and independence in the role. We don't micromanage, but expect that you will do the job well because you want to get great outcomes for our clients. We expect our staff to work hard. Most of our administrative assistants are trained and, over time, are promoted to the role of law clerk.§ §We are all working from home at the moment, but hope to be back in the office soon.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an administration officer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50627369.txt	§Broker Support / Assistant Account Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Broker Support / Assistant Account Executive§§Advertiser: §Nexus Risk Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Nexus Risk Services is a well-established and growing business in the insurance and risk management industry with branches across Australia. We provide a range of insurance broking products and risk services to our clients.§  §Driving the organisation is a firm commitment to building lasting client relationships and achieving standards of excellence in insurance broking. §  §We are now looking for a talented person to join one of our successful teams in our West Perth office. If you're ready to extend your insurance knowledge and apply your skills of exceptional customer service and assisting with new business opportunities, then we encourage you to apply.§  §You will be responsible for:§ § §Supporting the broking team by preparing insurance documentation;§ §Attending to client queries and prioritising effectively;§ §Developing strong relationships with clients and insurers; and§ §Assisting in lodging and managing claims efficiently and accurately.§ §You will possess:§ § §Initiative to deliver optimal outcomes for all stakeholders;§ §Excellent attention to detail and be well organised;§ §A 'can do' approach to your work environment;§ §5 years experience in an insurance brokerage role or similar;§ §Tier 1 accreditation; and§ §Possess CBS knowledge (preferable).§ §Working at Nexus you'll receive:§ § §A competitive salary package;§ §Salary continuance insurance;§ §Travel insurance, and§ §Support for further training & development.§ §This role presents an excellent opportunity to work as part of a successful team and to be encouraged and supported to build upon your existing skills.§  §This is a full time position. You must have the right to work in Australia.§  §Apply via Seek and please include a covering letter and your resume.§  §Please email your questions to Ainji Russell at §hr@nexusrisk.com.au§.§  §Due to the volume of interest, we apologise that unsuccessful applicants may not be notified.§  §We encourage you to apply by the 31 October 2020, however, we may close the search earlier if we find the right person to join Nexus.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a RG146 insurance broking accreditation?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Portfolio Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692986.txt	§Senior Portfolio Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Portfolio Analyst§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § §The Opportunity at AIA§ . § § §Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Project Management Office, you will play a critical role to support the operation of the PMO functions to ensure all projects/programs meet governance, reporting and execution needs.§ § §In this role, you will ensure all projects are successfully monitored, documented, tracked, reported, integrated and implemented. As well as supporting and coaching program, project managers and scrum masters and other business stakeholders, helping them navigate PMO processes and expectations.  This role can be filled in Melbourne or Sydney.§ § §Key priorities for this role § § §Provide governance and control support, ensuring project plan and associated deliverables are completed according to the PMO methodologies and standards§ § § §Develop and maintain portfolio roadmap, plans and milestone charts§ § § §Support the execution of the PMO governance, reporting and review framework to provide a holistic view of all organisational project activity§ § § §Ensure deployment release calendars are updated and maintained§ § § §Establish and maintain stakeholder relationships through effective communication, negotiation and issues management§ § § §Timely compilation of reports including analysis and drafting commentary/executive summary of analysis outcomes§ § § §Manage the portfolio tracking and reporting function§ § § §Facilitate governance and the PMO related meetings and forums§ § § §Develop and deliver training materials, as required§ § § §Provide PMO coordination, support, secretariat and advisory services as required§ § § §Assist the Portfolio Master Scheduler to develop portfolio scheduling management of interdependencies and reporting across the portfolio§ § § §Work closely with the respective projects/programs document and ensure application of learnings from projects to enhance ongoing delivery of the portfolio§ § § §To be successful in this role you will have § § §Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources or Information Systems§ § § §PMO and/or Project management certification (PMI, Prince2, P3O etc.)§ § § §Extensive experience working in a large PMO environment in a similar role. Experience in financial services/insurance industry§ § § §Strong analytical and communication skills§ § § §Good understand and experience (preferable) in both Waterfall and Agile principles and practices, including an understanding of the value of individuals and interactions over processes and tools§ § § §Experience and demonstrated understanding of iterative development, software development cycle and methodology and delivery§ § § §Strong stakeholder management at all levels, helping them navigate PMO processes and expectations§ § § §Applications close Tuesday 20th October. § § §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§ § §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§ § § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  §  § We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§  § We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§  § We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobTitle: Change Release Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50715380.txt	§Change Release Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Release Manager§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § §The Opportunity at AIA§ . § § §Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Portfolio Change, Optimisation & Change Capability, you will play a central and critical role in planning and governing the release of changes across the organisation.  § § §You will help to drive great adoption and support of changes through your leadership and governance of relevant change forums, including the People Leader Forums.  You will enjoy collaborating with key organisation stakeholders to support leader-led BAU and project change across the organisation, and to ensure congruency of timing and messaging.  This role can be filled in Melbourne or Sydney.§ § §Key priorities for this role § § §Work with the Heads of Portfolio Change across the team in order to gather, clarify and accurately represent the BAU and project initiatives planned across each business unit§ § § §Maintain a clear and well organized calendar of activities to support all stakeholders in delivering change packages/parcels§ § § §Work closely with the Head of Portfolio Change, Optimisation and Change Capability to refine and drive the effectiveness of leader-led change throughout the organisation§ § § §Engage and equip key executive and senior leaders to sponsor and support change forums in order to drive greater adoption and support of changes throughout the organisation§ § § §Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organisation in order to deliver the change messages in the right way and at the right time, including but not limited to those within communications, Organisational Development (OD), brand and strategy.§ § § §Refine any change materials to ensure they are fit for purpose for the target audience§ § § §Review the approach for delivering change within the organisation and ensure we adapt to an evolving environment§ § § §Manage and drive agile change operating rhythms across the Optimisation & Change portfolio to support sharing of key activities, showcasing of best practice and ongoing capability development for our team§ § § §To be successful in this role you will have § § §Formal Business qualification, ideally a degree or specialist communications/change management higher education qualification§ § § §Extensive experience in change management (including lean change)§ § § §Demonstrated experience designing and implementing change management§ § § §Proven experience working with a range of senior stakeholders§ § § §Strong experience in developing management reporting§ § § §Strong experience in organising data from multiple sources and arranging into a logical format§ § § §Experience in establishing new operating models and frameworks§ § § §Supporting communications and change for company mergers and acquisitions or large scale organisation transformations§ § § §Applications close Friday 16th October.§ § §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§ § §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§ § § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  §  § We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§  § We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§  § We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50695444.txt	§Risk Officer - Insurable Risk Advisory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk Officer - Insurable Risk Advisory§§Advertiser: §VMIA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§Risk Officer – Insurable Risk Advisory at VMIA§  §2 X Positions – 1 X Ongoing and 1 X Max Term until 30 June 2021§  §VMIA is the Victorian Government’s insurer and risk adviser, covering the people, places and projects that help Victorians thrive. From iconic cultural institutions, major infrastructure, public schools and hospitals, to emergency services and not for profits, our clients are diverse but united in their ambition to make a positive impact in our community. We share this ambition.§  §Your role§  §Your role will be to support the Insurable Risk Advisory team in working across all relevant client segments and providing relationship management support to our agency clients; contributing to account management and client service plan processes. In addition, you will be supporting the delivery of insurable risk advice to our Victorian public sector clients so that they’re not unconsciously uninsured.§  §With support and coaching, you will be responsible for developing trusted relationships through an empathetic and supportive approach for the delivery of strategic advisory services to clients; supporting our clients to manage their risk by building risk management capability and risk maturity.§  §This great opportunity would suit someone who is enthusiastic about providing high level support and wanting to expand on their understanding of the Insurable risk portfolio. In this role you will also get the opportunity to work closely with our State-wide and Enterprise Risk Advisory functions to ensure the best possible client experience, further strengthening the VMIA brand.§  §Your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Develop trusted relationships through empathy and support the delivery of strategic advisory services to clients.§ §Provide relationship management support to our agency clients and contribute to account management and client service plan processes.§ §Provide transactional insurance services to support the ongoing maintenance of cover for clients – including enquiries, renewal, ministerial directions, machinery of government changes, new policies, endorsements, debt management and general support services.§ §Under guidance, support the delivery of an end-to-end insurable risk advisory service, from needs analysis to insurance placement – helping our clients reduce the likelihood and consequences of insurable events.§ §Adhere to a quality assurance process for insurable risk services.§ §Actively monitor client feedback via formal and informal channels, and continually improve services.§ §What we’re looking for§ § §2-3 years’ experience in an insurance, risk management and or financial roles.§ §You have or are working towards a relevant tertiary qualification.§ §You might also hold professional membership with a risk management, insurance or relevant organisation.§ §Previous experience of working in public sector, community or not-for-profit in a risk management role (advantageous) would be advantageous.§ §Previous experience of working in Health sector and or General Government (desirable).§ §Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Project, SharePoint and Visio.§ §Excellent organisation skills and no problems adapting to changing needs and deadlines.§ §Confidence to work with stakeholders of all levels.§ §Quality conscious with attention to detail.§ §Experienced with multitasking and prioritising tasks.§ §‘Can do’ attitude, active team player and supportive mindset.§ §Collaborative, flexible with a strong interest in learning and building on your risk management mindset and have a conceptual understanding of risk management practices.§ §Highly developed communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and negotiate mutually beneficial outcomes.§ §Why work with us?§  §We’re known for our incredible culture and sense of community – and an § employee value proposition§ that makes our people proud.§  §We reward innovation, best practice thinking and collaboration. We are industry leaders in our diversity and inclusion work, are passionate about gender equality, and encourage and enable our people to bring their whole selves to work.§  §We were leaders in working flexibly even before COVID-19, and now operate successfully remotely, with a suite of events and activities to connect us even when we’re apart. In the future we’ll continue to work from where it makes sense to do so, in flexible working arrangements that works best for our people and our clients.§  §We offer programs, subsidies and leave options to support the wellbeing of our people as a top priority.§  §We invest in our people, ensuring your development and career growth is a priority.§  §How to apply§  §If you’d like to help make Victoria an even better place to live, we’d love to hear from you.§ § §attach your resume§ §attach a cover letter addressing your suitability for this role and why a role at VMIA appeals to you (§applications without a cover letter will not be considered§).§ §For more information, please see the § §position description§ §and contact Hanita Singh, Talent Acquisition Partner at §careers@vmia.vic.gov.au§, or visit our §careers page §  §Applications close COB Sunday 18 October 2020§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Do you have 2-3 years’ experience in an insurance, risk management and or financial roles?§Do you have pervious experience of working in public sector, community or not-for-profit in a risk management role?§Do you have previous experience of working in Health sector and or General Government?§§§

jobText: TXT/50644532.txt	§Claims Service Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Service Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Crawford and Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§About Crawford:§ §Crawford & Company is the world’s largest publicly listed independent provider of claims management solutions to the risk management and insurance industry. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§ §About the Role:§ §As a Claims Service Team Leader, you will be required to to support and assist in the delivery of a first class claims handling service – through the effective leadership of a team of high performing “Claims Service Consultants” and assist with client operations and with the development and ongoing improvement of operating procedures.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Lead, Guide and Mentor a team of Claims Service Consultants.§ §Champion and promote client workflow within the team and business.§ §In conjunction with the Service Centre/Business Unit Manager and Technical Leader (if applicable), assist in the learning, development and training of employees under your direct supervision.§ §Assisting in the development and implementation of standard work practices and standard operating procedures.§ §Managing escalations and implementing dispute resolution strategies.§ §Reviewing and managing operational performance (including but not limited to, adherence to client, Crawford, and industry KPI’s, service delivery, and quality), for which you are responsible.§ §Client relationship management which may include face-to-face meetings.§ §Associated ad-hoc administrative functions.§ §Providing constructive feedback in a structured way to direct reports, in an agreed frequency as directed by the Service Centre/Business Unit Manager, in a method consistent with Crawford & Company’s policies.§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of internal colleagues and external stakeholders– Customers, Clients, Brokers, and Suppliers. Occasional travel to other offices may be required. You may be required (as directed by the Service Centre/Business Unit Manager) to carry a case load.§ §You will also bring with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time and caseload management skills.§ §Requirements:§ §Experience/Knowledge:§ § §Leadership experience§ §Minimum of 5 years experience in a customer service environment/claims handling preferably General Property Insurance/ experience in a leadership position is preferred.§ §Personal Attributes:§ § § Good verbal and written communication skills§ §Strong analytical and mathematical ability§ §Strong organisational and interpersonal skills.§ §Professional & Responsible§ §Empathetic & Attention to detail§ §Team player & Ability to operate autonomously§ §Ability to work to deadlines§ §Technical Skills:§ § §Good organisational skills§ §Strong administration skills§ §Strong interpersonal skills including good communication skills§ §Proficient with MS Office§ §Analytical, numerate and accurate§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

While the role will be based in Brisbane which may have exposure to international projects and networks.§ § §Aon M&A is a global leader in M&A insurance solutions. We offer a broad range of due diligence and bespoke consultancy services, as well as specialised transactional liability consultancy and placement solutions.§ § §This is an opportunity to gain knowledge and experience across multiple industry sectors in the analysis of risk and translating that into risk and insurance programs for clients.§ § §As part of the Aon Client Services team, you will be responsible for:§ §Supporting Project Managers in delivering insurance advisory services§ §Assisting with the delivery of response to tenders§ §Co-ordination and management of information between internal and external stakeholders§ §Support and assist the risk analysis of the companies being acquired, design of new insurance programs and costings]§ §Completing risk and insurance Due Diligence reports§ § §About you:§ We are looking for someone who has a proven track-record within the Insurance and/or Risk Advisory sector, who has a keen interest, or background in, projects. jobText: TXT/50692793.txt	§Senior Portfolio Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Portfolio Analyst§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § § §The Opportunity at AIA§ §.§ § § § § §Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Project Management Office, you will play a critical role to support the operation of the PMO functions to ensure all projects/programs meet governance, reporting and execution needs.§ § § §In this role, you will ensure all projects are successfully monitored, documented, tracked, reported, integrated and implemented. As well as supporting and coaching program, project managers and scrum masters and other business stakeholders, helping them navigate PMO processes and expectations.  This role can be filled in Melbourne or Sydney.§ § § §Key priorities for this role § § § §Provide governance and control support, ensuring project plan and associated deliverables are completed according to the PMO methodologies and standards§ § § §Develop and maintain portfolio roadmap, plans and milestone charts§ § § §Support the execution of the PMO governance, reporting and review framework to provide a holistic view of all organisational project activity§ § § §Ensure deployment release calendars are updated and maintained§ § § §Establish and maintain stakeholder relationships through effective communication, negotiation and issues management§ § § §Timely compilation of reports including analysis and drafting commentary/executive summary of analysis outcomes§ § § §Manage the portfolio tracking and reporting function§ § § §Facilitate governance and the PMO related meetings and forums§ § § §Develop and deliver training materials, as required§ § § §Provide PMO coordination, support, secretariat and advisory services as required§ § § §Assist the Portfolio Master Scheduler to develop portfolio scheduling management of interdependencies and reporting across the portfolio§ § § §Work closely with the respective projects/programs document and ensure application of learnings from projects to enhance ongoing delivery of the portfolio§ § § § §To be successful in this role you will have § § § §Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources or Information Systems§ § § §PMO and/or Project management certification (PMI, Prince2, P3O etc.)§ § § §Extensive experience working in a large PMO environment in a similar role. Experience in financial services/insurance industry§ § § §Strong analytical and communication skills§ § § §Good understand and experience (preferable) in both Waterfall and Agile principles and practices, including an understanding of the value of individuals and interactions over processes and tools§ § § §Experience and demonstrated understanding of iterative development, software development cycle and methodology and delivery§ § § §Strong stakeholder management at all levels, helping them navigate PMO processes and expectations§ § § § §Applications close Tuesday 20th October. § § § §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§ § § §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§ § § § § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50630560.txt	§Client Service Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Service Partner§§Advertiser: §Maurice Blackburn Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Salary§§Attractive salary and benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §Client Service Partner §    §      §        §The Firm§        §Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors over a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.§        §About the Role§        §At Maurice Blackburn we proud of the team that we have created and have worked hard to be the largest Superannuation and Insurance claims team in Australia. Due to growth in this area, we are currently seeking Client Service Partners to join our team, located in Hamilton Hill.§        §The Claims team are passionate about helping everyday Australians gain access to their superannuation and other insurance entitlements. Most of our clients have been impacted by an injury or illness and face significant financial hardship. In this role you will be conducting client interviews over the phone or face to face to gather relevant information to assist the client in the claims process. jobText: TXT/50663809.txt	§Comcare Team Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Comcare Team Manager§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§Your Role§ § § §In this role you will provide day to day leadership, guidance and technical support to our Senior Case Managers.  The role is “hands on”, in that you will be undertaking initial Injured Worker Contacts and preparing claim determinations for Comcare Agencies.§ § § §As part of this role you will be responsible for developing a small team of 3 staff, providing motivation, direction, instructions and guidance of the team to achieve business and personal development goals. You will ensure the delivery of a customer focused, cost effective and professional claims service.§ § § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ § §Providing leadership and direction to the team to ensure delivery of KPI’s;§ §Observe and monitor and undertake quality assurance around claims processes, team performance trends and identify improvement opportunities or take remedial action to resolve issues identified;§ §Provide effective coaching and feedback to staff on technical and performance related issues;§ §Ensuring the delivery of an empathetic, caring and personalised customer experience;§ §Promoting a positive work environment;§ §Preparing Monthly Reports for Comcare; and§ §Ensure compliance with relevant legislation/regulations and policies.§ § § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ § §Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage with key stakeholders and staff to ensure the delivery of business objectives,§ §Knowledge of Comcare legislation/regulations,§ §Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills,§ §Excellent time management skills; with the ability to juggle multiple tasks,§ §Experience in coaching and mentoring staff, and§ §Proven ability to make sound decisions.§ § § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§ § §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §Flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive bonus§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation§ §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §The opportunity to work for an organisation that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ § § §A brief overview on GB:§ § § §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ § § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ § § §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ § § §To apply§ §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ §Click on Apply for this Job.§ § §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognize the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§ § § §To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applying.§ § § §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§§§§

You will be supporting a team of experienced technical underwriters to help the business achieve financial targets and profitability levels.§ § §Key responsibilities will include:§ §Providing administrative assistance to the senior underwriters at all stages of the underwriting process for the Motor Solutions portfolio§ §Distributing quotes, finalising schedules, management of bordereau and a range of other activities§ §Assist with gathering market intelligence that affects the key products, distribution, and potential growth§ §Building rapport with and providing a professional and effective service to intermediaries and key stakeholders§ § §About You:§ §A sound foundation of general insurance experience; exposure to underwriting and/ or commercial risk would be preferable but not essential§ §Strong communication skills and the ability to learn and understand technical matters quickly§ §Passion for customer service excellence and the ability to build, develop and maintain strong relationships§ §Strong teamwork and the drive to complete administrative tasks on time and to a high standard§ §Adaptability, resilience and flexibility are important, under-pinned by a strong work ethic § §Intermediate-advance user of Excel preferred along with other Microsoft Office products§ § §This is a great opportunity expand your skills and assist in achieving strategic business unit objectives in a period of growth and operational change. jobTitle: Trustee Administration Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50606207.txt	§Trustee Administration Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trustee Administration Specialist§§Advertiser: §CareSuper§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Fund Administration§§§§§§ §Are you an experienced Superannuation Administrator or Consultant looking for your next challenge?§ §Do you enjoy providing sound investigation and ownership of escalated queries?§ §Join our dedicated and talented Operations team!§CareSuper is an innovative and award-winning profit-to-member fund that puts members first in everything we do. We aim to be widely recognised as a leading fund that delivers superior outcomes for its professionally minded members.§If you've ever found yourself asking Can we do this better?' then you're exactly the kind of person we're looking for§The opportunity§An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced superannuation specialist to join our Operations team.  As a key contributor, you'll play an active role in providing administration expertise to the extended team and support delivery of excellent customer service.  Working with a diverse range of stakeholders, you'll have the opportunity to utilise your exceptional investigative and decision-making skills across a variety of areas including:§ §Managing complex member and employer inquiries and escalations via the operations inbox§ §Assisting the Operations team in the delivery and reporting of the monitoring program for Outsourced Providers§ §Completing phone call and email quality control checking including selection, review and follow up action§ §Assisting in the review and update of relevant communications such as PDS's, fact sheets, forms, website content, standard letters etc. as they relate to administration and ensure they are aligned with business rules, member experience and Fund Administrative processes§ §Utilising reporting tools to deliver analysis and insights relating to administration functions and performance§ §Improving member experience through the investigation and comprehensive resolution of complaints and incidents§What you'll bring§Ultimately, you are a self-starter and pride yourself on your ability to establish and maintain positive relationships.  Exceptional attention to detail, strong written and verbal communication skills as well as the ability to work under pressure are essential to thriving in this fast - paced role.  The ideal applicant will have:§ §Proven track record in a specialist superannuation administration, contact centre or similar role.§ §Strong solutions focused, analytical and problem-solving skills.§ §Excellent organisational skills with the ability to prioritise and manage the range of tasks required of this position.§ §An excellent working knowledge of/experience with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel & Microsoft Outlook.§ §Ability to communicate effectively with a range of staff and service providers.§ §An ability to research matters of a technical nature.§ §Able to work diligently, efficiently, and with accuracy paying close attention to detail.§ §Maintain current knowledge of superannuation and insurance by attending relevant seminars and conferences and meet RG 146 requirements.§Why CareSuper?§Apart from our status as a high-performing industry super fund and focus on providing high quality member customer service, we recognise that our staff are the drivers of our success. We are genuinely committed to delivering workplace diversity, sustainability and flexible working arrangements.§We also offer a diverse health and wellbeing program, extra paid leave and generous superannuation among many other staff benefits.§Apply now by sending your resume and cover letter to Louise Horszowski using the apply link.§Applicants must have the relevant work rights to be considered for an opportunity at CareSuper.§Agencies, please note: All vacancies are managed by our internal Human Resources Team. Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§§§

jobTitle: Client Executive - Real Estate Team Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665656.txt	§Client Executive - Real Estate Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Executive - Real Estate Team§§Advertiser: §Aon Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Unique opportunity to join a specialist nationwide insurance broking team§ §You will be in a hands-on client servicing role with the chance to develop your broking skills§ §This position will suit a dynamic people person with commercial or financial lines insurance experience § §The opportunity:§ We are looking for a positive and self-motivated team player who is keen to develop their insurance career and broking skills in our Real Estate broking team at Aon. This is a team in an exciting growth phase and will offer strong career development and growth for a motivated and driven individual.§ § §You will be part of a tight knit national team, ideally based in Melbourne, with the option to be based in Sydney, Parramatta or Perth.§  § Key responsibilities will include:§ §Managing a portfolio of Real Estate clients, responding to client’s new insurance quotes, service queries, claims, and renewals§ §You will actively manage your portfolio by developing long term relationships, and promoting additional services for your client’s businesses through your existing portfolio of clients and inbound leads generated from a variety of different channels including Industry associations and other referral partners. inbound, and some outbound, activity§ §Your day will be fast paced and varied, including; policy administration, team meetings, CRM system management for your clients and liaising with insurers on more challenging placements.§ §Collaborating with our Sales & Marketing teams to roll-out new business and cross-sell campaigns to promote our products & the Aon brand§ §Providing insight and input into new product development with the Aon broking team.§ §Opportunity also exists to participate on projects and other more strategic tasks from time to time and as appropriate.§ § §About you:§ That you are somewhat of a self-starter, highly client service focused, a great team player, and very driven to achieve your goals. An interest in the Real Estate sector would be beneficial, alongside having;§ § §Relevant financial lines or commercial insurance experience. Strong financial lines experience is highly desired.§ §A comparable sales / service focussed background, perhaps in broking, claims or underwriting. Diversity is the foundation on which we have built our world-class organization, unparalleled in delivering distinctive value through the work we do.§ § §We embrace an inclusive culture where our people trust each other, respect diversity and share ideas freely.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50669523.txt	§Corporate Enterprise Risk Management Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Enterprise Risk Management Officer§§Advertiser: §Moreton Bay Regional Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§$89,006 + 12% Super + 9 day fortnight§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Corporate Enterprise Risk Management Officer §      §        §Moreton Bay Regional Council is Australia's third largest local government, conveniently located between the Brisbane CBD and the Sunshine Coast.§        §          §            §              §The Moreton Bay Region is a diverse area, spanning more than 2000 square kilometres and boasting everything from rural townships to urban centres, coastal villages and thriving business precincts – We've Got It All.§              §Moreton Bay Regional Council employs more than 1700 staff dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 425,000 residents. We encourage you to apply to join council's team and help make a difference to one of South-East Queensland's fastest growing urban areas.  §              §The §Governance and Executive Services Department§ plays a central and coordinating role in Council, providing expert advice and administrative support to the Chief Executive Officer, elected members and the wider organisation on a range of complex legislative and integrity matters. The Department is also responsible for leading the delivering initiatives to support strong local governance and supports Council to deliver on each of the strategic priorities identified in the Corporate Plan §2017-2022§ in an ethical and efficient way.§              §The Governance Team includes the Governance Manager, Principal Corporate Policy Officer, Senior Governance and Integrity Officer and Enterprise Risk Management Officer. §              §The role §              §You will contribute to a risk aware and continuous improvement culture while ensuring a rigorous approach is established for the identification of key risks across the organisation. You will coordinate the implementation of Council’s Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program providing specialist advice on risk management issues to Council’s senior management, the Audit Committee, Workplace Health and Safety Committees and employees generally.§              §You will contribute to the development, review, and updating as required of Council’s ERM framework including the ERM policy, procedure and supporting documents to support continuous improvement.§              §Term: §Permanently Full Time§              §Award/Level: §Qld Local Government Industry Award (Stream A)- Level 6 of the Moreton Bay Regional Council EBA4 Certified Agreement §              §Location: §Strathpine§              §Package:§              §                §$89,006 pa§                §9 day fortnight§                §up to 12% superannuation§                §leave loading§                §72.5 hour fortnight§                §4 weeks annual leave§              §              §Requirements §              §To be successful in this role you will hold a Tertiary qualifications at degree level in a relevant discipline which may include risk management and have advanced knowledge of enterprise risk management principles and practices and substantial achievement in conducting organisation risk assessments in a complex business environment.§              §The ideal candidate will have: §              §                §knowledge and achievement in developing plans, systems and actions that improve an organisation's practices and reduce its level of risk - §and practical working examples to discuss at interview§ §                §ability to organise and manage programs/projects including achievement in the development and delivery of training and awareness programs to a wide variety of stakeholders§                §high level analytical, investigative and problem-solving skills§                §excellent written and verbal communications skills, including the ability to influence and negotiate positive outcomes§                §awareness of best practices and a desire to contribute this knowledge in the local government setting §              §              §Benefits§              §This role with Council offers excellent working conditions, generous employer funded superannuation benefits (up to 12%) and a 9 day fortnight in addition to four weeks paid annual leave per year.§              §Council’s office locations have local parking on-site and are in close proximity to public transport networks.§              §Work Location§              §Please note that whilst the current work location for this position is specified above, staff may be required to transfer to any of council's work locations with notice. Council currently has administration offices located at Caboolture, Strathpine and Redcliffe as well as depots, libraries and a range of other facilities located throughout the region.§              §How to Apply§              §Click on the 'Apply' button below to complete your online application. Please upload your current resume that demonstrates how you meet the requirements of this role. You will coordinate the implementation of Council’s Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program providing specialist advice on risk management issues to Council’s senior management, the Audit Committee, Workplace Health and Safety Committees and employees generally.§You will contribute to the development, review, and updating as required of Council’s ERM framework including the ERM policy, procedure and supporting documents to support continuous improvement.§Term: §Permanently Full Time§Award/Level: §Qld Local Government Industry Award (Stream A)- Level 6 of the Moreton Bay Regional Council EBA4 Certified Agreement §Location: §Strathpine§Package:§§$89,006 pa§9 day fortnight§up to 12% superannuation§leave loading§72.5 hour fortnight§4 weeks annual leave§§Requirements §To be successful in this role you will hold a Tertiary qualifications at degree level in a relevant discipline which may include risk management and have advanced knowledge of enterprise risk management principles and practices and substantial achievement in conducting organisation risk assessments in a complex business environment.§The ideal candidate will have: §§knowledge and achievement in developing plans, systems and actions that improve an organisation's practices and reduce its level of risk - §and practical working examples to discuss at interview§ §ability to organise and manage programs/projects including achievement in the development and delivery of training and awareness programs to a wide variety of stakeholders§high level analytical, investigative and problem-solving skills§excellent written and verbal communications skills, including the ability to influence and negotiate positive outcomes§awareness of best practices and a desire to contribute this knowledge in the local government setting §§Benefits§This role with Council offers excellent working conditions, generous employer funded superannuation benefits (up to 12%) and a 9 day fortnight in addition to four weeks paid annual leave per year.§Council’s office locations have local parking on-site and are in close proximity to public transport networks.§Work Location§Please note that whilst the current work location for this position is specified above, staff may be required to transfer to any of council's work locations with notice. jobText: TXT/50627958.txt	§Underwriting Assistant (5 Month Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Underwriting Assistant (5 Month Contract)§§Advertiser: §Chubb Insurance Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. § §Chubb Australia is currently experiencing a period of accelerated growth, and as we continue to excel and make our mark in the local market, we are looking for high potential individuals to join our dynamic and fast paced team.§ §MAIN  PURPOSE§ §The primary purpose of this role is to assist the Branch Underwriting team and deliver a high quality client service by supporting ownership of the operational functions of the team allowing them to focus on production and underwriting.  This includes (but is not limited to) tasks such as entering data into underwriting and various other systems required to track business, reviewing policy document, handling broker, accounting or policies queries and working with underwriters to review renewal and new business submissions.§ §This role reports directly to the Operations Unit Leader, however, through the matrix reporting structure may also have a dotted line to other parts of the underwriting community on a day to day basis.§ §MAJOR  DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES§ §Process Management and Customer Service§ § §To ensure all appropriate support and measures are taken for bookings to be registered within the required timeframes, and to the required quality standard applying right first time principle§ §Act as first point of contact for processing of complex business§ §To liaising with operations to resolve queries regarding New Business submissions to ensure these are registered in a timely manner§ §To prepare Underwriting files for both Renewal and New Business (including but not limited to inputting data into Underwriting system, compiling market research and completing raters)§ §To liaise with brokers and internal departments for credit control, claims and risk information§ §Chasing brokers for outstanding binding instructions or subjectivities§ §Review of policy documents produced by Operation. Creation of ad hoc documents§ §Assisting with the reconciliation of aged finance items§ §Ensure underwriting files are complete and fulfil audit requirement and mange transition of policies into the National Underwriting Centre§ §To ensure policy tracking/workflow tools are accurate and reflect current status of policy at all times§ §Service Delivery & Quality Adherence§ § §Build good working relationships with local underwriting teams and ensure that local underwriting management are regularly communicated with and kept updated on appropriate issues§ §Continuous Improvement§ § §To work in conjunction with all respective areas to ensure efficient working practices are in place, e.g. identifying process improvements, providing feedback to reduce rework or errors and escalate any blockages to the Operations Team Leader/Supervisor where necessary§ §Team Involvement§ § §Collaborate with and support others within the team§ §KNOWLEDGE  &  SKILLS§ §We are looking for someone who is adaptable to change, resilient, proactive and can manage their workload effectively. We also require someone who has:§ § §Excellent computer literacy§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills both in verbal and written forms§ §Superior Problem resolution and decision making skills§ §Proven experience of building and maintaining good working relationships§ §Experience supporting work allocation and working to tight deadlines/SLA's§ §Excellent knowledge of processes and systems§ §A collegial and constructive approach to working with and supporting colleagues within a team environment§ §Well-developed and refined analytical and organisational skills§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§.§§Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Portfolio Change, Optimisation & Change Capability, you will be excited to lead the creation and continuous improvement of AIA’s change capability framework, from quality tools and methods to supporting the growth of best practise and expertise across our community.§You will also enjoy collaborating with Heads of Portfolio Change & Optimisation to actively forward plan resource requirements and demands to meet the needs of the enterprise change heat-map maintain.  Using your insights, you will participate in relevant project, BAU and pre-project planning and estimation forums, as well as raising capacity risk at the relevant change and risk governance committees. This role can be filled in Melbourne or Sydney.§§Key priorities for this role §§Work with the Heads of Portfolio Change & Optimisation across the team in order to gather, clarify and accurately represent the BAU and project initiatives§Provide a business unit and enterprise view of change activities, highlighting key risk areas from a capacity perspective, and requirements for capability uplift where available§Review and analyse any changes captured through centralised systems/processes to accurately represent the change heat-map across the enterprise and business units§Support the entire Change Management portfolio through forward planning of resource requirements and demands§Participate in relevant project planning meetings to capture, provide change management effort estimates and recommend resource allocation§Collaborate with Heads of Portfolio Change & Optimisation to support resource management across their streams§Lead the creation of and continual improvement of our change capability through improved tools, methods, templates and sharing of best practice§§To be successful in this role you will have §§Formal business qualification, ideally a degree or specialist communications/change management higher education qualification§Extensive experience in change management (including lean change)§Demonstrated experience designing and implementing change management§Proven experience working with a range of senior stakeholders§Strong experience in developing management reporting§Strong experience in organising data from multiple sources and arranging into a logical format§Experience in establishing new operating models and frameworks§Supporting communications and change for company mergers and acquisitions or large scale organisation transformations§§Applications close Friday 16th October.§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, financial and legal advice and confidential counselling§          §Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services§          §Benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners such as free and discounted tickets.§        §        § §        §Join us.§        §Click §APPLY §to submit your application.
