jobText: TXT/50661227.txt	§Executive Manager,  Superannuation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Manager,  Superannuation§§Advertiser: §Commonwealth Bank - Wealth Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§§Do work that matters:§ § The Superannuation team at Colonial First State is responsible for all aspects of product management and development. This includes responsibility for the ongoing management and development of the CFS product range of superannuation products and insurance within super and input into the strategic road map for CFS superannuation products.§ § We currently seek an Executive Manager within the Superannuation team, to lead and develop an experienced product manager team and to be a key force in driving the business forward strategically at an exciting new juncture in the company’s history.§ § This is a permanent opportunity, reporting directly to the Head of Superannuation.§ § §See yourself in our team:§ § As Executive Manager you will manage a team of 7 staff who are responsible for all aspects of product management including the managing of regulatory and legal responses, maintaining all product governance forums and managing product reviews and ongoing product plans.§ § The team also support the Regulatory Reform program to ensure ongoing legislative compliance, lead the periodic update across all existing disclosure documents and manage all assigned issues and incidents with a strong focus on managing risk. There is also responsibility for them to maintain and manage all relevant product SOPs and for end to end ownership of the business processes and reporting relating to Prudential Standard SPS 515 - Strategic Planning and Member Outcomes.§ § As Executive Manager, additional focus areas for you will be:§Taking the lead in the preparation of all senior management and Trustee Board papers;§Driving member focused improvement initiatives to develop our product and service offering;§Working closely with all other divisions to implement product related decisions;§Leading the analysis of the market and competitor products relative to our own to identify new opportunities.§Maintaining day to day ownership of the relationship with CBA, a key outsourced supplier for Essential Super;§Maintaining a close and collaborative working relationship with key stakeholders including Advice Relationships (formerly known as Distribution), Marketing, Finance, Risk, Legal and Office of the Trustee.§ § §We’re interested in hearing from people who have:§ §Bachelor degree in Business, Economics, or relevant field required.§Significant (10 years +) relevant experience within the superannuation / insurance industry.§Previous product management experience within super is §essential.§Exceptional stakeholder management skills.§Clear leadership capabilities.§Proven experience of managing specific projects in the product management / development space.§Strong business acumen and analytical capability.§ §CBA has entered into an agreement with KKR to sell a 55% interest in its CFS superannuation and investments business for total cash consideration of $1.7billion (implying a total valuation of $3.3billion). CBA will retain a 45% shareholding in CFS.§ § §KKR is a leading global investment firm that manages multiple alternative asset classes, including private equity, energy, infrastructure, real estate and credit, with strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns for its fund investors by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and driving growth and value creation with KKR portfolio companies.§ § §The sale is expected to complete in the first half of 2021. As this is a role to work in the CFS business, the successful candidate will initially be employed by the CBA Group but on sale completion, their employment will transfer to a new entity that will employ the CFS business employees from completion.§ §Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. §Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.§Here, you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.§We’re determined to make a real difference for Australia’s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply.§ §If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

There will be numerous opportunities for growth in the future and the business loves to promote high performers. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Business§The role sits within one of the largest Life Insurance providers in the Australian market. They are well known for their commitment to their staff and similarly to their customers. They have recently gone under a lot of change in the operations teams and this has created opportunities in a number of areas. §The Role§The Team Lead, as part of a wider group of teams is responsible for a team of anywhere between 6 and 14 individuals at any one time. The team is responsible for processing and managing the New Business applications through the Retail Life Insurance channels. As a leader, you will be required to monitor the team performance and any gaps in training, ensure all compliance aspects are met, manage relationships with external team leaders to ensure whole business efficiencies and constantly provide training and support to own team.§The Person§We are looking for an individual who has come from a similar role or a senior role in the Retail Life, New Business space. Ideally you will have had at least 2 years as a Senior or Team Leader and are looking for a change or a step up. There will be numerous opportunities for growth in the future and the business loves to promote high performers. §§§§

jobTitle: Implementation Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50659006.txt	§Implementation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Implementation Manager§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§Showcase your expertise to help investigate and implement various process improvement initiatives that provide some of the greatest benefits for AIA.§§As Implementation Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring operational objectives are achieved by providing real-time support to the staff and the management team. The role involves constant management and involvement within small to medium sized projects.§Key responsibilities include:§Investigate and assess the feasibility and benefit of various process improvement initiatives§Provide change management support delivering various communication pieces and creating and updating SOP's§Prepare and support the delivery of communications and training as needed, including The Source updates, KUWCs and SOPs§Create and present business cases, as necessary, for system upgrades and significant process changes§Liaise frequently with Line 1 Risk and Product teams to ensure all initiatives are suitable for the business§§To be successful in this position, you will have:§Previous experience in a similar role§Previous Superannuation/Life Insurance and or investment products experience is advantageous§Proven ability to think analytically and critically while being open to new ideas; an innovative thinker§Knowledge of coaching concepts and methodology§Knowledge of Project Fundamentals§Strong communication and stakeholder management skills§§In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:§Take your career into a new area§Access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills§Make a difference in someone’s life every day§Work for a business helping millions of Australians every year§Access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself§Work in a business with no dress code§Enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you§Work with supportive and inclusive people and managers.§§What’s next?§If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button!§Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

We are ASX listed and boast a significant number of underwriting agencies across a diverse portfolio, and are always on the lookout for energetic, talented in innovative people that want to help shape the future of the insurance industry.§ § § §Steadfast Underwriting Agencies - Miramar, a market leading underwriting agency focus on a progressive approach to underwriting. We seek a Property Renewal Underwriter to provide underwriting services to the broker market. To liaise with brokers and internal staff on policy terms and conditions and assist the company in marketing its brand to the broker network.§ § § §About the role§ § § §The major responsibilities of the role are as follows:§ § § §Client Relationship Management§ §Undertaking actions which meet and/or exceed client expectations, using communication styles and methods to ensure understanding and continuing client satisfaction.§Influences outcomes that maximise potential for long term relationships§Develops ideas and solutions with the client§Maintains and demonstrates sound knowledge of clients, businesses and industries§Facilitates open communication§Develops approaches to client opportunities§Identifies current and potentially important clients§Acknowledges and recognises others who take action to meet client's needs§ § § §Customer Service Orientation§ §Develops relationships by listening to and making efforts to understand the customer (both internal and external; This team pride themselves on the level of camaraderie and employee engagement as well as the exceptional ongoing level of service provided to clients. §§This role will:§§Secure business with new clients and identify cross selling opportunities§Process and manage the administration of these accounts including preparing quotes, processing changes, policy preparation§Promote the Gallagher brand and yourself to generate ongoing new business opportunities§Ensure internal databases and relevant systems are kept up to date and accurate.§§§About you§§To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate:§Experience in the insurance broking or general insurance industry and looking to take the next step in your career§An organised and efficient mindset, able to balance multiple priorities simultaneously§A client focus and a natural communication style§Proven experience in document preparation with high attention to detail§Tier 1 Insurance broking qualification (or willingness to complete)§§§Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§§What will we offer?§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business.§§Additional benefits:§§Competitive remuneration and Rewards scheme§The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential§§§How to apply?§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§  §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657460.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Salary + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19, with our recruitment process now fully conducted virtually. As a business we have moved to a working from home environment until it is safe for all employees to return to our offices.§§Do you have case management background and passion for helping people? §§Establish and maintain effective relationships to support our injured worker§§Work for a supportive company in a collaborative environment§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation and Personal Injury Claims Management business§. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through ongoing support during their return to work journey. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having §over 2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees§ ensuring a long-term career here at EML.§§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Melbourne,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§The main purpose of this case manager role is to provide timely and personal service to the injured workers and their employers. This role will focus on the proactive support through the recovery and return to work process by managing all aspects of a portfolio of worker’s compensation claims within the Victorian legislation and compliance.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as workers, employers and providers§Undertake ongoing entitlement reviews in relation to weekly payments and medical expenses§Collaborate with treaters and other technical and support experts§Facilitate active participation of the injured worker and their employer in any return to work and recovery planning§Pro-actively manage rehabilitation providers and approval of rehabilitation plans§Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim costs§§ABOUT YOU§§Demonstrated experience and knowledge working in the insurance/workers compensation industry Prior experience in claims management extremely advantageous§Knowledge and previous experience working with the relevant Victorian worker’s compensation legislation and regulations.§Ability to negotiate and influence at all levels§Demonstrated ability to be empathetic§Basic understanding of medical terminology§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals. §EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite Learning and Development Team§End of Month Celebration Events§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. As part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact §Katherine Romano§ on §03 7000 0935§ or on email at §k.romano@eml.com.au§. § §§§§

Reporting through to the Head of Project Management Office, you will be key member of the AIA Australia Project Management Office and Change Optimisation, this role assists the PMO and Change functions within IESD and supports their respective teams as well as other supporting/external parties.§This is a fast paced hands on role which calls for an adaptable and mature minded individual, capable of navigating a large and complex organisation. You’ll have experience supporting multiple project/program managers and teams and be a strong communicator. This role is Melbourne based only.§§Key priorities for this role §§Coordinate events/meetings/teleconferences/presentations/catering/travel, including location, agendas, minute preparation & distribution§Establishment and maintenance of cyclical calendar triggers to pro-actively manage operating rhythm and deliverables of the PMO/Change within the timeframes including support on achieving the strategic plan for uplift within the PMO/Change teams§Supports the on boarding of new tools, templates and procedures§Coordinate PMO/Change activities§Attends to facilitating the categorisation/coding and payment of invoices as well as credit card processing. Facilitate set up of new vendors within the vendor payments system§Support the PMO Administrator with all aspects of their role, including covering leave§Responsible for the seamless on-boarding of new starters (contract and permanent) into the PMO and Change team§Drive the development of the PMO and Change team engagement and communications plan and facilitate the development and issuance of regular communications§Identify opportunities to improve central PMO and Change processes§Support the Head of’s in the construction and execution of strategic and operational plans§§To be successful in this role you will have §§Relevant tertiary qualification in Business or Project Management§Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills§Solid experience in project support, diary management or administrative/coordination roles§Able to prepare effective/concise project documentation and presentations§Strong analytical and communication skills§Experience developing and disseminating policies, procedures and standards in a complex office environment§Demonstrated personal leadership skills, with excellent interpersonal, influencing and communication ability§§Applications close Tuesday 20th October. §§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries§  §Our Mission & Vision:§  §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§  §Our Values:§  §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§  §About the Role:§  §The Broadspire Claims Consultant is responsible for the negotiation, investigation and settlement of Insured and Third Party claims.Effectively process and negotiate claims as per claims settlement authority levels, Service Level Agreements.§  §Key Responsibilities: § § §Accurate input of all required information including claims payments to either clients or third party suppliers, into the claims system§ §Check all documentation for accuracy§ §Liaise with customers and provide timely response to all communications giving clear and accurate advice§ §Controlling claims costs§ §Resolve disputes§ §Appoint service providers and suppliers§ §Liaise with internal and external service providers and suppliers§ §Negotiate with solicitors and third party insurers and attend settlement conferences where necessary§ §Ensure all recovery aspects of claims are monitored, and amounts due are obtained where appropriate§ §Ensure any potential fraud indicator is identified and acted upon§ §Client relationship management§ §Ad hoc administrative functions§ §About You:§  §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team and Insurance Broker, Supplier, Contractors and  All Internal and External colleagues bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time  management skills§  §Requirements:§ § §Minimum three years claims handling experience§ §Experience with claims management systems preferred§ § Educated to Year 12§ §Certificate IV in financial Services (General Insurance Tier 1) preferred§ §Willing to undertake further study and training as identified to support  and enhance position requirements§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§  §How to apply:§  §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§  §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§  §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50671679.txt	§National Casualty Portfolio Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Casualty Portfolio Manager§§Advertiser: §Guild Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§Your new company§Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by a genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial wellbeing. We pride ourselves for our future focus, recently being recognised for a third year in a row by the AFR BOSS Most Innovative Awards.§At the heart of what we do is being there for those our communities rely on.§Our comprehensive product suite includes professional indemnity, public liability, workers compensation as well as business, home & contents and car insurance. We are Australian owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence.§ §§Your new role §Working closely with our Head of Portfolio Management, you will take carriage of our casualty portfolio nationally and will drive and deliver Product & Underwriting strategy for Casualty classes that will optimise growth in new renewal business. You will also ensure that underwriting rules and pricing deliver short- and long-term profitability requirements across Guild Insurances’ direct channel.§Guild’s Casualty Portfolio largely comprises Products Liability, Public Liability, Professional Indemnity, Tax Audit and Management Liability. You will provide strategic and operational thought leadership across the product and underwriting department as you specialise in this portfolio. Specifically, you will:§§Collaborate, innovative and create portfolio strategy with product, risk appetite, underwriting, pricing and offers that will deliver the organisations growth and profit objectives§Ensure portfolio manager responsibilities are actioned for casualty lines§As a senior member of the Product & Underwriting Leadership Team, contribute to setting and delivery of all aspects of the team’s business plan and objectives§Facilitate Casualty Reinsurance Treaty review in consultation with Head of Product & Underwriting and Reinsurance Manager§Own Technical Underwriting and pricing of all large new business opportunities including assessment against developed acceptance criteria, determining terms, conditions and pricing recommendations§Drive casualty Underwriting excellence in referral underwriting and system-based underwriting across the organisation§Work closely with Analytics and Head of Portfolio Management to design and implement book pricing strategies for new and existing markets that ensure all portfolios written will achieve profit requirements§Produce analysis and commentary for inclusion in Underwriting Committee and board reports§Provide underwriting support for projects, both within and outside Underwriting and Acerta teams, requiring technical underwriting input on product models, underwriting question sets and acceptance parameters, pricing, underwriting guidelines including IOB content and drafting, reviewing and signing off of policy wordings and endorsements§Ensure compliance with regulatory regimes, remain abreast of regulatory trends and changes, and ensure the company anticipates and navigates changes successfully§Take opportunities to maintain and promote positive and constructive relationships with customers, distribution teams and other internal and external stakeholders.§§About you §You are a senior insurance professional with in-depth experience gained in mid to large sized organisations. You will bring deep experience in professional indemnity and will have had responsibility for casualty portfolio management and delivery of underwriting guidelines and initiatives. You are well known for your team leadership capability- having led technical specialists and will have exceptional analytical and technical pricing capability with your experience gained in an analytical role.  You will have proven capacity to undertake complex numerical analysis for strategic decision making and will love taking your team on this same journey. With exceptional communication and ability to build relationships across all levels of an organisation you will flourish in this role at a time of growth for Guild. You will also have your ANZIIF Tier 1 and 2 qualifications completed.§Why us? §We pride ourselves on having an inclusive and productive workplace where we treat our people and our clients with fairness, dignity and respect.§We offer: §§Paid parental leave for eligible staff from 6 weeks§An extra day of paid leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements§Enhanced long service leave§Staff discounts with leading retailers§An Employee Assistance Program that provides counselling and support to all staff members and their immediate family§Wellbeing initiatives such as health checks and skin checks§Flexible working program available to eligible staff§§For more information about Guild Insurance visit https://www.guildinsurance.com.au/§Sounds like your kind of role?§If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then let’s start a conversation!§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50670301.txt	§Internal Account Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Internal Account Executive§§Advertiser: §Tribal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999 base plus commission & super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§At Tribal we are currently recruiting for an Internal Account Executive to join us in Australia, this role will be critical in the support of our AUS and NZ sales and marketing functions. Working from home, you will work as part of the Account Management and Business Development teams who are responsible for building the sales pipeline globally. § §The role of Internal Account Executive focuses on new business generation and sales support. The Internal Account Executive will support with marketing campaigns, handle inbound enquiries, and qualify opportunities. You will additionally provide support to Tribal’s Account Directors to book meetings and help to prepare pre-sales resources ahead of demonstrations.§ §The primary responsibilities and deliverables of this role will be:§ § §Qualifying enquiries and booking appropriate follow-ups with the Sales Team.§ §Generate calling prospects to drive new business.§ §Create leads through sales and appointment setting campaigns.§ §Keep key business contact information up to date.  § §Improve campaign effectiveness by conducting appropriate research.   § §Strive to continuously improve customer care and satisfaction ratings.§ §Take ownership for and provide input into the development of sales and campaign plans.§ §Attend sales and marketing events, exhibitions, and roadshows.§ §Remain knowledgeable on Tribal markets and products to ensure you can confidently engage with customers.§ §Applicants to this role should have a strong sales focus, be able to communicate effectively with sales prospects, and take ownership for supporting in the generation of new business, therefore previous experience in a sales environment is beneficial.§ §Excellent organisation skills and strong customer service ability will be necessary to be successful in this role. Typical applicants will be recent graduates who are looking to kick start their career in sales or established sales support or internal sales execs, additionally you might be working in the education sector and looking for a change of career.§ §Why Tribal?§ §Your day to day life at Tribal will be diverse and challenging, and you’ll benefit from our generous benefits package.§ §If you are interested in applying for this position, please complete our short application form attaching your CV and cover letter.§ §Tribal are an equal opportunities employer.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§§§

With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.§        §About the role:§        §We have an opportunity for a negotiation Specialist to join our CTP Claims business in a §12 month secondment.§ This busy and varied role will see you proactively managing a portfolio of CTP Claims from investigating liability, providing reasonable and appropriate treatment and rehabilitation, gathering and analysing medical and financial documentation, assessing the value of the claim. Supported by an administration officer you will actively identify resolution opportunities, develop and deploy effective resolution strategies for CTP Claims and negotiate cost effective and timely settlements in line with customer vision, business outcomes and legislative requirements. The role will develop, co-ordinate and deliver performance coaching driving continuous improvement in timing and outcomes of resolving claims supporting the achievement of business goals and create value for our customers. You will be required to build, enhance and maintain quality relationships with all internal and external customers to ensure customer expectations are met and exceeded.§        §To be successful in this role you should have§        §          §Solid understanding of the §Motor Accident Insurance Act §1994 (“MAIA”) and all legislative, regulatory and procedural guidelines relating to CTP claims in Queensland;§          §Tertiary qualification in Business, Commerce, Law, Insurance or related field - Desired§          §Proven ability to communicate and build rapport with various stakeholders§          §Strong problem solving and resolution capabilities§          §Confidence in negotiating and decision making§          §Ability to interpret complex information and respond by developing appropriate actions§          §High standard of written communication across traditional and electronic communication media§          §At least 3 years’ experience with managing a portfolio of claims and/or personal injury experience.§          §Display behaviours that contribute and drive a positive culture.§        §        §We are seeking highly motivated, goal orientated and results driven candidates that have a willingness to help people in their time of need and deliver outstanding customer service. §        §Why join us?:§        §Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers. Joining Suncorp, you will be joining an organisation which cares and is proud of our achievements in being recognised for:§        §          §Best Insurance Company in Corporate Social Responsibility (2018)§          §Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for sixth consecutive year (2014 - 2019)§          §Money§ magazine’s Bank of the Year and Business Bank for second consecutive year (2018 - 2019)§          §General Insurance Product Innovation of the Year (2018)§          §NIBA General Insurer of the Year - Large General Insurer (2019)§        §        §If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today§        §At Suncorp we build inclusion by providing an environment where everyone can be themselves and feel valued, involved and respected for their perspectives and contribution.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About us:§Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.§About the role:§We have an opportunity for a negotiation Specialist to join our CTP Claims business in a §12 month secondment.§ This busy and varied role will see you proactively managing a portfolio of CTP Claims from investigating liability, providing reasonable and appropriate treatment and rehabilitation, gathering and analysing medical and financial documentation, assessing the value of the claim. Supported by an administration officer you will actively identify resolution opportunities, develop and deploy effective resolution strategies for CTP Claims and negotiate cost effective and timely settlements in line with customer vision, business outcomes and legislative requirements. The role will develop, co-ordinate and deliver performance coaching driving continuous improvement in timing and outcomes of resolving claims supporting the achievement of business goals and create value for our customers. You will be required to build, enhance and maintain quality relationships with all internal and external customers to ensure customer expectations are met and exceeded.§To be successful in this role you should have§§Solid understanding of the §Motor Accident Insurance Act §1994 (“MAIA”) and all legislative, regulatory and procedural guidelines relating to CTP claims in Queensland;§Tertiary qualification in Business, Commerce, Law, Insurance or related field - Desired§Proven ability to communicate and build rapport with various stakeholders§Strong problem solving and resolution capabilities§Confidence in negotiating and decision making§Ability to interpret complex information and respond by developing appropriate actions§High standard of written communication across traditional and electronic communication media§At least 3 years’ experience with managing a portfolio of claims and/or personal injury experience.§Display behaviours that contribute and drive a positive culture.§§We are seeking highly motivated, goal orientated and results driven candidates that have a willingness to help people in their time of need and deliver outstanding customer service. §Why join us?:§Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers. Joining Suncorp, you will be joining an organisation which cares and is proud of our achievements in being recognised for:§§Best Insurance Company in Corporate Social Responsibility (2018)§Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for sixth consecutive year (2014 - 2019)§Money§ magazine’s Bank of the Year and Business Bank for second consecutive year (2018 - 2019)§General Insurance Product Innovation of the Year (2018)§NIBA General Insurer of the Year - Large General Insurer (2019)§§If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today§At Suncorp we build inclusion by providing an environment where everyone can be themselves and feel valued, involved and respected for their perspectives and contribution.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50613640.txt	§Assistant Underwriter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Underwriter§§Advertiser: §DUAL Asia Pacific§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§For over 16 years DUAL Australia has become one of the largest independent Underwriting Agencies in Australia by focusing on creating unique products and solutions for the SME market. As a company we’re known in the industry as a group dedicated to giving back to the community by partnering with charitable groups and actively participating in fundraising events.§ §If you have strong communication and interpersonal skills, experience working in insurance or administration roles and a passion for customer service, then this is the role for you!§ §We are looking for a motivated individual to join our energetic and dynamic Melbourne office to assist with the day to day underwriting processes of our SME portfolio.§ §To be successful in this role you will need to possess a confident and friendly manner, be motivated to succeed, have excellent organisational skills and strong attention to detail.§ §In this role you would be responsible for;§ § §Ensuring timely delivery of the following renewal processes for the Financial Lines and Accident & Health “small-business” renewal portfolios: § §Extracting and uploading Renewal information to DUAL’s systems§ §Issuing renewals and new business quotations to brokers. Assisting brokers with all stages of the quotation process, including conversion of indications or quotations to bound policies, issuing documentation, mid-term adjustments and endorsements§ § § §Maintaining consistent “Fast Track” Binding Ratios and Lapse Ratios§ §Developing and maintaining Broker (client) expectations and working relationships§ §Developing working relationships with underwriters and brokers§ §If you enjoy working in a close knit and highly collaborative team environment, then Apply now!§ §To find out more about DUAL Australia, please head to the DUAL Australia §website§ or visit us on our §LinkedIn§ page to see what we’re up to and what we’re about.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50648778.txt	§Compensation Quality Assurer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Compensation Quality Assurer§§Advertiser: §AMP Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive base + 12% super + benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Actuarial§§§§§§Working for AMP §Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation.  It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.§We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities. §We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.§About the role§The role quality assures compensation calculations that have been conducted to remediate clients who received inappropriate advice. The role is a senior position in the compensation team and provides oversight of the work conducted by Calculations Analysts as well as your own case load of typically more complex cases. It is expected that the role provides support to the Manager, Compensation to help execute the Compensation team’s strategy and develop its processes and methods.§This is a 12 month fixed term contract§Key Responsibilities§§Provide quality assurance on compensation analysts’ compensation calculations, coach and mentor team of compensation analysts.§Design, develop and deliver end to end holistic compensation calculations in line with established policies, processes and procedures.§Maintain and update financial models and tools to facilitate calculation of compensation; for example, counterfactual superannuation balances, retrospective insurance premiums and estimate of financial loss.§Work closely with Advice Remediation Managers (case assessors) and Quality Assurance Managers to ensure timeliness and consistency of client remediation.§Contribute to AMP processes which improve our capacity to deliver consistent, transparent and fair remediation decisions in a timely manner.§§Capabilities & Experience§§Minimum 3 years relevant experience in financial services.§Experience in compensation calculations for remediation is extremely desirable.§Sound understanding of investment and superannuation products.§Superior personal interaction skills to manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders.§Strong Excel skills and the ability to develop and analyse quantitative and qualitative solutions.§§Please include a cover letter with your application.§§Wellbeing & Benefits §As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.§Inclusion & Diversity§AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50697417.txt	§Senior Claims Service Consultant Liability§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Service Consultant Liability§§Advertiser: §Allianz Australia Insurance Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Assessment§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Claims Service Consultant Liability §      §        §          §12 month contract opportunity§          §Take ownership of your own personal injury claims portfolio§          §Become part of a dynamic, high performing and supportive team environment§        §        § §What if you could use your skills and knowledge to make a positive impact?§        §We are looking for a Senior Claims Service Consultant to join our National Liability Claims team on a 12 month contract. You will be part of a results-driven team with a high performance culture responsible for managing claims involving third party material damage, financial loss and personal injury arising from Public and Products Liability or Professional Indemnity policies. These claims are diverse, frequently involving complex legal issues and a high net worth.§        §You'll be responsible for:§        §          §Managing a portfolio of personal injury claims in a timely and cost-effective manner§          §Ensuring a high standard of service is maintained for our internal and external customers while building a network of professional relationships across the insurance industry§          §Continuous communication with internal and external stakeholders to report on claim developments and potential large losses§          §Using your technical experience and knowledge to thoroughly investigate and assess claims to ensure that appropriate strategies are being implemented and pursued§          §Active communication and negotiation with Legal Service Providers and a variety of other service providers  with a view to achieving the best possible outcome for all stakeholders involved§          §Making key decisions throughout the claims management process including developing strategies and assessing policy coverage, liability and quantum§        §        § Important to your success:§        §          §Previous experience working in an insurance, claims or legal environment will be highly regarded§          §Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage your time in a fast-paced environment§          §Excellent customer service abilities and solid verbal and written communication skills§          §Strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills§        §        § What's on offer?§        §          §As we embed a customer-focused strategy across everything we do, you'll have an opportunity to drive innovation and real change that delivers a tangible and meaningful impact on our people, our customers and our community§          §Feel supported to give something a go - try different things, take on new responsibilities and explore opportunities§          §Be part of a team that's open-minded, supportive, approachable and genuinely focused on customer outcomes§          §Be supported to care for yourself and also things that matter in your life and to your community§        §        § About us§        §Allianz is the home for those who dare - a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people, we foster a culture where our employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and dare to challenge the industry.  When you join Allianz, you'll become part of a strong global insurer, helping to protect over 3 million Australians. We foster an environment of personal growth, so you feel safe to try, share, fail, learn and grow. We value diverse thinking where your ideas and innovative mindset are welcomed and encouraged. As a member of the Allianz family, you'll be supported to reach your full potential to grow an enriching career.§        §Allianz is committed to employment equity and therefore welcomes applications from men and women regardless of race or ethnicity, age, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or philosophy of life. Please advise us if you require any reasonable adjustments to fully participate in the recruitment process or perform the requirements of the role.§        § §        §If you dare, there's an opportunity for you at www.allianz.com.au/careers§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§12 month contract opportunity§§Take ownership of your own personal injury claims portfolio§§Become part of a dynamic, high performing and supportive team environment§§ §What if you could use your skills and knowledge to make a positive impact?§§We are looking for a Senior Claims Service Consultant to join our National Liability Claims team on a 12 month contract. You will be part of a results-driven team with a high performance culture responsible for managing claims involving third party material damage, financial loss and personal injury arising from Public and Products Liability or Professional Indemnity policies. These claims are diverse, frequently involving complex legal issues and a high net worth.§You'll be responsible for:§§Managing a portfolio of personal injury claims in a timely and cost-effective manner§Ensuring a high standard of service is maintained for our internal and external customers while building a network of professional relationships across the insurance industry§Continuous communication with internal and external stakeholders to report on claim developments and potential large losses§Using your technical experience and knowledge to thoroughly investigate and assess claims to ensure that appropriate strategies are being implemented and pursued§Active communication and negotiation with Legal Service Providers and a variety of other service providers  with a view to achieving the best possible outcome for all stakeholders involved§Making key decisions throughout the claims management process including developing strategies and assessing policy coverage, liability and quantum§§ Important to your success:§§Previous experience working in an insurance, claims or legal environment will be highly regarded§Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage your time in a fast-paced environment§Excellent customer service abilities and solid verbal and written communication skills§Strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills§§ What's on offer?§§As we embed a customer-focused strategy across everything we do, you'll have an opportunity to drive innovation and real change that delivers a tangible and meaningful impact on our people, our customers and our community§Feel supported to give something a go - try different things, take on new responsibilities and explore opportunities§Be part of a team that's open-minded, supportive, approachable and genuinely focused on customer outcomes§Be supported to care for yourself and also things that matter in your life and to your community§§ About us§Allianz is the home for those who dare - a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people, we foster a culture where our employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and dare to challenge the industry.  When you join Allianz, you'll become part of a strong global insurer, helping to protect over 3 million Australians. We foster an environment of personal growth, so you feel safe to try, share, fail, learn and grow. We value diverse thinking where your ideas and innovative mindset are welcomed and encouraged. As a member of the Allianz family, you'll be supported to reach your full potential to grow an enriching career.§Allianz is committed to employment equity and therefore welcomes applications from men and women regardless of race or ethnicity, age, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or philosophy of life. Please advise us if you require any reasonable adjustments to fully participate in the recruitment process or perform the requirements of the role.§ §If you dare, there's an opportunity for you at www.allianz.com.au/careers§§§§

jobTitle: Senior External Claims/ Loss Adjuster Job in Gold Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50626204.txt	§Senior External Claims/ Loss Adjuster§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior External Claims/ Loss Adjuster§§Advertiser: §Crawford and Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Crawford:§ §Crawford & Company is the world’s largest publicly listed independent provider of claims management solutions to the risk management and insurance industry. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§ §About the Role:§ §As an external claims adjuster, you will resolve commercial and domestic losses online and/ or on-site as well as ensuring compliance with service level agreements and maintaining high production levels§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Maintain expected case load of claims§ §Provide office and field based assessment and investigation of commercial and domestic insurance losses from first advice to final settlement.§ §Provide support and advice to policy holders with respect to their claims.§ §Examine claims forms, policies and endorsements, client instructions and other records to determine coverage.§ §Investigate claims by obtaining official reports, inspecting physical damage and by comparing claim information with evidence.§ §Set loss reserves and control claims costs§ §Settle claims after determining insurance carrier’s liability, client’s instructions, and authority levels required by obtaining demands and making offers to claimants, issuing settlement recommendations, making filings with regulatory agencies, disposing of salvage and pursuing subrogation when appropriate.§ §Effectively deal with service/product replacement providers§ §Comply with and maintain Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators§ §Maintain company reputation and insurance product integrity by complying with federal and state regulations and service standards.§ §Maintain professional and technical knowledge through continuing education.§ §Provide assistance to other offices in the event of a Catastrophe, as required.§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of  managers, claims administrators, state managers, support staff, clients, insured and service providers bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time and caseload management skills§ §Requirements:§ § §Substantial experience as a Loss Adjuster/ Internal Claims Adjuster§ §Thorough knowledge of insurance terminology, practices and conditions§ §Understanding of basic business accounting procedures§ §Clear English and report writing skills§ §Professional and positive outlook§ §Strong organisational and interpersonal skills§ §Work without supervision§ §Client service focus§ §Good verbal and written communication skills§ §Good attention to detail§ §Adequate numeracy and literacy skills§ §Good computer abilities, preferably previous use of an electronic claims system§ §Loss Adjusting qualifications preferred, or Professional qualifications applicable to the Loss Adjusting industry.§ §Member of the Chartered Institute of Loss Adjusters§ §Drivers Licence§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§ §Recruitment Agency Statement:§    § §Recruitment for this position will be managed in-house and we respectfully request that recruitment agencies refrain from submitting applications for this role§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have loss adjustment experience?§Do you have customer service experience?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50617152.txt	§Customer Service Consultant§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Consultant§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Us§We are an experienced and reliable accredited service provider for insurance claims and disaster relief across the eastern seaboard in relation to construction works. We are a preferred builder within Australia's leading insurance companies and have an enviable track record with our clients; by continually providing a competitive, reliable and quality service.§ §The Role§As a Customer Service Consultant you will be working in a high volume inbound contact centre as a pivotal member in our customer support team. The successful applicant will possess a can do attitude and be well organised. The role will involve liaising with multiple internal and external stakeholders, ensuring the delivery and action of information in a seamless manner; performing report reviews, data entry, processing tasks and problem solving to deliver high levels of customer service. Due to the nature of the role, you will be skilled in working in a high stress environment, and able to empathise with our customers who have been impacted by events such as fire, storm, cyclone and more. You will work with key stakeholders in order to progress claims through our standard work processes.§ §Here at Rizon, we pride ourselves on our all-inclusive team culture. The ideal candidate will have exceptional customer service and administration abilities; the ability to manage your own time and take ownership; able to work both within the team environment and autonomously; and the want to help others.§ §Located in the inner city suburb location (MILTON), we are close to all forms of public transport. § §Rizon is looking to fill Full Time Positions with rostered hours across Monday – Friday 7.00am-5.30pm with a possibility of weekend work during busy periods.§ §BRING YOUR STRONG CAN DO ATTITUDE WITH A SIDE OF FUN!§ §Role and Responsibilities:§ § §Answer high volume inbound calls from Customers and Insurance Consultants.§ §Review details of claims and delegate actions outside your process.§ §Review work orders and action requests to internal and external partners.§ §Respond to, manage and action all tasks associated within the claims process in a timely and professional manner.§ §Take ownership of individual customer enquiries and follow through to ensure appropriate outcome is achieved.§ §Handle important and detailed tasks to effectively process the claim and allocate jobs to supervisors and estimators.§ §Identify customer needs through effective questioning and active listening skills.§ §Maintain and update customer information into claims database system, comprehensively and accurately.§ §Maintain client satisfaction, adhering to contract requirements and Service Level Agreements.§ §Review quotes and variations submitted by builder.§ §Data entry. § §Carry out general administrative duties as directed.§ §Undertake other tasks as reasonably requested from time to time as required.§ §Ideal Candidate:§ § §You will be someone who is adaptable to change and thrives under pressure.§ §You will be agile and resilient and have the ability to problem solve.§ §You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills and work autonomously with a team goal in mind.§ §You will have exceptional attention to detail and prefer to input more detail than less detail.§ §You have excellent spelling, grammar and phone manner.§ §You have a natural empathy to help our customers in need.§ §Previous customer service experience and exposure in property claims management is an advantage. § §Skills & Experience:§ § §Highly competent in Microsoft applications: Outlook, Word, Excel.§ §High Attention to detail.§ §Fast & accurate data entry skills.§ §Demonstrated customer service skills.§ §Excellent communication skills.§ §If you believe you possess the above personality, skill set and drive please apply using a current resume and cover letter addressing your fit.§ §Residency Requirements:§Australian Citizens and Permanent Residents only (inc. New Zealand Citizens)§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50648768.txt	§Compensation Quality Assurer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Compensation Quality Assurer§§Advertiser: §AMP Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive base + 12% super + benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Actuarial§§§§§§Working for AMP §Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation.  It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.§We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities. §We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.§About the role§The role quality assures compensation calculations that have been conducted to remediate clients who received inappropriate advice. The role is a senior position in the compensation team and provides oversight of the work conducted by Calculations Analysts as well as your own case load of typically more complex cases. It is expected that the role provides support to the Manager, Compensation to help execute the Compensation team’s strategy and develop its processes and methods.§This is a 12 month fixed term contract§Key Responsibilities§§Provide quality assurance on compensation analysts’ compensation calculations, coach and mentor team of compensation analysts.§Design, develop and deliver end to end holistic compensation calculations in line with established policies, processes and procedures.§Maintain and update financial models and tools to facilitate calculation of compensation; for example, counterfactual superannuation balances, retrospective insurance premiums and estimate of financial loss.§Work closely with Advice Remediation Managers (case assessors) and Quality Assurance Managers to ensure timeliness and consistency of client remediation.§Contribute to AMP processes which improve our capacity to deliver consistent, transparent and fair remediation decisions in a timely manner.§§Capabilities & Experience§§Minimum 3 years relevant experience in financial services.§Experience in compensation calculations for remediation is extremely desirable.§Sound understanding of investment and superannuation products.§Superior personal interaction skills to manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders.§Strong Excel skills and the ability to develop and analyse quantitative and qualitative solutions.§§Please include a cover letter with your application.§§Wellbeing & Benefits §As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.§Inclusion & Diversity§AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50644263.txt	§Triage Claims Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Triage Claims Specialists§§Advertiser: §Crawford and Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Crawford:§ §Crawford & Company is the world’s largest publicly listed independent provider of claims management solutions to the risk management and insurance industry. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§ §About the Role:§ §As Intelligent Triage Claims Specialists, you will be responsible for delivering effective and efficient claims triage (including occasional full claim management) across the Crawford business in compliance with service level agreements and meeting key performance indicators§ §Key Responsibilities: § § §Provide first contact triage support and advice to Customers with respect to their claims, whilst also setting loss reserves and controlling claim costs§ §Support Customers experiencing vulnerability§ §Examine documentation, including claims forms, policies and endorsements, client instructions and other records to determine coverage and claims management strategies from a triage perspective§ §Occasionally progress claims that can be managed from desktop by conducting relevant analysis including physical damage details, interviewing insureds, and comparing claim information with evidence§ §Complete a suite of what happens next documentation for various stakeholders including loss adjusters, Insured, Insurers and Contractors by collecting and summarising information required§ §Adhere to any regulatory requirements§ §Adhere to General Insurance Code of Practice§ §Adhere to insurer client Service Level Agreements and processes§ §Update Crawford Claims Management system and any other as required§ §Effectively deal with service providers§ §Comply with and maintaining Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators§ §Maintain company reputation and insurance product integrity by complying with federal and state regulations and service standards§ §Maintain professional and technical knowledge through continuing education§ §Control claim costs§ §You may be required to conduct quality review/ audit on operational files in accordance with Crawford quality review protocols and other quality management related tasks§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of state managers, operations manager, branch manager, team leader, other Crawford employees, clients and service providers executive management, business unit managers, operational staff and clients bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time and caseload management skills§ §Key Requirements:§ § §Team Player§ §Internal claims or loss  adjuster background (senior)§ §Client service focus§ §Experience in management of General Insurance Claims§ §Insurance Contracts Act/FSRA legislation awareness§ §Stable work history§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Accurate keyboard skills§ §Ability to work without immediate supervision§ §Computer literate§ §High level literacy & adequate numeracy skills§ §Word Processing§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online with a coverletter using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§ §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§§§

jobText: TXT/50672923.txt	§Risk Manager – Risk Culture & Integrity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk Manager – Risk Culture & Integrity§§Advertiser: §AMP Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§AMP Life is Australia and New Zealand’s largest life insurer, with assets of over $31bn and over 1.5 million customers. AMP Life is transitioning its business model to be an in-force specialist life insurer, with a focus on providing existing customers in Australia and New Zealand with insurances such as income protection, disability and life insurances and savings & investment products.§ §§About the role§ §This role sits within the Resolution Life Australia Risk & Compliance Team; and has end to end accountability for RLA’s risk framework, risk capability and compliance.§ §You will be accountable for the oversight, monitor and champion of Risk Culture throughout the organisation together with the delivery of several other conduct and culture related accountabilities.§ §F§ocus areas:§§ §§Risk Culture§§Monitoring and preparing the necessary reporting to the Board to allow them to form a view on the risk culture of the business§Champion the continuous improvement of risk culture across the business§§Consequence Management§§Work with People & Culture to implement and oversee a consequence management framework§§Financial Accountability Regime§§Drive the implementation of the Financial Accountability Regime§Oversee and monitor changes to accountabilities and report to the Regulator as required§§Whistleblowing§§Monitor any whistleblowing events and ensure operational process and procedures are in place to support whistleblowing compliance obligations§§Delegations of Authority§§Ensure adequate delegations of authority are in place between the Board and Management and from the CEO§§Conflicts Management§§Record conflicts and monitor action plans, at both employee and entity levels§Provide advice to staff and Director on potential conflicts§§Business partnering§§Engaging daily with business managers and operational staff to promote and embed the risk culture§Being highly visible within the business on all matters related to the key focus areas above to provide advice and support where required§§ §Capabilities & Experience§§A passion for strong risk culture§Ability to handle confidential and potentially delicate situations with care§A strong understanding of regulatory requirements for Risk Culture and the various standards related to integrity§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Experience in dealing with executive level stakeholders§Highly organised with high attention to detail and forward planning§Ability to summarise information clearly and draw meaningful conclusions from the findings of their analysis.§§ §Experience and qualifications required§§Strong knowledge of the financial services regulatory environment§Prior experience in a related area (e.g. culture, ethics, governance)§Compliance and Risks Management certification or equivalent§Strong knowledge of the Life insurance industry (preferred)§§ §If you feel this role matches your skillset, please apply today.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
