Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Welcome to This Australian Life.§ §From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.§ §TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community.   People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community.  People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide.  People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart. § §About the Opportunity§ §This role is a Fixed term 12 month contract role, responsible for the coordination of claims related initiatives and projects dedicated to improving claims service for a key client§ §In this role you will be responsible for:§ § § §Assisting the Service Delivery Manager in delivering key claims initiatives and projects to improve the efficiency of the outsourced claims model§ § § §Developing initiative/project governance documents – including templates, reporting dashboards, roadmaps, plans, schedules and other documentation required to deliver project effectively§ § § §Monitoring initiative/project schedules to track completion of milestones within required timeframe and with desired results§ § § §Preparing and presenting regular progress update reports to key stakeholders§ § § §Logging, managing and analysing information to identify risks in timely manner and provide recommendations for corrective action as appropriate, including escalation to senior management§ § § §Providing support and guidance to the claims working group stream leads as required§ § § §Working collaboratively with peers and higher levels of management to ensure timely delivery of key targets§ § § §Supporting and managing the necessary communication activities for successful transition in adoption of process change§ § § §Participating in other business area duties as directed by the Service Delivery Manager§ § §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ § § §At least 5 years’ demonstrated claims assessment experience in the Insurance Industry, across Death/TPD, and income protection claims.§ § § §At least 5 years proven experience in claims projects/process improvement§ § § §Strong commercial, governance and risk mitigation acumen§ § § §Excellent communication and presentation skills both in technical and non-technical terms§ § § §Proven ability to collaborate across multiple internal and external stakeholder groups, including senior management§ § § §Demonstrated ability to remain agile in rapidly changing environment§ § § §Strong knowledge of relevant business unit and TAL-wide procedures, policies and guidelines§ § § §Qualification in project management desirable§ § § § §ork is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts.  We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.§ §We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.§ §You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.§ §If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50692762.txt	§Practice Manager - Project/Program Managers and Coordinators§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Manager - Project/Program Managers and Coordinators§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Practice Manager - Project/Program Managers and Coordinators §      §        §At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§        § §        §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  §  § We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§  § We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § §The Opportunity at AIA§ . § § §Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Portfolio Capability and Demand, you will have accountability for the continuous development and capability uplift of key delivery disciplines as well as manage the supply and demand of resources across the Portfolio ensuring  on time and quality delivery in accordance with AIA’s strategic delivery agenda. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§ § §Strategic priorities for this role § § § §Develop a practice framework including skill matrix for each role type (discipline) and plan to continually evolve and uplift capability and support development plans§ § §Lead the development and execution of an end to end training framework program including material to raise the capability through coaching, training and on the job learning§ § §Efficient identification, approval, recruitment, deployment and optimized allocation of PMO resources to ensure successful delivery of projects through resource capacity planning and performance management§ § §Work with the Delivery Heads Of, Program and Project Managers to balance the relative priorities of resources and ensure the right resources are in the right roles to ensure quality deliveries are achieved§ § §Ensure strong business stakeholder engagement and collaboration with technology to enhance quality, cost and timely delivery of projects and program§ § §Build and maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders, both internal and external to drive and influence in order to achieve project/program/portfolio objectives§ § §Work closely with Agile Coaches to lead the recruitment, development, capability, embedment of tools and culture pertaining to Agile methods and ways of working across the business, including the transition to SCRUM across projects§ § §Monitor and support direct reports compliance with appropriate project methodology, processes and policies followed across projects, programs and portfolio to ensure excellence in project delivery.§ § § §To be successful in this role you will have § § § §Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines§ § §Proven experience running specialist PMO practices§ § §Extensive program management and/or delivery experience with strong experience in Insurance/financial services industry§ § §Proven experience in establishing, growing and uplifting relevant practices to grow and develop resources that support strategic project delivery§ § §Ability to optimise allocation of practice resources to successfully deliver all projects within the PMO as well as ensuring optimal utilization and performance of resources§ § §Strong understanding of all relevant project methodologies and processes (including Safe Agile, Lean Waterfall) and the ability to identify and utilise key tools and processes to ensure project delivery success§ § §Experience in stakeholder management at all levels, with ability to influence, negotiate and prioritises to find ‘win-win’ outcomes§ § § §Applications close Tuesday 20th October.§ § §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§ § §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§ § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  §  § We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§  § We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§  § We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

We have staff with a diverse range of qualifications including engineers, licensed builders, building consultants, building surveyors, quantity surveying and drafting§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§ §About the Role:§ §As a State Manager, you will supports the national manager with the running of the state operations. The role requires the maintaining of an active case load of files along with working with the leadership team, mentoring and per reviewing to with our high performing and dedicated team of  Insurers and intermediaries, clients lawyers,  Insureds and their representatives, Loss adjusters and builders and contractors bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time and caseload management skills§ §Requirements:§ § §Provide input on strategic KPI’s in conjunction with National Administrator§ §Maintain a significant level of Fee Earning responsibilities§ §Maintain and build relationships with current client base§ §Attend industry functions, as required§ §Liaison with major suppliers§ §Experience/Knowledge Required§ § §Significant Building Consultant / Engineering / Quantity Surveying experience and Qualification and business operations experience.§ §Personal Attributes Required§ § §Leadership§ §Positive outlook§ §Commitment to continuous improvement and business growth§ §Management and organisational skills§ §Interpersonal skills (relationship building)§ §Technical Skills Required§ § §National Manager§ §National Engineering Manager§ §National Administrator§ §Clients§ §Crawford State Managers Operations Managers and Team Leaders§ §Crawford Adjusters§ §Education/Qualifications§ § §Building Consultant / Engineering / Quantity Surveying qualifications§ §IT proficient§ §Qualified Building Consultant (Certificate IV Building or Similar) or,§ §Bachelor of Engineering or,§ §Bachelor of Construction Economics (or similar)§ §Drivers Licence§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§ §Recruitment Agency Statement:§    § §Recruitment for this position will be managed in-house and we respectfully request that recruitment agencies refrain from submitting applications for this role§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a state manager?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

Consultant - CTP §      §        §CTP Claims Consultant | QLD - Brisbane§        §Allianz is the home for those who dare to challenge business as usual.§        § §        §Are you looking for an organisation that has a high level of Integrity and professionalism?§        §As a Claims Consultant you will be building effective working relationships with a variety of key ‎‎stakeholders, including injured claimants and/or their lawyers, and reviewing treatment requests and organising investigations into claims ‎with a focus on proactive claims management.§        §We are currently recruiting for a §permanent§ opportunity.§        §You'll be responsible for:§        §          §Manage your own CTP claims portfolio from lodgement to finalisation§          §Build effective working relationships with a variety of key stakeholders, including injured claimants and/or their lawyers, rehabilitation advisors and medical professionals, in order to drive successful rehabilitation and return to work outcomes§          §Review treatment requests and organise investigations into claims with a focus on proactive claims management§          §Make settlement offers, attend informal and settlement conferences to progress claims towards finalisation§          §Attend conferences with counsel, expert witnesses and lawyers§        §        §Important to your success:§        § a proactive approach§          §Ability to work in a high pressure environment§          §Skills to manage a targets driven case load§          §Ability to take ownership of assigned ‎tasks§        §        §What's on offer?§        §          §An exciting opportunity to join a global iconic insurance organisation, which is transforming through an exciting time of change and growth.§          §On-going training and development opportunities§          §Be a part of a successful team delivering customer satisfaction and service expectations§        §        §About us§        §Allianz is the home for those who dare - a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. jobText: TXT/50707272.txt	§Technical Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Specialist§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Salary + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19, with our recruitment process now fully conducted virtually. As a business we have moved to a working from home environment until it is safe for all employees to return to our offices.§§Utilize your knowledge of Workers’ Compensation legislation & support a team§§Coach and mentor our Case Managers§§Onsite Learning and Development Team§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation and Personal Injury Claims Management business§. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through ongoing support during their return to work journey. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having §over 2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees§ ensuring a long term career here at EML.§§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Melbourne,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§Working as part of the Claims Services, this exciting role requires a motivated self-starter to provide technical support and advice to EML claims teams. You will use your previous experience across many facets of workers compensation to coach team members and provide creative and strategic advice in accordance with Victorian workers compensation law and WorkSafe Victoria guidelines.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Providing technical support to claims teams about the claims management process in line with Victorian workers compensation law and WorkSafe Victoria guidelines§Assisting the claims teams in their achievement of performance measures§Reviewing and providing feedback about current claims management practices and procedures ensuring emerging trends are identified and managed§Developing strategic initiatives and procedures to ensure all service, performance and compliance measures are achieved§Building and maintaining strong collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders§Assisting with organisational compliance with legal, governance and WorkSafe Victoria agent requirements.§§ABOUT YOU§§Strong technical experience within the Victorian workers compensation scheme§Previous experience as a technical specialist in workers compensation claims within all or most claims management segments.§Experience in managing relationships and competing stakeholder priorities§Superior time management and negotiating skills§Exceptional problem solving and strategic thinking skills§Experience in coaching and supporting others§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals. §EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite Learning and Development Team§End of Month Celebration Events§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Katherine Romano§ on §03 7000 0935§ or on email at §k.romano@eml.com.au§. §§§§

Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§        § §        §The Opportunity at AIA§        §The position of Product Manager – Corporate will be a key member in the Group Product team reporting into the Head of Group Product. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney. §        § §        § §        §The Product Manager - Corporate performs a key role in managing the product requirements for Corporate new business and renewals as well as coordinating the timely installation and implementation of Corporate new business and renewals, leading product development and responsibility for driving efficiencies to the process.§        § §        §The successful applicant will be contributing to the development of sustainable group product terms and conditions, including development of value-add product documents§          §          §            §Coordinate the installations / renewals process of corporate new business by being the key point of escalation for key stakeholders, ensuring a timely and smooth implementation of corporate new business and renewals§          §          §            §Management of non-standard terms for corporate clients including negotiating approval from internal stakeholders and reinsurers§          §          §            §Lead the development of the AIA Corporate product, including undertaking market research and competitor analysis, to maintain market leadership§          §          §            §Responsible for identifying opportunities and implementing changes to improve the process for the onboarding and renewal of Corporate business§          §          §            §Overall accountability for the timely drafting of Policy Schedules & Endorsements for Group clients including adhering to the AIA due diligence process§          §        §   §            §Strong knowledge and understanding of superannuation legislation changes and regulatory environment impacting on group insurance clients§          §          §            §Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including high attention to detail§          §          §            §Excellent communications skills both verbal & written§          §          §            §Strong negotiation skills§          §          §            §Strong commercial awareness§          §        §        § §        §Applications close 25 September 2020.§        § §        §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§        § §        §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. employees, clients and service providers executive management, business unit managers, operational staff and clients bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time and caseload management skills§ §Key Requirements:§ § §Team Player§ §Internal claims or loss  adjuster background (senior)§ §Client service focus§ §Experience in management of General Insurance Claims§ §Insurance Contracts Act/FSRA legislation awareness§ §Stable work history§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Accurate keyboard skills§ §Ability to work without immediate supervision§ §Computer literate§ §High level literacy & adequate numeracy skills§ §Word Processing§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online with a coverletter using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§ §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§§§

jobText: TXT/50673039.txt	§Risk & Compliance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk & Compliance Manager§§Advertiser: §Sacks Legal Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§Our client is a leading Australian indemnity insurer providing insurance and a range of supportive advisory and professional development services to its members.§  §Established over 30 years ago this organisation has remained a strong and independent mutual, committed to providing value and comprehensive services.§  §Due to continued growth, an exciting newly created opportunity has arisen for an engaging Risk and Compliance Manager to join the governance team in Melbourne.§  §Reporting directly to the Chief Governance, Risk and Compliance Officer (CGRCO), you will assist in establishing a modern, agile, and fit for purpose Governance, Risk and Compliance function. As well as providing reliable, accurate, timely and well-informed advice to key stakeholders in the identification and management of enterprise wide risks, whilst driving a risk culture which is open and transparent.§  §PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES§:§ § §To ensure all relevant regulatory obligations impacting the organisation are being met and maintained§ §To design, manage, review and enhance the governance, risk and compliance frameworks and policies§ §To provide compliance incident recording, investigation, assessment, and remediation as required.§ §To assist first line with the identification and management of identified risks and compliance matters§ §To represent the organisation on relevant regulatory working groups and Committees§ §To assist the CGRCO with the regulatory liaison with relevant external stakeholders and Regulators§ §To lead relevant internal working groups/projects§ §Applications are sought from risk and compliance specialists with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in the financial services industry, preferably with a background in insurance.§  §A rewarding career and competitive salary await with this pioneering role!§  §Please send your CV to Tara Sacks at Sacks Legal Recruitment §tara@sackslegalrecruitment.com.au§ or call Tara on §0414105140§ for further information.§  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

Along the way, you'll educate our customers on what will happen at every stage and support them with anything they will need to know about their claim.§        §You'll be responsible for:§        §          §Determining liability and managing a portfolio of Workers' Compensation claims§          §Issuing dispute notices on applicable claims §          §Supporting customers step-by-step through our Case Management and Injury Management programs§          §Welcoming and helpful written and verbal customer communication§          §Nurturing excellent customer relationships and creating positive experiences§        §        §Important to your success:§        §          §You'll have experience within a case management role with the ability to understand the importance of early intervention and individualised claims management§          §You will be known for your empathetic style and customer focused approach which allows you to ‘walk in our customer's shoes'§          §The ability to handle difficult situations and act in a professional manner whilst resolving complex situations in a timely manner§          §Tertiary qualification is highly desired (Allied Health, Rehabilitation, Physiotherapy, Nursing or Occupational Therapy qualifications will be viewed favourably)§          §Solid problem solving and relationship building abilities§          §Excellent time management skills and the ability to adapt when changes occur.§        §        §What's on offer?§        §          §Work on a single portfolio of claims where you will have stability§          §Learning is not left to chance - you'll be exposed to ongoing coaching from your manager, given access to hundreds of courses through LinkedIn Learning plus we are making huge investment into external study and training§          §We value integrity, discretion and doing what's right for the customer over KPIs and strict process§          §What matters to you, matters to us too. jobText: TXT/50666503.txt	§Complex Complaints Management Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Complex Complaints Management Leader§§Advertiser: §icare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Complex Complaints Management Leader §      §        §icare is currently seeking a solutions-focused Complex Complaints Management Leader with a commercial mindset and a passion for social impact to join the team!§        §          §Lead a team responsible for resolving complex customer complaints§          §Permanent opportunity§          §Salary starting from $128,089 + superannuation (Clerk Grade 11/12)§        §        § §        §We’re looking for someone to lead the team responsible for resolving complex customer complaints and enquiries. In this role you will also proactively identify system failures, recommend strategic solutions and contribute to the development of specific business requirements of the wider Personal Injury Complaints team and Customer Outcomes.§        §You’ll be working with a diverse mix of creative, curious and smart people who really care about making a difference for people and the NSW community. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will set the bar high through the quality of the work you do and the people-oriented decisions you make.§        §You’ll bring your:§        §          §extensive knowledge of the NSW workers compensation industry§          §complaints handling experience, including the ability to respond to escalated complaints and implement strategies to manage complex matters/situations§          §demonstrated empathy and resilience, with the ability to provide solutions to address high profile, complex and unresolved issues§          §practical and technical experience of workers compensation claims, including the ability to undertake detailed investigations of claims§          §current knowledge of NSW legislation and relevant guidelines including legislative amendments.§        §        §Typically, you’ll already have experience in leading a customer service and/or complaint handling team and you’ll be looking for the next challenge.§        § §        §It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same. But on a typical day you might find yourself:§        §          §ensuring that escalated complaints are accurately recorded, investigated and resolved in a timely manner and strategies are devised to avoid further escalation§          §working in collaboration with other teams within icare, with external stakeholders and icare’s claims managers/ scheme agents, to develop and apply solutions to resolve escalated complaints and to share insights gained from them to make improvements and drive customer-centric decision making§          §responding to and resolving escalated complaints, working within the parameters of the team’s allocated decision rights while dealing with customers exhibiting complex behaviours  §          §advising management in relation to emerging issues detected during dealings with workers, scheme agents, providers, employers and external agencies including WIRO, SIRA and the NSW Ombudsman.§        §        § §        §We’re a new kind of organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.§        §If you think you’re the right person for this role, send us your resume (up to 3 pages). Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.§        §We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we want people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We recognise the importance of balance and flexibility and understand that it’s not a one size fits all approach, so we’d be happy to talk about and consider your specific needs.§        §Please note that you must be an Australian citizen or a permanent resident of Australia or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport to apply for this role.§        §          §icare is the brand of Insurance & Care NSW§          §For more information about icare visit our §website§          §icare operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions will be accepted§        §        § §        §Applications close: COB 15 Oct 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§icare is currently seeking a solutions-focused Complex Complaints Management Leader with a commercial mindset and a passion for social impact to join the team!§§Lead a team responsible for resolving complex customer complaints§Permanent opportunity§Salary starting from $128,089 + superannuation (Clerk Grade 11/12)§§ §We’re looking for someone to lead the team responsible for resolving complex customer complaints and enquiries. jobText: TXT/50609164.txt	§Case Consultant, Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Consultant, Group§§Advertiser: §MLC Life Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive package inclusive of 10% super §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Case Consultant, Group §      §        §MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting the lives of Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it. §        §The Role:§        §Our Claims team are there to help our customers at their most vulnerable; they support each policy holder/member through the claims process with integrity, fairness and compassion. They strive to make the right decisions and support ethical and fair outcomes.§        §We are currently recruiting for a Case Consultant to join our dynamic and highly-engaged Sydney Group Claims team. You will manage a portfolio of claims to finalisation with a strong focus on getting our customers back on their feet and returning to work by working closely with vendors, allied health professionals, third parties, and shared services. §        §You will be responsible for:§        §          §Managing claims from initial assessment through to claim closure within your Delegated Authority;§          §Partnering with your team including our Recovery Specialists to improve outcomes for customers;§          §Working to clearly defined SLAs including; ensuring investigations are completed on time and cases are managed within Authority; §          §Ultimately, supporting our customers during their time of need with empathy and respect. §        §        §About you:§        §Holding relevant experience in life insurance, workers compensation or TAC claims, experience in either Allied health or Law is preferred but not essential. You will be highly customer centric and will enjoy working in a collaborative environment. With an understanding of medical terminology advantageous, you will have knowledge of the claims processes and techniques used in claims investigations.§        §Our Purpose§        §MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide over 1.5 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night. §        §Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers and each other that defines who we are.  §        §Our Strategy§        §Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all at MLC Life Insurance to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution.  §        §With more than 1,600 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are. §        §Why Choose Us?§        §At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:§        §          §work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality §          §enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution§          §embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer§          §access CircleIn Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents §          §access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and§          §wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.§        §        §Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position. §        §.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting the lives of Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it. § §The Role:§ §Our Claims team are there to help our customers at their most vulnerable; they support each policy holder/member through the claims process with integrity, fairness and compassion. They strive to make the right decisions and support ethical and fair outcomes.§ §We are currently recruiting for a Case Consultant to join our dynamic and highly-engaged Sydney Group Claims team. You will manage a portfolio of claims to finalisation with a strong focus on getting our customers back on their feet and returning to work by working closely with vendors, allied health professionals, third parties, and shared services. § §You will be responsible for:§ §Managing claims from initial assessment through to claim closure within your Delegated Authority;§ §Partnering with your team including our Recovery Specialists to improve outcomes for customers;§ §Working to clearly defined SLAs including; ensuring investigations are completed on time and cases are managed within Authority; § §Ultimately, supporting our customers during their time of need with empathy and respect. § §About you:§ §Holding relevant experience in life insurance, workers compensation or TAC claims, experience in either Allied health or Law is preferred but not essential. You will be highly customer centric and will enjoy working in a collaborative environment. With an understanding of medical terminology advantageous, you will have knowledge of the claims processes and techniques used in claims investigations.§ §Our Purpose§ §MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide over 1.5 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night. § §Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers and each other that defines who we are.  § §Our Strategy§ §Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all at MLC Life Insurance to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution.  § §With more than 1,600 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are. § §Why Choose Us?§ §At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:§ §work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality § §enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution§ §embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer§ §access CircleIn Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents § §access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and§ §wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.§ §Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position. § §.§§§§

CTP Claims Advisor

  • Multiple positions available
  • Contract opportunities till September 2021
  • Support our injured customers through their recovery

The Role

The CTP Claims team currently have multiple opportunities available for experienced Claims Advisors. This busy and varied role will see you managing a portfolio of claims from inception, investigating the liability situation, gathering and analysing medical and rehabilitation data, assessing the value of the claim and negotiating settlement.

Key Responsibilities

  • Management and negotiation of claims, including communication with solicitors or direct claimants, by phone, correspondence and/or attending settlement conferences and/or hearings
  • Obtaining and reviewing medical, financial, investigative and rehabilitation reports to assist in the accurate assessment of individual claims
  • Ensuring legislative compliance timeframes are met in conjunction with ongoing review of medical, financial investigative and rehabilitation reports
  • Adopting appropriate strategies are observed to resolve claims cost effectively
  • Ensuring early access to appropriate rehabilitation so that injured claimants can achieve optimal recovery from their injuries
  • Negotiating claims settlements with solicitors in line with legislative, regulatory and procedural guidelines
  • Providing an excellent level of customer service to the legislative authority, employers and injured workers through compliance with legislation, timely response times and efficiency in processing

Skills & Experience

  • Previous CTP claims or personal injury claims experience with a track record for delivering results
  • Excellent verbal communication skills and the ability to listen, build rapport, communicate complex information and negotiate with a variety of internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong administrative and written skills and the ability to effectively manage all aspects of each claim whilst keeping in the restraints of the QLD legislation
  • Strong commitment and a high degree of integrity to help meet and exceed customer expectations
  • A positive attitude and willingness to contribute to workplace improvement and changes

About Us

Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. 

Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  Joining Suncorp, you will be joining an organisation which cares and is proud of our achievements in being recognised for:

  • Best Insurance Company in Corporate Social Responsibility (2018)
  • Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for sixth consecutive year (2014 - 2019)
  • Money magazine’s Bank of the Year and Business Bank for third consecutive year (2018 - 2020)
  • General Insurance Product Innovation of the Year (2018)

If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today. For further information regarding this position, please contact our recruiting partner Hays Talent Solutions on 02 8226 9659. 

At Suncorp we build inclusion by providing an environment where everyone is able to be themselves and feel valued, involved and respected for their perspectives and contribution.

jobTitle: Strategy and Performance Reporting Analyst Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640732.txt	§Strategy and Performance Reporting Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategy and Performance Reporting Analyst§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Strategy and Performance Reporting Analyst §      §        §At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§        § §        §The Opportunity at AIA§        §The position of Strategy and Performance Reporting Analyst will be a key member in the Banca, Partnerships and Advice team reporting into the Senior Strategy and Reporting Manager. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§        § §        § §        §The Strategy and Performance Analyst is responsible for monitoring business performances regularly and generating performance reports to management.§        § §        §The Strategy and Performance Analysis will drive proactive analysis of competitor and markets in which we operate (Life, Health and Wellbeing). The position will also take a supporting role in development of the annual strategic planning and review process in collaboration with the Senior Strategy and Reporting Manager.§        § §        §Key Responsibilities§        §          §            §Track, consolidate, interpret and present market share data for Banca, Partnerships and Advice leveraging reporting conducted by other parts of the business or via external independent research e.g. NMG§          §          §            §Monitor and analyse financial information from competitors and key players in the financial services industry for bench marking purposes§          §          §            §Share results of analysis with key stakeholders on a regular basis to inform their business strategies and decisions§          § to the business to help share and support strategic direction and internal strategy§          §          §            §Responsible for the development of all reporting for partners including detailed performance metrics such as conversion rates, customer penetration along with financial metrics§          §          §            §Work closely with the Data Governance and Business Insights & Data Analytics and Optimisation teams§          §          §            §Monitor and track sales performance including historical trend analysis and forecasting§          §        §        § §        §Skills and Experience §        §          §            §Strong commercial acumen§          §          §            §Excellent organizational and time management skills, including proven experience in co-ordinating input from a number of contributors§          §          §            §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§          §          §            §Strong skills in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly PowerPoint and Excel§          §          §            §Thought leadership: ability to research, reimagine and articulate new ways forward, turning data/research into insight and insight into proposed actions§          §          §            §Customer focused: viewing the world from a customer’s perspective§          §        §        § §        §Applications close Thursday 8 October. Due to high volumes of applications, we may close this early so please do not delay submitting.§        § §        §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§        § §        §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§        § §        §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§        § §        §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. jobText: TXT/50662982.txt	§Eligibility Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Eligibility Officer§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§ §Your Role§  §In the role of an Eligibility Officer you will be the first point of contact responsible for coordinating and obtaining information from key stakeholders to determine the acceptance or rejection of the claim in line with legislation.  Your strength in technical knowledge and resilience to achieve business and Return to Work SA objectives, through utilisation of your analytical and communication capability will see you succeed in this position.§   §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following§:§ §Actively listen, show empathy and recognise the needs of the worker and employer§ §Consider Compliance, Medical Relationship, Employment Relationship and Exclusionary Provisions when reviewing liability;§ §Identifying any potential barriers and providing effective strategies for eligibility outcomes;§ §Communicating all decisions to the employer and the injured worker§ §Providing education to Workers, Employer and Treating Medical Practioner in respect to rights and responsibilities;§ §Delivering a high level of service to achieve a positive, safe and sustained return to work as early as possible in a high-pressure environment § §Creating new claims at time of registration via phone and ensuring all relevant data and information is captured within the appropriate systems.§ §   § § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ §Demonstrated ability to be resilient and to interact empathetically with people in vulnerable situation.§ §Claims management experience and knowledge of relevant acts and legislative requirements§ §Understanding the rights and responsibilities of people who are impacted by a workplace injury§ §Ability to make sound decisions, negotiate and influence are essential to the success of this role§ §  §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you’ll experience the following:§ §True flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to celebrate your contribution to the company§ §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A fun, supportive and inclusive working environment§ § §A brief overview on GB:§  §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§   §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§   §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§   §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§   §If you think you can make a positive difference to our business please apply – we want to hear from you today!!§   §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this role§   §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50567108.txt	§Trainee Insurance Broker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trainee Insurance Broker§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tamworth & North West NSW§§Salary§§Competitive remuneration and incentive program§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§ §What is the role?§We're on the lookout for an entry level trainee to step into our trainee role in Tamworth. More specifically, you’ll be responsible for providing support to a team of insurance brokers and assisting with their client account management. The role will see you trained from the ground up, including being taken along to important client meetings, learning the ins and outs of insurance broking and developing your career with an excellent, professional business. In time, we'll also support you to complete the formal qualification in insurance broking - Tier 1. §§What are we looking for?§To be successful in this role, you will have be wanting to establish a career in this business with a passion to learn and absorb information. § §You will have a positive attitude, a natural communication style and the ability to think on your feet. You'll be able to prioritise your workloads, multi-task and manage stakeholder expectations. § §There is no pre-requisite for a certain type of experience in this role - we're more looking for the right attitude and a desire to learn and grow! § §Why Gallagher / AgriRisk?§Our company operates as part of AgriRisk.§As a specialist agribusiness insurance broker with over 25 years’ experience in the Australian agricultural sector, AgriRisk services clients across Australia from small family run rural farms regional business to  larger and more complex agribusiness risks.§Gallagher provides a range of insurance solutions, investment options and contingency strategies. The Gallagher brand is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with almost 35,000 employees globally. We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way. We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§§What will we offer?§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business. Additional benefits:§§Flexible working arrangements§Competitive remuneration and incentive program§Salary sacrificed superannuation§Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§§§How to apply?§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §§Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§ § § §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50575896.txt	§Administration Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Officer§§Advertiser: §Statewide Superannuation Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Fund Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Administration Officer §      §        §Statewide Super is the largest and leading South Australian Industry Superannuation Fund providing expert superannuation advice to over 137,000 members. We manage in excess of $9 billion in funds and have a clear focus on helping Australians save for their retirement. §        §Are you an experienced financial services administration professional seeking your next opportunity? Perhaps you are interested in moving into a career within the Financial Services Industry?  Is it time to take that exciting step to develop and expand your skillset? If you’ve answered yes to the above, we want to hear from you!§        §We are looking for an enthusiastic individual to join our Administration team on a 12 month fixed-term, maternity leave cover contract. §        §Administration within Statewide Super is far from “paper pushing” – our Administration Team are the engine room of the fund and are responsible for managing the processing of huge volumes of payments, documentation, claims and other changes to support and service our members.  §        §You will be working in a team environment with a fun, positive and member-focused culture.  Your attention to detail, confidentiality, ability to deal with sensitive financial information, and focus on quality will be critical to your success in this role.§        §Reporting to the Team Leader, Administration the successful candidate will be expected to perform the following duties and responsibilities:§        §          §Process information for new/existing members ensuring that administration service standards are achieved;§          §Provide superior customer service to our members by ensuring the quality of the information that we provide to them, the efficiency in the timeframe we go back to them and always following through on what we commit to do;§          §Collect and audit all new member documentation to ensure information is correct and proactively follow-up with members or employers where incorrect information is supplied;§          §Process non-insurance claims and benefit payments;§          §Ensure application forms, updates, and payments are accurate and completed within Service Level Agreements (SLAs);§          §Manage, record, reconcile and prepare reports for all contributions activities including monthly employer receipts, contribution returns, contribution adjustments and follow up of unallocated contributions;§          §Contribute to streamlining and improving processes to ensure an optimal member experience;§          §Facilitate positive outcomes for customers by liaising effectively between internal and external parties and seeking additional supervisory support to resolve complex transactions or queries;§          §Assist with mail handling, scanning and indexing, filing and records management tasks as required and as per established processes to effectively perform archiving, filing, updating publications, cataloguing and storing, retrieving and creating new references;§          §Contact members for correction of BPAY anomalies as they arise; and, §          §Manage lost members by contacting members with returned mail, collating missing information from the Australian Taxation Officer (ATO) and updating member data.§        §        §To be considered for this role candidates will need:§        §          §General knowledge of the superannuation and/or financial services industry;§          §Good up-to-date knowledge of taxation, superannuation, retirement and life insurance legislation is highly desirable;§          §Experience with data maintenance and integrity;§          §Experience with client management tools;§          §Customer service experience; and§          §RG146 certification will be viewed favourably, or a willingness to successfully complete this training within the first 12 months of employment (supported by Statewide Super).§        §        §A degree in commerce, business or other related areas will be viewed favourably – this opportunity is ideal for graduates wanting to enter the sector, as well as people who are wanting to further expand their career in financial services. §        §The successful candidate will be provided with comprehensive training to enable them to hit the ground running. In addition to this, Statewide Super supports the growth and development of employees with a tailored learning and development program, which is available to all employees.§        §If you work with us, you will be working with a group of people who love doing what they do. We value §integrity§, §respectful relationships§ and §collaboration§ and, above all, are §member-focused§.§        §If these qualities are also important to you and you believe you fit the criteria for this opportunity, please forward a cover letter, curriculum vitae and academic transcript to: §iwanttowork@statewide.com.au§        §Statewide Super is an equal opportunity employer, committed to encouraging flexibility, valuing difference and embracing diversity. We pride ourselves on representing the diverse and multicultural communities of our membership and are dedicated to increasing opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians. To learn more, please read our Reconciliation Action Plan §https://www.statewide.com.au/about-us/reconciliation-action-plan/§.§        §Please note: It is a condition of employment for this role that a National Police Clearance be obtained. Only successful candidates will be contacted due to the volume of applications received. No Agencies please.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Statewide Super is the largest and leading South Australian Industry Superannuation Fund providing expert superannuation advice to over 137,000 members. jobText: TXT/50658702.txt	§Property Claims Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Claims Officer§§Advertiser: §MAYDAY Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$70,000 - $75,000 plus super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Property Claims Officer to manage a portfolio of commercial Property Claims. §The role overview:§ § §Pay,§ $70,000 - $75,000 +Super § §Team,§ although you are working for a global company you will be working with a collaborative team, who are all leaders in their fields and are known for their great culture. § §Management,§ you will learn from the best, working for a motivating and supportive Management team who are driven by your development. § §Location, §Due to the Pandemic you will have the opportunity to WFH, and work from their stunning Sydney offices, which are 1 minute walk from public transport, with harbour views.§ §Working hours,§ are Monday- Friday, with NO demand to work weekends EVER.  § §Duration§, Initially a 6 month FTC, with a very high possibility to go permanent, and genuine opportunities to progress internally; this global insurer values it's staff and is ever-growing.§ § §What’s in it for you:§ § §Work for a company with an award-winning reputation for providing a top quality claims experience for their customers§ §Be part of an ethos of fairness, equality, and fast turnaround times§ §Be supported in your workload with well distributed cases and assistance where needed§ §Have access to tools and technology that will allow you to work efficiently§ §Be prized for initiative and ideas that you bring, for your work ethic and team mindset§ §Ongoing training to support your career development, even in the early stages§ §Manage a varied and high-end portfolio § §Enjoy being part of a high performing team with a fun and collaborative team culture § §Immediate start for the right person § § §The role:§ § §Managing a portfolio of claims § §Promptly and professionally liaising with Brokers and Clients§ §Assessing claims§ §Documenting all claims in accordance with internal policies§ §Effectively negotiating settlements where appropriate  § § §Experience needed:§ § §Good IT skills, and ability to learn and work across multiple systems § §Previous experience managing commercial claims § §Desire to work with a high performing, collaborative team, and progress your career in Insurance § § If this sounds like the role for you, please click the link to apply now!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50663106.txt	§Operations Implementation Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Implementation Analyst§§Advertiser: §Commonwealth Bank - Wealth Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§Do work that matters:§ § We currently have a 12 month contract available for the role of Implementation Analyst. The Analyst is responsible for assisting the Implementation Manager in successfully delivering project change into the Colonial First State (CFS) Client Operations division through the planning, change management and implementation of group or CFS projects.§ § The team look to represent the CO division on all projects and be the voice of CO and our members. There will be a need to drive and champion solutions that achieve service excellence through simplicity, consistency, efficiency and reliability and a focus on maximising the benefits of change for CO and our members.§ § §See yourself in the team:§ § The Implementation Management team support CFS Operations in the delivery of regulatory, mandatory, strategic, transformative and digital initiatives.§ § §Key focus areas in this role will be:§ §Actively supporting the Implementation Manager and project through all stages, including: initiation; planning; development; testing and implementation (for example, project working groups, workshops, risk in change, etc). Supporting the Implementation Manager in their role as the business lead and sign off for the CO division on your assigned project/s§Supporting the Implementation Manager in their facilitation of the decision making process within the CO Management Team through information gathering. Analysis and investigation of processes, standard operating procedures and system functionality. Documentation of data analysis methodology and completion of analysis.§Supporting or co-ordinating Implementation plans, such as the development and execution of pre and post implementation testing. Including, completion of testing or coordinating SME testing across the business§Many of our previous contract Analysts who have performed successfully in the role have transitioned to permanent opportunities within other areas of the business.§ § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess: §Strong analytical and organisational skills§Good judgement and proven problem solving skills§Previous and recent work experience within the life insurance / superannuation industry and have a solid understanding of administration processes and supporting structures§Strong PC literacy and mainframe experience§Initiative and have strong leadership and interpersonal skills§Proven ability to build and maintain effective relationships and rapport at all levels§A willingness and ability to work under challenging deadlines§ §CBA has entered into an agreement with KKR to sell a 55% interest in its CFS superannuation and investments business for total cash consideration of $1.7billion (implying a total valuation of $3.3billion). CBA will retain a 45% shareholding in CFS.§ § §KKR is a leading global investment firm that manages multiple alternative asset classes, including private equity, energy, infrastructure, real estate and credit, with strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns for its fund investors by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and driving growth and value creation with KKR portfolio companies.§ § §The sale is expected to complete in the first half of 2021. As this is a role to work in the CFS business, the successful candidate§ §will initially be employed by the CBA Group but on sale completion, their employment will transfer to a new entity that will employ the CFS business employees from completion.§ §Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. §Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.§Here, you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.§We’re determined to make a real difference for Australia’s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply.§ §If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
