jobText: TXT/50689662.txt	§Practice Manager - Project/Program Managers and Coordinators§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Manager - Project/Program Managers and Coordinators§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§.§§Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Portfolio Capability and Demand, you will have accountability for the continuous development and capability uplift of key delivery disciplines as well as manage the supply and demand of resources across the Portfolio ensuring  on time and quality delivery in accordance with AIA’s strategic delivery agenda. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§§Strategic priorities for this role §§Develop a practice framework including skill matrix for each role type (discipline) and plan to continually evolve and uplift capability and support development plans§Lead the development and execution of an end to end training framework program including material to raise the capability through coaching, training and on the job learning§Efficient identification, approval, recruitment, deployment and optimized allocation of PMO resources to ensure successful delivery of projects through resource capacity planning and performance management§Work with the Delivery Heads Of, Program and Project Managers to balance the relative priorities of resources and ensure the right resources are in the right roles to ensure quality deliveries are achieved§Ensure strong business stakeholder engagement and collaboration with technology to enhance quality, cost and timely delivery of projects and program§Build and maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders, both internal and external to drive and influence in order to achieve project/program/portfolio objectives§Work closely with Agile Coaches to lead the recruitment, development, capability, embedment of tools and culture pertaining to Agile methods and ways of working across the business, including the transition to SCRUM across projects§Monitor and support direct reports compliance with appropriate project methodology, processes and policies followed across projects, programs and portfolio to ensure excellence in project delivery.§§To be successful in this role you will have §§Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines§Proven experience running specialist PMO practices§Extensive program management and/or delivery experience with strong experience in Insurance/financial services industry§Proven experience in establishing, growing and uplifting relevant practices to grow and develop resources that support strategic project delivery§Ability to optimise allocation of practice resources to successfully deliver all projects within the PMO as well as ensuring optimal utilization and performance of resources§Strong understanding of all relevant project methodologies and processes (including Safe Agile, Lean Waterfall) and the ability to identify and utilise key tools and processes to ensure project delivery success§Experience in stakeholder management at all levels, with ability to influence, negotiate and prioritises to find ‘win-win’ outcomes§§Applications close Tuesday 20th October.§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobTitle: Underwriter, Financial Lines (12 Month Contract) Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50636219.txt	§Underwriter, Financial Lines (12 Month Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Underwriter, Financial Lines (12 Month Contract)§§Advertiser: §Chubb Insurance Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. § §Chubb Australia is currently experiencing a period of accelerated growth, and as we continue to excel and make our mark in the local market, we are looking for high potential individuals to join our dynamic and fast paced team.§ §MAIN  PURPOSE§ §The primary purpose of this role is to contribute to the achievement of department, branch and corporate goals relative to profit, growth, service producer and client relations.§ §MAJOR  DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES§ §Achievement of Retention and/or Personal premium budget § § §Achieve financial targets.§ §Underwriting§ § §Underwriting authority in all lines.§ §Within scope of delegated authority:§ §       - Evaluates and accepts or declines new lines,  renewals and endorsements.§      - Evaluates and makes recommendation for acceptance or declination on risks which exceed authority.§ § §Recommends account trade off decisions.§ §Assists manager in providing input on portfolio analysis, profit analysis, premium planning, market and environment analysis, process and systems effectiveness and efficiency, etc.§ §Responsible for underwriting results of assigned producers.§ §Producer Relations§ § §Underwriter is responsible for profit and premium growth of assigned producers. This would include producer account control and book composition and analysis.§ §Visits assigned producers to discuss risks, communicate Chubb’s business appetites, and to retain existing / produce new business.§ §Responsible for providing supervisor with input on premium planning variance.§ §Service§ § §Responsible for underwriting service to assigned producers.§ §Utilises the MOS and/or other Chubb measurement systems designed to improve processes, service and productivity§ §Expenses§ § §Negotiates advantageous commission levels where possible.§ §Stays within agreed travel / promotional budget.§ §Demonstrates good judgment in deployment of survey and audit resources.§ §Meets agreed standards of productivity.§ §Assist in premium collection for assigned producers.§ §KNOWLEDGE  &  SKILLS§ § §Minimum 2 years Underwriting experience, preferably with Small Commercial business products§ §Understands portfolio analysis / underwriting, in particular the renewals process§ §Understands pricing techniques.§ §Makes recommendations for tailoring coverage and manuscripting policies.§ §Has a working knowledge of alternative risk transfer.§ §Understands the underwriting appetites of the other departments and how those relate to interdepartmental accounts.§ §Understands the broker selection and appointment process.§ §Is familiar with the products / services of key competitors.§ §Is comfortable with a wide range of negotiation techniques.§ §Has demonstrated ability to work well with people and influence decisions.§ §Chubb is committed to equal employment and celebrates individual differences by creating a workplace environment in which everyone feels welcomed, respected and valued. We offer you the opportunity to work as part of a dynamic and agile environment where continuous development is encouraged throughout your career, both locally and globally. Some additional benefits offered include a flexible working approach via our “My One Thing” initiative, education assistance, dress for your day every Friday, and promotion of health and wellbeing (including discounted health insurance, daily breakfast and fresh fruit).§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50627165.txt	§Product & Underwriting Operations Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product & Underwriting Operations Analyst§§Advertiser: §Guild Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§Your new company §Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by a genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial wellbeing. We pride ourselves on our future focus and innovation.§At the heart of what we do is being there for those our communities rely on.§Our comprehensive product suite includes professional indemnity, public liability, workers compensation as well as business, home & contents and car insurance. We are Australian owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence. §About you §You could be a Business Analyst or Underwriting Operations Specialist looking to broaden your experience and skills whilst designing and delivering customer centric underwriting solutions that drive real business value.  You will have a track record of managing and implementing projects and having oversight across different systems that keep a business running. You are familiar with and understand the Product & Underwriting function within the General Insurance industry from your work experience.§You can pull together different threads of information from your own analysis as well as speaking with your colleagues into an efficient solution or an idea of how we can change our Product and Underwriting systems for the better. As the subject matter expert, ideally, you’re already familiar with PolicyCenter, Underwriting Rules and Rating Algorithms and have worked with Tableau and JIRA; and are capable of planning and executing Business Acceptance Testing.§You can build relationships not just in the immediate Product and Underwriting Team around you, but also with other teams across the business including Claims, Relationships & Customer Care and Technology. You will design solutions and detail requirements to achieve business outcomes and then oversee, test and communicate those changes.  Teams will look to you as their key point of contact so they know what’s changing in our underwriting systems, when these changes will happen and how they could be affected.§You’ve shown capability for complex numerical analysis and are comfortable with technology. You’re known for your flexibility and openness to trying different approaches to solve an issue. Needing to be across different projects, you can juggle your work well and are comfortable dealing with competing priorities.§If you were already in this role, here are some of the things you might have done last week§§You’ve had meetings with the leaders in the different areas of Product and Underwriting to understand and define what they want to change, and you’ve fed this into your well-organised JIRA Backlog.§You’ve developed test scenarios, plans and cases and directly executed User Acceptance Testing for system changes we’re about to roll out while documenting the business and system requirements that will inform the next round of changes.§You worked with our Technology Team and our Business Process and Systems Team to fix a few bugs and defects. You’ve also had continued discussions with your colleagues in the Technology Team regarding system changes to Policy Centre that the Underwriting team require.§You met with our Marketing Team and let them know we’ve updated some of our policy documentation so they can communicate this out and keep our insureds informed.§You’ve had your regular catchups with colleagues from our Customer Care and Regional teams so you’re aware of any issues they may be experiencing from system changes you’ve made.§You generated reports on our referrals via Tableau while constantly thinking of how we can automate and make our reporting more efficient. With your capacity for complex analysis, you’ve pulled insights from these reports about what’s triggering these referrals, where and why they’re happening.§You updated our rating systems in Policy Centre and worked with our Senior Portfolio Specialists to understand what needs to be updated in our Knowledge Centre then implemented these updates.§§Why us?§We pride ourselves on having an inclusive and productive workplace where we treat our people and our clients with fairness, dignity and respect.§We offer: §§Paid parental leave for eligible staff from 6 weeks§An extra day of paid leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements§Enhanced long service leave§Staff discounts with leading retailers§An Employee Assistance Program that provides counselling and support to all staff members and their immediate family§Wellbeing initiatives such as health checks and skin checks§Flexible working program available to eligible staff§§For more information about Guild Insurance visit https://www.guildinsurance.com.au/§Next Steps§If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then the please apply here.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The role also supports the management and development of the Company’s underwriting operations, delivery of on-the-job technical underwriting training and business development strategies to build the core business. Ideally the role is Melbourne based.§§Strategic priorities for this role §§Lead the end to end diagnostics and business prioritisation of initiatives to develop the yearly road map of negotiate and prioritises to find ‘win-win’ outcomes§§Applications close Tuesday 20th October. §§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. By truly caring about people, we foster a culture where our employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and dare to challenge the industry. §        §Allianz is committed to employment equity and therefore welcomes applications from men and women regardless of race or ethnicity, age, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or philosophy of life. Please advise us if you require any reasonable adjustments to fully participate in the recruitment process or perform the requirements of the role.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Case Manager - National Team §§What if you could turn your job into a career with purpose?§We are looking for a driven and dedicated Case Manager to join our National Claims Team working predominately with a large NSW self-insurance client.§You will also be exposed to a diverse portfolio of workers compensation claims across multiple jurisdictions. You will work within a team who are located around the country and who provide support to our state-based branches and clients by managing claims from multiple states of risk.§This is an exciting, diverse and unique role and would suit someone who is keen on taking their workers compensation career to the next level, with ongoing training and genuine opportunities for career progression.§Who are we?§The Underwritten Workers Compensation and Distribution business is responsible for the underwriting, sales and claims management for workers compensation in the risk states (NT, WA, TAS, ACT and Seafarers). Our National Claims Team provides support and assistance to risk-state based employers, managing claims in these jurisdictions as well as being involved with the management of claims for Self-Insured clients, Excess of Loss, Reinsurance and Dust Disease liabilities.§You'll be responsible for: §§Managing a diverse portfolio of claims for a NSW self-insured client§Interpretation and application of various legislation and regulations§Assessment of injuries including reviewing medical reports and surgical requests§Assessment of damages and negotiation of settlements§Provision of instructions to legal counsel§Liaising with key external stakeholders including brokers, insureds, solicitors, doctors and claimants§Utilising claims management systems§Developing strategies to progress matters towards resolution§Assisting in the retention of major clients by providing outstanding customer service§§Important to your success:§§You'll have experience within a case management role in Workers Compensation with the ability to understand the importance of early intervention and individualised claims management§Exposure to self insurance, law or Allied Health (desirable but not essential).§You will have excellent communication skills both written and verbal with a customer focused approach.§The ability to handle difficult situations and whilst resolving complex situations in a timely manner§You will be proactive with the drive to learn and develop skills.§Excellent time management skills and the ability to adapt when changes occur.§§What's on offer?§§Be part of a team that's open-minded, supportive, approachable and genuinely focused on customer outcomes§You will be responsible for end-to-end claims management for large NSW Self-Insurance client/s§You will also have support from Case Manager who assists with claim closures§You'll gain exposure to other jurisdictions which can be agreed upon in development plan§§About us§Allianz is the home for those who dare - a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people, we foster a culture where our employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and dare to challenge the industry. §Allianz is committed to employment equity and therefore welcomes applications from men and women regardless of race or ethnicity, age, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or philosophy of life. Please advise us if you require any reasonable adjustments to fully participate in the recruitment process or perform the requirements of the role.§§§§

We are a highly collaborative team of high achievers. jobText: TXT/50641345.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Salary§§Competitive Package + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks. Part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. §§Provide a specialised, person-centered approach to injured workers who have sustained a work-related psychological condition.§§Work systemically with key internal and external stakeholders to influence a return to work plan.§§Opportunities to expand your development through secondment and internal opportunities§§EML is a leading Workers Compensation and Personal Injury Claims Management business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through ongoing support during their return to work journey. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over 2,400 dedicated employees, alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a long-term career here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Chatswood§, you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§With the ongoing need to support our injured workers, we are currently looking for Allied Health professionals or experienced Case Managers to manage an average portfolio for our §Psychological and Mental Health claims§. As a Case Manager, you are the central point of contact for an injured worker, guiding them through the worker’s compensation process and helping them recover as quickly as possible.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES §§Manage an ongoing portfolio of claims with a focus on psychological and mental health injuries§Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as injured workers, employers and providers§Adopt a service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of all stakeholders§Undertake ongoing entitlement reviews in relation to weekly payments and medical expenses§Facilitate active participation of the injured worker and their employer in any return to work and recovery planning§Pro-actively manage rehabilitation providers and approval of rehabilitation plans§Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim cost§§ABOUT YOU§§As a Case Manager you display a high level of empathy and resilience when supporting your injured workers§You have strong technical capabilities with experience and/or an interest in the management of claims involving long term recovery§You are proactive, strategically focused and can think creatively when engaging with stakeholders such as workers, employers, providers and family§You have strong communication skills and can build rapport and confidence with your customers§Effectively listen and understand the needs of the customer and what is important to them to enable their recovery and return to work§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals. §EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§: §§Work with a team who support each other and work within a collaborative and vibrant culture§One refresh day every month to enjoy what you love doing most§A corporate wellbeing program§Enjoyable twice yearly companywide parties§Get paid an extra 17.5% of your pay when you take annual leave§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Isabel Tran§ on §02 8098 6364§ or on email at §I.Tran@eml.com.au§. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50622849.txt	§Claims Assessor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Assessor§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Great benefits + flexible working arrangements§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§We are currently looking for a Claims Assessor to assess retail claims within the guidelines available and in line with the contractual obligations of AIA for the specific product being claimed. The incumbent will have experience in assisting claimants back to work and work closely with our Senior Claims Analysts, Claims Specialists and advisors to achieve optimal outcomes for AIA and claimants.§§The key accountabilities for this role include:§Assess claims through the practical application of the policy terms and conditions and analysis of medical, financial and other relevant information§Manage ongoing claims through the regular analysis of medical, financial and other relevant information§Confirm, and where appropriate, to substantiate claim decisions to members, Trustees and/or intermediaries as appropriate§Deploy reasonable application of resources and requirements in assessing a claim,  ensuring that the client is given a fair assessment but without compromising AIA in any way§Investigate and resolve disputes pertaining to expectations of the client/adviser versus the reality of our product rules, policy terms and conditions and industry/business practice and our data§Ensure that the agreed Individual processing Turn Around Times (TAT) are met or exceeded§Ensure that the quality, including presentation, accuracy and detail of claims assessment meets or exceeds the business unit minimum performance standards§§As the successful candidate, you will have:§Experience within life insurance or related industry.§High level of knowledge of product, claims, medical, system and legislation/regulations impacting life insurance§Genuine interest and desire for the achievement of high standards and process improvement.§Strong customer service focus§Medical Terminology or similar§Good analytical skills, with a high attention to detail and the ability to analyse data and make recommendations on claim decisions§Strong written and verbal communication skills§Strong computer skills including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50606218.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Package + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks. Part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. §§Take the lead on influencing and driving return to work outcomes §§Work collaboratively within a positive team environment with highly supportive leaders §§Opportunity to work with a well-established organisation based in George St, Sydney §§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims Management§ business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an §additional four offices§. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a §long-term career§ here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Sydney,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§We are looking for an experienced case manager with the technical skills and knowledge to join our Workers Compensation Claims team in NSW. In this role, you will be proactively managing claims, drawing on your exceptional customer service and decision-making skills to achieve desired return to work outcomes.§ §§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Assist the worker and employer with the claim process and providing support in the completion of relevant documents to ensure timely access to required services to support return to work and injury recovery§Service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of workers and employers§Ensure that active and timely intervention occurs to improve recovery and return to work outcomes§Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as workers, employers and providers§Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim costs§§ABOUT YOU§§Professional case management experience in NSW Workers’ Compensation.§You are passionate about helping others and providing a high level of customer service. Ideally Allied Health background/degree or workers rehabilitation, social work or equivalent.§Proven capability of dealing with conflict, complaints and difficult customers in any previous or current role.§Experience and high level of knowledge of the NSW workers compensation scheme, legislation and policies§High attention to detail and organizational skills with some previous exposure to leadership and coaching§Demonstrates ability to negotiate and influence others§§WHAT WE OFFER§We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including: §§Work with a team who support each other and work within a collaborative and vibrant culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Comprehensive onsite learning and development support§A corporate wellbeing program§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Isabel Tran§ on §02 8098 6364§ or on email at §I.Tran@eml.com.au§. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Insurance Pricing- Portfolio Specialist  Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50651891.txt	§Insurance Pricing- Portfolio Specialist §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Pricing- Portfolio Specialist §§Advertiser: §Guild Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§Your new company §Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by a genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial wellbeing. We pride ourselves on our future focus and innovation.§At the heart of what we do is being there for those our communities rely on.§Our comprehensive product suite includes professional indemnity, public liability, workers compensation as well as business, home & contents and car insurance. We are Australian owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence.§About you §You are an experienced insurance professional with a strong background in general insurance pricing and portfolio analysis. You could have gained this experience working in general insurance and have become familiar with commercial and/or personal lines. You could also come from workers compensation or life insurance.§You know your way around Microsoft Excel as an expert, comfortably using it to analyse complex data. You are also familiar with business intelligence tools used in the insurance industry such as Tableau or Duck Creek Insights.§You could have tertiary qualifications in Commerce, Law, Engineering, Science or Economics, or have already had substantial experience in a similar role and can demonstrate a strong grasp of insurance pricing and analytics You could be a technical underwriter or an emerging actuary interested in gaining broader exposure in a different area of insurance.§Crucially, you’re also known for taking the initiative to connect with your colleagues across the business to collaborate, to ask for help and to learn from them. You build relationships with them, drawing from their knowledge and perspectives so you can look beyond what the numbers tell you on the surface and dive deeper to understand the “why” so you and your colleagues can focus on “what next”.§You can distil and package complex information from different sources to provide insights, building an engaging story around the emerging trends that you’ve uncovered that you can communicate with clarity.§If you were working for us, here are some of the things you might have done last week§§Used Excel and other business intelligence tools available to you to surface trends in the numbers across our portfolios, packaging and summarising this information to provide your stakeholders with market-level insights.§Digging deeper into the underlying drivers of the health of our portfolios by connecting and speaking with your colleagues in Portfolio Management, Underwriting and Claims.§Running workshops with colleagues from different disciplines to identify and evaluate potential threats to delivering our underwriting margins. Then, pooling your collective insights to create a concise and clear story that you present to senior members of the business.§With the support of your colleagues in the Portfolio Management team, building your understanding of our markets and our products.§Learning from your manager and perhaps your colleagues in the Strategy, Risk and Analytics team to become more familiar with how we organise our data.§§Why us?§We pride ourselves on having an inclusive and productive workplace where we treat our people and our clients with fairness, dignity and respect.§We offer: §§Paid parental leave for eligible staff from 6 weeks§An extra day of paid leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements§Enhanced long service leave§Staff discounts with leading retailers§An Employee Assistance Program that provides counselling and support to all staff members and their immediate family§Wellbeing initiatives such as health checks and skin checks§Flexible working program available to eligible staff§§For more information about Guild Insurance visit https://www.guildinsurance.com.au/§Next Steps§If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then the please apply here.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50654858.txt	§Business Relationship Manager, NSW§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Relationship Manager, NSW§§Advertiser: §Pentana Solutions Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Relationship Manager, NSW §      §        §Pentana Solutions Pty. Ltd., a global company with its HQ situated in Melbourne, specialise in the development and supply of automotive software tailored to dealerships. Our current leadership position within the automotive IT industry stems from vast industry experience, technological knowledge and years of continual product development. With over 500 staff in 13 locations around the globe, our products and services extend to over 100 countries with over 50,000 daily users.§        §As a company, we recognise our people are our greatest asset; we value attitude as well as aptitude and provide opportunities to those who demonstrate the ability and drive to succeed in their role. If you want to join a team who are continually driving toward the future, an exciting opportunity now exists for an Business Relationship Manager (BRM) for NSW, in our Sales department.§ §A home office role and reporting directly to the State Manager - NSW,  the incumbent; an integral part of the Sales team, acts as a liaison between the Pentana Solutions customer and the business.  They will be responsible for building and maintaining positive customer relationships, customer retention and overall customer satisfaction within their region – NSW.§THE ROLE:§Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to;§        §          §Keep up-to-date with current industry and dealership requirements; jobTitle: External Claims Adjuster Job in Rockhampton & Capricorn Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50711205.txt	§External Claims Adjuster§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§External Claims Adjuster§§Advertiser: §Crawford and Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Rockhampton & Capricorn Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Crawford:§ §Crawford & Company is the world’s largest publicly listed independent provider of claims management solutions to the risk management and insurance industry. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§ §About the Role:§ §As an external claims adjuster, you will work under moderate or specialised supervision, resolve commercial and domestic losses, ensuring compliance with service level agreements and maintaining high production levels§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Maintain expected case load of claims§ §Provide office and field based assessment and investigation of commercial, domestic and liability insurance losses from first advice to final settlement.§ §Provide support and advice to policy holders with respect to their claims.§ §Examine claims forms, policies and endorsements, client instructions and other records to determine coverage.§ §Investigate claims by interviewing claimants and witnesses, obtaining official reports, by inspecting physical damage, by comparing claim information with evidence.§ §Set loss reserves and control claims costs§ §Settle claims after determining insurance carrier’s liability, client’s instructions, and authority levels required by obtaining demands and making offers to claimants, issuing settlement recommendations, making filings with regulatory agencies, disposing of salvage and pursuing subrogation when appropriate.§ §Effectively deal with service/product replacement providers§ §Recommend litigation when appropriate.§ §Present evidence at legal proceedings producing reports and other documents as evidence if applicable.§ §Comply with and maintain Service Level Agreements and jobText: TXT/50665118.txt	§Senior Compensation Claims Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Compensation Claims Manager§§Advertiser: §APRG - Attraction. Guidance.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Compensation Claims Manager §      §        §We are seeking an experienced workers compensation professional who takes pride in providing genuine service and working towards positive return to work outcomes for claimants.§        §The Organisation§        §As one of Australia’s largest employers, our client provides ample opportunity for career development while fostering a tight-knit culture of reliability and accountability. §        §Removed from the depersonalized nature of larger institutions, this role prioritises collaboration and care for injured workers to adapt to unique circumstance and work towards positive outcomes.§        §The Role §        §As a Senior Claims Manager, you will manage a portfolio of workers compensation claims as well as identifying, escalating and managing high risk and business sensitive claims. You will be required to complete the end to end case management, including managing the rehabilitation and return to work as well as developing the skills of others. Key responsibilities include: §        §          §            §Handling claims through any stage of its life cycle with emphasis on successful implementation of rehabilitation measures and return to work plans§          §          §            §Providing high levels of service to claimants and stakeholders §          §          §            §Conducting functional interviews with injured worker, medical practitioners and allied health, Managers and other key stakeholders §          §        §        §Your Background §        §          §Experience managing compensation claims at any level §          §An empathetic disposition, with an understanding of the importance of commercial decisions§          §Proven ability to manage and prioritise tasks in a fast-paced environment§          §Positive and proactive attitude to change§        §        §The Benefits§        §          §Make your mark within a reputable organisation who take pride in a very strong retention rate and an excellent leadership team§          §Manageable caseloads§          §Competitive salary package§          §Full-time permanent opportunity based in Mount Gravatt §        §        §Next Steps§        §Apply now via Seek. For a confidential discussion to learn a more you can contact Joseph via §hello@aprg.com.au§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We are seeking an experienced workers compensation professional who takes pride in providing genuine service and working towards positive return to work outcomes for claimants.§  §The Organisation§  §As one of Australia’s largest employers, our client provides ample opportunity for career development while fostering a tight-knit culture of reliability and accountability. §  §Removed from the depersonalized nature of larger institutions, this role prioritises collaboration and care for injured workers to adapt to unique circumstance and work towards positive outcomes.§  §The Role §  §As a Senior Claims Manager, you will manage a portfolio of workers compensation claims as well as identifying, escalating and managing high risk and business sensitive claims. You will be required to complete the end to end case management, including managing the rehabilitation and return to work as well as developing the skills of others. Key responsibilities include: § § § §Handling claims through any stage of its life cycle with emphasis on successful implementation of rehabilitation measures and return to work plans§  § § §Providing high levels of service to claimants and stakeholders §  § § §Conducting functional interviews with injured worker, medical practitioners and allied health, Managers and other key stakeholders §  § §Your Background § § §Experience managing compensation claims at any level § §An empathetic disposition, with an understanding of the importance of commercial decisions§ §Proven ability to manage and prioritise tasks in a fast-paced environment§ §Positive and proactive attitude to change§ §The Benefits§ § §Make your mark within a reputable organisation who take pride in a very strong retention rate and an excellent leadership team§ §Manageable caseloads§ §Competitive salary package§ §Full-time permanent opportunity based in Mount Gravatt § §Next Steps§  §Apply now via Seek. For a confidential discussion to learn a more you can contact Joseph via §hello@aprg.com.au§ §§§§

by providing risk assessment and product terms on new business opportunities including reviewing and assisting in the preparation of tender documents, ensuring product terms are consistent with AIA philosophy, competitive (yet sustainable) and supported by internal stakeholders & reinsurers.§          §          §            §Contribute to written communication on product and technical issues and where required, attend client meetings as required to assist Distribution in influencing client acceptance of important product changes.§          §          §            §Conduct research on competitor offers & identify areas of difference when compared to AIA offering§          §          §            §Support development of Policy Documents and disclosure material in plain language Maybe you are wanting to specialise or even diversify your experience?§ §Are you willing to learn whilst on the job?§ §Are you looking to work for an employer who values flexibility and work life balance?§ §AB Phillips provides a complete range of insurance, financial services and people solutions to businesses and individuals. The business was established in 1975 and AB Phillips has now become one of the most successful integrated insurance, risk and financial services businesses in Melbourne operating from offices in Moorabbin and Frankston.§ §The Account Manager – Personal Lines is responsible for the acquisition, management and development of insurance clients in Personal Lines. The Account Manager - Personal Lines also develops and maintains customer relationships with the primary objectives of creating an excellent client experience; ensuring the successful delivery or AB Phillips total risk, insurance and service solution; and maximising revenue of the portfolio thus contributing to AB Phillips' new business growth objectives. Furthermore, the Account Manager – Personal Lines will also service an existing portfolio of clients by providing professional insurance and financial services designed to identify and fulfil client needs.§ §To be successful for this position you will:§ § §Have Tier 2 Insurance Broking qualifications (essential)§ §Have Tier 1 Insurance Broking qualifications (highly desirable)§ §Possess proven ability to influence and negotiate to achieve beneficial outcomes§ §Be pragmatic and logical in approach§ §Have well-developed communication and interpersonal skills (both written and oral)§ §Be results driven and focused, with the ability to achieve outcomes with minimal direct management§ §Have the ability to work confidently with all levels of management and stakeholders§ §Be passionate about providing quality service that supports and develops others§ §Take a consultative approach to all dealings where required§ §Possess high levels of personal and professional integrity and confidentiality§ §Display a lead by example approach and have initiative and drive to self-motivate and motivate others§ §AB Phillips is large enough to provide many future career opportunities whilst also providing an environment where you will be a valued member of the team.  We offer salary packaging, income protection, employee assistance program, travel insurance coverage and other similar benefits.§ §If you are looking to join a dynamic, down to earth, diverse and growing firm who provide expert professional solutions in insurance, financial services and people management to businesses and individuals then please apply.§§§§

Through our success, we aspire to more prosperous and sustainable communities, not only the creation of enterprise value.§We believe that extraordinary people do extraordinary things. Extraordinary comes in different perspectives and experiences. We’re looking for people who want to be a part of a team that has the appetite and ambition to be different. We’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to be their best selves, every day.§Your Impact §As the Manager of Travel Claims your new role will see report into the Group Manager Travel Operations where you will lead a team of claims specialists in delivering an exceptional experience for nib Travel brand customers, with clear and consistent outcomes.§This role will see you provide the leadership required in delivering to key metrics and performance targets and be a key stakeholder in supporting external Underwriters, giving them confidence in nib’s ability to manage and control a portfolio of claims. More specifically, you will:§§Oversee claim assignments accounting for an individual’s competency and experience, providing balanced workloads, whilst driving for continually improved outcomes.§Ensure an appropriate framework exists in which to manage claims, accounting for the service experience and outcomes, as well as relevant compliance and regulation.§Support delivery of insights and analysis for claims management including people's performance measures, to help inform the functions future direction.§Foster high-performance individuals and create an empowered culture to get things done.§Responsible for the development and management of all operational SLA’s with internal and external stakeholders§§Your Team§We drive value for both our customers and the business by understanding how and why our users use our products. We are a highly collaborative team of high achievers. We love to explore, challenge, and have a lot of fun along the way by challenging the status quo and experimenting.§Your Background §You will have extensive claims leadership experience with strong capabilities in transformation, communication, MS and Salesforce applications, and stakeholder management.§You will have proven experience developing and delivering strategic programs of work with a focus on digital transformation, automation and workforce optimisation, complimented with an aptitude for analysis and statistics. It is preferable you also understand operations and technology development lifecycles and platform management and are Tier 2 RG146 trained.§Benefits§The nib Group is a highly collaborative, purpose-led, and values-driven organisation. To support you at work (and play), we offer some fantastic benefits including but not limited to:§§Employee health insurance discounts§Employee share plans§Volunteer leave§Paid parental leave§Gym discounts and fitness incentives§Short-term incentive programs§Educational assistance§Flexible working arrangements, including work from home§§We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.§nib is committed to remote and flexible working, giving our people the opportunity to create and personalise their own work environments, whilst also offering opportunities for our people to connect, socialise and come together as teams in collaborative and innovative ways.§All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment.§www.nib.com.au§ §§§§

We value our staff members and provide all staff with ongoing training to promote growth within the company.§  §The Role§  §In this role, you will be working closely with our Existing Financial Planner/s to provide quality & complaint advice to our client base. § § § §Preparation of high-quality recommendations for clients, including SOA’s and ROA’s.§  § § §You will need in depth understanding of risk and compliance in relation to investments, insurance, superannuation both simple and  complex strategies specifically focused around SMSF collaboration §  § § §Reviewing advice documents and paperwork to ensure they are complete and accurate.§  § § §Gather technical account and policy information on existing superannuation, insurance and the whole of life policies for analysis and review.§  § § §Provide financial planners with information and guidance on research, recommended strategies, alternate strategies, and Compliance.§  § § §Prepare relevant financial modeling for client situations.§  § § §Management of client portfolios§  § § §Review PDS documentation§  § §What you'll need for the position:§  §You have a desire to work within a professional and supportive culture and will need to possess the following skills and experience:§ § § §An experienced, confident and capable paraplanner ideally with 2+ years of experience.§  § § §Exceptional attention to detail with a solutions-based focus (always asking if there's a better way)§  § § §Strong time management skills with the ability to work well in a team environment as well as autonomously.§  § § §Possess strong technical knowledge comprehensive knowledge regarding SMSF related research tools.§  § § §Have excellent written and verbal communication skills,§  § § §Diploma of Financial Planning RG146 compliant. • Up-to-date knowledge of the current Industry Compliance  §  § §While your technical knowledge is awesome, your superpowers are identifying opportunities for someone to improve their financial situation, and being able to communicate sometimes complex strategies in a way anyone can understand.§  §Why Us?§ § § §Work culture is one of our number one position could be the perfect fit for you, then we look forward to hearing from you.§  §Location: Bundall QLD 4217§  §To Apply: Please click 'apply' via seek§  §We look forward to hearing from you.§ jobTitle: Senior Case Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50643225.txt	§Senior Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Case Manager§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§In November 2019, AIA Australia welcomed CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA family. This role is positioned in the CMLAS Pty Ltd business and based at our offices in Sydney Olympic Park.§§Your role as a Senior Case Manager will see you work in a team that is responsible for the assessment of Group Income Protection claims for a number of Superannuation Funds. While managing your own portfolio of claims the Senior Case Manager role is also a technical role.§You will be the technical expert, providing guidance and coaching support to other Claims Assessors. In addition to this you will work closely with our partner Superannuation Funds to address any questions and queries.§To be successful as a Senior Claims Assessor, you will come from a claims management background in a life insurance environment. You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills, have financial or accounting skills and the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders whether internal or external. You will know how to manage your time and be organised to deliver your work in a fast paced dynamic environment. You will be motivated by making a difference and will understand how to manage your priorities and stakeholders effectively.§Some of the main responsibilities include:§§Manage own claims portfolio including more complex claims, and proactively contribute to the overall achievement of claims turnaround times, SLAs and Life Code of Practice obligations.§Ensure that the quality, including presentation, accuracy and detail of claims assessments meets or exceeds the business unit minimum performance standards.§Be aware of the importance and value of good business relationships between all stakeholders and taking accountability for maintaining those relationships.§Participate in  initiatives to help achieve claims strategy and develop a high performance culture, including the delivery of projects as required§Actively participate in any other tasks, projects or responsibilities assigned from time to time by Management.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50590759.txt	§Insurance Broker - Client Service Officer / Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Broker - Client Service Officer / Associate§§Advertiser: §Lockton Companies Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$70,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Lockton Companies Australia§  §More than 7,500 professionals at Lockton provide 52,000 clients around the world with risk management, insurance, and employee benefits services. Our successful team of entrepreneurial professionals have driven Lockton to become the largest privately held, independent insurance broker in the world. Growing rapidly in Australia, we now have offices Perth, Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Darwin and Adelaide.§  §We work in a fast-paced and exciting environment in  Sydney, but have a relaxed and non-hierarchical culture. Our staff believe passionately in our company values: independence, entrepreneurial spirit and empowering our people to do what's best for our clients. §  §About the role§  §A fantastic opportunity to learn the world of corporate insurance broking. We are seeking an Insurance Broker - Client Services Officer/Associate in our Sydney office, who is a motivated team player with a positive attitude. The role will involve providing support and assistance with all aspects of servicing of corporate client trade credit insurance and surety needs.§  §To be successful in this role, you will need:§ § §Tier 1 or Diploma in Insurance Broking.§ §Minimum of two years general insurance broking experience.§ §Knowledge of commercial insurance products, specifically trade credit and surety. § §Be capable of following directions and working collaboratively with others, while also being self-motivated and be able to manage own workload.§ §Be able to manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously.§ §Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills (verbal and written).§ §Have a high level of attention to detail.§ §Have a strong ‘can-do’ attitude and willingness to pitch in.§ §Experience meeting with clients to identify their insurance needs and explaining details of insurance and conditions, risk coverage, premiums and benefits.§ §Calculating premiums and establishing method of payment§ §Reviewing clients' risk profile if changed to ensure the coverage of insurance is still appropriate.§ §Monitoring insurance claims to ensure the best outcomes for your client.§ §recording information about clients and their policies§ §Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of changes in the insurance industry.§ § §  §It would be great if you can demonstrate: § § §A high level of customer service experience.§ §Direct experience dealing with insurance underwriters and clients.§ §An understanding of claims administration.§ §Insurance policy administration and invoice systems (e.g. Winbeat, CBS or EGlobal).§ §Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.  § § §  §Benefits - what’s in it for you?§ § §Varied and interesting work within a team of professionals who are passionate about what they do. § §An inspired work culture and a collaborative team environment, in a central Sydney location. § §A competitive salary ($70,000 to $80,000 gross) and employee benefits.§ § §  §www.locktonaustralia.com.au§  § §§§§

the Banca, Partnerships and Advice Leadership Team§ § § §Partner with Finance on the annual budgeting process aligned to the enterprise strategic planning process and quarterly reviews§ § § §Planning, directing and communicating the department’s strategic plan and long term goals§ § § §Lead and co-ordinate all management reporting across Banca, Partnerships and Advice including partner reporting obligations§ § § §Provide accurate and timely reports including financial performance analysis§ § § §Prepare monthly management financial reports including key data, financial performance of each business and highlight key issues with identified risk and opportunities to business§ § § §Manage the engagement and collaboration with Group Office to deliver required reporting§ § § § §Skills and Experience § § § §Strong commercial acumen§ § § §Strong management reporting experience§ § § §Project/program experience highly regarded§ § § §Excellent organizational and time management skills, including proven experience in co-ordinating input from a number of contributors§ § § §Thought leadership: ability to research, reimagine and articulate new ways forward, turning data/research into insight and insight into proposed actions§ § § §Relationship management: influences, negotiates and engages. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§ § § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries.§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally.§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit.§ §About the Role:§ §As Internal Claims Adjuster, you’ll manage a portfolio of property claims to conclusion, ensuring compliance with service level agreements, meeting key performance indicators, and be a first point of contact for minor escalations and technical referrals.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Maintaining expected case load of property claims§ §Examining claims forms, policies and endorsements, and other records to determine coverage§ §Investigating claims by conducting office based analysis of physical damage details, interviewing claimants, and comparing claim information with evidence§ §Providing support & advice to policy holders with respect to their claims§ §Setting loss reserves and Controlling claim costs§ §Preparing first reports by collecting and summarising information required§ §Settling claims after determining liability, client’s instructions, and authority levels§ §Type client reports in an accurate & timely manner§ §Adhere to insurer client Service Level Agreements and processes§ §Update Claims Management System as required§ §Effectively deal with service/product replacement providers§ §First point of referral for minor escalations§ §Distribution of claims to adjusters§ §Point of contact for technical referrals§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of claims adjusters, bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit; down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service; and time and caseload management skills§ §Who we’re looking for:§ § §Previous claims experience preferred§ §Experience in management of General Insurance Claims§ §Insurance Contracts Act/FSRA legislation awareness§ §Stable work history§ §Excellent English§ §High Typing speed§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role.§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon.§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check.§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your average typing speed?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

With approximately 1000 employees, Eclipx Group helps consumers and businesses of all sizes access the funds they need to operate through fleet leasing, novated leasing vehicle sales, commercial equipment finance and consumer motor vehicle finance solutions.§ § §About the Position§ § We have an exciting opportunity for a §Claims Consultant§ to join our in-house Accident Management division, 1800Accident. This role will have accountability for providing end to end case management to our customers through the motor claim process, liaising with customers, suppliers and insurers to ensure the claim is managed efficiently and effectively. Your ability to adapt and change in an environment that’s forever evolving, use your initiative and build relationships with a variety of stakeholders will place you in good stead for this role.§ § §You will be responsible for:§End to end claims management§Manage inbound and outbound calls from customers, suppliers and insurers§Build and maintain quality relationships with all internal and external stakeholders§Provide accurate and timely responses to all queries - keeping customers and third-party providers informed of claim progress§Contribute to the continuous improvement of the business by actively identifying opportunities to improve processes and/or procedures§Work effectively and collaboratively within a team environment to achieve team goals and objectives§What we are looking for:§Exceptional customer service and administrative skills§An ability to work effectively within a busy team environment§Strong attention to detail§Highly motivated and enthusiastic§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Minimum of two years call centre and/or customer service experience (desirable)§Experience in managing motor or fleet claims (desirable)§Benefits of joining Eclipx:§Attractive remuneration package§Exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people§Training and Education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential, giving you the opportunity to be innovative and take the lead in driving your career§Dress for your Day - we believe that how we choose to dress is a reflection of who you are; by joining us you will have an opportunity to let your personality shine through§Diversity - we know it takes people with different ideas, strengths, interests, and cultural backgrounds to make our company succeed§Additional benefits - including staff discounts, salary packaging and novated vehicle leasing§§§§

jobTitle: Capacity Support Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50570105.txt	§Capacity Support Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Capacity Support Specialist§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§The Role§The Capacity Support specialist will manage and oversee the Recovery and Capacity Support Performance Measure, by owning the process, and championing our performance with Worksafe. They will need to manage the process, develop and participate in the review of claims with Worksafe, utilise their knowledge and skills in return to work and injury management, and have exceptional stakeholder communication skills, to drive optimal return to work and capacity outcomes. §In addition to managing this measure, the Capacity Support specialist will provide oversight for claims approaching this measure, by reviewing claims, attending case conferences, and by up-skilling and developing capability for case managers, to continue to drive optimal return to work and capacity outcomes.§You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ §       Provide advice and/or assistance to Worker’s Compensation claims staff, employers, workers and treating health practitioners to promote cost effective, durable Return To Work and recovery outcomes centred on a customer focused workers compensation claims service§ §       Drive and monitor the Capacity Support performance measure (APA) to achieve target performance § §        Effectively manage a portfolio of high return to work risk claims to improve return to work rates and worker satisfaction § §        Provide return to work and related technical advice and guidance to others including Technical Managers and Case Managers § §        Provide Injury Management and Return to Work assistance/advice to claims teams § §        Provide coaching and mentoring to Case Managers § §        Be the key contact for WorkSafe for the Capacity Support performance measure § §        Communicate strategically with all stakeholders. This includes upfront expectation setting and education regarding obligations § §        Facilitate stakeholder engagement including relevant workplace parties and treating health practitioners § §        Provide exemplary client service § §        Support recovery and return to work planning § §        Attend & participate in Case Conferencing§ § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ §In-depth knowledge of Recoveries & Return to Work strategies and WorkSafe’s performance measures, and the application of these in claims management methods§ §Experience in the application of Worker's Compensation legislation, specifically through experience within the worker’s compensation industry§ §Tertiary qualifications in the disciplines of personal injury management (or similar) will be held in high esteem§ §Exceptional time management and Organisational skills and the ability to prioritise your tasks§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a team-player attitude§ §An aptitude for working within a dynamic, fast paced and challenging environment§ §Coaching and mentoring skills§ §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§ § §Attractive remuneration packaging§ § § §Flexible work hours§ § § §Staff referral incentive§ § § §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ § § §Service recognition awards§ § § §Employee assistance program for yourself and immediate family members§ § §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ § ​§A brief overview on GB:§​§Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§To apply§ §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognise the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applying.§Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§§§§§
