jobText: TXT/50646505.txt	§Claims Technical Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Technical Specialist§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§Competitive Salary + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§§Utilize your knowledge of Workers’ Compensation legislation to support a team§§Coach and mentor our Case Managers in the new model§§We care for our employee's career development with an in-house L&D Team§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims Management§ business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of §additional four offices§. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a §long-term career§ here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §King Street, Newcastle§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§You will provide regular advice and feedback to Case Managers and Team Leaders, within our §Support Claims §team, on adverse decisions relating to liability/work capacity / permanent impairment/weekly payment entitlements and communication of these decisions. You will assist in improving the overall quality of these decisions.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Working directly with a team of Case Managers supporting the delivery of a world class customer experience§Assessing all technical considerations of compensation payments and liability determination§Working within the legislative and regulatory environment to optimise outcomes for all stakeholders§Applying sound risk management principles to ensure compliance and robust decision making§Understand the impact of initial eligibility under legislation in regards to benefits for injured workers and impact to stakeholders§Participate and provide technical support in employer claims reviews§§ABOUT YOU§§Strong technical experience in workers’ compensation claims§Proven experience coaching & mentoring case managers in the workers compensation industry§Demonstrated understanding and application of relevant NSW Workers compensation laws and the associated regulations§You have previous experience working as a case manager or a technical specialist background§Tertiary studies in Allied Health or Legislation is desirable§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals.§ EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Onsite learning and development team§A corporate wellbeing program§Comprehensive learning and development support§Access to discounts at over 350 retailers through our Rewards Hub program§17.5% annual leave loading§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks.§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. As part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact Mary on §0280713623§ [link removed] or on email at m.norouzifar@eml.com.au. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50620755.txt	§Senior Underwriter Strategic Accounts and Schemes§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Underwriter Strategic Accounts and Schemes§§Advertiser: §Ansvar§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Underwriter Strategic Accounts and Schemes §      §        §About the business§        §Ansvar Insurance was launched in Australia in 1961 and has evolved to the company we are today; offering a range of products to the Care, Community, Faith, Education and Property Owners sectors.§        §We strive to be the most trusted and ethical specialist insurer within our core sectors, and to contribute to and help build safer communities that promote well-being and peace of mind§        §About the Role§        §As an experienced Underwriter you will be responsible for the personal underwriting of medium to complex risk within our portfolios and sectors within delegated underwriting authority and in accordance with the Company's laid down strategies to support the profitable growth of the business. In this role you will also be responsible for maximising existing and new business opportunities sourced by the State’s Business Development team in partnership with the Regional Underwriting Manager §        §Reporting to the Regional Underwriting Manager and based within the Perth office, key responsibilities will include:§        §          §Assist in the growth and maintenance of profitable, sustainable business within all allocated State's portfolio of business§          §Undertake personal underwriting of the portfolio§          §Deliver professional and efficient customer service to brokers and distribution partners, as well as internal colleagues§          §Assist the Portfolio Manager in maximising the profitability of the portfolio§          §Contribute to the alignment of risk and compliance management practises within the portfolio by sitting at the first line of defence§          §Act as a technical point of authority concerning the portfolio§          §Contribute to the development of a workplace learning environment§        §        §As an  experienced Underwriter you must be highly disciplined, with excellent planning and time management skills and the ability to work effectively to deliver viable results for the Company. You will also display a flexible attitude with a ‘can-do’ approach and a willingness to assist as required, this includes providing your expertise and knowledge to other functions of the business. You will be a team player, and assist in sharing knowledge and skill across the Company to ensure a culture of continuous learning and development.§        §You will have demonstrable underwriting capability within the general insurance sector and experience dealing directly with brokers and clients. Possessing a proven track record of meeting KPIs/business goals and targets and up to date knowledge in most aspects of general insurance, including a practical understanding of insurance principles, policies, pricing, reinsurance, claims and risk management is essential. You will have at least 5+ years’ experience working in a underwriting capacity including business development functions with strong commercial lines product knowledge and you have  completed or be undertaking insurance qualifications to ANZIIF Associate level and/or have relevant tertiary qualifications related to Insurance.§        §This is a fantastic opportunity to express your interest in joining a dynamic organisation that is passionate about being the first choice for our customers. In return, you will gain extensive exposure to the general insurance industry and work for a Company that is committed to providing its employees with a professional, supportive work environment and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.§        §If this sounds like the role for you, send a current resume and cover letter by selecting the apply button now.§        §Applications for this role close cob Friday 9th October 2020§      §      §www.ansvar.com.au§    §    §  §§§About the business§  §Ansvar Insurance was launched in Australia in 1961 and has evolved to the company we are today; offering a range of products to the Care, Community, Faith, Education and Property Owners sectors.§  §We strive to be the most trusted and ethical specialist insurer within our core sectors, and to contribute to and help build safer communities that promote well-being and peace of mind§  §About the Role§  §As an experienced Underwriter you will be responsible for the personal underwriting of medium to complex risk within our portfolios and sectors within delegated underwriting authority and in accordance with the Company's laid down strategies to support the profitable growth of the business. In this role you will also be responsible for maximising existing and new business opportunities sourced by the State’s Business Development team in partnership with the Regional Underwriting Manager §  §Reporting to the Regional Underwriting Manager and based within the Perth office, key responsibilities will include:§ § §Assist in the growth and maintenance of profitable, sustainable business within all allocated State's portfolio of business§ §Undertake personal underwriting of the portfolio§ §Deliver professional and efficient customer service to brokers and distribution partners, as well as internal colleagues§ §Assist the Portfolio Manager in maximising the profitability of the portfolio§ §Contribute to the alignment of risk and compliance management practises within the portfolio by sitting at the first line of defence§ §Act as a technical point of authority concerning the portfolio§ §Contribute to the development of a workplace learning environment§ §As an  experienced Underwriter you must be highly disciplined, with excellent planning and time management skills and the ability to work effectively to deliver viable results for the Company. You will also display a flexible attitude with a ‘can-do’ approach and a willingness to assist as required, this includes providing your expertise and knowledge to other functions of the business. You will be a team player, and assist in sharing knowledge and skill across the Company to ensure a culture of continuous learning and development.§  §You will have demonstrable underwriting capability within the general insurance sector and experience dealing directly with brokers and clients. Possessing a proven track record of meeting KPIs/business goals and targets and up to date knowledge in most aspects of general insurance, including a practical understanding of insurance principles, policies, pricing, reinsurance, claims and risk management is essential. You will have at least 5+ years’ experience working in a underwriting capacity including business development functions with strong commercial lines product knowledge and you have  completed or be undertaking insurance qualifications to ANZIIF Associate level and/or have relevant tertiary qualifications related to Insurance.§  §This is a fantastic opportunity to express your interest in joining a dynamic organisation that is passionate about being the first choice for our customers. In return, you will gain extensive exposure to the general insurance industry and work for a Company that is committed to providing its employees with a professional, supportive work environment and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.§  §If this sounds like the role for you, send a current resume and cover letter by selecting the apply button now.§  §Applications for this role close cob Friday 9th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an underwriter?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

§Echelon Australia, a subsidiary of Marsh (JLT), offers a premier claims management service, specialising in the area of insurance operations and self-insurance programs.  A full-time position currently exists for a Senior Claims Consultant within our Melbourne team handling public liability claims for two of our ‘blue chip’ corporate clients.§        §        §In this role, you will complete a variety of duties, including liaising with claimants, clients, solicitors, repairers, and assessors, whilst conducting general claims duties.§        §        §What is in it for you?§        §Marsh strongly believes in “Feeling comfortable bringing your whole self to work is a fundamental right of every colleague.” We offer following benefits to our employees so they feel valued each day Within B&A, the Corporate Facilities team will provide dedicated servicing to Aon and Marsh for SME Packages and Commercial Motor business transacted via the Aon Vertex and Marsh Gateway Connect.§        §This newly created team currently has a vacancy for a §Senior§ §Underwriter§; this role will suit a candidate who has had extensive experience in underwriting SME Packages and Commercial Motor, has excellent broker management and influencing skills, and is looking to progress their career. This is a virtual team with members located in Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne and Hobart; it is possible for this Senior Underwriter to be located in any Allianz office in Australia.§        §You'll be responsible for:§        §          §Underwrite insurance risks across the Business Pack and Commercial Motor products, adhering to underwriting guidelines and standards;§          §Manage new business requests, renewal management and the processing of endorsements and amendments as requested;§          §Act as the underwriting referral point for other team members;§          §Work closely with both the management team and the broader business, you will ensure that tasks are managed according to agreed service standard;§          §Work effectively within the underwriting team and development staff to convert quality business to achieve profitable growth;§          §Training and coaching of staff to raise underwriter competency;§          §Submit ideas on how we can improve our underwriting approach to deliver objectives;§          §Monitor performance to ensure key financial indicators are achieved, namely GWP, Leakage and Profit measures.§        §        §Important to to lead and positively influence the team.§        §        §What's on offer?§        §          §Develop your underwriting expertise on a portfolio of clients in two key SME products;§          §Establish relationships with two major international partners;§          §An opportunity to stretch yourself and work with a strong team, which will allow you to further your technical knowledge;§        §        §          §We value integrity, discretion and doing what's right for the customer over KPIs and strict process;§          §A team which embraces diversity and inclusion to create an environment built on respect and genuine care for one another;§          §What matters to you, matters to us too. Feel supported to have open, honest conversations about the flexibility you need so that you're able to take care of your personal life.§        §        §About us§        §Allianz is the home for those who dare - a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. jobText: TXT/50619686.txt	§Senior Account Executive - Perth§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Account Executive - Perth§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§About the role§Gallagher’s highly successful Perth office is seeking an experienced senior insurance broker to join the team. This busy and varied role will see you managing your own significant portfolio of clients; taking a pro-active approach to all aspects of account management and people management.§In addition, you will be: §•Maintaining and developing meaningful business relationships with new and existing clients by taking a proactive approach to all aspects of account management and service delivery§•Describe insurable risk, design appropriate insurance solutions; negotiate and manage the best deal in the global Insurance market§•Develop and maintain meaningful working relationships with our Underwriting partners§•Manage and maintain budgets, business plans and debtors§•Sales driver with the ability to build long term pipelines to support new business growth§•Lead and mentor our junior brokers in the team§•Be a Gallagher brand ambassador through ongoing promotion of the business within the business community.§About you§You will be an experienced Broker, passionate about the client experience who can demonstrate: §•Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar role§•Strong account management experience gained within general commercial Insurance§•A proven track record of delivering results both financial and operational§•Ability to identify and develop new business opportunities§•Ability to maintain long-term relationships with key clients, suppliers, agencies, insurance industry bodies and he like to promote and protect the Gallagher brand§•A driven, passionate professional with highly developed communication and negotiation skills.§ §What will we offer§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business. Additional benefits:§•Competitive remuneration and incentive program§•Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances§•Salary sacrifice options including additional leave§•Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§•The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential§§Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§How to apply§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50669292.txt	§Property Underwriter, Strata (9 Month Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Underwriter, Strata (9 Month Contract)§§Advertiser: §Chubb Insurance Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. § §Chubb Australia is currently experiencing a period of accelerated growth, and as we continue to excel and make our mark in the local market, we are looking for high potential individuals to join our dynamic and fast paced team.§ §MAIN  PURPOSE§ §The primary purpose of this role is to contribute to the achievement of department, branch and corporate goals relative to profit, growth, service producer and client relations.§ §MAJOR  DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES§ §Specific duties/ responsibilities are detailed in the individual’s performance plan, based on the following key performance goals.§ §BOOK MANAGEMENT§ § §Achieve new business, rate and retention targets for assigned book of business to support the achievement of Unit/SBU/Branch revenue and profit goals via a number of key strategies, including:§ -Design and implementation of effective portfolio analysis, profit and retention strategies§ §Collaboration with NUC and other internal customers regarding book management strategy and maintenance of “one voice” with brokers; provide feedback and possible solutions to NUC.§ §Monitoring/reporting on status of open claims for assigned accounts (or in area of speciality) and make recommendations§ §Thorough and considered preparation for account reviews with management, demonstrating knowledge of risk, industry, competitive environment and Chubb’s products and capabilities§ §UNDERWRITING QUALITY AND COMPLIANCE§ § §Adhere to appropriate underwriting, compliance and file documentation standards and workflows to support the achievement of Branch/SBU revenue and profit goals.§ §Within scope of delegated authority, evaluate and accept or decline new business, renewals and endorsements.§ §Evaluate and make recommendation for acceptance or declination on risks which exceed authority.§ §Recommend account trade off decisions.§ §As appropriate, provide input to Manager on profit analysis, premium planning, market and environment analysis§ §SALES AND MARKETING§ § §Achieve individual producer targets as specified in goals/business plan§ §Develop and/or implement an effective business development strategy to prospect for new business across SBU/product lines and broker segments. This includes collaborating with key internal stakeholders to maximise sales and marketing outcomes§ §Actively and effectively manage sales pipeline to identify and develop new business prospects§ §BROKER AND KEY ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT§ § §Manage broker and key account relationships for assigned territory through proactive communication, visitation and collaboration with key internal and external stakeholders to retain and grow the business.§ §Visit assigned producers to discuss risks, communicate Chubb’s business appetites, and to produce new business§ §Monitor assigned producers performance by analysing quality, volume and mix of business by producer.  Determine degree on conformity to department underwriting and marketing goals; rectifies deviations; communicate suggestion and results to manager.§ §Plan and execute a regular and ongoing quality underwriting travel program to promote understanding of and support for underwriting and marketing goals.  Travel includes the ongoing solicitation of new business and presentations to prospective producers.§ §Responsible, appropriate and strategic management of resources and expenses associated with the above activities§ §COLLABORATION§ § §Work with colleagues at all organisational levels to promote and foster effective and constructive teamwork.§ §KNOWLEDGE  &  SKILLS§ § §Demonstrable ability to proactively identify and implement intelligent solutions to unique underwriting situations.§ §Appropriate levels of subject matter expertise in relation to: pricing techniques, alternative risk transfer and the development of reserves by individual case and by book of business.§ §Working knowledge of the key accounts in the Branch.§ §Understanding the underwriting appetites of the other departments and associated relationships with interdepartmental accounts.§ §Judgement, experience and confidence to make appropriate recommendations for tailoring coverage and manuscripting policies.§ §Familiarity with the products / services of key competitors.§ §Demonstrable capacity and efficacy in utilising negotiation strategies to achieve constructive business outcomes§ §Demonstrated ability to work well with people and influence decisions.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50697846.txt	§Business Analyst - Actuarial§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Analyst - Actuarial§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive salary + generous employee rewards§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Actuarial§§§§§§§Opportunity for a driven graduate to gain valuable workplace skills§§Utilise your analytical skills to contribute to continued success & growth§§Celebrate success with reward and recognition §§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims§ Management business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees,§ alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a long-term career here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in Sydney§,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§As a Business Analyst in the actuarial team, your role is to provide insightful analysis of claims experience and other items that drive outcomes and financial performance across the full range of EML’s business.  The role encompasses reporting and forecasting of claims and recovery outcomes, profitability, operational needs and resourcing requirements and input to underwriting, across a broad range of workers compensation business streams, and emerging CTP and personal injury offerings.§Your role also involves contributing to business development, providing education to EML’s clients and staff, and liaison with our clients and their actuarial advisors.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Modelling and forecasting of performance and financial outcomes§Development and provision of incisive analysis and reporting tools to support improved claims management processes and operational performance.§Review of external actuarial valuation reports and development and maintenance ofanalysis to track, investigate and communicate experience features indicative of portfolio and scheme performance§Development of analysis and reporting to support the contractual specifications associated with new business and contract renewals and input to Input into negotiation of contractual specifications of claim performance and remuneration structures§Compilation of quantitative and qualitative information required for the insurance liability valuations§§ABOUT YOU§§University degree with a quantitative basis such as Actuarial/Mathematics/Statistics/Physics/ Econometrics/Engineering. (progress toward qualification as a Fellow of the Institute of Actuaries of Australia –desirable)§Competency/aptitude with SAS/SQL Excel and R§Interest in workers compensation and CTP business§Superior oral and written communication skills§Knowledge of general insurance valuation, pricing & analysis techniques is desirable§Experience in a general insurance or accident compensation business and/or an actuarial consulting setting is desirable§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals. §EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§A corporate wellbeing program§Access to discounts at over 350 retailers through our Rewards Hub program§Comprehensive learning and development support§End of Month Celebration Events§Twice Yearly Company Events§Quarterly Reward and Recognition§17.5% annual leave loading§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks.§We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please apply now or for more information/confidential conversation please §contact Alice Galloway on §028098 6358§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50608465.txt	§Senior Account Executive - Parramatta§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Account Executive - Parramatta§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§About the role§This role will see you manage your own portfolio of clients as well as building new business opportunities including, but not limited to:§•Maintaining and developing meaningful business relationships with new and existing clients by taking a proactive approach to all aspects of account management and service delivery§•Describe insurable risk, design appropriate insurance solutions; negotiate and manage the best deal in the global Insurance market§•Develop and maintain meaningful working relationships with our Underwriting partners§•Manage and maintain budgets, business plans and debtors§•Sales driver with the ability to build long term pipelines to support new business growth§•Be a Gallagher brand ambassador through ongoing promotion of the business within the business community.§About you§You will be an experienced Broker, passionate about the client experience who can demonstrate: §•Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar role§•Strong account management experience gained within general commercial Insurance§•A proven track record of delivering results both financial and operational§•Ability to identify and develop new business opportunities§•Civil constructions and/or heavy motor experience is highly advantageous §•Ability to maintain long-term relationships with key clients, suppliers, agencies, insurance industry bodies and he like to promote and protect the Gallagher brand§•A driven, passionate professional with highly developed communication and negotiation skills§ §What will we offer§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business. Additional benefits:§• Competitive remuneration and incentive program§• Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances§• Salary sacrifice options including additional leave§• Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§• The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential§§Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§§How to apply§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing§.§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§§§§§

ASX 200 listed company, a market leader in the insurance industry and an innovator in§insurance broking.§        § §        §About the role§        § §        §Efficient and timely delivery of trust account and credit control processes:§        §          §Daily Cash receipt management and payment allocation for general insurance products including investigation of missing information and mismatched amounts and following up relevant parties to resolve;§          §Daily bank / trust account reconciliations and update of system interface journals§          §Daily Update of Unallocated Cash Registers§          §Debtor Control and any related reconciliations including liaising with both insurance brokers and underwriters;§          §Issuing of Fortnightly Credit control letters and dealing efficiently with responses§          §Processing of Refunds, Cancellations, Withdrawals and other payments throughout the month§          §Management of key requirements under a variety of different general insurance binders;§          §Processing policy endorsement or cancellation calculations, including broker commission amounts, and various state and Federal taxes thereon;§          §Document management for daily and monthly reporting, including Bordereaux preparation;§          §Preparation of various weekly / monthly reports;§          §Liaising with our offshore processing team in Malaysia;§          §Liaising with auditors and accounting team, answering queries, providing samples as part of the annual audit§        §        §Team Management/Supervision§        § escalation for various issues, including but not limited to IT, client, process and people issues, etc.§          §Ensure adherence to standard operating procedures and agreed processes§ gained in a professional services/financial institution/insurance environment. jobText: TXT/50616831.txt	§Compliance Manager §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Compliance Manager §§Advertiser: §Hudson - Risk and Compliance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Compliance Manager §      §        §My client a nationally known Super Fund are looking for a Compliance Manager to join the team. Reporting into the Head of Compliance, the main focus of the role will be in the implementation of the Compliance Management Framework, and the provision of expert advice on regulatory requirements, regulatory changes and compliance risks.§        § In addition, the Compliance Manager will also assist the Head of Risk & Compliance in the ongoing development of compliance policies.§        §The Compliance Manager will work closely with the business, and as such the person will need to have well developed relationship management and communication skills and a good sense of business acumen§        § §Key Duties & Responsibilities: §        § §        §          §Monitor changes in the regulatory environment and work with relevant business areas to assess the implications for the Fund, and provide information updates, advice and training as needed.§          §Perform compliance reviews of marketing materials and provide feedback to help the marketing team meet business objectives and satisfy compliance obligations.§          §Perform compliance review and provide advice on a range of key documents including Product Disclosure Statements, Factsheets, Significant Event Notices, Annual Reports and website content.§          §Manage the process for the reporting of risk and compliance matters to the Board or Board sub-committees as required. This will involve the collection and review of information provided by business units, and the writing of updates on compliance matters and regulatory matters.§          §Investigation of incidents and compliance breaches to identify event causes and the implications of these from a regulatory perspective, as well as reporting on these as needed (including involvement with liaison with regulators).§          §Proactively lead and coordinate the compliance obligations attestation program for the Fund, and follow-up on issues as needed.§          §Assist in managing responses to regulators, and auditors on compliance and regulatory related matters.§          §Provide training and coaching on compliance issues to staff as needed.§          §Provide advice to the business on compliance matters related to key superannuation legislation§          §Assist the Head of Risk & Compliance on activities as required in areas such as: the ongoing development of compliance policies, and the identification and assessment of strategic challenges that may emerge from regulatory changes.§        §        §Skills & Experience: §        §          §Personal ethics and integrity.§          §A professional background in compliance or law.§          §Good understanding of the financial services industry, or another highly regulated industry.§          §Attention to detail, and ability to understand both the intent of regulators and the business context.§          §Ability to constructively challenge, consult and advise, whilst maintaining excellent working relationships.§          §Ability to effectively negotiate, influence and engage a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.§          §Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to inform and/or influence audiences.§          §The ability to conduct research on legal and regulatory matters in an accurate and timely manner, including legislation.§          §Sustain a culture of accountability, ownership, and delivery.§          §Sound organisational planning and implementation skills, and demonstrated ability to apply them in rapidly changing business environments.§        §        §Education/Qualification Requirements §        §Required §        §• Degree qualification in law. Qualifications in another business related discipline may be appropriate if the person has considerable experience in compliance or professional qualifications in compliance.§        § §Desirable §        §• Professional accreditations in areas relevant to superannuation and/or financial services.§        §• Membership of relevant professional bodies.§        §If you would like to apply for this role please APPLY below or contact Martin Dawson on §0282332312§ / §martin.dawson@hudson.com§      §      §      §    §    §      §        §          §            §jobs.hudson.com§            §            §Specialist Recruitment | Talent Management§          §        §      §    §  §§§My client a nationally known Super Fund are looking for a Compliance Manager to join the team. Reporting into the Head of Compliance, the main focus of the role will be in the implementation of the Compliance Management Framework, and the provision of expert advice on regulatory requirements, regulatory changes and compliance risks.§ In addition, the Compliance Manager will also assist the Head of Risk & Compliance in the ongoing development of compliance policies.§The Compliance Manager will work closely with the business, and as such the person will need to have well developed relationship management and communication skills and a good sense of business acumen§ §Key Duties & Responsibilities: § §Monitor changes in the regulatory environment and work with relevant business areas to assess the implications for the Fund, and provide information updates, advice and training as needed.§Perform compliance reviews of marketing materials and provide feedback to help the marketing team meet business objectives and satisfy compliance obligations.§Perform compliance review and provide advice on a range of key documents including Product Disclosure Statements, Factsheets, Significant Event Notices, Annual Reports and website content.§Manage the process for the reporting of risk and compliance matters to the Board or Board sub-committees as required. This will involve the collection and review of information provided by business units, and the writing of updates on compliance matters and regulatory matters.§Investigation of incidents and compliance breaches to identify event causes and the implications of these from a regulatory perspective, as well as reporting on these as needed (including involvement with liaison with regulators).§Proactively lead and coordinate the compliance obligations attestation program for the Fund, and follow-up on issues as needed.§Assist in managing responses to regulators, and auditors on compliance and regulatory related matters.§Provide training and coaching on compliance issues to staff as needed.§Provide advice to the business on compliance matters related to key superannuation legislation§Assist the Head of Risk & Compliance on activities as required in areas such as: the ongoing development of compliance policies, and the identification and assessment of strategic challenges that may emerge from regulatory changes.§Skills & Experience: §Personal ethics and integrity.§A professional background in compliance or law.§Good understanding of the financial services industry, or another highly regulated industry.§Attention to detail, and ability to understand both the intent of regulators and the business context.§Ability to constructively challenge, consult and advise, whilst maintaining excellent working relationships.§Ability to effectively negotiate, influence and engage a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.§Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to inform and/or influence audiences.§The ability to conduct research on legal and regulatory matters in an accurate and timely manner, including legislation.§Sustain a culture of accountability, ownership, and delivery.§Sound organisational planning and implementation skills, and demonstrated ability to apply them in rapidly changing business environments.§Education/Qualification Requirements §§Required §• Degree qualification in law. Qualifications in another business related discipline may be appropriate if the person has considerable experience in compliance or professional qualifications in compliance.§ §Desirable §• Professional accreditations in areas relevant to superannuation and/or financial services.§• Membership of relevant professional bodies.§If you would like to apply for this role please APPLY below or contact Martin Dawson on §0282332312§ / §martin.dawson@hudson.com§§§§

jobText: TXT/50586706.txt	§Health Connect Consultant - Sydney or Brisbane§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health Connect Consultant - Sydney or Brisbane§§Advertiser: §Zurich Financial Services Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Health Connect Consultant - Sydney or Brisbane §      §        §Are you the kind of person that loves a challenge? Are you looking to develop your career and be part of a successful and growing team? The role of Health Connect Consultant could be just what you are looking for.§        § §        §As part of our commitment to grow and develop our employees, we are recruiting in the Underwriting department of our Life & Investments business. This role represents a fantastic opportunity for an aspiring insurance professional to learn and acquire the skills necessary to develop into either an Underwriter or a Claims Assessor. §        § §        §We are looking for a smart, switched-on and engaged individual who is looking for an opportunity to deliver a superior level of customer service through the provision of tele-interviewing and other key related activities, including supporting the underwriting team with pre-application assessments. In this role you’ll be pivotal to the ongoing development of adviser and customer relationships. §        § §        §Key to this role will be your highly collaborative approach. On a daily basis you’ll be working hand in hand with a range of stakeholders including Sales & Distribution, Underwriting and Operations to ensure all activities are executed within the agreed service level and compliance requirements. §        § §        §You’ll have a proven track record of exemplary customer service and being flexible to meet the needs of our customers. You’ll have demonstrable problem-solving skills and the ability to meet deadlines as well as multi-task effectively. Your strong interpersonal skills will stand you in good stead as you speak to and liaise with internal and external stakeholders regularly.§        § §        §Candidates with a background in nursing or another health-related field would be highly regarded for this role.§        § §        §This role can be performed outside of our North Sydney offices, so applicants from the Brisbane area are also welcomed to apply.§        § §        §At Zurich, you’ll have the opportunity to work with highly successful, passionate and well-respected industry professionals. As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future. An annual lifestyle payment, employee discounts and a volunteer day per year are also some of the many things you can enjoy as part of the Zurich family. §        § §        §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work with us. Apply today!§        § §        §At Zurich we are aware of the Governments’ social distancing recommendations. To enable this, we will utilise digital technology where possible to ensure the safety of all employees and candidates, through the recruitment and onboarding process.§        § §      §      §        §        § Please click the 'Apply for this job' button below to submit your application§      §    §    §www.zurich.com.au§  §§§Are you the kind of person that loves a challenge? Are you looking to develop your career and be part of a successful and growing team? The role of Health Connect Consultant could be just what you are looking for.§ § § §As part of our commitment to grow and develop our employees, we are recruiting in the Underwriting department of our Life & Investments business. This role represents a fantastic opportunity for an aspiring insurance professional to learn and acquire the skills necessary to develop into either an Underwriter or a Claims Assessor. § § § §We are looking for a smart, switched-on and engaged individual who is looking for an opportunity to deliver a superior level of customer service through the provision of tele-interviewing and other key related activities, including supporting the underwriting team with pre-application assessments. In this role you’ll be pivotal to the ongoing development of adviser and customer relationships. § § § §Key to this role will be your highly collaborative approach. On a daily basis you’ll be working hand in hand with a range of stakeholders including Sales & Distribution, Underwriting and Operations to ensure all activities are executed within the agreed service level and compliance requirements. § § § §You’ll have a proven track record of exemplary customer service and being flexible to meet the needs of our customers. You’ll have demonstrable problem-solving skills and the ability to meet deadlines as well as multi-task effectively. Your strong interpersonal skills will stand you in good stead as you speak to and liaise with internal and external stakeholders regularly.§ § § §Candidates with a background in nursing or another health-related field would be highly regarded for this role.§ § § §This role can be performed outside of our North Sydney offices, so applicants from the Brisbane area are also welcomed to apply.§ § § §At Zurich, you’ll have the opportunity to work with highly successful, passionate and well-respected industry professionals. As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future. An annual lifestyle payment, employee discounts and a volunteer day per year are also some of the many things you can enjoy as part of the Zurich family. § § § §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work with us. Apply today!§ § § §At Zurich we are aware of the Governments’ social distancing recommendations. To enable this, we will utilise digital technology where possible to ensure the safety of all employees and candidates, through the recruitment and onboarding process.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Case Manager - Low Risk Claims Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50603490.txt	§Case Manager - Low Risk Claims§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager - Low Risk Claims§§Advertiser: §Guild Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§Your new company §Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by a genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial wellbeing. We pride ourselves on our future focus and innovation.§At the heart of what we do is being there for those our communities rely on.§Our comprehensive product suite includes professional indemnity, public liability, workers compensation as well as business, home & contents and car insurance. We are Australian owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence. §About you §You’re self-motivated and have a willingness to learn by doing and asking questions. You’re no stranger to a fast-paced environment and are open to a highly transactional role.§You’re resilient and maintain professionalism even under tricky situations. You have a “client first” approach, able to communicate with a wide variety of people. You are organised, you keep on top of your work and can cope with competing deadlines. With your high attention to detail, you’re computer-literate and can learn unfamiliar software with relative ease.§You could have been in customer service roles previously and though experience in the insurance industry and in workers compensation would be valuable, they’re not a must.§You must have a genuine interest in having a career in the insurance industry and would want to grow with us.§If you were already in this role, here are some of the things you might have done last week§§You were managing your own portfolio of low risk/ fast track claims in line with your delegated authority, our service standards and claims guidelines.§You were working through a list of claims that need to be finalised and closed while juggling new low risk claims that have been lodged. As an initial point of contact, you supported the workers and employers involved in these new claims, setting their expectations on how you’ll be managing their claims.§You assisted your Case Manager colleagues with their own portfolio. You helped them book appointments for injured workers with specialists and sent relevant files to solicitors and medical practitioners involved in the claims.§You’ve buddied up with one of the Case Managers and they’ve started showing you the ins and outs of managing psych claims. Gradually, you’re getting a feel for how to manage longer-tail and more complex claims through experience, training and observing how your colleagues work.§§Why us?§We pride ourselves on having an inclusive and productive workplace where we treat our people and our clients with fairness, dignity and respect.§We offer: §§Paid parental leave for eligible staff from 6 weeks§An extra day of paid leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements§Enhanced long service leave§Staff discounts with leading retailers§An Employee Assistance Program that provides counselling and support to all staff members and their immediate family§Wellbeing initiatives such as health checks and skin checks§Flexible working program available to eligible staff§§For more information about Guild Insurance visit https://www.guildinsurance.com.au/§Next Steps§If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then the please apply here.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Technical Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50623186.txt	§Technical Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Specialist§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§12 month Contract + Part  Time Hours §§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19, with our recruitment process now fully conducted virtually. As a business we have moved to a working from home environment until it is safe for all employees to return to our offices.§§Do you have a passion for coaching and developing people? §§Looking to take the next step in your workers compensation career? §§Part Time Role – 3 days per week §§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation and Personal Injury Claims Management business§. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through ongoing support during their return to work journey. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having §over 2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees§ ensuring a long-term career here at EML.§§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Melbourne,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§This part time Technical Specialist role in the Medical Team requires a motivated self-starter to provide technical support and advice to EML claims teams. You will use your previous experience across many facets of workers compensation to coach team members and provide creative and strategic advice in accordance with Victorian workers compensation law and WorkSafe Victoria guidelines.§This role is part time and will require you to work from 8:30am – 5:00pm on Monday, Wednesdays and Fridays.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Providing technical support to teams about the claims management process in line with Victorian workers compensation law and WorkSafe Victoria guidelines§Assisting the claims teams in their achievement of performance measures§Reviewing and providing feedback about current claims management practices and procedures ensuring emerging trends are identified and managed§Developing strategic initiatives and procedures to ensure all service, performance and compliance measures are achieved§Building and maintaining strong collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders§Assisting with organisational compliance with legal, governance and WorkSafe Victoria agent requirements.§§ABOUT YOU§§Strong technical experience within the Victorian workers compensation scheme, legislation and policies§Experience in managing relationships and competing stakeholder priorities§Superior time management and negotiating skills§Exceptional problem solving and strategic thinking skills§Desire to coaching and supporting others§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals. §EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite Learning and Development Team§End of Month Celebration Events§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Katherine Romano§ on §03 7000 0935§ or on email at §k.romano@eml.com.au§. §§§§

We offer development programs, further education, and exciting career progression opportunities, in addition to a thriving social culture that includes monthly activities and events.§ §So, are you ready to join one of Australia’s leading financial service firms?§ § § §Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:§ § §Provide high quality customer service to our clients both on the phone and face-to-face§ §Provide administration support to General Insurance brokers and other team members when required§ §Processing client documentation using industry specific software§ §Assist with the preparation of documents§ §Renewal notice control§ §Service and maintain client database§ §Follow up unpaid accounts and issue unpaid letters§ §Demonstrate initiative and work as an enthusiastic team member§ §We are looking for candidates who:§ § §Possess relevant client services experience within the financial services industry§ §Previous experience using Winbeat (advantageous but not essential).§ §Neat and professional presentation§ §Clear verbal and written communication skills§ §Show initiative, enthusiasm and a can-do attitude§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Interested?§ §If you are interested in joining Findex, please apply with your cover letter and resume.§Find out more§ §www.findex.com.au §§§§

jobText: TXT/50521606.txt	§Senior Claims Consultant, Heavy Motor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Consultant, Heavy Motor§§Advertiser: §Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About the business§ § §A strong, trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers around the globe. Part of Berkshire Hathaway's insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals with excellent capabilities and character. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?§ § §About the role§ § §The role of Senior Claims Consultant – Inland Marine (Contractor's P&E/Heavy Motor) will sit within the broader Marine product and is an external customer facing role which will support our claims offering.  Preferred location is Sydney.  Our claims teams interact with the broader Marine team supporting the business goals and as well as contributing on a strategic level. We are seeking an experienced professional to join our growing team.§ §In this role, the Senior Claims Examiner will have an opportunity to handle all facets of plant and equipment claims and provide underwriting support in a highly collaborative team environment, dedicated to best in class service. Specific responsibilities include:§ §Job Responsibilities:§ §Managing a broad portfolio of plant and equipment claims in accordance with BHSI Claims Service Standards, which ensure the highest level of customer service;§Maintaining high quality claim files from a technical content standpoint;§Duties may include but are not limited to: proactively handling claims from first notice of loss through to ultimate resolution; working with and advising internal partners on claims; developing a plan of action focused on claim resolution; working and meeting with customers and brokers; retaining and directing independent adjusters and / or other vendors as appropriate;§Conducting claim investigations with a keen focus on subrogation and salvage opportunities;§Analysing coverage and drafting coverage position letters that effectively communicate coverage positions;§Assessing loss exposures and posting timely and accurate file reserves;§Occasional travel to client / broker meetings, mediations, conferences and other industry events;§ § §Benefits and perks§ §Compensation will be commensurate with experience.§ § §Skills and experience§ §Minimum of 5 years of plant and equipment and/or heavy motor claim handling experience;§Cargo claims handling experience preferred but not essential.§Ability to work independently§Excellent interpersonal communications and negotiation skills.§Ability to work in a team environment.§Should have technical competence in all aspects of claims with emphasis on customer service.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

As a company we’re known in the industry as a group dedicated to giving back to the community by partnering with charitable groups and actively participating in fundraising events.§  §We’re looking for a great communicator and relationship manager with a passion for customer service, excellent people skills, the ability to negotiate in tough circumstances, legal qualifications (preferred but not essential) and the ability to manage multiple claims whilst handling enquires via phone and email.§  §This role is ideal for a recent law graduate, paralegal or claims officer with 1 – 3 years’ experience looking to gain experience within an in-house claims team or someone who would like to further develop their claims management skills, enjoys working with different teams within an organisation and is passionate about customer service.§  §The focus of this role is to manage Financial Lines claims and notifications, through to resolution by providing professional, prompt and courteous service to DUAL’s clients. for personal development then Apply Now!§  §To find out more about DUAL Australia, please head to the DUAL Australia §website§ or visit us on our §LinkedIn§ page to see what we’re up to and what we’re about.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance jobText: TXT/50564996.txt	§Claims Consultant (Maternity Cover)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Consultant (Maternity Cover)§§Advertiser: §Underwriting Agencies of Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Underwriting Agencies of Australia §(UAA) is a niche Insurance Underwriting Agency specialising in industrial and commercial plant and equipment, particularly Mobile Plant and Equipment Insurance. §Our expertise and professional services are provided by our customer-focused, highly skilled team who are responsive to client needs. With more than 30 years’ experience, UAA prides itself on innovate insurance solutions for the mobile plant industry in Australia, New Zealand and globally. Our focus is on developing long term relationships with our customers built on mutual respect and reliability. §Our Claims service team has extensive experience in managing claims for our customers and has access to a network of the very best industry service suppliers across Australia, New Zealand, Latin America, Asia and the regions of Pacific Island and Papua New Guinea to service our national and international branches.§An exciting opportunity has arisen to join our energetic and opportunistic team as a Claims Consultant in our Newcastle office. The successful candidate must be available to work a minimum of four (4) days per week, however may be asked to work additional hours as required by the business. §The Role§This is a Maternity Cover position, with the potential to extend and/or become a permanent position at UAA. Initially, the successful candidate will be employed on a temporary 6 month contract, commencing in September 2020. This position, you will report to the National Claims Manager – Australia and be a part of a team of experienced Claims Consultants. The role will provide you with a significant level of autonomy, whereby you will review and manage a diverse range of claims from inception to completion.§Although the position is based in Newcastle, due to COVID-19 our Newcastle team is currently working from home (WFH), for the foreseeable future. Upon return to the office, the successful candidate will be required to attend the Newcastle office.§ Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: §Managing claims from lodgement to completion, claims such as material damage, financial loss and both road risk and broad form liability claims§Providing exceptional service to Insurance brokers and the industry§Working closely with the Mobile Plant & Machinery industry and Service Providers§Working with the Business Development Manager (BDM) to implement business growth strategies§Working with various claims fundamentals such as financial recovery process, salvage, litigation and engage opportunities to mitigate loss for our customers§About You§Must Have:§Claims experience (or similar)§Ability to work in a team environment§Strong time management skills§Self-Driven, takes ownership and autonomy§Excellent verbal and written communication skills§Strong negotiation and conflict-resolution skills§High attention to detail§The ability to absorb information at a fast pace§Exceptional customer service skills§Desired: §Experience working in the Insurance Industry and/or Claims experience§Heavy industry experience, i.e. construction, earth moving, mining§Employee Benefits§Great team culture§Ability to work from home§All equipment when WFH and in the office will be supplied§Great employee benefits§Competitive salary package§How to Apply§If this sounds like the perfect position for you, click ‘Apply’ now. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Risk and Compliance Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647420.txt	§Senior Manager, Risk and Compliance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager, Risk and Compliance§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§The position of Senior Manager, Risk and Compliance will be a key leader in the team reporting into the Head of Risk and Compliance, Life Insurance Office. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§§The Senior Manager Risk and Compliance is part of a small team of internal consultants who play a critical role in first line risk representatives for AIA Australia’s Life Insurance business.§The role will promote, guide and facilitate ownership and management of risk across the Life Insurance Office.  This will include implementing AIA’s framework for identifying, monitoring and mitigating risk and for complying with obligations to customers, regulators and other stakeholders.  In this role, you will work very closely with the Retail Distribution teams, Enterprise Risk & Compliance (Line 2 Risk), as well as external Trustees and Partners of our in-Super Retail products.§§Key Responsibilities§§Develop strong relationships with key stakeholders including Retail Distribution team members, and Retail Product Managers under the Chief Life Insurance Officer (CLIO); our IT teams; and Trustees including Colonial First State Investments Limited and Equity Trustees Limited§Develop and deliver the Risk and Compliance plans for the CLIO Business Unit.§Own and manage risks within the CLIO Business Unit on a daily basis.§Assist the CLIO Business Unit to develop and implement controls and to test whether these controls are effective.§Develop innovative and improved operating practices for control design and testing.§Monitor the risk profile to identify, understand, escalate and report on issues, incidents, and changes in the business.§Provide support to understand and mitigate the risks of change from projects and other initiatives (Risk in Change).§Provide timely business commentary and information on the business risk profile for risk reporting purposes.§Support the business in conducting thorough root cause analysis of issues and incidents, and monitor close out and embedding of sustainable actions§Support the development of a proactive risk culture where business leaders demonstrate risk ownership§§Skills and Experience §§Extensive experience in financial services in audit or risk analysis function, preferably in life insurance environment. ‘Big Four’ accounting firm, regulator or management consulting experience is preferred.§Robust knowledge of risk and compliance frameworks, methodologies and approaches.§Strong understanding of life insurance products, distribution models, and relative Regulatory requirements and Codes of Practice.§Substantive understanding of requirements for retail insurance products within superannuation.§GS007 or other assurance standard reporting such as ASAE3402.§Proven record of leading without authority in matrix structured organisations.§Excellent organizational and time management skills, including demonstrated experience in coordinating input from a number of contributors.§§Applications close 13th October.§§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

You will also be supporting senior individuals on their significant corporate clients so that they can focus on investing their time in new business opportunities and delivering on strategic objectives that will be beneficial to all the team. Key responsibilities will include:§ § Managing key stakeholder relationships and enhancing the client experience· Designing appropriate servicing solutions and insurance programs§ § Managing essential interface with the administration support, claims and placement teams§ § Identifying revenue enhancement opportunities within a designated portfolio§ §Assisting on business development opportunities within new and existing accounts for all aspects of Aon offerings§ §About you§ To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate a genuine drive to learn and develop your broking skills. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people working across 120 countries. This allows us to gather the best thinking from around the world and deliver solutions locally. jobText: TXT/50606004.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Package + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks. Part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. §§Are you an experienced case manager looking for a change?  §§Progress your career with this dynamic role  §§Work collaboratively within a positive team environment with highly supportive leaders and structured career development and progression §§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims Management§ business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an §additional four offices§. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a §long-term career§ here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY§§National Self Insurance§ is an arm of EML that caters to employer’s who are self insured for their workers compensation requirements and have partnered with EML to administer their claims management function.§NSI currently have a national offering for our employer partners, and have offices in Brisbane, Parramatta, Melbourne, Adelaide and Perth.§We now have an opportunity available for an experienced §Case Manager§ and as part of our diverse team based in §Parramatta,§ you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§The purpose of this Senior Case Manager role is to pro-actively and effectively manage claims, including disability management aspects of a caseload of claims within the legislation or policy and achieve compliance with the performance measures. The role acts as a senior member of the team, including coaching and escalations responsibilities.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of workers and employers§Ensure that active and timely intervention occurs to improve recovery and return to work outcomes§Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as workers, employers and providers§Assist the worker and employer with the claim process and providing support in the completion of relevant documents to ensure timely access to required services to support return to work and injury recovery§Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim costs§§ABOUT YOU§§Demonstrated experience in worker’s compensation claims management or from an Allied Health background;§Workers Compensation experience (highly desirable)§An empathetic, resilient, and motivational approach to provide customer centric support;§A driven professional with highly developed written and verbal communication skills, outstanding organisational and coordination skills§Positive attitude and a willingness to learn§Strong stakeholder engagement and management§Experience and/or education in the field of physiotherapy, occupational therapy, exercise physiology, chiropractic, etc.§§WHAT WE OFFER§We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including: §§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite Learning and Development Team§End of Month Celebration Events§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Isabel Tran§ on §02 8098 6364§ or on email at §I.Tran@eml.com.au§. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
