jobText: TXT/50585616.txt	§Associate / Account Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate / Account Executive§§Advertiser: §Lockton Companies Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Lockton Companies Australia§ §Lockton is the largest privately-owned insurance broker in the world, with an enviable record of growth over the last few years. In Australia we operate out of multiple states and territories and have an international network of offices in over 100 countries. More than 8,000 professionals at Lockton provide upwards of 60,000 retail and wholesale clients around the world with risk management, insurance and employee benefits services.§  §From its founding in 1966 in Kansas City, Missouri, Lockton has attracted entrepreneurial professionals who have driven its growth to become one of the top 10 largest insurance brokerages in the world.§  §The Lockton company structure has produced a unique culture where creative, driven and proactive people can thrive, and where client advocacy and service are of paramount importance. We empower our Associates to think independently.§  §It is our people who make the biggest difference. That’s why we recruit based on attitude and ambition. We look for people who want to make things happen, who want to be the best in their area, who are intelligent and insightful, who are able to forge meaningful and deep relationships, and who enjoy delivering great service.§  §For more information visit: www.locktonaustralia.com.au §  §About the role§ §We are seeking a motivated and passionate broker to join our Mining & Mining Services team who is looking to take the next step in their career. Your outstanding communication skills, MS Office skills and insurance experience, preferably in Mining & Mining Services, will be invaluable.              §  §The successful candidate will be expected to assist in providing end to end broking services to an existing portfolio of Mining & Mining Services clients.§  §What will you be doing?§ §Monitor portfolio of clients to ensure current insurance and risk management needs are fully met.§ §Provide personalised advice to clients in all matters affecting their Insurance program needs.§ §Prepare and execute policy documentation implementing clients' instructions.§ §Prepare and provide clients with Manuals of Insurance and Insurance Schedules.§ §Maintain a sound knowledge of clients' industries, businesses and risks.§ §Develop and maintain close working relationships with key stakeholders.§ §Negotiate renewal terms with underwriters.§ §Ensure timely and favourable settlement of claims.§ §Processing client accounts and billing.§ §Tender submission support. § §Supporting colleagues as required and as directed by the Team Leader and Department Manager.§ §To be successful in this role, you will:§ §Be capable of following directions and working collaboratively with others, while also being self-motivated and able to manage own workload.§ §Be able to manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously.§ §Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills (verbal and written).§ §Have a high level of attention to detail and be very well organised.§ §Be responsive to the changing needs of the team, office and business, and to any issues that arise.§ §Have a strong ‘can-do’ attitude and willingness to pitch in.§ §Have a good sense of humour and be adaptable to change.§ §You will also need: § §Tier 1 Certificate Insurance Broking or Diploma of Financial Services Insurance Broking or progressing towards completion.§ §Moderate to high level of proficiency in MS Office and competent using a broad range of  software.§ §Minimum 3 years’ experience in the insurance broking and financial services industry.§ §Benefits - what’s in it for you?§ §Varied and interesting work within a successful team of professionals who are passionate about what they do. § §An inspired work culture and a collaborative team environment, in a central location. § §A competitive salary and employee benefits.§ §www.locktonaustralia.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of insurance broking experience do you have?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a RG146 insurance broking accreditation?§§§

jobText: TXT/50580205.txt	§Claims Assessor | Remote§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Assessor | Remote§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§§We’re looking for people with a background in Claims and Worker’s Compensation to come and leverage their skills and expertise with AIA.§§Thanks to technology AIA are leading the way with flexible working we can now offer virtual and remote working – giving you more options than ever before! These opportunities are your chance to:§develop new skills in a Claims environment and make a difference in the lives of our customers§utilise your clear written and verbal communication skills to help customers understand policy terms and conditions§apply your analytical and judgement skills to reach positive decisions for our customers and our business§build strong and respectful relationships with your colleagues, customers and other stakeholders§§We’re looking for motivated people who want to transition their current skills and expertise especially if they have some of the following:§high-quality customer service skills§excellent communication, including empathy and great listening skills§expertise in an allied health environment§strong problem solving and critical thinking skills§great time management and multi-tasking skills§strong relationship building skills; and§a desire to make a difference and find solutions.§§In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:§take your career into a new area§not be bound by your geographical location and explore remote working opportunities§access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills§make a difference in someone’s life every day§work for a business helping millions of Australians every year§access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself§work in a business with no dress code§enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you§work with supportive and inclusive people and managers.§§What’s next?§§If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button!§Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

Just as you will help us grow our business, we will help you grow in your career.§        §About the role: Trustee Governance Manager§        §The role of the Trustee Governance Manager is to manage and maintain the Trustee's policies and procedures and to also manage the Internal Audit Program for the Superannuation Trustee Office (STO).§        §Responsibilities will include:§        § With a company engagement score of 93% we can proudly say that NTI is an employer of choice.§ §Is this the role for you?§ §If you are interested and would like to join our dedicated team of Underwriting professionals, please submit a Resume and Cover Letter.§ §Please note we will only be in contact with candidates selected to progress to the next stage of the recruitment process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an underwriter?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50573086.txt	§Case Manager - Closed Scheme Claims§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager - Closed Scheme Claims§§Advertiser: §QBE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Case Manager - Closed Scheme Claims §      §        §Case Manager – Closed Scheme Claims §        §Location: Parramatta, NSW §        §Type: Full-Time, Permanent position.§        § §        §Your part in a changing world§        §At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – §to give§ §people the confidence to achieve their ambitions§.§        §We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation. We employee a team of more than 11,800 people, in 27 countries around the world.§        § §        §The opportunity§        §We currently have an exciting opportunity available for a Case Manager to join our Insurance for NSW business located at our Parramatta office on a permanent basis.§        §As a Case Manager you will work in partnership with NSW Government agencies on Closed Scheme Claims and provide proactive claims management that helps injured workers return to health and work following workplace injury or illness.§        §Within the team you will work closely with stakeholders through case conferencing, claims reviews and onsite visits to ensure a safe and durable return to work. You will provide best practice claims management for your client portfolio, drawing on your exceptional customer service and decision-making skills to achieve return to work objectives. You will also be working in a flexible, positive and driven team environment.§        § §        §Your story so far§        §The role requires a high level of customer service, excellent negotiation skills and the ability to communicate in a professional manner to a variety of different stakeholders.§        §As well as enjoying being an integral member of a team that delivers satisfying outcomes for individuals you will have a positive and flexible attitude and be motivated to deliver superior results.§        §In addition, we require applicants who possess:§        §          §A working knowledge of workers compensation insurance§          §Proven customer service experience in a similar environment/industry§          §A customer-centric, empathetic approach to dealing with all stakeholders and a desire to promptly resolve enquiries§          §Ability to handle multiple and competing tasks to meet customer needs§          §A modern approach to improving the business and a willingness to embrace change§          §Ability to be self-motivated with excellent organisational skills.§        §        § §        §We are here to support you§        §We are proud to have been Voted #5 in the 2019 Top 20 Australian Workplaces for New Dads - HBF Direct Advice for Dads and we achieved Gold employer status in the 2019 Australian LGBTI Inclusion Awards.§        §We also offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance.§        §As a QBE employee, we will offer you:§        §          §Flex@QBE leave to enhance your work/life integration§          §Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, which includes a free 12-month subscription to Headspace§          §Access to ‘Share the Care’ – 12 weeks’ flexible leave for new parents inclusive of paid superannuation§          §Income protection insurance and reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums§          §Access to REACH My Best - free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, financial and legal advice and confidential counselling§          §Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services§          §Benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners such as free and discounted tickets.§        §        § §        §Join us.§        §Click §APPLY §to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.§        §QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at §recruitment@qbe.com§.§        §Applications Close: COB Tuesday 29th September 2020.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Case Manager – Closed Scheme Claims § §Location: Parramatta, NSW § §Type: Full-Time, Permanent position.§ § § §Your part in a changing world§ §At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – §to give§ §people the confidence to achieve their ambitions§.§ §We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§§We’re looking for people with a background in Claims and Worker’s Compensation to come and leverage their skills and expertise with AIA.§§Thanks to technology AIA are leading the way with flexible working we can now offer virtual and remote working – giving you more options than ever before! These opportunities are your chance to:§develop new skills in a Claims environment and make a difference in the lives of our customers§utilise your clear written and verbal communication skills to help customers understand policy terms and conditions§apply your analytical and judgement skills to reach positive decisions for our customers and our business§build strong and respectful relationships with your colleagues, customers and other stakeholders§§We’re looking for motivated people who want to transition their current skills and expertise especially if they have some of the following:§high-quality customer service skills§excellent communication, including empathy and great listening skills§expertise in an allied health environment§strong problem solving and critical thinking skills§great time management and multi-tasking skills§strong relationship building skills; and§a desire to make a difference and find solutions.§§In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:§take your career into a new area§not be bound by your geographical location and explore remote working opportunities§access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills§make a difference in someone’s life every day§work for a business helping millions of Australians every year§access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself§work in a business with no dress code§enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you§work with supportive and inclusive people and managers.§§What’s next?§§If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button!§Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

work closely with the Head of Branch Operations ANZ in supporting activities to drive oversight of the branch's operating platform, covering both P&C and L&H reinsurance business in ANZ Branch and These activities support legal entity management and operational excellence, in alignment with the company’s standards and in compliant with local regulatory requirements.§ In addition, you will be involved in supporting outsourcing activities along with activities to support the preparation of input into the annual evolution of the strategy and business plan facilitating the development of insights.§ Key responsibilities in the role include:§ § §Collaborate with the relevant functions (mainly enabling functions) to ensure appropriate quality and output is delivered through a coordinated approach. E.g. functional responsibility for ensuring compliance with APAC Outsourcing framework.§ §Drive Operational Excellence within the branch (P&C and L&H), and utilise all existing resources (functions / subject matter expertise) to implement sustainable solutions; particularly any areas of potential operational weakness (e.g. ORM incident, ORM Event, GIA findings) and inconsistency across branches.§ §Ensure a coordinated approach to all Business Reviews (GIA, ORM, BRR, IRR etc.) within the branch and support and/or deliver Business Continuity Management requirements.§ §Responsible for the collaboration with other Asia teams such as the L&H and P&C Business Operations teams and Business Services to ensure an aligned approach for local execution§ §Facilitate the implementation of market strategy and business plan, via supporting the local P&C and L&H CM Head. This may include maintenance and monitoring of business and operational plans and tracking activities to ensure timely execution of agreed actions; or project manage those large / prioritised initiatives§ § Key abilities / skills / experience the successful candidate will benefit from are:§ § §Ability to research and translate complex concepts and information into business relevant insights and subsequently into appropriate communication channels;§ §Relevant knowledge and expertise of the insurance or/and reinsurance industry, and the legal and economic/ social environment in which it operates§ §Experience in strategy/business planning preferred with the ability to research and translate complex concepts and information into business relevant insights succinctly§ §Strong influencing and communication skills working across a broad range of stakeholders (including senior managers) to obtain information, implement initiatives and drive successful completion of tasks and actions§ §Agile with a "can-do" attitude and a strong attention to detail, backed by Project Management experience (ideally)§ §Strong ability to manage expectations and deadlines in face of complexity, conflicting pressure and ambiguous circumstances§ §Strong skill set in using the Microsoft suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Project & Word) and developing reporting for senior audiences backed by a relevant industry qualification and/or business degree (Business, Maths, Economics are seen as strong backgrounds for the role).§ § Ideal backgrounds for the role would include individuals who have around 5-8 years experience in Insurance through having worked in Strategy, Operations, Project Management and wider into the Consulting sector, in particular "Big 4".§If this role sounds the like the perfect combination of your strong insurance skills within a dynamic, constantly changing team that offers essential support to the business, then please apply on line now to be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§§§

Documents and member communication comply with APRA’s Prudential Standards, Life Insurance Code of Practice and Insurance in Superannuation Code of Practice. §§Skills and Experience §§Strong experience in life insurance or relevant industry§1 – 2 years’ experience in group or retail product management preferable§Excellent knowledge of the Australian group insurance market and good understanding of key drivers §Sound knowledge and understanding of superannuation legislation changes and regulatory environment impacting on group insurance clients§Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including high attention to detail§Excellent communications skills both verbal & written §Strong negotiation skills §Strong commercial awareness§§Applications close 9 October 2020.§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications). §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. jobText: TXT/50608408.txt	§Senior Risk and Compliance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Risk and Compliance Manager§§Advertiser: §The Co-Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§About Us§  §The Co-Group is a charitable, not-for-profit (NFP) organisation that works hand-in-hand with disability, aged care and community service organisations across Australia to connect them with the best workforce solutions.§  §TCG supports organisations by providing them with a responsive, tailored workforce solution which includes skilled and experienced team members able to deliver high quality services to meet emergency, short-term and long-term needs.  §  §About the role§  §The Co-Group is seeking an enthusiastic, dynamic and hands-on§ Senior Risk and Compliance Manager §to prepare assist in the establishment of new businesses and ensure coverage of Insurances via establishment of risk frame works. Working closely with a number of entities (existing and new) to ensure ongoing coverage across appropriate policies with appropriate limits. §  §This role will suit a highly driven, collaborative and motivated individual with suitable qualifications and experience in company risk mitigation.§  §The key functions of the role include:§ § §Risk Management: § §Embedding and enhancing existing Risk Framework.§ §Monitoring of new and changing business developments for risk purposes§ §Renewals: review types of coverage and limits, and liaison with legal advisors§ § § §Group Risk Review § §Monitor and enhance Group Risk Matrix framework§ §Ensure Risk Matrix reflects current business profile§ § § §New Business start up § §Registrations§ §Insurances (Workers Compensation, Professional Indemnity, Public Liability, Management Liability etc)§ §Company Secretarial monitoring§ § § §Insurances: § §Group: Annual Return Preparation multiple entities, and review of Premiums, Limits and Claims multiple entities§ § § §The responsibilities of the role include:§ § §Establishing a close working relationship with the business through providing risk advice, review and challenge to facilitate the identification, measurement, monitoring and reporting of various non-financial risks§ §Development of analytics and stakeholder engagement required to provide risk advice on Services and Strategic change initiatives including any reporting required for relevant management committees§ §Assisting with embedding of the Risk Management Framework across businesses§ §Working with business stakeholders to collate required information to provide regular reporting to Senior Management and the Risk & Compliance Committee on risk profiles, incidents and issues, control gaps and status of gap actions§ §Facilitating Risk and Control Assessment workshops for various Group businesses including documenting risk profiles, control effectiveness, control gaps and remediation action status§ §Preparation & implementation control assurances across various Group businesses§ §About You§  §As a team member you will need to:§ § §show initiative§ §have exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.§ §be resilient and adaptable§ §have exceptional attention to detail§ §be able to manage competing priorities and deadlines§ §achieve and deliver outcomes§ §be a true team player with extraordinary people skills§ §Your Skills and Experience§  §To be successful in the role, you will require the following skills and experience:§ § §Demonstrated minimum 4 years experience within in a similar Risk Management role§ §Tertiary qualifications deemed relevant to the role as determined by TCG§ §Sound knowledge of insurance application and review process§ §Proven experience in running risk and control workshops, providing advice on risk identification, control design and control assurance§ §Experience in preparing risk management reports for senior management§ §Experience in documenting risk management frameworks and procedures§ §Demonstrated Excellent stakeholder management skills, including a proven ability to influence§ §Company Secretarial knowledge is not essential but viewed favourably§ §Other Requirements§ § §Candidates will need to possess a current National Police Clearance that is less than 12 months since date of issue.§ §Candidates will need to demonstrate compliance, or willingness to comply with our Immunisation and Vaccination policy.§ §How to Apply§  §If you are the person we have outlined above, then please apply by:§ § §responding to this ad and ensure you have included §a cover letter addressing 'Your Skills and Experience' criteria §as outlined above.§ §Include your §current resume§ that provides §details (name, email and telephone number) of 2 employment related referees.§ §The team at TCG will be reviewing applications for this position as they are received.  If you are one of the applicants who TCG thinks may be the right fit for the position, you will be contacted §via email§.  §  §Questions?§  §Should you have any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to the HR Team @ TCG via email at §talent@co-group.org.au§  §  §Recruiters ... §thank you for your interest in this position, however at this stage TCG is recruiting directly.  If we need assistance in finding the right candidate, we will be in touch.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50592691.txt	§Senior External Claims/ Loss Adjuster§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior External Claims/ Loss Adjuster§§Advertiser: §Crawford and Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Crawford:§ §Crawford & Company is the world’s largest publicly listed independent provider of claims management solutions to the risk management and insurance industry. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit§ §About the Role:§ §As an external claims adjuster, you will resolve commercial and domestic losses online and/ or on-site as well as ensuring compliance with service level agreements and maintaining high production levels§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § § § §Maintaining expected case load of property claims§ §Examining claims forms, policies and endorsements, client instructions and other records to determine coverage§ §Investigating claims by conducting office based analysis of physical damage details, interviewing claimants, and comparing claim information with evidence§ §Providing support & advice to policy holders with respect to their claims§ §Setting loss reserves§ §Preparing first reports by collecting and summarising information required§ §Where possible settling claims after determining liability, client’s instructions, and authority levels§ §Controlling claim costs§ §Type client reports in an accurate & timely manner§ §Adhere to insurer client Service Level Agreements and processes§ §Update Claims Management System as required§ §Effectively deal with service/product replacement providers§ §First point of referral for minor escalations§ §Distribution of claims to adjusters§ §Point of contact for technical referrals§ §Assist Branch/Regional Manager as required with the management of the Internal Claims Team§ §Comply with and maintain Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators§ §Maintaining company reputation and insurance product integrity by complying with federal and state regulations and service standards§ §Process daily outgoing mail in a timely manner§ §Archive files and retrieve archived files on request§ §Maintaining professional and technical knowledge through continuing education§ §Providing assistance to other offices in the event of a Catastrophe, as required§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of  managers, claims administrators, state managers, support staff, clients, insured and service providers bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit,  down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service, time and caseload management skills§ §Requirements:§ § §Experience in management of General Insurance Claims§ §Thorough knowledge of insurance terminology, practices and conditions§ §Understanding of basic business accounting procedures§ §Clear English and report writing skills§ §Professional and positive outlook§ §Strong organisational and interpersonal skills§ §Work without supervision§ §Client service focus§ §Good verbal and written communication skills§ §Good attention to detail§ §Adequate numeracy and literacy skills§ §Good computer abilities, preferably previous use of an electronic claims system§ §Loss Adjusting qualifications preferred, or Professional qualifications applicable to the Loss Adjusting industry.§ §Drivers Licence§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§ §Recruitment Agency Statement:§    § §Recruitment for this position will be managed in-house and we respectfully request that recruitment agencies refrain from submitting applications for this role§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have loss adjustment experience?§Do you have customer service experience?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50630650.txt	§Senior Risk Analyst, Australasia§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Risk Analyst, Australasia§§Advertiser: §AIG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Senior Risk Analyst, Australasia §      §        §Progress your career in a truly global environment §        §An environment in which knowledge is cultivated and innovation is encouraged §        §Be part of an experienced and highly valued team §      §      §        §Who we are§ American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.§ § §Get to know the business§ Corporate operations provide a wide range of services to the organization such as finance, risk management, internal audit, communications, security and human resources.§ § §Enterprise Risk Management§ As an insurance industry leader, we’re in the business of helping our clients manage risk. And as a global corporation of nearly 50,000 employees in more than 80 countries, we face a wide array of our own risks every day. These can come from financial markets, operational errors and regulatory changes, which can affect our workforce, our profitability and more.§ § The Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) team is responsible for ensuring that our businesses have the right tools and systems in place to identify, measure and manage these risks. The team plays a critical role in strategic decisions about where to expand or contract businesses, where to invest, to collect premiums that are enough to cover future claims, and how much capital we need to reserve to weather unexpected events.§ § As an ERM employee, you will shape and support how AIG manages its risks. Your knowledge about the company’s risks will shape the daily decision-making among AIG’s businesses and functions, while informing our clients and the markets that we serve.§ § ERM also encourages all employees to speak up when they spot something that fosters risk so that we can address it in a timely manner.§ § §About the role§ §What you need to know:§        §          §Work with the Chief Risk Officer (CRO) and key executives to identify, assess, monitor and report on the key risks facing AIG.§          §Provide support and advice to key projects, including preparation of risk assessments as required to support material outsource initiatives.§          §Work with Risk colleagues across Asia on shared projects or initiatives to address emerging risks - this can be anything from climate risk to cyber security to conduct and culture and beyond.§          §Oversee the collection and interpretation of key risk metrics and escalate where out of tolerance. Work with risk owners to develop mitigating action plans.§          §Educate and support our network of Risk Champions embedded into each business unit.§          §Assist with the design and roll out of new risk register software.§          §Manage the risk event reporting program.§          §Provide support to the New Zealand Risk Officer.§        §        §What we’re looking for:§        §          §Minimum of 4 years’ experience in a risk, audit or compliance role in general insurance or a broader financial services role.§          §Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills.§          §Proactive and constructive. A ‘can do’ attitude and genuine desire to help AIG execute its strategy safely.§          §Ability to manage competing projects and deliverables.§          §Experience and judgement; know when to support stakeholders and when to escalate.§          §Prior use of enterprise risk management software.§          §Prior experience working in a large global matrix reporting environment is advantageous.§          §Degree educated and CPA, CISA or further risk management studies well regarded.§ §        §        §We are an Equal Opportunity Employer§ It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. jobText: TXT/50542115.txt	§Sales Manager (VIC)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales Manager (VIC)§§Advertiser: §MetLife Insurance Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§Summary of Responsibilities:§ §The Sales Manager (SM) is responsible for driving the growth of MetLife in the retail market through identifying and successfully initiating new high value distribution partnerships with quality financial advice businesses.  In addition to building and managing their own panel of advisers, the SM will provide pro-active support to all sales activity across the VIC region including the management of relationships with local licensee teams and representing MetLife at PD days/conferences/industry events.  The SM will also be expected to help shape the way MetLife goes to market in Australia and provide input into the future development of the MetLife’s retail insurance offer.§ § § §Principal Responsibilities:§ § §Plan and execute sales activity to achieve new business targets§ §Increase awareness and usage of MetLife’s retail insurance offer among leading financial advice businesses§ §Work with Strategic Accounts to implement account plans which grow sales via identified high priority licensee groups§ §Cultivate relationships with key industry influencers to identify new adviser opportunities and grow MetLife’s brand in the local market (e.g. Licensee State Managers, AFA State Chapters and other industry bodies)§ §Provide regular, structured and constructive insights from advisers and licensees which help improve MetLife’s end to end insurance offering§ §Actively contribute to the development of MetLife’s retail insurance offer§ §Role model best practice sales behaviours and sales culture at all times§ § § §Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Required:§ §Sales Ability§ § §Able to identify sales opportunities and determine what steps need to be taken realise them§ §Able to open doors§ §Applies a consistent sales process§ §Hunter not farmer§ § § §Respected Business Expert§ §Highly developed understanding of the life insurance industry, distribution channels and products currently available in the market.  Well-developed relationships with key risk writing practices essential.§ §Start-up Mindset§ §Thriving on the challenge of building a business from scratch.  Takes pride in ownership and is willing to do whatever it takes to ensure the team succeeds.§ §Commercial Acumen§ §Understanding how life companies operate and what profitable sales looks like.  Ability to have business to business conversations with advisers and licensees.§ §Insight Selling§ §Using deep insights about adviser businesses, the broader industry and our own offer to constructively challenge the status quo.  Able to add value by showing how a solution is uniquely placed to address a specific challenge the adviser faces or unlock a growth opportunity in their business.§ §Resilience § §Enthusiastic, results driven individual that can operate well in both a team environment and independently. Focused on goal achievement and expansion of business no matter the obstacles or challenges.§ §Puts Customers First § §Genuinely cares about the wellbeing of our customers and advisers.  Leads by example and helps MetLife deliver great customer experiences to achieve competitive advantage.§ §Drives Results § §Achieves set goals and is accountable for continuously lifting performance, while helping lead change and ensuring high standards.§ §Building Partnerships§ §Developing long term, collaborative and profitable relationships with advisers.  Attracting the best advisers in the industry that want to partner with us.  Able to have the tough conversations when required. § §Planning and Organising§ §Assisting in implementing plans for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently and effectively.§ §Executive Disposition§ §Demonstrating the outward qualities that stakeholders, customers and employees expect from management; communicating and listening effectively using behaviours appropriate for the level of positional power and influence; inspiring confidence and trust in others; acting as an advocate for MetLife.§ §Communicating with Impact§ §Communicating in a way that is clear, concise, and easily understood; communicating with impact and credibility; influencing others using persuasive arguments; using appropriate language, style, and terminology for the situation.§ §Creates Partnerships§ §Authentically builds trusted relationships and collaborates across global, diverse and multi-functional teams to successfully drive business objectives.§ §Seizes Opportunity § §Constantly seeking new opportunities and ways to create new and balanced business growth while improving operational capabilities.§ §Models our Values§ §Pro-actively contributes to the team and aims to help builds a culture that promotes the company’s values and standards through role modelling, accountability and ownership of decisions.§ § § §Key Knowledge Areas§ §Insurance§ § §Expert understanding of MetLife’s offering including how features and benefits connect to different client types/needs§ §Detailed understanding of underwriting processes and philosophies in the market – including interplay with reinsurance§ §Detailed understanding of claims processes and philosophies in the market§ §Working knowledge of risk research platforms and how advisers utilise them in practice§ §Detailed understanding of how insurance is priced in the retail market§ §Expert knowledge of lapse management strategies – how to identify bad business before it gets onto the books§ §Distribution§ § §Strong sales process and planning§ §Strong communication skills and the ability to influence internal and external stakeholders§ §Markets & Customers§ § §Established relationships with key risk producing practices and AFSL’s – demonstrated ability to influence their decision making§ §Expert knowledge of the financial services industry including; structure, the role of different parties in the value chain, market drivers and current trends.§ §Detailed knowledge of compliance frameworks which advisers operate under (especially APL’s/Research and BID)§ §Detailed knowledge of MetLife’s competitors including key offerings and relationship strategies.§ § § §Required Experience;§ § §Appropriate Tertiary Qualifications (preferably Business with a major in Marketing or Communications)§ §Minimum 2-3  years’ experience in similar role, within Financial Services Industry§ §RG146 accredited§ § § §What's in it for you?§ § §·       §Great central location (when we return from WFH that is!)§ §·       §Fantastic employee benefits §including - flexible work arrangements, health & wellbeing allowance, access to corporate discounts through Perks at Work, additional purchased annual leave, super matching and free weekly fresh fruit.§ §·       Access to §ongoing professional development, including study support §and §career progression§ within a leading global organisation. § § § §To apply, please send your resume to §aupeopleculture@metlife.com§ §Applications close Thursday 17th September 2020§ § § §MetLife is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We are committed to attracting, retaining and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. They have a strong presence in Australia and are consistently seeking strong talent to join their ranks.§The Role§As an Account Director/Principal Broker you will: § § § §Manage a portfolio of circa 400k in income within the mid-market/corporate space.§ §Work closely with the NSW service and BD team.§ §Mentor junior staff.§ §Be provided with assistance from Account Executives.§ §Direct, lead and grow the portfolio.§ § §Ideal Candidates§You will have:§ § §Previous Corporate Broking experience.§ §Solid track record of portfolio management (mid-market Corporate) experience.§ §Strong technical knowledge of GI products.  Professional Risk policies are managed via the Pro/Financial Risks team.  Some working knowledge of D&O, PI, Cyber & Workers Compensation programs is not priority however is preferable.§ §Whilst the role is primarily portfolio management, they all have Business Development budgets.  The candidate should have capacity to develop business organically and via introduction of new clients.§ § §Benefits§ § §Salary range between 145k-170k + super + new business incentive.§ §Flexible working arrangements currently in practice for 2-3 days from home§ § §How to Apply§Don’t delay and APPLY NOW by submitting your resume for immediate consideration. §For any enquiries, please Tom on §0438 456 082§.§§§§

You will proactively monitor portfolio lead indicators and provide product or pricing recommendations to support future profitable growth for the various insurance portfolios. jobText: TXT/50543486.txt	§Finance Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Finance Administrator§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§ § §About the role§We currently have an opportunity within our Finance Team for a Finance Administrator reporting to the Branch Accounts Team Leader. This is a national position supporting multiple branches across the Gallagher broking business and responsible for all financial activities, which occur within the branch network.§Key responsibilities include:§Receipting/allocation of all client payments to invoices including direct deposits, bpay, postbill pay and foreign currency §Allocation of credit and debit invoices §Assisting and supporting brokers with accounts queries including client and creditor payments §Processing the administration and approval step of client refunds §Weekly reconciliation of unallocated items report §Supporting the central finance team with banking and creditor payment queries §Liaising with underwriters on closing requests and outstanding premium requests §Premium funding flagging of policies and allocation of settlements §Identify opportunities to improve business process§§About You§§Demonstrated experience and understanding of accounts administration  §Experience and understanding of insurance will be highly regarded  §High attention to detail and levels of accuracy  §Excellent time management  §Strong team player with willingness to support others   §Excellent communication skills with the ability to liaise with a range of stakeholders.§§Why Gallagher Australia?§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 28,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2019 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 8th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§What will we offer?§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team and will have additional benefits:§Competitive remuneration and incentive program§Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances§Salary sacrifice options including additional leave§Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential.§§How to apply?§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§§§§§

§Assessment§§§§§§Aegis Management Support Group§ §Company Background & Job Purpose:§ § § §Aegis Group is a friendly small business that conducts General Insurance Investigations and Assessments for our Western Australian and Interstate clients.§ § § §The Assessor/Investigator position is an extremely important and challenging role within our organisational structure.§ § § §Your objective will be to Assess/Investigate general home and motor vehicle insurance claims in a concise, accurate and timely manner.§ § § §In this position, you will report directly to the Partners of the business.§ § §Duties & Responsibilities:§ §We are currently seeking an experienced Assessor/Investigator to work on a §sub contract basis§.  § §This exciting and challenging role will see you manage your own portfolio of General Home and Motor Vehicle Claims in conjunction with the partners within the business.§ §Your primary role will be to Assess/Investigate and process Home and Motor Vehicle claims from start to finish.   Other roles include liaising with various government and private agencies whenever the need arises.§ §You will have a polite, confident and professional attitude, a reliable vehicle and be smartly groomed and dressed.  This role would ideally suit someone that has previously worked within a Police or other investigative type background.. § §To excel in this role, we require somebody with the following attributes:§ § § §Must hold a valid Western Australian Investigators Licence § § § §Must hold (or be willing to obtain) an ANZIIF Certificate in Claims Investigation Standard and the General Insurance Code of Practice § § § §Must have previous Home and/or Motor Vehicle Claims Assessing/Investigation experience  § § § §An ability to focus on providing our clients with an exceptional level of personalised service§ § § §Excellent organisational and communication skills§ § § §Strong decision making ability§ § § §High level of typing accuracy§ § § §Excellent analytical skills§ § §If you meet the above criteria, are available for an immediate start and are looking for a new challenge within a professional and friendly small business, we would like to hear from you.§ §Please e-mail your current Investigators Licence, resume and covering letter outlining your skill set to §richard.wright@aegisgroup.com.au§     §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you hold a current security licence?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50541277.txt	§Property Claims Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Claims Leader§§Advertiser: §Sedgwick Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Sedgwick is moving to a new and exciting way of working. We are looking for a Property Claims Leader to join us on our journey and redefine what success looks like for customers who have experienced a significant event and need to make a claim on their insurance policy.§  §YOU ARE§ a subject matter expert in insurance claims with a particular passion in property insurance. You have demonstrated experience leading large teams and have a proven track record of exceeding performance in an environment which requires a fine balance between customer experience and cost outcomes.  Determination, grit, risk-taker, nimbleness, and agility aren't just descriptive words; they are ingrained in the way you work and live.§  §Engaging with clients and other stakeholders comes naturally to you as is your ability to listen to challenges or problems, understand needs and develop solutions in a nimble and agile way.§  §More importantly, you believe it is impossible to revolutionise the claims experience without using technology. Ultimately, you are motivated by the need to help customers and challenge the paradigm at each opportunity to ensure customer comes first.§  §THIS POSITION §will report directly into the Head of Claims and be responsible for the direction, performance and overall success of your direct reports and their teams.§  §CRUCIAL TO YOUR SUCCESS§ will be the role you play as an ambassador for change, your ability to lead and create a culture of high performance and your grit to overcome challenges.§  §WE ARE§ not your average claims management function; we are different, think bigger and expect nothing less than excellence.§  §We don’t just employ; we listen, empower, partner and promote. At Sedgwick, §caring counts®.§  §The location of this position is not critical; we would love to hear from all candidates regardless of where you are based around Australia. §  §The Benefits:§ § §Work-life balance§ §Work with and learn from the best in the industry § §Opportunity for career progression within a global organisation§ §Ongoing support and development§ §Great culture and work environment§  § §Responsibilities:§ § §Work with teams and colleagues to deliver a world class claim experience for clients and their insureds§ §Bring together the full suite of capability within Sedgwick to deliver customer, cost and quality outcomes§ §Coach and develop Team Leaders to understand the critical success factors necessary to deliver colleague, client and customer outcomes whilst managing a claim portfolio§ §Engage with and listen to clients to understand their requirements, pain points and desired solutions. Represent these insights back to the Sedgwick business.§ §Identify, promote and implement initiatives and continuous improvement opportunities§ §Support colleagues to identify performance and development goals measured through regular feedback and coaching§ §Ensure proactive and strategic management of the claims portfolio to deliver on SLA’s and customer requirements§ §Initiate, support and assist your teams ongoing training, learning and development§ §Retain, build and grow strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §Manage and resolve escalated complaints in line with complaints processes and procedures§ §Contribute to the successful and high performing culture of the wider division§  § §About you:§ § §5 years hands-on leadership experience§ §5+ years working in claims across various portfolios§ §2 years’ specific experience working in property claims§ §Exceptional people leadership skills§ §A genuine commitment to delivering a positive customer experience§ §Strong technical knowledge of general insurance across domestic property§ §Proven track record of delivering results§ §Experience in the application of continuous improvement methodologies§ §Excellent communication skills, written and verbal§ §Strong skills and experience in Microsoft Word and Excel§ §Ability to work in a fast-paced, diverse and dynamic environment§  § §Our Values: Accountability   -   Collaboration   -   Empathy   -   Growth   -   Inclusion§ §  §All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Sedgwick Australia Pty Ltd is dedicated to eliminating discrimination and contributing to equal opportunity in the workplace.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§§§

jobText: TXT/50569784.txt	§2 x Senior Policy & Communications Specialist, Claims§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§2 x Senior Policy & Communications Specialist, Claims§§Advertiser: §TAL§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Senior Policy and Communications Specialist, Claims§ § § §Join Australia's Leading Life Insurer§ § § §2 x 12 month Parental Leave contract roles§ § § § §Welcome to This Australian Life.§ §From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.§ §TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community.   People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community.  People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide.  People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart. § §About the Opportunity§ §This role is accountable for developing, managing, implementing, and monitoring compliance with relevant regulatory requirements for Claims (such as but not limited to the Life Insurance Code of Practice). In addition to this, the role will be responsible for the management of TAL’s internal Claims policies, procedures, and guidelines, as well as control of TAL’s internal means of correspondence with claims customers.§ §You will work independently, but will refer to more senior colleagues for more complex issues/decisions and the role will also actively drive compliance and risk management strategies for the TAL claims team. You will also be involved in supporting the business to satisfy their responsibilities regarding relevant internal policy frameworks as well as helping the business to use the frameworks to better achieve business & customer outcomes.§ §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ § § §Minimum of 3 years’ experience (mid-level management) in a relevant Risk Management, Compliance, Legal and/or Technical Claims environment;§ § § §Degree qualified in a business-related line e.g. legal / accounting / commerce would be advantageous§ § § §Track record of delivering sustainable solutions to reduce or eliminate inefficiency in business processes§ § § §Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to work as a team member;§ § § §Ability to influence and achieve outcomes in consultation with senior management & key stakeholders across the organisation§ § §Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts.  We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.§ §We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.§ §You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.§ §If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. §§§§

Established in 1989, the business operates throughout Australia with an expert team of professional building supervisors and repairers, who provide a premium customer service experience.§ §We currently have opportunities for Estimators to join our team in Australia. Our areas of expertise and management systems allow us to handle a high volume of small to medium value claims, in addition to a large number of major loss claims from catastrophic and significant weather events.§ §As an Estimator you will be responsible for costing claim damages prepared by supervisors who have visited site and created a scope with supporting photographs. Desk top costings or second quotes across a wide variety of claims ranging in value up to $500k. You will be also providing technical support, information and advice to assist the team’s collective intelligence to resolve all claims. § §To be considered a strong candidate for this position, it is likely that you will be able to demonstrate the following:§ §Certificate IV in Building Construction Estimation or similar with Diploma or relevant degree being highly regarded§Demonstrated experience as an Estimator within the insurance repair industry will be highly regarded, with a high level of competency and breadth of capability, with a focus on claim values between $10k and $500k§Demonstrated leadership skills, able to be a part of a high performing team.§Demonstrated ability to complete quality reports and quotes consistently within PDS and KPI frameworks§Demonstrated capacity to review claims evidence and develop detailed scopes to complete quality assured quotes and reports.§Excellent written communication skills and able to prepare quotes and reports in accordance with internal standards.§Experience in interpreting and delivering relevant claim outcomes aligning with the client requirements to validate cause and resulting damages§Capacity to assess hazards and implement measures to control risk in accordance with OHSE standards.§ §This is an outstanding opportunity to develop your career with a national market leader with a commitment to ongoing sustainable growth.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Communications and Policy Officer Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50706045.txt	§Communications and Policy Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications and Policy Officer§§Advertiser: §Ashby Magro Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Communications and Policy Officer §      §ElectricSuper is a superannuation scheme offered exclusively to employees in the electricity supply industry and their spouses in South Australia. It provides super services to over 3,000 members and has funds of over $1.4 billion.  They have consistently been successful in meeting their investment benchmarks, importantly delivering above median returns for members.  §   § This newly created position, Communications and Policy Officer, reports to the CEO and  has 3 main components which will appeal to the person looking for a great opportunity to learn the superannuation industry or to extend their current working knowledge of superannuation. § You will have responsibility for managing the many communication projects including the drafting and distribution of material to employers and members, management of the website and maintenance of the member database.§ Policy and compliance issues will also be part of the brief.  You will liaise with the lawyers in relation to proposed Rule amendments/clarifications, assist with ensuring that ElectricSuper complies with its legal and statutory obligations and update Scheme Rules as necessary.§Working within the small team you will provide office support by organising travel and accommodation for the staff and the Board, ensuring invoices are correct and monitoring their  payment by the outsourced provider, managing payroll and liaising with, and monitoring, suppliers.§   § This role needs someone who is customer service focused, highly organised, with high attention to detail and is able to work both autonomously and as part of a small team. RG146 compliance would be highly regarded as would relevant tertiary qualifications.  However, of greater importance is your willingness to learn and the personal qualities you will bring to this high performing, successful team.§ A salary will be negotiated which will attract the candidate of the calibre we seek.§  § To request a copy of the position description please email §admin@ashbymagro.com.au§   § Brief enquires may be made to Allison Ashby on §0414 731 313§.§   § Applications should include a covering letter and resume in Word format and may be submitted by clicking the “apply” button below or through our website www.ashbymagro.com.au.§ Applications should be received prior to close of business 23 October 2020. §      §      §    §  §§§ElectricSuper is a superannuation scheme offered exclusively to employees in the electricity supply industry and their spouses in South Australia. It provides super services to over 3,000 members and has funds of over $1.4 billion.  They have consistently been successful in meeting their investment benchmarks, importantly delivering above median returns for members.  §   § This newly created position, Communications and Policy Officer, reports to the CEO and  has 3 main components which will appeal to the person looking for a great opportunity to learn the superannuation industry or to extend their current working knowledge of superannuation. § You will have responsibility for managing the many communication projects including the drafting and distribution of material to employers and members, management of the website and maintenance of the member database.§ Policy and compliance issues will also be part of the brief.  You will liaise with the lawyers in relation to proposed Rule amendments/clarifications, assist with ensuring that ElectricSuper complies with its legal and statutory obligations and update Scheme Rules as necessary.§Working within the small team you will provide office support by organising travel and accommodation for the staff and the Board, ensuring invoices are correct and monitoring their  payment by the outsourced provider, managing payroll and liaising with, and monitoring, suppliers.§   § This role needs someone who is customer service focused, highly organised, with high attention to detail and is able to work both autonomously and as part of a small team. RG146 compliance would be highly regarded as would relevant tertiary qualifications.  However, of greater importance is your willingness to learn and the personal qualities you will bring to this high performing, successful team.§ A salary will be negotiated which will attract the candidate of the calibre we seek.§  § To request a copy of the position description please email §admin@ashbymagro.com.au§   § Brief enquires may be made to Allison Ashby on §0414 731 313§.§   § Applications should include a covering letter and resume in Word format and may be submitted by clicking the “apply” button below or through our website www.ashbymagro.com.au.§ Applications should be received prior to close of business 23 October 2020.§§§§

superannuation (ideally) or financial services industry.  §The core purpose of this role is to ensure that the Fund and its service providers adhere to internal policy framework and operate within external regulatory requirements. § § Your purpose will be to: § § §Work closely with the senior management team to provide advice, support, education and training to all stakeholders and business partners to facilitate compliant outcomes;§ §Act as a technical referral point for your business partners in relation to relevant compliance and regulatory obligations including recommending courses of action to resolve any issues;§ §Develop, review and update the Fund’s compliance policies and procedures ensuring ongoing compliance with legislation, regulatory requirements and standards;§ through education, training and audit activities of internal teams to improve process efficiency and to ensure client-centric business outcomes§ § To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Possess a expectations;§ §Have highly developed oral and written communication skills AND§ §Have proven experience working under pressure and organising work priorities to meet deadlines§ § This is an exciting jobTitle: Manager Claims Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50693009.txt	§Manager Claims§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Claims§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § §The Opportunity at AIA§ In November 2019, AIA Australia welcomed CommInsure Life (CMLAs Pty Ltd) into the AIA family. This role is positioned in the CMLAS Pty Ltd business and based at our offices in Sydney Olympic Park.§ Your role as a Claims Manager you will be required to lead and manage an operational team within Savings and Investments Services with the aim of providing exceptional support to the Senior Manager of Administration. This is a 6 month secondment position open to AIA and CMLA employees. § § §Some of the key responsibilities:§ §Lead your team to fulfil the Vision and Values of the business.§ §Lead your team to deliver exceptional customer service and high quality within agreed service level agreements (SLA’s).§ §Living and advocating our Management Operating System, including performance review discussions and change management.§ §Ensure all Customer, Trustee and Legislative requirements are met.§ §Design, drive and implement a Customer Led, Compassionate Claims Journey by effectively advocating the VOC and the VOB, considering all compliance obligations to positively influence all key customer touch points that matter.§ §Consistent and effective management of stakeholders across our business including external Trustees.§ §Data and analytics to positively impact the customer experience by improving effectiveness and driving quality outcomes, including coaching and training. Provide strategic recommendations to senior management based on effective use of data.§ §Create and Implement your team strategy and 90 day business plans, and support business strategic priorities.§ §Provide support to your Manager and SIS Leadership team to drive positive change and culture.§ §Ensure controls are effectively in use and adding value to the overall business and customer and experience.§ §Manage risk within the team and provide support and effective controls to managing risk in S&I, and the business.§ § §We are interested in hearing from those with:§ §Previous management and leadership experience of claims team preferably, but not essential.§ §Previous Superannuation/Life Insurance and or investment products knowledge and experience.§ §Excellent stakeholder management of relationships across the business, leadership, and Trustees, Life Business claims counterparts§ §Ability to keep up with Super and Life legislation updates and implement changes into the team processes and technology where necessary.§ §Strong negotiation & influential skills§ §RG146 qualifications will be highly considered§ §Knowledge of coaching concepts and methodology§ §Knowledge of productivity essential concepts and methodology§ §Strong ability to make effective decisions on claims and business processes§ §Proven analytical skills§ §Self-Management and the ability to supervise and lead others.§ §Sound understanding of the key business drivers§ §Ability to multitask and work on a variety of tasks with tight deadlines§ §Strong organisation and planning skills§ §Effective time management skills§ § §If this sounds like you then apply now!§ Any enquiries, please contact §owen.fox@aia.com§. Please note this is for enquiries only, for all applications, please apply through Workday.§ § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  §  § We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§  § We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§  § We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§
