We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries.§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally.§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit.§ §About the Role:§ §As Internal Claims Adjuster, you’ll manage a portfolio of property claims to conclusion online and on-site, maintain compliance with service level agreements and key performance indicators, as well as deliver a high level of customer service and productivity as a first point of contact for minor escalations and technical referrals both online and on-site.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Maintaining expected case load of property claims online and onsite§ §Examining claims forms, policies and endorsements, client instructions and other records to determine coverage§ §Investigating claims by conducting office-based analysis of physical damage details, interviewing claimants, and comparing claim information with evidence.§ §Providing support and advice to policy holders with respect to their claims§ §Setting loss reserves§ §Preparing first reports by collecting and summarising information required§ §Where possible settling claims after determining liability, client’s instructions, and authority levels§ §Controlling claim costs§ §Type client reports in an accurate and timely manner§ §Adhere to insurer client Service Level Agreements and processes.§ §Update Claims Management System as required§ §Effectively deal with service/product replacement providers§ §Comply with and maintain Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators§ §Maintaining company reputation and insurance product integrity by complying with federal and state regulations and service standards§ §Process daily outgoing mail in a timely manner§ §Archive files and retrieve archived files on request§ §Maintaining professional and technical knowledge through continuing education§ §Providing assistance to other offices in the event of a Catastrophe, as required§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of claims adjusters, bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit; down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service; and time and caseload management skills§ §Who we’re looking for:§ § §Previous claims experience preferred§ §Experience in management of General Insurance Claims§ §Insurance Contracts Act/FSRA legislation awareness§ §Stable work history§ §Excellent English§ §High Typing speed§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role.§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon.§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check.§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§.§ §Recruitment Agency Statement:§    § §Recruitment for this position will be managed in-house and we respectfully request that recruitment agencies refrain from submitting applications for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your average typing speed?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50703411.txt	§Claims Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Advisor§§Advertiser: §Suncorp§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Claims Advisor §      §        §The Role§        § §        §Our CTP and Workers’ Insurance Statutory products operate across all open schemes and are distributed under AAMI, APIA, GIO, Shannons, Suncorp, and Vero brands.  As Australia’s largest Statutory insurer, Personal Injury Insurance aspires to be the leading personal injury insurer across all schemes and markets nationally.§        § §        §The CTP Claims team currently have an exciting opportunity for a §Claims Advisor§ to manage a portfolio of ACT CTP Claims within a team managing direct claimants and solicitor represented claims in a full-time permanent role.§        § §        §The purpose of this role is to provide a superior level of customer service whilst maintaining a commercial focus on achieving business outcomes. This role is responsible for the proactive management of a portfolio of compulsory third-party claims in accordance with relevant legislative, regulatory & procedural guidelines, to achieve cost effective and timely claim outcomes.§        § §        §Key responsibilities§        § §        §          §Proactively manage a portfolio of claims in accordance with legislative, regulatory and procedural guidelines to achieve cost effective and timely claim resolutions§          §Proactively work to resolve claims within the earliest possible timeframes by engaging with stakeholders and actioning activities and incoming correspondence in a timely fashion, across a portfolio of claims to achieve optimal outcomes§          §Ensure legislative compliance timeframes are met in conjunction with ongoing review of medical, financial, investigative and rehabilitation reports§          §Management and negotiation of pre-proceedings and litigated claims, including communication with claimants and solicitors, by phone, correspondence and/or attending settlement conferences and/or hearings.§          §Overall management of individual claims to ensure appropriate strategies are followed to reduce the average duration and cost of claims§          §Continually assess the Quantum and Estimate of claims utilising the evidence available and in accordance with procedural requirements§          §Work within the designated Delegation of Authority§          §Utilise and collaborate with Injury Management and Technical Advisors to discuss and action plan file direction§          §Utilise and collaborate with relevant internal business areas (e.g. Fraud and Investigations, Sharing & Recoveries, Resolution Services) to discuss and action plan file direction§          §Adhere to departmental procedures on all claims for a consistent and appropriate approach to claims management§          §Maintain consistent, effective and proactive file management practices§        §        § §        §Skills & Experience§        § §        §To be successful in this role, you will possess:§        § §        §          §Previous insurance claims experience with a track record for delivering results (desirable)§          §Workers Compensation and CTP experience is desired but not mandatory§          §University Qualification is also desired but not mandatory§          §The ability to build rapport and negotiate with various of stakeholders included claimants, third party providers, external bodies and internal teams§          §The ability to effectively manage all aspects of each claim whilst keeping in the current restraints and upcoming ACT legislation§          §Strong commitment and a high degree of integrity to help meet and exceed customer expectations§ on our various Insurance, Banking & Superannuation products§          §Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§          §Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§          §We offer support and various programs for our people: (Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Facilities for nursing mothers, Company share options, Social club, Years of Service Recognition)§        §        § §        §About Us§        § §        §Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.§        § §        §Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers. Joining Suncorp, you will be joining an organisation which cares and is proud of our achievements in being recognised for:§        § §        §          §Best Insurance Company in Corporate Social Responsibility (2018)§          §Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for sixth consecutive year §(2014-2019§)§          §Money§ magazine’s Bank of the Year and Business Bank for second consecutive year §(2018-2019§)§          §General Insurance Product Innovation of the Year (2018)§        §        § §        §If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today.§        § §        §For further information regarding this position, please contact our resourcing partner Hays Talent Solutions on §02 8226 9659§.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Role§ §Our CTP and Workers’ Insurance Statutory products operate across all open schemes and are distributed under AAMI, APIA, GIO, Shannons, Suncorp, and Vero brands.  As Australia’s largest Statutory insurer, Personal Injury Insurance aspires to be the leading personal injury insurer across all schemes and markets nationally.§ §The CTP Claims team currently have an exciting opportunity for a §Claims Advisor§ to manage a portfolio of ACT CTP Claims within a team managing direct claimants and solicitor represented claims in a full-time permanent role.§ §The purpose of this role is to provide a superior level of customer service whilst maintaining a commercial focus on achieving business outcomes. This role is responsible for the proactive management of a portfolio of compulsory third-party claims in accordance with relevant legislative, regulatory & procedural guidelines, to achieve cost effective and timely claim outcomes.§ §Key responsibilities§ §§Proactively manage a portfolio of claims in accordance with legislative, regulatory and procedural guidelines to achieve cost effective and timely claim resolutions§Proactively work to resolve claims within the earliest possible timeframes by engaging with stakeholders and actioning activities and incoming correspondence in a timely fashion, across a portfolio of claims to achieve optimal outcomes§Ensure legislative compliance timeframes are met in conjunction with ongoing review of medical, financial, investigative and rehabilitation reports§Management and negotiation of pre-proceedings and litigated claims, including communication with claimants and solicitors, by phone, correspondence and/or attending settlement conferences and/or hearings.§Overall management of individual claims to ensure appropriate strategies are followed to reduce the average duration and cost of claims§Continually assess the Quantum and Estimate of claims utilising the evidence available and in accordance with procedural requirements§Work within the designated Delegation of Authority§Utilise and collaborate with Injury Management and Technical Advisors to discuss and action plan file direction§Utilise and collaborate with relevant internal business areas (e.g. Fraud and Investigations, Sharing & Recoveries, Resolution Services) to discuss and action plan file direction§Adhere to departmental procedures on all claims for a consistent and appropriate approach to claims management§Maintain consistent, effective and proactive file management practices§§ §Skills & Experience§ §To be successful in this role, you will possess:§ §§Previous insurance claims experience with a track record for delivering results (desirable)§Workers Compensation and CTP experience is desired but not mandatory§University Qualification is also desired but not mandatory§The ability to build rapport and negotiate with various of stakeholders included claimants, third party providers, external bodies and internal teams§The ability to effectively manage all aspects of each claim whilst keeping in the current restraints and upcoming ACT legislation§Strong commitment and a high degree of integrity to help meet and exceed customer expectations§A positive attitude, resilience and willingness to contribute to workplace improvement and changes§§ §Benefits§ §§Discounts of up to 25% on our various Insurance, Banking & Superannuation products§Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§We offer support and various programs for our people: (Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Facilities for nursing mothers, Company share options, Social club, Years of Service Recognition)§§ §About Us§§ §Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.§ §Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers. Joining Suncorp, you will be joining an organisation which cares and is proud of our achievements in being recognised for:§ §§Best Insurance Company in Corporate Social Responsibility (2018)§Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for sixth consecutive year §(2014-2019§)§Money§ magazine’s Bank of the Year and Business Bank for second consecutive year §(2018-2019§)§General Insurance Product Innovation of the Year (2018)§§ §If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today.§ §For further information regarding this position, please contact our resourcing partner Hays Talent Solutions on §02 8226 9659§.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Claims Executive - Financial Lines Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50608628.txt	§Senior Claims Executive - Financial Lines§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Executive - Financial Lines§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About the Role§Reporting to the Claims Manager, this role will see you provide claims management and advocacy on a portfolio of technical Financial Lines claims. You will be responsible for the management of some of the most complex matters within Gallagher for our clients covering myriad of classes of insurance including Directors and Officers, Professional Indemnity, Management Liability and Cyber. This role is a 12 month contract role (with a view for extension). We are offering a truly flexible working arrangement that can be performed over 4 or 5 days per week.§About you§You are legally qualified and/or a practicing solicitors (minimum 2 years PQE).§To be successful in this role, you will be will be experienced in:§•The management of Financial Lines and/or litigated claims;§•Effective communication with a focus on drafting claims submissions and dispute resolution submissions; §•Client and stakeholder management and the ability to communicate and negotiate difficult claims;§•Developing effective working relationships and using your influencing skills to work across the business; and§•The management of claims arising out of Financial Lines insurance products including Professional Indemnity, Management Liability, Directors and Officers and Employment Practices Liability§ §Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§What will we offer§It’s an amazing time to be joining a well-established team!§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business. Additional benefits:§•Competitive remuneration and incentive program§•Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances§•Flexible working arrangements§•Salary sacrifice options including additional leave§•Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§•The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential§How to apply§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. jobText: TXT/50526510.txt	§Senior Claims Consultant (Major Loss)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Consultant (Major Loss)§§Advertiser: §CHU Underwriting Agencies Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About CHU§ §CHU is part of the Steadfast Group; a top 200 ASX-listed company with $7 billion in total billings is the largest general insurance broker network and group of underwriting agencies in Australasia. Our policies are underwritten by QBE Insurance (Australia) Ltd, one of Australia’s most secure insurance companies.§ §We are one of Australia’s largest and most awarded insurance underwriting agencies. Our point of difference is that we offer comprehensive insurance, so our customers don’t need to purchase ‘optional extras’. We protect almost 1 million apartments, units and townhouses across Australia, with almost half a trillion value insured. We are multi-award winners: back to back winners of the Underwriting Agency of the Year Award 2017 – 2018, Insurance Business Gold Award winner 2016 – 2018, and 2019 winner of ANZIIF Excellence in Workplace Diversity and Inclusion.§ §Working with CHU§ §When you join CHU, you will join a friendly and supportive team, committed to providing our customers with an outstanding service. To reward you, we offer:§ § §An inclusive and flexible work environment. We are currently working from home but our offices are open if required!§ §Competitive salary packaging and excellent benefits.§ §Ongoing coaching and feedback, including bi-monthly formal feedback sessions with your Manager.§ §Offices close to Cafes, Shops and Public Transport.§ §About the role§ §The role sits within the local CHU Branch team and reports to the National Technical Claims Manager. The Major Loss Consultant is an integral part of the CHU Claims proposition, driving an outstanding customer experience, delivering market leading loss assessment through quality technical response.§ §This position is also responsible for supporting attritional Claims teams and the Internal Dispute Resolution Team as required.§ §The position is diverse, and includes the following key elements:§ § §Ensure the delivery of a "Concierge" claims service on every claims (in accordance with company standards.§ §Consistently delivery of  a "phone first" approach to your designated claims.§ §Manage a portfolio of technical first party strata claims within the Major Loss quantum guidelines.§ §Assist and provide technical claims advice to colleagues across the business.§ §Manage all claims within agreed workflow timeframes.§ §Assist where possible any overflow of claims matters from other branches (which may occur in circumstances such as CAT).§ §Ensure regular and accurate reporting is provided to the technical claims manager as requested.§ §Respond to technical queries and referrals from your broker/complainant.§ §Lodge disputes onto ERM and update the complainant/client accordingly.§ §Make informed decisions at dispute stage 1 and 2 (where required).§ §Negotiate and compromise decisions where required to come to a resolution (where required).§ §Support to be provided to the Technical Claims Manager in IDR or otherwise.§ §About you§ §The successful applicant will have the following traits and experience:§ § §Minimum 5 years’ experience working in either broker or intermediary based insurer environment.§ §5 years property claims experience, preferably strata.§ §Sound working knowledge of claims operations and understanding of quality service standards.§ §ANZIIF Cert IV or equivalent.§ §Strong problem solving and ability to think analytically.§ §Comprehensive experience in dealing with loss assessors, repairers, brokers, strata managers etc.§ §Demonstrated high level of organisational and time management skills.§ §Experience in management of claims response delivery.§ §Ability to provide complaints guidance/training/feedback to the business where required.§ §Ability to identify trends to ensure continuous improvements in complaint resolution.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

We collaborate with various departments across the business to ensure the profitable pricing of risks and identification of potential growth opportunities.§ §About the role§ §Reporting to the Underwriting Operations Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring that sustainable and profitable business practices are established and maintained whilst delivering the highest levels of service and quality to your stakeholders.§ §This is a full time maternity leave contract for up to 12 months, with possibility of extension.§ §Key responsibilities§ §Manage renewals, endorsements and new business opportunities to attain financial targets§ §Perform the risk acceptance process so that business is written in accordance with guidelines§ §Participate in the audit process, underwriting policies and pricing/policy negotiation with the Commercial team.§ §Our Ideal Candidate§ §A minimum of five years’ experience in heavy motor underwriting§ §Relevant industry qualifications§ §A strong customer focus, service ethic and commitment to excellence§ §Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills§ §The ability to work in a fast paced environment, negotiate, handle multiple priorities and manage expectations§ §NTI's Culture§ §Our culture is not like any other, we pride ourselves on having a supportive team culture that inspires effort and rewards success. With a company engagement score of 93% we can proudly say that NTI is an employer of choice.§ §Is this the role for you?§ §If you are interested and would like to join our dedicated team of Underwriting professionals, please submit a Resume and Cover Letter.§ §Please note we will only be in contact with candidates selected to progress to the next stage of the recruitment process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an underwriter?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50583671.txt	§Senior Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Kennedy Reid§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$80,000-$85,000 package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§THE ROLE§ § §Manage an end-to-end caseload of maximum 50-55 injured workers§ §Predominately physical injuries under NSW WorkCover § §Liaise with key internal stakeholders to gather information§ §Make liability decisions on claims and communicate effectively § §Coordinate medical treatment where necessary§ §Conduct strategic file reviews with key internal stakeholders§ §Give input into monthly meetings with stakeholders to drive outcomes§ §Build lasting relationships with company line managers  § §Deliver training and support to individual Case Managers § § §WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?§As a well established national brand who self-insure against workplace injuries, you can expect;§Stability:§ If you're coming from the forever changing environment of a scheme agent, you can expect complete stability in Self Insurance. They are not bound by the same obligations that are applicable in a scheme agent. Additionally, as they're a larger organisation, you can expect complete job security.§Support/Professional Development:§ Working with some of the most reputable leaders in the industry, you can expect to get full support in a collaborative environment that focusses on your professional development. Being a larger organisation, there is also lots of opportunity for internal promotion and movement within different areas/roles of the wider business. You will also get exposure to end to end, holistic case management, as well as several state legislations including NSW, QLD and ACT.You will also have scope to get involved in projects and really take ownership of your work. §Work/Life Balance:§ Caseloads do not fluctuate! You can expect to manage a consistent portfolio of 50-55 claims. They also promote flexibility and allow for flexible work arrangements. §Culture: §With a smaller team structure, you can expect a welcoming family-like feel that promote togetherness and a collaborative work environment. The manager is super experienced, fair and approachable. They value their employees and will set you up for a long-term success. They also have one of the best staff retention rates in the industry! §§ABOUT YOU§ § §Solid Workers Compensation claims experience essential, either in Self insurance or in a scheme agent.  § §As the portfolio is predominately NSW WorkCover, someone with NSW legislation knowledge/experience would be highly desirable § §Allied Health background desired. § § §HOW TO APPLY§ §Click the 'APPLY NOW' button. If you have any specific questions about the role, or want a confidential chat, please contact Kate Carroll on §0477 773 466§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50564626.txt	§Sustainability Performance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sustainability Performance Manager§§Advertiser: §QBE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sustainability Performance Manager §      §        §Your part in a changing world§        §At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – §to give§ §people the confidence to achieve their ambitions§.§        §We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation. We employee a team of more than 11,800 people, in 27 countries around the world.§        §The opportunity§        §An exciting, new opportunity for an experienced Sustainability professional has become available, joining the Group Corporate Affairs and Sustainability division in Sydney.§        §This is an amazing opportunity to contribute to the development of sustainability frameworks, strategy, policy and performance metrics, as well as manage the data collection and reporting of our sustainability performance across the QBE Group.§        §Reporting to the Group Head of Sustainability, you will:§        §          §Lead our annual sustainability materiality assessment process including desktop research and external stakeholder engagement;§          §Contribute to the ongoing review of our Group Sustainability strategy in line with materiality results and agreed sustainability priorities along with QBE’s purpose, vision, strategy and desired culture;§          §Project manage the development of key sustainability targets and associated metrics, including the annual update of our external Sustainability Scorecard;§          §Develop / maintain easy to use data collection and reporting templates;§          §Lead the development of our annual Sustainability Report, including managing internal data collection and verification, the external assurance process and service provider relationships (editors, designers, assurance);§          §Work with key people across the business to collect the information required to complete external analyst surveys (e.g. DJSI, FTSE4Good, ISS, MSCI) and other internal / external reporting requirements;§          §Assess QBE’s current management of sustainability in line with best practice sustainability frameworks, stakeholder expectations, competitor performance and benchmarking results and help to identify strengths, gaps and associated opportunities and risks. Engage with issue owners to discuss improvement opportunities and prepare periodic updates to management with supporting analysis and insight;§          §Support the development and maintenance of overarching sustainability frameworks, policies and procedures and work with Risk on sustainability elements of the Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA); §Monitor alignment with voluntary standards and/or membership of industry sustainability initiatives (e.g. Principles of Sustainable Insurance) and prepare communications of progress where relevant;§          §          §Contribute to the Sustainability Team’s ability to provide strategic counsel on a range of sustainability trends and issues.§        §        §Your story so far§        §          §Previous experience in a similar role; within Insurance or Financial Services industries being advantageous;§          §Strong experience in data analysis, sustainability benchmarking and reporting frameworks (e.g. CDP, DJSI, GRI);§          §Solid understanding of/experience with external assurance processes;§          §Working knowledge of the regulatory and compliance requirements within the Insurance/Financial Services industries;§          §Highly-developed verbal and written communication, and proficiency in developing executive-level reports and presentations that are both commercial and compelling;§          §Strong project management skills;§          §Highly-developed commercial acumen and ability to articulate the business drivers for sustainability;§          §Superior stakeholder management skills, including the ability to gain influence and present across all organisational levels.§        §        §We are here to support you§        §We are proud to have been Voted #5 in the 2019 Top 20 Australian Workplaces for New Dads - HBF Direct Advice for Dads and we achieved Gold employer status in the 2019 & 2020 Australian LGBTI Inclusion Awards. We are also a finalist in the 2020 Australian HR Awards, shortlisted for Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion Program and Best Health & Wellbeing Program.§        §We also offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance.§        §As a QBE employee, we will offer you:§        §          §Flex@QBE leave to enhance your work/life integration;§          §Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, which includes a free 12-month subscription to Headspace;§          §Access to ‘Share the Care’ – 12 weeks’ flexible leave for new parents inclusive of paid superannuation;§          §The ability to maximise retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matching;§          §Income protection insurance and reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums;§          §Access to REACH My Best - free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, financial and legal advice and confidential counselling;§          §Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services;§          §Benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners such as free and discounted tickets.§        §        §Join us.§        §Click §APPLY §to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.§        §QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at §recruitment@qbe.com§.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Your part in a changing world§ §At QBE, we’re driven by our purpose – §to give§ §people the confidence to achieve their ambitions§.§ §We are an international insurer and reinsurer offering a diverse portfolio of commercial, personal and specialty products, as well as risk management solutions. Our product portfolio includes property, motor, crop, energy, marine and aviation. We employee a team of more than 11,800 people, in 27 countries around the world.§ §The opportunity§ §An exciting, new opportunity for an experienced Sustainability professional has become available, joining the Group Corporate Affairs and Sustainability division in Sydney.§ §This is an amazing opportunity to contribute to the development of sustainability frameworks, strategy, policy and performance metrics, as well as manage the data collection and reporting of our sustainability performance across the QBE Group.§ §Reporting to the Group Head of Sustainability, you will:§ § §Lead our annual sustainability materiality assessment process including desktop research and external stakeholder engagement;§ §Contribute to the ongoing review of our Group Sustainability strategy in line with materiality results and agreed sustainability priorities along with QBE’s purpose, vision, strategy and desired culture;§ §Project manage the development of key sustainability targets and associated metrics, including the annual update of our external Sustainability Scorecard;§ §Develop / maintain easy to use data collection and reporting templates;§ §Lead the development of our annual Sustainability Report, including managing internal data collection and verification, the external assurance process and service provider relationships (editors, designers, assurance);§ §Work with key people across the business to collect the information required to complete external analyst surveys (e.g. DJSI, FTSE4Good, ISS, MSCI) and other internal / external reporting requirements;§ §Assess QBE’s current management of sustainability in line with best practice sustainability frameworks, stakeholder expectations, competitor performance and benchmarking results and help to identify strengths, gaps and associated opportunities and risks. Engage with issue owners to discuss improvement opportunities and prepare periodic updates to management with supporting analysis and insight;§ §Support the development and maintenance of overarching sustainability frameworks, policies and procedures and work with Risk on sustainability elements of the Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA); §Monitor alignment with voluntary standards and/or membership of industry sustainability initiatives (e.g. Principles of Sustainable Insurance) and prepare communications of progress where relevant;§ § §Contribute to the Sustainability Team’s ability to provide strategic counsel on a range of sustainability trends and issues.§ §Your story so far§ § §Previous experience in a similar role; within Insurance or Financial Services industries being advantageous;§ §Strong experience in data analysis, sustainability benchmarking and reporting frameworks (e.g. CDP, DJSI, GRI);§ §Solid understanding of/experience with external assurance processes;§ §Working knowledge of the regulatory and compliance requirements within the Insurance/Financial Services industries;§ §Highly-developed verbal and written communication, and proficiency in developing executive-level reports and presentations that are both commercial and compelling;§ §Strong project management skills;§ §Highly-developed commercial acumen and ability to articulate the business drivers for sustainability;§ §Superior stakeholder management skills, including the ability to gain influence and present across all organisational levels.§ §We are here to support you§ §We are proud to have been Voted #5 in the 2019 Top 20 Australian Workplaces for New Dads - HBF Direct Advice for Dads and we achieved Gold employer status in the 2019 & 2020 Australian LGBTI Inclusion Awards. jobText: TXT/50577185.txt	§Mental Injury Return to Work Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Mental Injury Return to Work Specialist§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§The Role§ §The role of a Mental Injury Return to Work Specialist is to provide specialist return to work expertise to a small portfolio of complex Mental Injury Worker’s Compensation claims, as well as working closely alongside GB’s claims managers to provide coaching and mentoring with relation to effectively managing Mental Injury claims. §  §You will also work closely alongside GB’s Mental Health Consultants to both develop innovative strategies to assist Injured Worker’s with a mental injury to return to work in a safe manner, and engage with employers and treating health practitioners with a focus on positively influencing and encouraging parties to participate in the return to work process and take ownership of actions.§ §§You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§  §Taking the lead on influencing and driving return to work on Mental Injury Worker’s Compensation cases identified at high risk of exceeding expected return to work outcomes. §Working closely with case managers to manage the return to work aspects of allocated mental injury cases§Utilising their knowledge and skills in return to work and mental injury management, and exceptional stakeholder management skills, to drive optimal return to work outcomes§Providing advice and/or assistance to WCV claims staff, employers, workers and treating health practitioners to promote cost effective, durable RTW outcomes centred on a customer focused workers compensation claims service.§Driving and monitoring the Return to Work Index measure for a specific portfolio§Attending and participating in Case Conferencing, where necessary§Complying with the Accident Compensation Act 1985/ WIRC Act 2013 and other Legislative requirements§ §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§  §Recent experience within worker’s compensation agents or personal injury industry as a Return to Work Coordinator / Manager, Case Manager, Mental Injury Specialist or Occupational Rehabilitation Provider §An understanding of common mental injuries, treatment options and medical terminology§Experience in managing complex Return to Work cases through early identification of Return to Work barriers and implementation of effective strategies§Experience with facilitating Return to Work for workers with a psychological injury is desirable§Excellent customer service skills§Tertiary qualification in appropriate discipline such as Psychology, and / or demonstrated experience in a similar role will be held in high regard§ §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§  §Attractive remuneration packaging§Flexible work hours§Staff referral incentive§Opportunities for ongoing education and development§Service recognition awards§Employee assistance program for yourself and immediate family members§The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §To apply§ §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§  §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognise the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§  §To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applying.§  §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§ §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50576288.txt	§Senior Product Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Manager§§Advertiser: §TAL§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§Welcome to This Australian Life.§ §From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.§ §TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community.   People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community.  People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide.  People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart. § §About the Opportunity§ §Reporting to the reporting to the Head of Product, your role as the Senior Product Manager is responsible for delivering market leading, profitable products (including services) and support Group Life clients comprising industry Funds, Master Trusts and Corporates.§ §You will have overall responsibility for the product portfolio management and development for a range of clients, applying your knowledge of the product lifecycle, analytical and problem-solving skills and commercial judgement to support the industry-leading TAL Group Life Division to acquire new mandates, install new schemes, maintain-competitive products, and retain and group valuable existing partnerships§ §In this role you will be responsible for:§ § § §Ensure active product management plans/strategies are in place for a product portfolio to ensure profitability including§ § § §Define, develop and maintain up-to-date product documentation for Group Life and Group Salary Continuance including for tenders, proposals, policy documents, service level agreements and other required disclosure material.§ § § §Understand and negotiate complex contracts independently and to complete drafting, and manage appropriate signoff and execution.§ § § §Know and track client portfolio rankings based on available research databases and be an expert with respect to client competitors.§ § § §Track and report on Product approved exceptions/concessions for the client portfolio.§ § § §Implement Product enhancement/upgrade/changes on a regular basis.§ § § §Work on other projects and opportunities as required by the Head of Product.§ § § §Responsible for legislation/regulatory compliance of a portfolio of group policies.§ § § §Manage change and influence others to ensure compliance.§ § § §Run product workshops, training for internal and external stakeholders.§ § § §Identify new market opportunities or potential problems.§ § § §Represent Product on internal projects/forums.§ § § §Influence Key Account Team members and leaders.§ § § §Thought leadership in insurance outside of the team.§ § § §Create marketing/technical material.§ § § §Manage and development Product Managers within team§ § §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ § § §Strong technical knowledge of life insurance product, with experience in interpreting, reviewing and devising detailed terms and conditions plus an understanding of pricing methodologies.§ § § §Outstanding analytical skills and methodologies§ § § §Excellent time management, organisational and presentation skills§ § § §Knowledge of compliance and other legislative requirements§ § § §Excellent attention to detail§ § § §Product development and new opportunity assessment experience within the financial services industry.§ § § §Tertiary qualification in finance, commerce, business and /or related disciplines.§ § § §Skilled at writing technical documentation with in-depth knowledge of MS Office suite§ § § §Client relationship, negotiation and influencing skills (desired)§ § § §Knowledge of project management theory (desired)§ § §Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts.  We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.§ §We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.§ §You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.§ §If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50540320.txt	§Senior Commercial Loss Adjuster§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Commercial Loss Adjuster§§Advertiser: §Sedgwick Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Sedgwick is the world’s largest provider of outsourced claims management and loss adjusting services. Through the dedication and expertise of more than 27,000 colleagues across 65 countries, the company goes far beyond just managing claims — we aim to simplify the process and reduce complexity, making it easy and effective for everyone involved.§  §Despite the current Covid-19 climate, Sedgwick’s Major and Complex Loss Division continues to see success, thus is enabling us to provide career opportunities at a time others can’t. We have a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Commercial Loss Adjuster to join our Commercial Team.§  §Although the location states Brisbane, we would love to hear from all suitable candidates in the South East Queensland region. §We don’t just employ; we listen, empower, partner and promote. At Sedgwick, §caring counts®.§  §The Benefits:§ § §Work-life balance§ §Work with and learn from the best in the industry § §Opportunity for career progression within a global organisation§ §Ongoing support and development§ §Great culture and work environment§  § §Responsibilities:§ § §Deliver professional and excellent service when completing on-site and desktop assessments, interacting with customers and clients§ §Proactively communicate clear and accurate advice, solutions, timeframes and claim progress to all stakeholders§ §Clearly document all decisions made and reasons, including ownership details, reserve changes and acceptance/rejection of claims§ §Contributing to the further growth and success of the branch and region§ §Clarifying circumstances surrounding loss and causation§ §Verify the nature and extent of loss/damage§ §Quantify the work of reinstatement (material damage claims)§ §Actively pursue and generate new business§ § §  §About you:§ § §Insurance loss adjusting experience, especially in respect of commercial claims§ §Minimum 15 years’ experience in insurance,§ §10 years’ experience in commercial and major loss§ §International loss adjusting and catastrophe experience§ §Excellent Business development and negotiation skills § §Relevant industry qualifications, particularly ANZIIF or AICLA or equivalent§ §Strong organisational, and written / verbal communication skills§ §A strong service delivery focus for clients, including insurers, customers and brokers§ §The ability to work under pressure and meet targets§ §The ability to work in a team involving the implementation and achievement of strategic objectives, and to provide mentoring to colleagues as required§ §Resilient with a growth mindset§ §Able to demonstrate the application of our Caring Counts philosophy and core values§  § §Salary: $115,000-$130,000 base§ §  §Our Values: Accountability   -   Collaboration   -   Empathy   -   Growth   -   Inclusion§ §  §All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Sedgwick Australia Pty Ltd is dedicated to eliminating discrimination and contributing to equal opportunity in the workplace.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have loss adjustment experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Do you have a Diploma of Loss Adjusting?§§§

jobText: TXT/50621617.txt	§Senior Product Developer - Direct Life§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Developer - Direct Life§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Product Developer - Direct Life §      §        §At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§        § §        §The Opportunity at AIA§        §The position of Senior Product Developer – Direct Life will be a key senior member in the Product and Strategic Business Delivery team reporting into the Head of Product – Direct Life. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§        § §        § §        §This role is responsible for developing new direct life insurance products and deeper integration between life, health and wellbeing that will be offered across AIA Partners.  This role will also be involved in the ongoing product management of the current suite of products to ensure that learnings can be brought into new products.§        § §        §This role will need to work closely with distribution stakeholders, proposition development managers and other product owners (Life, health & Wellbeing) across AIA, locally and offshore, to ensure that the product component of the proposition achieves AIA’s objectives.  Other key stakeholders will include pricing, underwriting, customer and operations.§        § §        §Key Responsibilities §        §          §            §In partnership with internal and external stakeholders, develop and deliver the new life product strategy for direct to consumer segments. §          §          §            §Leveraging AIA’s local and international capabilities to bring new and enhanced product concepts to the Australian business and sharing local insights and capabilities within the wider group.§          §          §            §Act as the business owner and being accountable for the delivery of agreed new products to market, ensuring that customer and commercial objectives are achieved.§          §          §            §Work with the wider AIA team to support the management of the existing portfolio of products with a particular focus on ensuring that customer insights and learnings are carried through to future development opportunities.§          §          §            §Work collaboratively with a wide range of AIA and Partner stakeholders at all levels of the organisation to bring product concepts to life and champion those concepts through the different stages of the product development process.§          §          §            §Work closely with other life product owners, health product owners and AIA Vitality Product owners to develop and deliver innovative product concepts to market.§          §        §        § §        §Skills and Experience §        §          §            §Tertiary qualification is required in business, insurance, finance, marketing, legal or financial planning. Actuarial skills will be highly regarded.§          §          §            §Prior product management experience, ideally including insurance or other financial services product or strong product innovation experience within a fast paced, innovative and customer centric organisation.§          §          §            §An understanding of the key drivers of longer term life product profitability and sustainability or an ability to demonstrate the capability to do so.§          §          §            §Need to be able to work independently within a geographically dispersed business, remain focused on core commercial and customer outcomes and be able to hold self and others accountable for delivery.§          §          §            §Strong leadership and people management capability.§          §          §            §Experience of managing a portfolio of business deliverables and ability to effectively influence stakeholders outside of direct span of control to deliver the required outcomes.§          §          §            §A minimum of 5 years of product management experience at a senior level.§          §          §            §Desirable to have extensive practical life industry experience in applicable areas such as product management (minimum 5 years), underwriting, claims, sales and strategic management are essential.§          §          §            §Desirable to have an appreciation of Australian financial services regulation, constraints and upcoming changes§          §          §            §Must have had exposure to products that are distributed through digital channels and ideally exposure to the distribution of financial services products.§          §        §        § §        §Applications close 6 October 2020. §        § §        §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§        § §        §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§        § §        § §        §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§        § §        §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. GB helps people, teams and businesses overcome adversity and loss through the guiding expertise of over 5,000 claims professionals, all committed to going beyond expectations in the continuous pursuit of a better way.§ § §At GB, we have a proven track record of building strong partnerships, helping our clients to improve return to work performance and helping injured workers to return to work and to life.§ § §About the position§ § §As an Eligibility Team Manager, you will lead one of GB’s largest claims teams and support the crucial function of Eligibility in our Worker’s Compensation division. You will use your strong client engagement and relationship building skills to foster strong rapport with clients and guide them through the Initial liability process for their Injured Workers. You will also have a focus on ensuring the delivery of a professional and customer-focused claim's management service, while developing staff and implementing quality initiatives.§ § §This is a full time and permanent position, working alongside GB’s Worker’s Compensation team based in the heart of Melbourne’s CBD.§ § §Duties§:§ §Engaging and build a strong relationship with portfolio of corporate clients in a proactive manner to create solid platforms for discussion and understanding pertinent to initial liability decisions being made by your team of Eligibility experts§ §Managing your team's daily workflow in order to achieve an effective team output and to maintain client service standards§ §Providing effective and engaging leadership, coaching and feedback to staff on technical, business and performance related issues§ §Engaging and build a strong relationship with portfolio of corporate clients in a proactive manner to discuss clams strategies and address areas of concern§ §Working with Branch Managers to identify staff's skills and knowledge gaps and assist with the up-skilling of your team, and engaging staff to meet their own personal performance measures and goals§ §Working alongside your Branch Manager to develop and cultivating team morale, and an achievement and service orientated culture; ensuring a dedicated and team based approach to the determination of claims§ §Identifying any areas for improvement in claims determination service provision, and implementing strategies and processes to ensure GB's services meet business and WorkSafe requirements§ §Recruitment of staff and conducting performance counselling§ §Facilitating effective team meetings and project activities§ §   § § §Skills and Experience§ §Experience within a People Manager role. Outstanding leadership skills, and experience in coaching and mentoring staff is essential to your success§ §Previous experience within a client services or account management position is ideal, however not essential§ §Knowledge of industry performance measures§ §Excellent interpersonal skills with all levels of staff and external parties§ §Conflict resolution skills§ §Excellent time management skills§ §Tertiary qualifications in Allied Health and/or Tertiary qualification in appropriate field will be held in high esteem§ §Benefits§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §Flexible work hours and Work from Home§ §Staff referral incentive bonus§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation § §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §To apply§ § §Do you think you can make an impact to our business? We want to hear from you today, click on §Apply for this Job. § § §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognise the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§ § §You will need to have the right to work in this country to be eligible for employment with Gallagher Bassett Services.§ § §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§   §§§§§

You’ll have comprehensive knowledge of medical, legal, product and regulatory issues as well as claims management tools. An annual lifestyle payment, employee discounts and a volunteer day per year are also some of the many things you can enjoy as part of the Zurich family. §        § §        §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work with us. Apply today!§        § §        §At Zurich we are aware of the Governments’ social distancing recommendations. To enable this, we will utilise digital technology where possible to ensure the safety of all employees and candidates, through the recruitment and onboarding process.§        § §      §      §        §        § Please click the 'Apply for this job' button below to submit your application§      §    §    §www.zurich.com.au§  §§§As one of the world’s leading insurers and a brand that people trust we are committed to assessing claims promptly, fairly and transparently. This approach has helped us achieve a well earned reputation for our superior claims service. Join our high performing Life Insurance claims team and challenge yourself to provide our customers with an outstanding level of service as you manage the claims process in a sensitive and professional way.§ § § §In this role you’ll manage a mixed portfolio of claims which may include income protection, total and permanent disability, death, terminal illness, trauma and business expense claims. You’ll manage claims and stakeholder engagement from assessment to determination and enjoy working autonomously to manage technically complex claims, leveraging your understanding of the relevant legislations and guidelines. § § § §You’ll have experience within a life insurance claims role specifically managing Retail Income Protection. You will also have training in medical terminology or an allied health/medical based course. You’ll have comprehensive knowledge of medical, legal, product and regulatory issues as well as claims management tools. Your excellent communication and negotiation skills will stand you in good stead as you communicate with diverse audiences using appropriate methods and language.§ § § §As you make a difference and have real impact on people’s lives you’ll feel the support of being part of a committed team that services our customers and is part of a strong and stable global company that is also one of Australia’s largest Life Insurers. § § § §As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future. jobText: TXT/50541135.txt	§Case Managers / Senior Case Managers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Managers / Senior Case Managers§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Your Role§ §As a Case Manager in GB’s Self Insurance (SI) team, you will provide specialist claims advice and expertise to your client. You will be responsible for the end-to-end management of your Worker’s Compensation claims portfolio, spanning from initial liability determinations for incoming new claims to achieving a successful return to work and life with your injured workers. § § § §You will work as part of an experienced SI Claims team, who strive to deliver quality customer service in all of their interactions, and foster a fantastically diverse, supportive and collaborative team culture.§ § § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ §Providing a professional and customer focused end-to-end claims service for your client and Injured Worker portfolio§ §Determining liability and identifying claims with increasing levels of risk within your portfolio, and strategising for both current and potential liabilities on these claims§ §Delivering high quality customer service and technical claims expertise towards all parties, and demonstrating a commitment to learning and development § §Working in conjunction with both external parties such as medical professionals, treating health providers and employers to facilitate and influence a sustainable return to work and life for injured workers§ §Participating in Case Conferences and implementing strategies for effective cost management on claims § §Preparing for and partaking in Dispute Resolution and Conciliation conferences for claims within your portfolio§ §Processing applications for permanent impairment and determining injured worker Impairment Benefit entitlements§ §Providing instructions to solicitors on litigated claims § § §We’re interested in hearing form people who possess:§ §Recent experience within a claims management role within the Worker’s Compensation industry§ §Tertiary studies within the fields of Psychology, Allied Health, Health Sciences or Law are ideal, but not essential to be considered § §Administration experience/knowledge of general business and administrative practices§ §Exceptional time management and organisational skills and the ability to prioritize your tasks § §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a team-player attitude § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you’ll experience the following:§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §Flexible work hours including Work from Home§ §Staff referral incentive bonus§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation § §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §The opportunity to work for an organisation that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A brief overview on GB:§ §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ § § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ § § §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ §If you think you can make a positive difference to our business please apply – we want to hear from you today!!§ § § §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this role.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50633535.txt	§Workers Compensation Claims - Technical Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Workers Compensation Claims - Technical Specialist§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Salary + 17.5% Leave Loading +Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19, with our recruitment process now fully conducted virtually. As a business we have moved to a working from home environment until it is safe for all employees to return to our offices. As part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions§§Utilize your knowledge of Workers’ Compensation legislation to support a Corporate Claims team§§Coach and mentor our Case Managers in the new model§§We care for our employee's career development with an in-house L&D Team§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims Management§ business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of §additional four offices§. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a §long-term career§ here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in our§ Parramatta §office, you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§You will provide regular advice and feedback to Case Managers and Team Leaders, within our §Corporate Claims §teams, on adverse decisions relating to liability/work capacity / permanent impairment/weekly payment entitlements and communication of these decisions. You will assist in improving the overall quality of these decisions.§This role is a 6 months fixed term contract. §YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Working directly with a team of Case Managers supporting the delivery of a world class customer experience§Assessing all technical considerations of compensation payments and liability determination§Working within the legislative and regulatory environment to optimise outcomes for all stakeholders§Applying sound risk management principles to ensure compliance and robust decision making§Understand the impact of initial eligibility under legislation in regards to benefits for injured workers and impact to stakeholders§Participate and provide technical support in employer claims reviews§§ABOUT YOU§§Strong technical experience in workers’ compensation claims§Proven experience coaching & mentoring case managers in the workers compensation industry§Demonstrated understanding and application of relevant NSW Workers compensation laws and the associated regulations§You have previous experience working as a case manager or a technical specialist background§Tertiary studies in Allied Health or Legislation is desirable§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals.§ EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Onsite learning and development team§A corporate wellbeing program§Comprehensive learning and development support§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. As part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact §Thomas Brown§ on §02 8098 6356§ or on email at §t.brown2@eml.com.au§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50543152.txt	§Senior Claims Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Consultant§§Advertiser: §MLC Life Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive package + bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Claims Consultant §      §        §MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting the lives of Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it. §        §The Role:§        §The Claims team are there to help our customers at their most vulnerable; they support each policy holder and member through the claims process with integrity, fairness and compassion. They strive to make the right decisions and support ethical and fair outcomes. §        §We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Claims Consultant to join our Sydney-based Retail Claims team. In this role, you will provide claims expertise and coaching to a team of Case Management professionals to support our customers during their time of need, delivering an exceptional customer experience. You will also be responsible for managing the most complex claims.§        §Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:§        §          §Managing a case load of complex claims; §          §Role modelling, promoting, encouraging, up-skilling and coaching team members to provide an exceptional customer experience;§          §Provide guidance to Case Consultants in resolving complaints/escalations fairly and quickly;§          §Assisting the Lead Case Consultant with authorisations;  §          §Implement and maintain a high-performance culture by assisting Case Consultants to be accountable for their productivity and output, and to demonstrate a results focussed approach;§          §Enhance the reputation of the team by establishing trusting relationships with peers, customers and all stakeholders; and§          §Contribute to the achievement of the team’s financial and other targets by using techniques and tools to manage and advocate for change.§        §        §About you:§        §Do you have experience in managing Life Insurance claims? Are you looking to take the next step in your career?§        §You will hold experience in driving return to work outcomes, you will hold strong customer-service orientation skills and will have exceptional technical knowledge of life insurance legislation and regulations. A strong communicator, you are great at problem solving and enjoy change. Although not essential, tertiary qualifications as well as Australian Insurance Institute certification will be highly advantageous. §        §Our Purpose§        §MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide over 1.5 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night.§        §Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers and each other that defines who we are. §        §Our Strategy§        §Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all at MLC Life Insurance to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution. §        §With more than 1,600 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.§        §Why Choose Us?§        §At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:§        §          §work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality §          §enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution§          §embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer§          §access CircleIn Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents §          §access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and§          §wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.§        §        §Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position. §        §.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§MLC Life Insurance. A strong communicator, you are great at problem solving and enjoy change. Although not essential, tertiary qualifications as well as Australian Insurance Institute certification will be highly advantageous. § §Our Purpose§ §MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers.
