To support all at MLC Life Insurance to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution. § §With more than 1,600 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.§ §Why Choose Us?§ §At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:§ §work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality § §enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution§ §embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer§ §access CircleIn Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents § §access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and§ §wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.§ §Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. jobText: TXT/50569917.txt	§Senior Policy & Communications Specialist, Claims§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Policy & Communications Specialist, Claims§§Advertiser: §TAL§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Welcome to This Australian Life.§ §From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.§ §TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community.   People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community.  People who are passionate about making the most of the choices and options we provide.  People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart. § §About the Opportunity§ §This role is accountable for developing, managing, implementing, and monitoring compliance with relevant regulatory requirements for Claims (such as but not limited to the Life Insurance Code of Practice). In addition to this, the role will be responsible for the management of TAL’s internal Claims policies, procedures, and guidelines, as well as control of TAL’s internal means of correspondence with claims customers.§ §You will work independently, but will refer to more senior colleagues for more complex issues/decisions and the role will also actively drive compliance and risk management strategies for the TAL claims team. You will also be involved in supporting the business to satisfy their responsibilities regarding relevant internal policy frameworks as well as helping the business to use the frameworks to better achieve business & customer outcomes.§ §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ § § §Minimum of 3 years’ experience (mid-level management) in a relevant Risk Management, Compliance, Legal and/or Technical Claims environment;§ § § §Degree qualified in a business-related line e.g. legal / accounting / commerce would be advantageous§ § § §Track record of delivering sustainable solutions to reduce or eliminate inefficiency in business processes§ § § §Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to work as a team member;§ § § §Ability to influence and achieve outcomes in consultation with senior management & key stakeholders across the organisation§ § § §Life insurance claims experience (desirable)§ § §Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts.  We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.§ §We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.§ §You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.§ §If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions. §§§§

§Workers' Compensation§§§§§§The Role§ §As an Injury Management Advisor, you will use your skills and expertise in the field of personal injury management to provide advice and assistance to claims staff to promote appropriate injury management and durable RTW outcomes relating to Worker’s Compensation claims. §  §The role of an Injury Management Advisor is centred on a customer focused workers compensation claims service, ensuring timely, educated and informed medical claims management decisions on claims, focusing on improved outcomes all parties involved. § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ §Implementing your Personal Injury expertise in the review of complex medical requests arising from Worker’s Compensation claims§Collaborating with Case Managers and Treating Health Providers to review and make recommendations for treatment plans for injured workers based on medical advice and evidence§Liaising with Medical Advisors relating to specialised and niched requests for surgery and treatment to ensure Worksafe and industry guidelines are being adhered to as part of treatment requests §Advising employers, employer consultants and other stakeholders with updates regarding injury management strategies §Providing quality customer service to injured workers, employers, employer consultants & other stakeholders§Providing Injury Management expertise and advice, as well as coaching and mentoring to claims managers § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ §Tertiary qualifications within Allied Health or Personal Injury industry§Work experience within the personal injury management or Workers Compensation industry§Expertise in implementing relevant legislation as part of decision making within the insurance industry§Attention to detail and critical thinking skills and an aptitude for working in a fast-paced environment§Coaching and mentoring skills§Excellent customer service, communication and interpersonal skills § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§ §Attractive remuneration packaging§Flexible work hours§Staff referral incentive§Opportunities for ongoing education and development§Service recognition awards§Employee assistance program for yourself and immediate family members§Personal touches like weekly fruit bowls and birthday celebrations §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A brief overview on GB:§  §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§  §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§  §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ § §To apply§ §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognise the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§  §To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applying.§  §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50526260.txt	§Senior Claims Consultant (Major Loss)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Consultant (Major Loss)§§Advertiser: §CHU Underwriting Agencies Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About CHU§  §CHU is part of the Steadfast Group; a top 200 ASX-listed company with $7 billion in total billings is the largest general insurance broker network and group of underwriting agencies in Australasia. Our policies are underwritten by QBE Insurance (Australia) Ltd, one of Australia’s most secure insurance companies.§  §We are one of Australia’s largest and most awarded insurance underwriting agencies. Our point of difference is that we offer comprehensive insurance, so our customers don’t need to purchase ‘optional extras’. We protect almost 1 million apartments, units and townhouses across Australia, with almost half a trillion value insured. We are multi-award winners: back to back winners of the Underwriting Agency of the Year Award 2017 – 2018, Insurance Business Gold Award winner 2016 – 2018, and 2019 winner of ANZIIF Excellence in Workplace Diversity and Inclusion.§  §Working with CHU§  §When you join CHU, you will join a friendly and supportive team, committed to providing our customers with an outstanding service. To reward you, we offer:§ § §An inclusive and flexible work environment. We are currently working from home but our offices are open if required!§ §Competitive salary packaging and excellent benefits.§ §Ongoing coaching and feedback, including bi-monthly formal feedback sessions with your Manager.§ §Offices close to Cafes, Shops and Public Transport.§ §About the role§  §The role sits within the local CHU Branch team and reports to the National Technical Claims Manager. The Major Loss Consultant is an integral part of the CHU Claims proposition, driving an outstanding customer experience, delivering market leading loss assessment through quality technical response.§  §This position is also responsible for supporting attritional Claims teams and the Internal Dispute Resolution Team as required.§  §The position is diverse, and includes the following key elements:§ § §Ensure the delivery of a "Concierge" claims service on every claims (in accordance with company standards.§ §Consistently delivery of  a "phone first" approach to your designated claims.§ §Manage a portfolio of technical first party strata claims within the Major Loss quantum guidelines.§ §Assist and provide technical claims advice to colleagues across the business.§ §Manage all claims within agreed workflow timeframes.§ §Assist where possible any overflow of claims matters from other branches (which may occur in circumstances such as CAT).§ §Ensure regular and accurate reporting is provided to the technical claims manager as requested.§ §Respond to technical queries and referrals from your broker/complainant.§ §Lodge disputes onto ERM and update the complainant/client accordingly.§ §Make informed decisions at dispute stage 1 and 2 (where required).§ §Negotiate and compromise decisions where required to come to a resolution (where required).§ §Support to be provided to the Technical Claims Manager in IDR or otherwise.§ §About you§  §The successful applicant will have the following traits and experience:§ § §Minimum 5 years’ experience working in either broker or intermediary based insurer environment.§ §5 years property claims experience, preferably strata.§ §Sound working knowledge of claims operations and understanding of quality service standards.§ §ANZIIF Cert IV or equivalent.§ §Strong problem solving and ability to think analytically.§ §Comprehensive experience in dealing with loss assessors, repairers, brokers, strata managers etc.§ §Demonstrated high level of organisational and time management skills.§ §Experience in management of claims response delivery.§ §Ability to provide complaints guidance/training/feedback to the business where required.§ §Ability to identify trends to ensure continuous improvements in complaint resolution.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50544922.txt	§Superannuation Analyst §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Superannuation Analyst §§Advertiser: §B & K Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$75k - $85k p.a. + Includes Superannuation §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§ §The Business§ § The business is highly regarded for their expertise and range of product offerings in research and consulting for the wealth management industry. This business is a market leader in superannuation fund research and its position flows from the accuracy of its superannuation fund, investments and insurance data. Due to strong staff retention, this role does not come up often so now is a great opportunity to begin a new chapter in your career.§ § §The Role§ § Reporting into the Manager of Research, you will be responsible for the analysis and review of a range of funds across the superannuation space. The day to day can be quite varied and there will be a lot of interaction with people at various levels of seniority across the space. You will be required to;§Locate and gather all relevant fund related information§Prepare reports and assessments based off your findings across investments and superannuation funds§Maintain relationships with industry partners, working closely with superannuation product managers§Assist the research team in a wide range of business activities and help develop new research tools§ § §The Person§ § Foremost, it will be important that you have knowledge of the superannuation space. The role has a large amount of excel work involved and will require intermediate to advanced skills. A strong ability in verbal and written English is essential for all the reporting needs. Ideally, we will be looking for someone with at least 2 or 3 years of superannuation based experience. This could be from a client services, paraplanning/ advice or remediation background in Super. § If you feel you have the right experience and would like to know more, please apply to this ad or contact B & K Consulting directly. B & K Consulting has been appointed exclusively to manage the recruitment process for this position.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50560931.txt	§Rehabilitation Consultant - Mental Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rehabilitation Consultant - Mental Health§§Advertiser: §Zurich Financial Services Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Rehabilitation Consultant - Mental Health §      §        §Are you the kind of person that thrives on providing customers with an exceptional service? Would you like to build on your existing rehabilitation experience?  A role in our growing Life & Investments business could be just what you’re looking for. §        §As one of the world’s leading insurers and a brand that people trust we are committed to paying claims as promptly, fairly and transparently as possible. This approach has helped us achieve a well earned reputation for our superior claims service. §        § §        §In this role you will be responsible for supporting our claims teams by monitoring occupational rehabilitation services and providing advice and training to improve the claims experience for Zurich and our customers. As an experienced individual, you will have a portfolio of rehabilitation claims, which you will manage and strategise with external rehabilitation providers. You will also assist in implementing strategic rehabilitation projects; ensure consistency and quality across rehabilitation decisions; provide technical advice and guidance to the claims team; and collaborate with colleagues to share best practice rehabilitation and recovery concepts.§        § §        §You’ll possess an enquiring mind, a ‘can-do’ attitude and the ability to challenge other stakeholders thinking when necessary. Moreover, Zurich supports and promotes a flexible working culture.§        § §        §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work with us. Apply today!§        § §        §At Zurich we are aware of the Governments’ social distancing recommendations. This role will ideally suit someone on the Southside of Brisbane.§Your duties will include but are not limited to:§§Complete vehicle damage assessments§Oversee the quality of the entire claims process§Ensure compliance with legislation§Detect and reduce fraud§Achieve fast turnaround times and control costs§Be the face of our business and always provide awesome service§§About You§You will be a driven individual, with the ability to adapt and work autonomously, as well as in a team environment.§The successful candidate will also have:§§A motor trade qualification in Motor Mechanic, Panel Beating and/or Spray Painting§Experience in an Assessing / Estimating role will be highly regarded§Strong communication and negotiating skills§The ability to build and maintain strong relationships§High attention to detail and a passion for providing awesome customer service§The ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work towards departmental KPI’s§§What Youi Can Offer You§§A fully maintained company car + fuel card + the latest mobile business tools§Awesome employee benefits and discounts§A culture of high performance and autonomy in a supporting and fun, team environment§Very attractive bonus incentive which gives you the opportunity to earn above your salary§Diverse career and development opportunities available§Award winning health and well-being program§§If you are ready to begin your career with us, please "APPLY NOW".§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50631667.txt	§Senior Actuarial Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Actuarial Analyst§§Advertiser: §Chubb Insurance Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Actuarial§§§§§§Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients.§ §Chubb Australia is currently experiencing a period of accelerated growth, and as we continue to excel and make our mark in the local market, we are looking for high potential individuals to join our dynamic and fast paced team.§ §MAIN  PURPOSE§ §To provide meaningful, insightful and timely actuarial advice to International Accident & Health (A&H) Management teams and Actuaries in Australia & New Zealand.§ §MAJOR  DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES§ § §Undertake detailed analytics and preparation of analysis for pricing, portfolio monitoring and reserve reviews of key A&H portfolios for A&NZ Senior Actuaries and Product Managers to assist in the production of these reviews.§ §Undertake analysis and modelling to assist Actuaries in production of the Annual Business Plan Loss Ratios for A&H portfolios.§ §Undertake technical pricing analysis and building/updating of rates and rating structures for selected Products.§ §Develop improved data and information management dashboards to enable enhanced monitoring and management of the business.§ §Undertake individual account and scheme/facility analysis and pricing for Senior Actuaries.§ §KNOWLEDGE  &  SKILLS§ § §Tertiary degree in a mathematics related field.§ §Progress towards becoming a Fellow or Associate of the Institute of Actuaries of Australia or equivalent.§ §Minimum 4-8 years relevant actuarial work experience in insurance industry.§ §Strong in MS Office applications, SAS / SQL /R/ Python programming, Statistical tools. Emblem / Radar skills desirable.§ §Proficient on data visualisation tool like Qlikview/Qliksense.§ §Strong data capabilities, attention to detail and problem solving ability.§ §Ability to manage competing projects and meet deadlines. Effectively communicate actuarial analysis and concepts to customers with no actuarial background.§ §Chubb is committed to equal employment and celebrates individual differences by creating a workplace environment in which everyone feels welcomed, respected and valued. We offer you the opportunity to work as part of a dynamic and agile environment where continuous development is encouraged throughout your career, both locally and globally. Some additional benefits offered include a flexible working approach via our “My One Thing” initiative, education assistance, dress for your day every Friday, promotion of health and wellbeing (including discounted health insurance, daily breakfast and fresh fruit), and the option to enrol into the Chubb Limited discounted stock purchasing scheme.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

Our consultants are provided with a diverse range of client opportunities to develop their skills and grow their career.§ §Our work covers the full spectrum of actuarial roles in general insurance and health insurance –including pricing and product management, liability valuation and financial condition reporting, capital and risk management, climate risk modelling and big data analytics. Alongside our consulting advice, Finity also develops a range of software products for our clients utilising leading edge technology.§The role§There is an opportunity for a newly qualified Actuary, or someone close to qualification, with a passion for General Insurance to join our team in Sydney. We’re looking for a well-rounded person who is confident, articulate and has a passion for client service. The role will see you work across a wide variety of projects gaining exposure to a range of clients, business challenges and actuarial consulting opportunities.§ §We care about our people and working with Finity will provide you with:§ § §The opportunity to develop your career § §Market leading rewards§ §Ongoing learning and development § § §If you are interested in joining our team, please apply through our website www.finity.com.au/careers or contact Fiona Hollier (HR Manager) for a confidential discussion on §02 8252 3445§ or email §fiona.hollier@finity.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Claim Manager - Full Time Job in Adelaide - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
jobText: TXT/50694617.txt	§Senior Claim Manager - Full Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claim Manager - Full Time§§Advertiser: §Lawson Risk Management Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§Senior Claim Manager § §About us§ §Lawson are South Australia’s leading provider of injury management and work health safety solutions. We are entirely customer focussed; authentic; strategic and creative. We are not burdened by bureaucracy or corporate stuffiness. §  §Our purpose is to Create Better Workplaces.  We believe that a healthy workplace is more than just safer, it makes people better – mentally, physically and productively.  We work with our clients to optimise their workplace culture and we do that through knowledge, technical skill and by bringing creativity and personality to everything we do.  To fight stigma, we endeavour to start with empathy, not prejudice. We help our clients to create positive change by dismantling old structures to create new ones.§  §Our people are trusted because we provide fair and equitable advice and management. And, we deliver.§  §The Position§ §Lawson currently have an opportunity for a full time Senior Claim Manager to join our team of professionals.  Working as the primary adviser to some of South Australia’s most well-known employers, the successful applicant will have passion and a demonstrated success in workers’ compensation claims management.  The current opportunity is for a 12-month contract with a strong possibility of conversion to a permanent role.§  §In this role your responsibilities will include but not limited to:§ § §Manage portfolios of workers’ compensation claims, across a diverse range of clients in a fair and equitable manner, from end to end,§ §Develop injury management strategies to achieve safe and successful return to work outcomes,§ §Provide technical and strategic advice in complex decision-making processes including: eligibility, treatment approval and lump sum payments,§ §Attend the SAET and provide instructions to solicitors,§ §Ensure compliance with the Return to Work Act 2014 (SA) and relevant standards,§ §Assist in the development, implementation, evaluation, review & improvements of claim management policies, procedures and processes,§ §Work on safety programmes with our WHS – Injury and Risk Managers,§ §Collaborate on strategy with clients and Lawson’s Manager – Strategy, Governance and Reporting,§ §Intrastate Travel will be required. A Motor Vehicle and valid driver's licence is essential. Interstate Travel may also be required.§ §Skills & Experience§ §An extensive working knowledge of the Return to Work Act 2014 (SA) and associated legislation,§ §Demonstrated experience in effective management of complex workers’ compensation claims,§ §The ability to communicate with a diverse range of stakeholders,§ §Knowledge and experience with the claims management data software, SolvInjury. (desirable),§ §Proficient in MS Office software (Word, Excel).§ §Qualifications§ §Formal qualifications desirable,§ §Success in a workers’ compensation claims management role mandatory.§ §Competencies§ §A strong sense of drive and personal accountability, § §An ability to manage sensitive matters with discretion,§ §A customer first commitment,§ §Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation skills,§ §An ability to multi-task,§ §A genuine desire to contribute to a vibrant and diverse team culture.§ §What we offer§ §Competitive remuneration§ §10% Superannuation (SGC)§ §17.5% annual leave loading§ §An opportunity to work in a vibrant, & professional small team environment§ §Growth by supporting a diverse set of programmes with large employers§ §Long term opportunities for highly capable individuals§ §To Apply§ §If you meet the above criteria and want to be part of a dedicated & experienced team, please send your resume and cover letter to Michelle Harris, Director, Finance & Administration via email: §michelle@lawsonrisk.com.au§  §Applications close: 23rd October 2020§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50708967.txt	§Investigations Manager | Victoria§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investigations Manager | Victoria§§Advertiser: §The Procare Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Attractive remuneration and incentives package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Investigations Manager | Victoria §      §The Procare Group is a leading national provider of insurance risk and solutions services, including Investigations, Claims and Risk, Injury Management and Rehabilitation with key customers including major insurers & ASX 100 corporations. We are committed to being the most respected insurance support services business in Australia. §   § We love connecting with our customers and empowering them to achieve better results. We're all about building a high-performing team, where we embrace collaboration and new ways of thinking. We are grounded in authenticity and work together to deliver value for our customers through every interaction. It's a fast-paced business, and that's the way we love it. We know that fantastic talent is the only way to shape our future success. §  § We focus on innovation and high-value outcomes, whilst retaining a smaller company feel including flexibility, commitment to our staff and genuine customer service.  Our success is reflected in our strong client base, sustained growth & excellent staff retention, affording a positive combination of job security and career progression.§  § We are seeking an §Investigations Manager §to join our National Management team. This role primarily involves oversight of the development of our Factual Investigations services across the state, with significant customer service responsibilities, development of growth opportunities and driving quality outcomes in our service provisions.§   § This is a unique opportunity to lead the growth of our Victorian Investigations division as part of a leading national provider of insurance services. You must be a high calibre individual with demonstrated experience, tenacity and a commitment to a demanding & busy role. §  § Reporting to the Executive Director and with regular liaison with the key divisional Managers, the purpose of the role is to:§        §          §Ensure we deliver consistent, high quality investigation services to our clients through a passion for outcomes, teamwork and a focus on business efficiency.§          §Provide timely, professional and effective communication with clients and grow the division’s client-base through a number of targeted activities.§          §Prepare and produce internal management reports and external reports in line with our SLAs and client requirements.§          §Support & assist our staff in their roles and identify opportunities to enhance operational performance of the team and divisions.§          §Assist the Executive team with marketing, tenders & business development activities.§          §Manage quality & compliance processes across the division.§        § §About You:§        §          §Mandatory: §demonstrated operational and or management experience, including working with senior internal and external business stakeholders and customers.§          §Strong customer service ethos, internally and externally.§          §The ability to get the best out of people by providing strong and balanced leadership.§          §Experience working in insurance factual investigations is highly desirable along with a working knowledge of the insurance industry.§        § §We offer:§        §          §Excellent remuneration package including generous incentives.§          §A stable, committed and experienced National management team.§          §A genuine commitment to your work life balance.§          §Work with prestigious clients incl. ASX 100 companies and a current, solid client network.§          §Genuine & friendly working culture with ongoing commitment to the development of our people.§          §A unique leadership opportunity to develop our Victorian investigations division with the support of a successful national business.  §        § For more information please visit out our website §www.procaregroup.com.au§.§  § Applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. To apply, please send both a cover letter outlining your suitability to the role along with your resume via the link.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Procare Group is a leading national provider of insurance risk and solutions services, including Investigations, Claims and Risk, Injury Management and Rehabilitation with key customers including major insurers & ASX 100 corporations. We are committed to being the most respected insurance support services business in Australia. §   § We love connecting with our customers and empowering them to achieve better results. We're all about building a high-performing team, where we embrace collaboration and new ways of thinking. We are grounded in authenticity and work together to deliver value for our customers through every interaction. It's a fast-paced business, and that's the way we love it. We know that fantastic talent is the only way to shape our future success. §  § We focus on innovation and high-value outcomes, whilst retaining a smaller company feel including flexibility, commitment to our staff and genuine customer service.  Our success is reflected in our strong client base, sustained growth & excellent staff retention, affording a positive combination of job security and career progression.§  § We are seeking an §Investigations Manager §to join our National Management team. This role primarily involves oversight of the development of our Factual Investigations services across the state, with significant customer service responsibilities, development of growth opportunities and driving quality outcomes in our service provisions.§   § This is a unique opportunity to lead the growth of our Victorian Investigations division as part of a leading national provider of insurance services. You must be a high calibre individual with demonstrated experience, tenacity and a commitment to a demanding & busy role. §  § Reporting to the Executive Director and with regular liaison with the key divisional Managers, the purpose of the role is to:§ § §Ensure we deliver consistent, high quality investigation services to our clients through a passion for outcomes, teamwork and a focus on business efficiency.§ §Provide timely, professional and effective communication with clients and grow the division’s client-base through a number of targeted activities.§ §Prepare and produce internal management reports and external reports in line with our SLAs and client requirements.§ §Support & assist our staff in their roles and identify opportunities to enhance operational performance of the team and divisions.§ §Assist the Executive team with marketing, tenders & business development activities.§ §Manage quality & compliance processes across the division.§ § §About You:§ § §Mandatory: §demonstrated operational and or management experience, including working with senior internal and external business stakeholders and customers.§ §Strong customer service ethos, internally and externally.§ §The ability to get the best out of people by providing strong and balanced leadership.§ §Experience working in insurance factual investigations is highly desirable along with a working knowledge of the insurance industry.§ § §We offer:§ § §Excellent remuneration package including generous incentives.§ §A stable, committed and experienced National management team.§ §A genuine commitment to your work life balance.§ §Work with prestigious clients incl. ASX 100 companies and a current, solid client network.§ §Genuine & friendly working culture with ongoing commitment to the development of our people.§ §A unique leadership opportunity to develop our Victorian investigations division with the support of a successful national business.  § § For more information please visit out our website §www.procaregroup.com.au§.§  § Applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. jobTitle: Underwriter Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701301.txt	§Underwriter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Underwriter§§Advertiser: §Guild Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§Your new company §Guild Insurance is Australia’s leading provider of insurance solutions for allied healthcare professionals. For more than 50 years, we’ve been providing exceptional products and services and unparalleled customer experiences, driven by a genuine care for our clients’ professional and financial wellbeing. We pride ourselves on our future focus and innovation.§Acerta is Guild Insurance’s intermediary division with products supported by an experienced team ready to provide prompt broking advice and professional insight. Our strength lies in our relationships and innovation is core to everything we do. It underpins our commitment to drive business growth for each broker partner. Momentum is Acerta’s tech start up and fastest growing distribution channel.§At the heart of what we do is being there for those our communities rely on.§Our product suite includes a range of commercial and niche personal lines products. We are Australian owned with offices nationally, so our customers benefit from our local knowledge and presence. §About you §You thrive in a close-knit team environment. You pick up on where you and your team could improve your processes/ ways of working. Known for initiative, you take these observations and try to act on them, suggesting how your processes could be better. You’ll be excited by the idea of working in an expanding team who’ve experienced significant growth over the past year.§You already have some experience across general insurance in an Assistant Underwriter/ Underwriter role. Ideally, you will have a combination of personal lines and commercial lines insurance You’re used to engaging with a range of brokers at a network and individual level.§You’re proficient with the Microsoft Office suite, with a fundamental working knowledge of Excel and Guidewire. You could already be familiar with digital insurance products and platforms as you will be dedicated to our Momentum [link removed] team, managing an online underwriting platform exclusively available to our broker partners.§You should already be qualified with ANZIIF Tier 1 or working towards this.§If you were already in this role, here are some of the things you might have done last week§§You’re in regular contact with our Project Manager to understand your focus for day to day work over the week.§You’ve been busy fielding phone and online queries from our broker partners regarding our Momentum products. You’ve sought to understand the issues they’re facing and have coordinated solutions to these- working with your other Momentum colleagues to deliver these.§You worked closely with the National Manager-Digital on referrals, providing technical underwriting assistance on matters related to policy acceptance; risk management; pricing; policy wording interpretation; and terms and conditions.§You’ve spoken to or corresponded with our existing broker partners, maintaining productive and professional relationships with them. You’ve also helped expand Momentum’s business, building new relationships with others who could be part of our broker network.§§Why us?§We pride ourselves on having an inclusive and productive workplace where we treat our people and our clients with fairness, dignity and respect.§We offer: §§Paid parental leave for eligible staff from 6 weeks§An extra day of paid leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements§Enhanced long service leave§Staff discounts with leading retailers§An Employee Assistance Program that provides counselling and support to all staff members and their immediate family§Wellbeing initiatives such as health checks and skin checks§Flexible working program available to eligible staff§§For more information about Acerta visit https://acerta.com.au/§Next Steps§If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then the please apply here.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Claims Project Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50712605.txt	§Claims Project Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Project Specialist§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§Your Role§ §In this position, you will manage a 6-month project for Gallagher Bassett, undertaking an entitlement review on a cohort of claims. § §This role will ensure young workers are in receipt of the correct entitlement as it relates to their apprenticeship status and age related increases. You will be providing support and guidance to both injured workers and employers regarding incremental increases, and contribute to the Worker’s Compensation Scheme by assessing claims, obtaining the required information and ensuring this entitlement is processed accurately and timely. § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ §Reviewing incremental increase claims in line with legislation to ensure increases in entitlement had been applied correctly, by determining what information is required and requesting further information to be able to process entitlement payments§ §Completing review processes independent of other claims-based activities occurring on this cohort of claims§ §Discussing your findings with injured workers and employers, as well as providing progress updates on your cohort of claims, and ensure volume targets are met§ § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ §Case management experience, or experience in applying and interpreting claims based legislation§ §Recent work experience within a customer service focussed role§ §Exceptional time management and organisational skills and the ability to prioritise your tasks § §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a team-player attitude § §An aptitude for working within a dynamic, fast paced and challenging environment § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §Flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive bonus§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation § §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §The opportunity to work for an organisation that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A brief overview on GB:§ §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). jobText: TXT/50543689.txt	§Customer Solutions Specialist - 11 roles available§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Solutions Specialist - 11 roles available§§Advertiser: §Menulog Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Menulog is one of Australia and New Zealand's largest online food delivery businesses. With more than 20,000 restaurant partners, we pride ourselves on providing amazing food experiences to three million active customers each year. § §Menulog is currently seeking §11 solutions agents§ to join our high performing operations team. The solutions agents will be responsible for handling escalated enquiries and issues arising from Menulog stakeholders (including but not limited to Customers and Restaurant Partners) through Voice, Chat, Email and Social Media channels.  § §The positions are full time, however candidates must be available to work on a shift basis and happy to do regular weekend work (2 weekends per month) and shifts ranging from 8am to midnight (the later shifts may be able to work from home). § §Key Responsibilities § § § §Take ownership of issues, investigating and resolving them in a timely manner, making decisions based on a set of Menulog policies and principles § § § §Handle live voice/chat/social media issues that are urgent (red flags) to de-escalate situations and provide case management to mitigate risk to Menulog§ § § §Reactive posting on social media channels to respond to public posts and queries§ § § §Conduct mystery shop calling§ § § §Quality checking and calibration of onshore and offshore team responses to customer and restaurant enquiries (via multiple channels including voice, chat and email) § § § §Help with the review and update of training and knowledge base materials to be used on and offshore§ § § §Contribute to process and system improvements to improve customer experience and productivity§ § §Skills, Experience & Attributes Required § § § §2+ years in a customer service position handling complaints and escalated queries§ § § §Exceptional written and verbal communication§ § § §Customer centric attitude with genuine empathy§ § § §High level of customer service with strong problem solving, critical thinking and decision making skills§ § § §Lead by example attitude; positive and solution-focused§ § § §Excellent IT skills including CRM use and social platform understanding§ § § §Dependable/reliable and ability to work flexible hours (7 days per week between 08:00 am and midnight)§ § §If this sounds like you and you want to work for a fast-paced, ever-growing, exciting and fun company please apply via seek. § §Please note that all new hires to Menulog need to undertake a criminal conviction check.§ §Recruiters will not be used to fill this position. § §Only candidates selected for the short list will be contacted in relation to this role. § §About Menulog§ §Menulog is one of Australia and New Zealand's largest online ordering and food delivery platforms, with more than 20,000 restaurant partners and over three million active customers. Born in Australia more than 14 years ago, Menulog is now part of Just Eat Takeaway.com, a leading global online food delivery marketplace. § §Menulog ANZ has more than 130 local employees, across marketing, technology, operations, sales, analytics and finance. The Menulog business continues to grow at an impressive rate year on year, and is always on the lookout for energetic, talented and passionate people to join our ever-growing team.§ §We’re a fast-paced, forward-thinking, entrepreneurial business, providing an incredible working environment as well as fantastic opportunities for career development and growth. We provide a flexible work environment and a number of employee benefits, including access to discounted meals, paid maternity leave, Employee Assistance Program and lots more.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: APS 6 Reconsiderations Officer Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665161.txt	§APS 6 Reconsiderations Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§APS 6 Reconsiderations Officer§§Advertiser: §Calleo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§Annual salary + 15.4% Super§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§This government agency is dedicated to minimising harm in the workplace, ensuring recovery at work and eventual return to work, as well as promoting the health benefits of good work.§   § You will form one part of the Reconsiderations and Appeals Team who are responsible for the statutory reconsideration of claims decisions. As Senior Reconsiderations Officer, you will help drive and manage a range of reconsiderations including engagement with claimants, employers and medical providers. You will have the ability to have an impact and make decisions on claims that are medium to low risk. Reporting into the Assistant Director of Reconsiderations, you will also have leadership and coaching responsibilities, assisting in the supervision of other team members.§   § Key responsibilities:§ § §You will deliver reconsideration services in line with the claims management strategy including the achievement of claims management targets and broader strategic projects§ §Assess and make decisions on medium to low risk reconsiderations in line with a planned approach. Support high risk decisions through research, support and drafting.§ §Work across the agency and other client agencies, to focus on the delivery of consistent claims management, positive claim outcomes, sharing information and better practice, and resolving conflicts.§ §You will act in accordance with APS and the agencies requirements including human resource, financial management and procurement requirements.§ §Coach and mentor team members.§ § Skills and experience:§ § §Demonstrated experience in analysing information (particularly data), risk management and using judgement to inform decisions.§ §You will be resilient, responsive and collaborative with a proven commitment to individual and team outcomes.§ §Strong stakeholder engagement and relationship building skills.§ §Passionate about coaching and collaboration§ §Experience working with legislation in service delivery operations.§ §Desirable to have tertiary qualifications in law.§ §Desirable to have experience in an insurance or injury compensation environment§ §   § Applicants will require the ability to obtain and maintain a Baseline Security Clearance. A police check will be completed for the successful candidate before commencement.§   § If this a role of interest, please apply directly through this web page. For more information, please call Tom on §0478 172 216§  or email §tom.lewis@calleo.com.au§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Internal Claims Adjuster Job in Hobart - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681176.txt	§Internal Claims Adjuster§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Internal Claims Adjuster§§Advertiser: §Crawford and Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hobart§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Crawford:§ §Crawford & Company is the world’s largest publicly listed independent provider of claims management solutions to the risk management and insurance industry. We self-insure entities, with an expansive global network serving clients in more than 70 countries.§ §Our Mission & Vision:§ §To provide leading and trusted expert assistance to our customers to help them enhance lives and restore businesses and communities in Australia and across the globe. We also aim to be the leading provider and most trusted source for expert assistance, serving those who insure and self-insure the risk of businesses and communities globally.§ §Our Values:§ §We promote our §RESTORE§ values throughout the business and the work they do. This means demonstrating at all times respect, empowerment, sustainability, training, one Crawford, recognition and entrepreneurial spirit.§ §About the Role:§ §As Internal Claims Adjuster, you’ll manage a portfolio of property claims to conclusion, ensuring compliance with service level agreements, meeting key performance indicators, and be a first point of contact for minor escalations and technical referrals.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Maintaining expected case load of property claims§ §Examining claims forms, policies and endorsements, and other records to determine coverage§ §Investigating claims by conducting office based analysis of physical damage details, interviewing claimants, and comparing claim information with evidence§ §Providing support & advice to policy holders with respect to their claims§ §Setting loss reserves and Controlling claim costs§ §Preparing first reports by collecting and summarising information required§ §Settling claims after determining liability, client’s instructions, and authority levels§ §Type client reports in an accurate & timely manner§ §Adhere to insurer client Service Level Agreements and processes§ §Update Claims Management System as required§ §Effectively deal with service/product replacement providers§ §First point of referral for minor escalations§ §Distribution of claims to adjusters§ §Point of contact for technical referrals§ §About You:§ §You’ll work as one with our high performing and dedicated team of claims adjusters, bringing with you an entrepreneurial spirit; down to earth and respectful attitude; positive outgoing personality; good customer service; and time and caseload management skills§ §Who we’re looking for:§ § §Previous claims experience preferred§ §Experience in management of General Insurance Claims§ §Insurance Contracts Act/FSRA legislation awareness§ §Stable work history§ §Excellent English§ §High Typing speed§ §We encourage people of all genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply for this role.§ §How to apply:§ §To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link. We look forward to meeting you soon.§ §Please note: It is the policy of Crawford & Company that all successful employees consent to a national police check.§ §To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status§.§ §Recruitment Agency Statement:§    § §Recruitment for this position will be managed in-house and we respectfully request that recruitment agencies refrain from submitting applications for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your average typing speed?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50652049.txt	§Client Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Executive§§Advertiser: §Aon Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §We are looking for an experienced insurance professional§ §Suitable for someone to take on a client portfolio with a broking, claims or underwriting background§ §You will be joining a very close knit and supportive sales and service team§  § §The opportunity:§ We are looking for an highly personable candidate to join our HIA Insurance Services team in Canberra, as a §Client Executive§, responsible for the servicing and retention of clients in the building and construction sector. §  § You will be responsible for:§ §Providing a high level of client service relating to new enquires, quotes, client renewals, claims and customer service§ §Dealing with your own clients in a phone based relationship management role, whilst handling proactive outreach to new and existing clients§ §Offering additional products and services to clients as you manage the renewal process§ §Achieving budgeted revenue for retention, and growth on existing and new business§ § §About you:§ §You will be an all-rounder who thrives in a very dynamic client servicing position§ §We are looking for someone with comparable insurance experience§ §You will enjoy exceeding team and personal goals, and working as part of a close knit team§ §High levels of motivation and a desire to be part of a supportive team environment will be paramount when looking at this hire§ § §About us:§ We’re a team of authentic and smart individuals focused on providing exceptional value to our clients and our local communities. Meaningful and genuine relationships are at the heart of our business success and we’re proud of our positive impact.§ § §Working within our HIA Insurance Services (HIAIS) team, a joint venture between Aon and the Housing Industry Association. Over the last 20 years HIAIS has built a dominant position and an envious reputation in the provision of insurance products and solutions to the Australian residential building industry.§ § §Here at Aon, you’re always more than just a job title. We encourage and support you to expand your knowledge and grow alongside some of the best people in the business – in Australia and throughout our connected global networks.§            § §As a valued colleague of Aon, you (and your family) have access to benefits that support your holistic wellbeing§ §You will receive a generous Group Salary Continuance Insurance (SCI) policy which will provide you with up to 75% of your salary§ §Aon actively supports employees who wish to pursue work-related studies§ §Aon colleagues gain access to the Well One app. The Well One program aims to support colleagues in balancing emotional, physical, lifestyle and financial wellbeing§ § §How to apply:§ Please submit your up to date resume with relevant experiences.§ § §Aon is committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture with growth and development opportunities for everyone. Diversity is the foundation on which we have built our world-class organization, unparalleled in delivering distinctive value through the work we do.§ § §We embrace an inclusive culture where our people trust each other, respect diversity and share ideas freely.§ §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50663314.txt	§Team Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Manager§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§Your Role§ § §The role of the Team Manager is to provide motivation, direction, instructions and guidance to the team to achieve team and unit goals. You will need to have held leadership roles within workers compensation, personal injury, insurance, or the disability sector. Providing day to day leadership and direction to the team to ensure delivery of KPI’s.§ § § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ § § § §Provide effective coaching and feedback to staff on technical and performance related issues§ §Work with Branch Managers to identify skills and knowledge gaps and assist with the upskilling of the team§ §Identifying opportunities for process improvement§ §Ensure high levels of customer service are delivered with a level of empathy and understanding  § §Ensuring compliance with the RTW ACT 2014 and other relevant legislation/ regulations and policy§ §Monitor team and individual performance against agreed KPI’s§ § § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ § § § §Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a team§ §Ability to manage and develop teams§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §Ability to be adaptable and flexible§ §Ability to engage with key stakeholders and staff§ §Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills§ §Excellent time management coupled with the ability to make sound decisions§ §Workers Compensation, Insurance or Service Industry experience would be held in high regard§ § § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you’ll experience the following:§ § §True flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to celebrate your contribution to the company§ §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A fun, supportive and inclusive working environment§ § § §A brief overview on GB:§ § § §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ § § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ § § §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ § §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ § §If you think you can make a positive difference to our business please apply – we want to hear from you today!!§ § § §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this role.§§§§

Providing day to day leadership and direction to the team to ensure delivery of KPI’s.§ § § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ § § § §Provide effective coaching and feedback to staff on technical and performance related issues§ §Work with Branch Managers to identify skills and knowledge gaps and assist with the upskilling of the team§ §Identifying opportunities for process improvement§ §Ensure high levels of customer service are delivered with a level of empathy and understanding  § §Ensuring compliance with the RTW ACT 2014 and other relevant legislation/ regulations and policy§ §Monitor team and individual performance against agreed KPI’s§ § § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ § § § §Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a team§ §Ability to manage and develop teams§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §Ability to be adaptable and flexible§ §Ability to engage with key stakeholders and staff§ §Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills§ §Excellent time management coupled with the ability to make sound decisions§ §Workers Compensation, Insurance or Service Industry experience would be held in high regard§ § § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you’ll experience the following:§ § §True flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to celebrate your contribution to the company§ §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A fun, supportive and inclusive working environment§ § § §A brief overview on GB:§ § § §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ § § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ § § §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ § §If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ § §If you think you can make a positive difference to our business please apply – we want to hear from you today!!§ § § §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50680756.txt	§Assistant Product Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Product Manager§§Advertiser: §BT Financial Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§How will I help?§ §  §You will be responsible for supporting the product management of BT’s superannuation products. You will focus on achieving analytical tasks that assist the product team in achieving financial targets, increasing market share, and building customer advocacy through the delivery of a market-leading product and customer solutions. §  §Reporting to the Senior Product Manager, you will collaborate with many internal stakeholders and cross functional teams and deliver key product management tasks, providing analysis and key insights.§  §You will support the superannuation team with product-related tasks including but not limited to product-related material, disclosure documents, reporting, marketing communications, training, and special projects materials. You will manage and maintain due diligence files for compliance audit purposes to ensure compliance obligations are met.§  §What’s in it for me? §  §Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you’ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You’ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us. §  §What do I need?§ §  §You will be degree qualified with RG146 qualifications and have held a similar position ideally within Financial Services/ Superannuation. You will have demonstrated knowledge of current market conditions, factors impacting business performance and competitor performance & products. You will have the ability to work dynamically with competing priorities, and across multiple teams/ stakeholders. Your strong influencing, negotiation and problem-solving skills coupled with a customer focused attitude will be critical to your success in this role.§  §What’s it like to work there?  §  §We aim to provide a supportive team to help us reach our purpose of Helping Australians Succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.§  §The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50675174.txt	§Insurance Broking Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Broking Assistant§§Advertiser: §Huntsman Recruiting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wagga Wagga & Riverina§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Real estate, law, yeah... if you want to be like the rest of them... §   § But I’m guessing you’re not just after a mediocre life, career or salary.§   § If I knew a long time ago what was involved with being an Insurance Broker; the intelligence required, the relationships you’ll build, the characters you’ll come across and the six figure salaries... Well, let’s just say I wouldn’t be writing this ad, I’d be joining the industry. §   § The insurance game is something that not many people consider when weighing up a career.§   § But let me tell you, it is the ducks nuts... §   § Insurance is one of the most important segments of the economy and has recorded incredible growth when compared with other sectors.§   § Now is the time to jump onboard, learn the industry and grow a lucrative career.§   § Kicking off locally in 2017 to now servicing a range clientele between Sydney and Melbourne, MACK Insurance Services have gone from strength to strength, tripling business every year.§   § They are now looking to add fresh blood to the team who they can mould and sculpt into a successful broker.§   § It’s not all work with the crew at MACK Insurance. You’ll be coming into a fun and supportive team who are genuinely invested in their personal and professional growth in the business.  With their new office a couple of doors down from Romano’s, you’ll be able to take advantage of a mid-week counter lunch or Friday afternoon wind downs with the team.   §   § While you are new to the industry, you’ll be starting off assisting with reception enquiries where you will be taught the industry specifics, compliance and generally how things operate, with the intention being that you will eventually move into a Broker role.§   § You love that there is always something new to learn and no two days are the same.  §   § You’ll be working alongside three authorised representatives who will be showing you the ropes and teaching you to prepare basic home and contents renewals and new business submissions.§   § We don’t particularly need someone with Insurance experience, however if you do – that’s great too! You’ll be mentored by the Managing Director’s who are some of Wagga’s leading brokers which means you’ll be exposed to complicated cases and the ins and outs of products and policies.§   § You’ll have customer service experience in a professional based setting whether that be in real estate or financial services, so you’ll be confident speaking with clients and building rapport. Afterall, you are a people person who thrives on making new connections. §   § For someone with initiative and keen to make their mark in the industry, the role offers further training to complete Tier 1 and 2 along with a Diploma of Insurance Broking.§   § If you have a couple years up your sleeve in the industry and ready to make the move, this is an awesome stepping stone to build a financially rewarding career in a business who have growth in their sights. §   § Don’t have an up to date CV? That’s fine, call Kaitlin Fuller at Huntsman Recruiting §02 69214488§ to find out more information on the role, the business and their culture.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50640699.txt	§Insurance Broker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Broker§§Advertiser: §Bluewell§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§We are looking for a qualified insurance broker preferably with at least 5 years of commercial Insurance Broking experience to come into our Southport office to become a senior broker.§ § §Easy-going laid-back office with a view of the whole city and ocean.§ §Good productive environment, with a happy go lucky team.§ §Wage by negotiation, but will be a combination of base wage and commission.§ §We are one of Australia's fastest growing online insurance brokerages with brands like www.publicliabilityinsurance.com.au and Bluewell Insurance Brokers, with a focus on small to medium sized businesses and the Tradesman sector. We are seeking a highly motivated Insurance Broker to join our team.§ §Position would suit someone that can work in a fast-paced environment, looking to work for a company with a modern view on doing business. The role will have a sales component to look after an existing book of business and take inbound leads for bigger more complex insurances that cannot be handled by junior brokers. We are also looking for someone that will obtain and foster referral sources to refer clients to us. We also need someone that can "share the knowledge" to train and mentor our junior brokers to get them to the next level.§ §As the successful candidate you:§ § §Must be very computer savvy.§ §Must be fluent with windows and office.§ §Must have a switched-on fast learner mentality.§ §Have patience to train junior brokers in a positive manner.§ §Have previous history in setting up referral networks.§ §​​​The successful candidate will have:§ § §A high level of servicing clients and always have the customers best interests in mind§ §Proven track record for closing business and a drive to be successful.§ §Warm, friendly, engaging personality§ §Excellent verbal and written skills§ §Excellent relationship management skills§ §Ability to interact with both clients and underwriters§ §Excellent communication and negotiation skills§ §Flexible team-oriented approach§ §Impressive work ethic§ §Positive CAN-DO attitude§ §Multi-tasking§ §Excellent time management skills§ §Competent in IT and office procedures§ §Ability to operate within compliance and administrative framework§ §Duties in this role will include:§ § §Maximise client retention, cross sales and client satisfaction§ §Excellent conversion of company supplied new business inquiries§ §Liaising and forming relationships with Underwriters§ §Proactively uncovering winning insurance solutions§ §Contribute to revenue growth through achieving financial objectives and targets§ §Contribute to a positive CAN-DO team spirit§ §If you are a passionate and motivated high performer looking to work with a friendly team send us your resume today.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of insurance broking experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years of business development experience do you have?§Do you have customer service experience in the insurance industry?§Do you have sales experience in the insurance industry?§§§
