jobText: TXT/50690297.txt	§Enterprise Agile Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Enterprise Agile Coach§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§.§§Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Portfolio Capability and Demand you will play a critical role in developing, coaching and mentoring the AIA delivery community to improve our performance across the Portfolio  as well as have the exciting opportunity to help us grow and develop our Agile Ways of Working and wider adoption progressively across the enterprise.§The overarching goal of the Agile Coach will be to support and champion the improvement of Agile in  practical and pragmatic way including processes, implementation of measurement metrics, better practices (such as lean and agile), continuous improvement tools, automation opportunities and waste reduction. This role can be filled in Melbourne (preferred) or Sydney.§§Strategic priorities for this role §§Drive adoption and transformation to Agile across the organization, establishing successful and pragmatic approaches to Agile practices across individuals, teams, portfolio and enterprise§Develop a robust strategy and tangible, practical two staged plan to uplift the Agile capability of the organisation – initially within delivery and then progressively through the broader enterprise§Coach, train, develop and mentor teams and team members to become self-sustaining in delivery, prioritisation and continuous improvement§Coach teams on core aspects on project delivery in a SCRUM/Agile delivery approach§Support Agile Teams to get buy-in for vision and journey to transform delivery capability across teams, focusing on highest value items§Guide and build strategy for knowledge and skills capability across teams§Introduce and promote best-fit ways of working including change management, lean, agile, continuous integration and delivery practices across teams to assist with fixing problems§Build and promote an understanding and awareness of Agile ways of working using key stakeholders across the business creating awareness and adoption of the Agile ways of working§§To be successful in this role you will have §§Extensive experience in project delivery with at least 10-15 years’ experience using Agile practices at an enterprise level§§Proven and extensive experience working as an Agile Coach at an enterprise level§Experience in developing and providing pragmatic training and coaching stakeholders/delivery staff at all levels of the organisation from executive right through to those technical and business delivery staff§Experience in consulting on continuous Integration, Automated Testing and Continuous Delivery§A strong reputation for uplifting agile capability in a practical and pragmatic way as well as driving and influencing the progression of Agile at all levels§Advanced experience in using, developing and leading the embedment and use of digital tools to support Agile delivery.§Recent experience working on large and complex organizational transformation programs with ability to build and maintain relationships with stakeholders at different levels quickly§§Applications close Tuesday 20th October.§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50697112.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Package + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks. Part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. §§Provide a specialised, person-centered approach to injured workers who have sustained a complex medical work-related condition.§§Work systemically with key internal and external stakeholders to influence a return to work plan.§§Opportunities to expand your development through secondment and internal opportunities§§EML is a leading Workers Compensation and Personal Injury Claims Management business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through ongoing support during their return to work journey. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over 2,400 dedicated employees, alongside the opening of an additional four offices. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a long-term career here at EML.§THE OPPORTUNITY §We are looking for Case Management Specialists in our Sydney office who can demonstrate strong customer relationship skills and provide a high level of customer service to all stakeholders, including injured workers, employers, medical providers, icare, bereaved families and other customer support networks.§ §ABOUT YOU §§You are driven to provide a high level of customer care and empathy in medically complex claim scenarios§You take a unique approach with each customer, communicating and interacting in a professional, discreet and sensitive manner at all times§You are calm under pressure, emotionally resilient and have a positive, continuous improvement mind set§You are creative, collaborative and can bring out the best in others§You have deep experience in workers compensation case management or allied health background - chiropractic background is highly desirable§§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES §§Managing a small portfolio of claims focusing on complex injuries including spinal cord and brain injury, our focus is returning people to health and supporting them in reaching their individual goals§Providing a holistic customer service experience that promotes involvement in innovative and contemporary health and wellbeing solutions§Creating a signature experience for all your customers by using your deep subject matter knowledge about workers compensation and/or personal injury§Designing tailored solutions for customers with psychological and complex injuries§Providing high level support, sensitivity and care in managing injuries resulting from extreme traumatic events and workplace fatalities§§We stand together as equals.§ EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including§:§§A vibrant, collaborative team culture§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite learning and development team§End of Month Drinks§17.5% annual leave loading§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Isabel Tran§ on §02 8098 6364§ or on email at §I.Tran@eml.com.au§.  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We’re also one of the state’s largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1000 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.§ § We're all looking to make a difference through the work we do. To do work that is exciting, challenging and rewarding. When you work at RAA, that something could be helping a member keep their life moving —on the road, on holiday or at home. Or it could be seeing your innovative idea for transforming the business come to life.§ § But one thing's for sure, you are going to make an impact. Because that's what we're all about here at RAA —giving people the power to make moves that matter.§        § §        § §About the role:§ § RAA Insurance has successfully grown to become a leading iconic Insurance brand in SA. However, to be successful in the role you will need to have:§ §Motor claims (or similar claims) experience is preferred;§Outstanding attention to detail and excellent verbal and written communication skills;§The empathy to deal with customers who have suffered loss;§A positive can-do attitude and team ethos; and§Intermediate PC skills, and experience with Insurance based systems.§ § §What we offer:§ §Free RAA Premium Road Service§Discounts on all RAA Products and Services§Flexible Work Arrangements§Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program§Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan§On-site Café§ § §How to apply:§ § Follow the prompts to send us a cover letter (addressed to Jessica Ames, HR Support Officer) and a CV. §Please upload as one document in PDF format. Applications close at 9:00am Friday 16 October 2020.§ § Any applications sent from agencies won’t be considered.§ § §We’re committed to building a workplace that’s diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50689855.txt	§Practice Manager - Business Analysts and Business Process Test Managers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Manager - Business Analysts and Business Process Test Managers§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§.§§Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Portfolio Capability and Demand, you will have accountability for the continuous development and capability uplift of key delivery disciplines as well as manage the supply and demand of resources across the Portfolio ensuring on time and quality delivery in accordance with AIA’s strategic delivery agenda. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§§Strategic priorities for this role §§Develop a practice framework including skill matrix for each role type (discipline) and plan to continually evolve and uplift capability and support development plans§Lead the development and execution of an end to end training framework program including material to raise the capability through coaching, training and on the job learning§Efficient identification, approval, recruitment, deployment and optimized allocation of PMO resources to ensure successful delivery of projects through resource capacity planning and performance management§Work with the Delivery Heads Of, Program and Project Managers to balance the relative priorities of resources and ensure the right resources are in the right roles to ensure quality deliveries are achieved§Ensure strong business stakeholder engagement and collaboration with technology to enhance quality, cost and timely delivery of projects and program§Build and maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders, both internal and external to drive and influence in order to achieve project/program/portfolio objectives§Work closely with Agile Coaches to lead the recruitment, development, capability, embedment of tools and culture pertaining to Agile methods and ways of working across the business, including the transition to SCRUM across projects§Monitor and support direct reports compliance with appropriate project methodology, processes and policies followed across projects, programs and portfolio to ensure excellence in project delivery.§§To be successful in this role you will have §§Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines§Proven experience running specialist PMO practices§Extensive business analysis and testing experience and delivery experience with strong experience in Insurance/financial services industry§Proven experience in establishing, growing and uplifting relevant practices to grow and develop resources that support strategic project delivery§Ability to optimise allocation of practice resources to successfully deliver all projects within the PMO as well as ensuring optimal utilization and performance of resources§Strong understanding of all relevant project methodologies and processes (including Safe Agile, Lean Waterfall) and the ability to identify and utilise key tools and processes to ensure project delivery success§Experience in stakeholder management at all levels, with ability to influence, negotiate and prioritises to find ‘win-win’ outcomes§§§Applications close Tuesday 20th October. §§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Claim Manager - Part Time Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50694755.txt	§Senior Claim Manager - Part Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claim Manager - Part Time§§Advertiser: §Lawson Risk Management Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§Senior Claim Manager - Part Time§ §About us§ §Lawson are South Australia’s leading provider of injury management and work health safety solutions. We are entirely customer focussed; authentic; strategic and creative. We are not burdened by bureaucracy or corporate stuffiness. §  §Our purpose is to Create Better Workplaces.  We believe that a healthy workplace is more than just safer, it makes people better – mentally, physically and productively.  We work with our clients to optimise their workplace culture and we do that through knowledge, technical skill and by bringing creativity and personality to everything we do.  To fight stigma, we endeavour to start with empathy, not prejudice. We help our clients to create positive change by dismantling old structures to create new ones.§  §Our people are trusted because we provide fair and equitable advice and management. And, we deliver.§  §The Position§ §Lawson currently have an opportunity for a part time Senior Claim Manager to join our team of professionals.  Working as the primary adviser to some of South Australia’s most well-known employers, the successful applicant will have passion and a demonstrated success in workers’ compensation claims management.  The current opportunity is for a 12-month contract with a strong possibility of conversion to a permanent role.§  §In this role your responsibilities will include but not limited to:§ § §Manage portfolios of workers’ compensation claims, across a diverse range of clients in a fair and equitable manner, from end to end,§ §Develop injury management strategies to achieve safe and successful return to work outcomes,§ §Provide technical and strategic advice in complex decision-making processes including: eligibility, treatment approval and lump sum payments,§ §Attend the SAET and provide instructions to solicitors,§ §Ensure compliance with the Return to Work Act 2014 (SA) and relevant standards,§ §Assist in the development, implementation, evaluation, review & improvements of claim management policies, procedures and processes,§ §Work on safety programmes with our WHS – Injury and Risk Managers,§ §Collaborate on strategy with clients and Lawson’s Manager – Strategy, Governance and Reporting,§ §Intrastate Travel will be required. A Motor Vehicle and valid driver's licence is essential. Interstate Travel may also be required.§ §Skills & Experience§ §An extensive working knowledge of the Return to Work Act 2014 (SA) and associated legislation,§ §Demonstrated experience in effective management of complex workers’ compensation claims,§ §The ability to communicate with a diverse range of stakeholders,§ §Knowledge and experience with the claims management data software, SolvInjury. (desirable),§ §Proficient in MS Office software (Word, Excel).§ §Qualifications§ §Formal qualifications desirable,§ §Success in a workers’ compensation claims management role mandatory.§ §Competencies§ §A strong sense of drive and personal accountability,§ §An ability to manage sensitive matters with discretion,§ §A customer first commitment,§ §Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation skills,§ §An ability to multi-task,§ §A genuine desire to contribute to a vibrant and diverse team culture.§ §What we offer§ §Competitive remuneration§ §10% Superannuation (SGC)§ §17.5% annual leave loading§ §An opportunity to work in a vibrant, & professional small team environment§ §Growth by supporting a diverse set of programmes with large employers§ §Long term opportunities for highly capable individuals§ §To Apply§ §If you meet the above criteria and want to be part of a dedicated & experienced team, please send your resume and cover letter to Michelle Harris, Director, Finance & Administration via email: §michelle@lawsonrisk.com.au§  §Applications close: 23rd October 2020§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

company). § §Reporting into the CEO of PUM, your aim will be to manage and continuously improve capabilities and processes of claims in order to support the business at a strategic and operational level.§ §PUM is an AFSL holder and the successful candidate will support the CEO with all compliance matters relating to claims .   § §Key responsibilities but not limited to:§ § §Establishing strong relationships with key stakeholders§ §Ensure all claims are managed in a compliant and timely manner, to completion.§ §Handle complaints and provide outstanding customer service.§ §Manage workflow and team.  Engage and manage the services ancillary staff, assessors.§ §Facilitate audits and other requirements§ §Provide leadership to the business in relation to claims.§ §Review procedures and constantly implement improvements.§ §Experience required for the position:-§ § §Relevant tertiary qualification or at least 3 years work experience in claims management roles, preferably within agriculture or crop or farmpack.§ §Strong management experience§ §Exceptional written and verbal communication skills§ §Ability to work in a fast-paced evolving environment, prioritise and manage your time§ §Exceptional analytical skills and attention to detail§ §Experience within crop or farmpack insurance is highly desirable§ §Conditions§ §In return, at Primacy you can expect to be ‎recognized for your commitment and rewarded for high performance with excellent employee ‎benefits and opportunities for career development.‎§ §We are open to flexible work arrangements for experienced candidates. § §A generous commensurate salary will be offered to the right candidate.§ §If this opportunity is of interest please apply online with an updated resume.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Client Adviser Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50668955.txt	§Client Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Adviser§§Advertiser: §VMIA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§Client Adviser – Max Term 12 months§  § §  §VMIA is the Victorian Government’s insurer and risk adviser, covering the people, places and projects that help Victorians thrive. From iconic cultural institutions, major infrastructure, public schools and hospitals, to emergency services and not for profits, our clients are diverse but united in their ambition to make a positive impact in our community. We share this ambition.§  § §  §Your role§  §We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Client Adviser to join our Client Advisory team within the Risk Services division.§  §In this role you are responsible for providing timely, accurate and consistent responses to client enquiries and requests made of VMIA through our website, email and phone channels. The role provides a key component of VMIA’s service delivery and works collaboratively with Underwriters, Risk Advisers, Claims Managers and other VMIA staff.§  §In this client-focused role, you thrive on finding solutions for our clients. You are curious and energised to come up with ways to improve the client experience and ensure the best possible outcomes for clients. You bring solid experience in customer service and can communicate in an engaging way with clients, whether you interact via the phone or in writing. A sound knowledge and experience in Insurance and being able to confidently demonstrate your understanding of Risk Management will be looked on favourably.§  §You’re a member of the Client Advisory team, reporting to the Manager, Client Advisory in the Insurable Risk Advisory function.§  § §  §What we’re looking for§ § §1 - 3 years’ experience in insurance sector is desirable§ §Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline or insurance professional qualification is desirable§ §Impressive verbal and written communication skills and excellent customer service skills§ §Excellent time management and organisational skills to manage competing deadlines§ §Keen eye and an attention to detail§ §Active team player and you enjoy helping others§ §Enthusiastic, self-motivated and confident with strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills.§ § §  §We encourage people from all gender identities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures, with disabilities, and from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply§.§  §Please let us know of any accessibility needs to consider during the recruitment process.§  § §  §Why work with us?§  §We’re known for our incredible culture and sense of community – and an § employee value proposition§ that makes our people proud.§  §We reward innovation, best practice thinking and collaboration. We are industry leaders in our diversity and inclusion work, are passionate about gender equality, and encourage and enable our people to bring their whole selves to work.§  §We were leaders in working flexibly even before COVID-19, and now operate successfully remotely, with a suite of events and activities to connect us even when we’re apart. In the future we’ll continue to work from where it makes sense to do so, in flexible working arrangements that works best for our people and our clients.§  §We offer programs, subsidies and leave options to support the wellbeing of our people as a top priority.§  §We invest in our people, ensuring your development and career growth is a priority.§  § §  §How to apply§  §If you’d like to help make Victoria an even better place to live, we’d love to hear from you.§ § §attach your resume§ §attach a cover letter addressing your suitability for this role and why a role at VMIA appeals to you (§applications without a cover letter will not be considered§).§ § §  §For more information, please see the § §position description§ and contact Hanita Singh, Talent Acquisition Partner at §careers@vmia.vic.gov.au§, or visit our §careers page §  § §  §Applications close on COB Monday 12 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline?§Do you have insurance professional qualification?§§§

jobTitle: Underwriting Manager (QLD & NT) Job in Brisbane - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50694028.txt	§Underwriting Manager (QLD & NT)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Underwriting Manager (QLD & NT)§§Advertiser: §CHU Underwriting Agencies Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§About CHU§ §CHU is part of the Steadfast Group; a top 200 ASX-listed company with $7 billion in total billings is the largest general insurance broker network and group of underwriting agencies in Australasia. Our policies are underwritten by QBE Insurance (Australia) Ltd, one of Australia’s most secure insurance companies.§ §We are one of Australia’s largest and most awarded insurance underwriting agencies. Our point of difference is that we offer comprehensive insurance, so our customers don’t need to purchase ‘optional extras’. We protect almost 1 million apartments, units and townhouses across Australia, with almost half a trillion value insured. We are multi-award winners: back to back winners of the Underwriting Agency of the Year Award 2017 – 2018, Insurance Business Gold Award winner 2016 – 2018, and 2019 winner of ANZIIF Excellence in Workplace Diversity and Inclusion.§ §Working with CHU§ §When you join CHU, you will join a friendly and supportive team, committed to providing our customers with an outstanding service. To reward you, we offer:§ § §An inclusive and flexible work environment.§ §Competitive salary packaging and excellent benefits.§ §Ongoing coaching and feedback, including bi-monthly formal feedback sessions with your Manager.§ §Office location that is close to Cafes, Shops and Public Transport in sunny Brisbane!§ §About the role§ §The Underwriting Manager (QLD & NT) is responsible for the management and underwriting of an extensive portfolio of Residential and Commercial Strata clients. Key to the success of this role, the Underwriting Manager must be a strong leader, with the ability to lead, coach and mentor the broader Underwriting Team, as well as providing technical support.§ §This is a great opportunity for someone with proven leadership experience, that will contribute to our culture and ongoing success. Reporting to the Regional Manager (QLD & NT), the role of Underwriting Manager is mainly responsible for:§ § §Uses complex Underwriting capability in residential and commercial strata to provide professional underwriting practice and service clients. This may be on large and/or complex accounts, and referrals.§ §Provide premium quotations for renewals, new business and endorsements up to a delegated value.§ §Providing technical advice to the Underwriting team – be a trusted referral point for all complex underwriting queries within the QLD & NT portfolio.§ §Develop the technical expertise of all Underwriting staff.§ §Monitoring workflow and processes across all systems for Underwriting team, including setting targets, sending instructions to team and ensuring the team meet SLA’s.§ §Provide strategic input into optimisation of Underwriting across CHU including system enhancement, workflow and process and policy enhancement (this being done in tandem with the National Underwriting Manager).§ §Conduct internal spot audits on underwriting within the QLD & NT Underwriting team as may be required from time-to-time, and coordinate a program of peer audits on a quarterly basis.§ §Analyse loss ratio and all relevant underwriting information to determine if each risk of an acceptable standard, including alternate methodology.§ §Ensure complaints/client issues are responded to and resolved professionally and in accordance with CHU policies and procedures§ §Prepare and/or provide inputs into reports on portfolio performance.§ §Be a thought leader for all underwriting staff within the branch.§ §Manage performance of the Underwriting Team. Actively support, coach and mentor team members to enhance our overall underwriting service capability and bench strength.§ §About you§ §Reporting to the Regional Manager (QLD & NT), the Underwriting Manager must have each of the following attributes:§ § §Hands on/willingness to assist and work as a team;§ §A passion for transformational leadership;§ §Demonstrates genuine compassion through their actions;§ §Finds a way to deliver a solution;§ §Challenges the status quo;§ §Flexible and practical; and§ §Confident to make decisions.§ §Skills/Qualifications required:§ §The candidate we are looking for will have the following attributes:§ § §A minimum 5 years’ experience in risk underwriting in property (residential or commercial risks);§ §Have obtained Associate Level CIP with ANZIIF (or equivalent certified training completion);§ §Proven experience leading and managing a team;§ §Ability to calculate and monitor Risk Retention & Capacity Treaty, Facultative - Risk Acceptance;§ §Capability to analyse exposure on perils (Accidental Damage, Fire, Flood, Earthquake, Cyclone (storm & sea surge), Liability);§ §Exceptional communication and relationship building skills; and§ §Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.§ §If you are the successful candidate you will be offered a competitive salary package, access to a diverse staff benefits program, and most importantly and you will be working within an organisation and team with an exceptional workplace culture.§ §If this is the role for you, please Apply NOW.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680115.txt	§Claims Specialist - Reinsurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Specialist - Reinsurance§§Advertiser: §B & K Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$100k - $130k p.a. + Bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Claims Specialist - Reinsurance §      §        §Leading Global Reinsurance Business §        §Growing team - strong, inclusive culture §        §Modern, CBD Offices - Competitive Salary §      §      §        §Our client, a global reinsurance business, is looking for a talented Claims Specialist to join their team. In this role you will both manage claims, implement process improvements and build strong client relationships. Despite the times and COVID-19, this is a business which is growing on the back of the innovative solutions they provide and truly customer centric approach they take.§        §You will be joining an experienced and dedicated group of claims professionals who have a shared goal to produce high quality work and an exceptional client experience. §        §Responsibilities;§        §          §Proactively manage a portfolio of claims (both retail and group) collaboratively with your allocated clients (life insurers)§          §Provide training, mentoring and consulting around operational improvement activities and provide wider market insights§          §Analyse claims data to provide risk management insights and identify future risks and opportunities §          §Work closely with your clients to help guide them to help achieve strategic goals around claims management§          §Proactively engage with and influence stakeholders to ensure compliance with claims guidelines and controls §        §        §Experience required:§        §          §Experience in life insurance claims and a strong knowledge of the current regulatory landscape§          §Industry knowledge of group and retail products and current trends in the market§          §A track record of success and influencing and rapport building in previous roles§          §A strong understanding of internal & external dispute resolution; the role of rehabilitation/return-to-work in the management of disability claims§        §        §Being a reinsurance business, they are really only looking to hire top performers from the industry. You will have a true passion for claims and the ability and want to improve processes and outcomes. You will effectively also account manage so as well as claims knowledge, you will need to be someone who is comfortable building relationships and be able to negotiate, influence and build rapport.§        §You will be working with a talented, intelligent team which is solutions focused and naturally attuned to delivering results. With the business being global, you have the opportunity to work in a number of locations (post COVID-19) and you will have access to some of the best training and people in the market.§        §Please feel free to apply if this is a role that appeals. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Our client, a global reinsurance business, is looking for a talented Claims Specialist to join their team. In this role you will both manage claims, implement process improvements and build strong client relationships. Despite the times and COVID-19, this is a business which is growing on the back of the innovative solutions they provide and truly customer centric approach they take.§You will be joining an experienced and dedicated group of claims professionals who have a shared goal to produce high quality work and an exceptional client experience. §Responsibilities;§§Proactively manage a portfolio of claims (both retail and group) collaboratively with your allocated clients (life insurers)§Provide training, mentoring and consulting around operational improvement activities and provide wider market insights§Analyse claims data to provide risk management insights and identify future risks and opportunities §Work closely with your clients to help guide them to help achieve strategic goals around claims management§Proactively engage with and influence stakeholders to ensure compliance with claims guidelines and controls §§Experience required:§§Experience in life insurance claims and a strong knowledge of the current regulatory landscape§Industry knowledge of group and retail products and current trends in the market§A track record of success and influencing and rapport building in previous roles§A strong understanding of internal & external dispute resolution; the role of rehabilitation/return-to-work in the management of disability claims§Being a reinsurance business, they are really only looking to hire top performers from the industry. You will have a true passion for claims and the ability and want to improve processes and outcomes. You will effectively also account manage so as well as claims knowledge, you will need to be someone who is comfortable building relationships and be able to negotiate, influence and build rapport.§You will be working with a talented, intelligent team which is solutions focused and naturally attuned to delivering results. With the business being global, you have the opportunity to work in a number of locations (post COVID-19) and you will have access to some of the best training and people in the market.§Please feel free to apply if this is a role that appeals. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50692916.txt	§Underwriter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Underwriter§§Advertiser: §DUAL Asia Pacific§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§We’re looking for an experienced Financial Lines Underwriter to join our Brisbane team.§  §We’re looking for candidates with demonstrated knowledge of client industries and businesses as well as market knowledge of risk, good interpersonal and communication skills, proven sales ability and a passion for excellent customer service and building relationships.§  §The ideal candidate will have the ability to manage multiple clients with a minimum of 3 years in Insurance (Underwriting or Broking), experience or exposure to Financial Lines and their Tier 1 qualification (preferred but not essential). The ideal candidate will also be comfortable presenting to external clients.§  §Duties will include;§ § §Preparing and communicating quotations, bindings, policy conditions and mid-term adjustments/ endorsements for administration processing§ §Negotiating rates/terms with brokers§ §Following up offer of quotations/renewal§ §Updating reporting systems§ §Management of inboxes during absences§ §Development and maintenance of broker relationships including visitations to client offices which may include interstate travel and presentations§ §Ensuring excellent service standards are maintained§ §Answering broker enquiries§ §Working effectively with the team to accomplish agreed underwriting goals§ §If you enjoy working in a close knit and highly collaborative team environment, have a drive to grow business, as well as negotiation skills and strong attention to detail then Apply Now!§  §To find out more about DUAL Australia, please visit the DUAL Australia §website§ or visit our §LinkedIn§ page to see what we’re up to and what we’re about.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an underwriter?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Damage Specialist - Work From Home Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50609108.txt	§Damage Specialist - Work From Home§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Damage Specialist - Work From Home§§Advertiser: §GoGet Carshare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§ § §GoGet is a fundamental good. For individuals, business and society as a whole.  GoGet is Australia's first and largest carshare service, We empower smarter lifestyles and create liveable communities.  Our focus is on carshare: wheels for whatever, round the corner, by the hour.  Individuals and businesses can free themselves from the costs and inconvenience of car ownership while also generating a proven environmental benefit by taking 10 cars off the road for every GoGet.§ §Reporting to the Damage & Recovery Manager, The Damage Specialist will contribute to a highly efficient, well performing operations and damage team.  The Damage Specialist will have an efficiency mindset and not be afraid to positively challenge existing processes and procedures in order to get the job done.   § §Forward thinking, with attention to detail, adaptability and strong numerical and analytical skills as well as the ability to influence others will ensure success in the role. § §Day to day will see you getting cars back on the road after accidents, booking them into repairers that any works are conducted in a safe, fast and cost-efficient manner. You will be liaising with GoGet Members via phone and email, as well as Third Parties regularly and need to be able to communicate with confidence and empathy.§ § § §Responsibilities:§ § §Coordinating the repairs of GoGet Vehicles within our established repairer network§ §Ordering of commonly used parts from our suppliers and holding them accountable to service level agreements.§ §Minimising uninsured losses by investigating damage and accident claims§ §Liaising with insurers and our insurance broker to promptly resolve insurance related accidents§ §What we’ll be looking for you to demonstrate:§ § § §You are genuinely excited about being part of what GoGet is doing§ §You know how to get things done; fast, safe, efficient and commercially sound§ §Internal and external stakeholder management and working in a matrix environment comes naturally§ §You’re highly organised and are comfortable working independently from home, but are also a collaborative team player.§ §This isn’t an analyst role, but you’ll still need to be very comfortable with understanding, interpreting and reporting on data.§ §Challenger thinking, prototyping, problem solving and disruptive approach.  Comfortable to fail well and learn from mistakes§ §A great communicator§ §We’d love it if you have experience in a similar role.§ § § §GoGet has a fun, friendly and sociable work culture. We currently get to work from home most of the time and for those rare times we head into the office, we’ve got a relaxed casual dress code every day of the week, not just on Fridays.§ §This is a 12 month temporary position however we believe in promoting from within so for those who are ambitious and exceed their performance targets, we strive to offer future roles across all areas of our business. If you fit these criteria, we look forward to hearing from you! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§§§

jobText: TXT/50692768.txt	§Consulting Standards Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Standards Analyst§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Standards Analyst §      §        §At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§        § §        §The Opportunity at AIA§        §.§        § §        § §        §Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Project Management Office, you will play a critical leadership enablement role to support the delivery of AIA’s Strategic delivery agenda.§        § §        §Additionally, working closely with your peers, you will support the design and implementation of common project management methodologies (lean waterfall and agile), standards, supporting tools and policies and quality assurance controls and measures to drive and facilitate the successful delivery of projects. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§        § §        §Strategic priorities for this role §        §          §            §Support by ensuring appropriate project methodology, processes, policies, standards and governance is followed across projects, programs and portfolio (including reporting)§          §          §            §Collaborating with colleagues, support the development of continuous framework enhancements and new policies, tools and process as well as the implementation and embedment of these§          §          §            §Make changes to existing policies, governance, processes and practices. Ensure adherence to standards set by AIA Group office§          §          §            §Maintain policies and procedures that govern Project, Program and Portfolio practices§          §          §            §Assist stakeholders with the adoption of project methodologies, governance, standards and tools to ensure consistent and efficient project delivery aligned to organisational strategic objectives§          §          §            §Help identify themes across projects of the portfolio at the earliest opportunity and proactively address through training or other collaborative means§          §          §            §Assist the Portfolio Master Scheduler to develop and roll out guidelines for portfolio and project scheduling management to ensure consistency across projects and flow on to portfolio§          §          §            §Provide governance and control support, ensuring project plan and associated deliverables are completed according to the PMO methodologies, standards and policies§          §          §            §Perform regular quality assurance: auditing the quality requirements and quality control results to ensure that appropriate quality standards are used and policies adhered to§          §        §        § §        §To be successful in this role you will have §        §          §            §Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines§          §          §            §PMO and/or Project management certification (PMI, Prince2, P3O etc.)§          §          §            §Agile Certification (desirable)§          §          §            §Strong experience working in a large PMO environment in a similar role. Experience in financial services/insurance industry§          §          §            §Previous experience and knowledge using project management tools (MS Project, Jira, Confluence, digital collaboration tools etc.)§          §          §            §Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills§          §          §            §Ability to deliver training in an engaging way that results in embedment of knowledge and skill§          §        §        § §        §Applications close Tuesday 20th October. §        § §        §Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§        § §        §Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§        § §        §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§        § §        §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § § §The Opportunity at AIA§ §.§ § § § § §Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Project Management Office, you will play a critical leadership enablement role to support the delivery of AIA’s Strategic delivery agenda.§ § § §Additionally, working closely with your peers, you will support the design and implementation of common project management methodologies (lean waterfall and agile), standards, supporting tools and policies and quality assurance controls and measures to drive and facilitate the successful delivery of projects. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§ § § §Strategic priorities for this role § § § §Support by ensuring appropriate project methodology, processes, policies, standards and governance is followed across projects, programs and portfolio (including reporting)§ § § §Collaborating with colleagues, support the development of continuous framework enhancements and new policies, tools and process as well as the implementation and embedment of these§ § § §Make changes to existing policies, governance, processes and practices. Ensure adherence to standards set by AIA Group office§ § § §Maintain policies and procedures that govern Project, Program and Portfolio practices§ § § §Assist stakeholders with the adoption of project methodologies, governance, standards and tools to ensure consistent and efficient project delivery aligned to organisational strategic objectives§ § § §Help identify themes across projects of the portfolio at the earliest opportunity and proactively address through training or other collaborative means§ § § §Assist the Portfolio Master Scheduler to develop and roll out guidelines for portfolio and project scheduling management to ensure consistency across projects and flow on to portfolio§ § § §Provide governance and control support, ensuring project plan and associated deliverables are completed according to the PMO methodologies, standards and policies§ § § §Perform regular quality assurance: auditing the quality requirements and quality control results to ensure that appropriate quality standards are used and policies adhered to§ § § § §To be successful in this role you will have § § § §Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines§ § § §PMO and/or Project management certification (PMI, Prince2, P3O etc.)§ § § §Agile Certification (desirable)§ § § §Strong experience working in a large PMO environment in a similar role. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. SRG Group has made its name as a diversified Broking Group with specialties in providing insurance and risk solutions to SME, Corporate, Workers' Compensation, and Sport & Events clientele.  As a leader in providing Claims Management and Advocacy services as well as our state-of-the-art integrated workflow system, we have a focus on exceeding our client's expectations. Read on to see why it has never been a more exciting time to be part of our team.§  §Position Overview:§We are seeking an experienced Senior Account Executive to join our dynamic and ever growing Client Services Team (CST). You would be a knowledgeable authority within this team and provide high level, first class Broking support to Senior Management, Account Managers & Authorised Representatives utilising your advanced skillset across a multitude of clients and industries. §  §The successful applicant 's main duties will include but not be limited to:§ § §Policy administration including invoicing via our CBS broking system§ §Utilising our purpose built and state-of-the-art workflow management system to maintain records and provide excellent service to our client base§ §Claims Management§ §Liaising with Clients, Underwriters, Account Managers and other key stakeholders§ §Providing technical broking support and constantly upskilling your knowledge of our ever changing industry§ §You will be welcome into a company that focuses on leading HR systems and who will ensure you are supported to hit the ground running!§  §Salary & Benefits:§An attractive base Salary Package is on offer with further investment in training and career development opportunities.§  §Employees have access to our employee benefits scheme that includes access to Discounts, Health & Wellness Programs, Health Club Membership and Loyalty benefits§  §The SRG Foundation:§We care about the Community. Our Foundation supports Community Partners and our Employees who wish to take a proactive role in the Community. SRG will contribute financial donations and paid leave for Employees who would like to actively participate in volunteering activities.§Experience & Qualifications:§You will have been an existing Account Executive for 3+ years or have a been in a similar position within the insurance industry.§More Information:§For further information on this role please contact our HR Coordinator Claire Philpot on §08 9442 1117§ or visit our website  §www.srggroup.com.au§ to find out more about us.§Confidentiality will always be paramount in our dealings.§Australian Citizens or Permanent Residents will only be considered, no recruitment agency applications§  § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an account executive?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§§§

Insurance broking qualification §?Good relationship management §?Willingness to learn§?Able to work in a high pressured environment §?Excellent organisational skills § §Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia?s and the world?s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World?s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential§How to apply§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. jobText: TXT/50654664.txt	§Training & Relationship Manager - QLD§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Training & Relationship Manager - QLD§§Advertiser: §Netwealth Investments Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Fund Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Training & Relationship Manager - QLD §      §        §About us:§        §Netwealth is an ASX listed financial services and technology company providing astute investors, financial advisers, private clients and high net worth firms with a way to §see wealth differently§. We offer a range of innovative portfolio administration, superannuation, retirement, investment and Managed Account solutions through our award-winning platform. Currently rated Australia’s Number 1 Platform for overall functionality and satisfaction, we provide wealth professionals with the technology required to efficiently manage and add value to their wealth portfolios.§        §The Opportunity:§        §This position is initially responsible for servicing existing and pipeline clients training and development needs on a day to day basis and being a support function to the practice at all levels of the business. The primary relationship rests with the Senior Distribution Manager (SDM) and with the Training and Relationship Manager (TRM) supporting Principal, Administrators and Advisers.§        §The secondary responsibility of the position is to support advisers within dealerships who have approved Netwealth as a platform provider in order to secure their business and assist with all their training needs. A critical role for Netwealth is to provide support to these advisers in understanding and using the Netwealth products and thereby growing their use of our products.§        §In this role you will be responsible for:§        §          §Training and development of Netwealth clients;§          §Market the Netwealth products to existing advisory groups to assist in rapidly growing the Netwealth business and its distribution network;§          §Regional budget and working with SDM to grow new sales and strengthen pipeline;§          §Administering SDM pipeline;§          §Maintaining and developing existing relationships;§          §Maintain regular contact with established adviser base as allocated;§          §Building our training commitment to advisers who work with Netwealth;§          §Mentoring other team members in both business development and marketing ideas and strategies;§          §Playing a key role in the accuracy and planning of key clients in the in-house CRM, Microsoft Dynamics§          §Contribute to Netwealth business development strategies and events.§        §        § §We’d love to hear from you if you have:§        §          §A deep understanding of platform functionality and the financial services industry;§          §Excellent communication skills;§          §Self-motivating with excellent time management & organisational skills;§          §The ability to work autonomously;§          §High level of technology competency;§          §A team player with an agile and collaborative mindset,§          §A car and valid drivers license.§        §        §Remuneration includes a base salary relevant to your skills and experience together with bonus for achieving sales targets to promote and reward success. §        §Working at Netwealth is exciting, challenging and full of new experiences. It’s a great time to join our growing company and talented team. If you love working in a challenging and fast-paced environment, now is the time to tell us more about yourself.§        §How to apply:§        §Does this role sound like your next opportunity? We'd love to hear from you as soon as possible so please "Apply Now"! Attach your resume and write a covering letter telling us why you feel you are the perfect person to join our Netwealth team.§      §      §      §    §  §§§About us:§§Netwealth is an ASX listed financial services and technology company providing astute investors, financial advisers, private clients and high net worth firms with a way to §see wealth differently§. We offer a range of innovative portfolio administration, superannuation, retirement, investment and Managed Account solutions through our award-winning platform. Currently rated Australia’s Number 1 Platform for overall functionality and satisfaction, we provide wealth professionals with the technology required to efficiently manage and add value to their wealth portfolios.§§The Opportunity:§§This position is initially responsible for servicing existing and pipeline clients training and development needs on a day to day basis and being a support function to the practice at all levels of the business. The primary relationship rests with the Senior Distribution Manager (SDM) and with the Training and Relationship Manager (TRM) supporting Principal, Administrators and Advisers.§The secondary responsibility of the position is to support advisers within dealerships who have approved Netwealth as a platform provider in order to secure their business and assist with all their training needs. A critical role for Netwealth is to provide support to these advisers in understanding and using the Netwealth products and thereby growing their use of our products.§§In this role you will be responsible for:§§Training and development of Netwealth clients;§ §Market the Netwealth products to existing advisory groups to assist in rapidly growing the Netwealth business and its distribution network;§ §Regional budget and working with SDM to grow new sales and strengthen pipeline;§ §Administering SDM pipeline;§ §Maintaining and developing existing relationships;§ §Maintain regular contact with established adviser base as allocated;§ §Building our training commitment to advisers who work with Netwealth;§ §Mentoring other team members in both business development and marketing ideas and strategies;§ §Playing a key role in the accuracy and planning of key clients in the in-house CRM, Microsoft Dynamics§ §Contribute to Netwealth business development strategies and events.§ §We’d love to hear from you if you have:§§A deep understanding of platform functionality and the financial services industry;§ §Excellent communication skills;§ §Self-motivating with excellent time management & organisational skills;§ §The ability to work autonomously;§ §High level of technology competency;§ §A team player with an agile and collaborative mindset,§ §A car and valid drivers license.§Remuneration includes a base salary relevant to your skills and experience together with bonus for achieving sales targets to promote and reward success. §Working at Netwealth is exciting, challenging and full of new experiences. It’s a great time to join our growing company and talented team. If you love working in a challenging and fast-paced environment, now is the time to tell us more about yourself.§§How to apply:§§Does this role sound like your next opportunity? We'd love to hear from you as soon as possible so please "Apply Now"! Attach your resume and write a covering letter telling us why you feel you are the perfect person to join our Netwealth team.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50591031.txt	§Customer Service Officer, Motorcycle and Caravan§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Officer, Motorcycle and Caravan§§Advertiser: §NM Insurance Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§NM Insurance Pty Ltd is a leading insurance underwriting agency across Australia and New Zealand. Through our trading brands we are leaders in recreational asset insurance, property and casualty lines, and commercial marine insurance.§ §The majority of our products are distributed via intermediary partners, primarily through licenced insurance brokers and franchised dealers of motorcycles, caravans and boats.§ §Our business requires a professional, energetic and customer focussed person to support our fast growing motorcycle and caravan portfolio.§ §We are seeking someone with Insurance experience in consumer / retail lines, preferably in the motorcycle and/or caravan space.  We will consider applicants with other personal lines experience who are looking to move into this space, but strong Sales/Underwriting experience, professional standards and customer focus are a must.§ §Based out of our Sandringham offices in Victoria. You will work within a team already well focussed and supportive to the next stage of our business growth.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Underwriting and customer support within strict underwriting guidelines.§ §Supporting business partners who distribute and negotiate motorcycle and caravan lines.§ §Engaging in a team environment to support portfolio and company requirements.§ §Responding to customer telephone and other electronic enquiries.§ §Servicing internal and external customer needs in a professional, empathetic and personable manner.§ §Reporting to line managers salient information regarding customer and internal engagement to allow the business to grow successfully.§ §Contributing to a culture of compliance, support and professionalism both internally and externally.§ §Processing and assisting with referrals from business development teams across Australia and New Zealand.§ §Reporting and promoting potential compliance risks and incidents within our regulatory framework.§ §Key Requirements§ § §Sound knowledge of the general insurance industry and underwriting procedures.§ §Insurance Sales experience.§ §Outstanding customer service focus and skills.§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills.§ §High professional and ethical standards.§ §Ability to prioritise and balance multiple tasks.§ §Ability to perform in a team environment.§ §Tier 2 qualified (RG146).§ §We offer a friendly, supportive and professional working environment and look forward to receiving your resume and cover letter outlining your ability to perform this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have customer service experience in the insurance industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50709708.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§Competitive Package + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks. Part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. §§Are you passionate about helping people get their lives back?§§Manage a portfolio of Federal Self-Insurance personal injury claims§§Opportunities to expand your development through secondment and internal opportunities§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims Management§ business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an §additional four offices§. We foster a learning culture that allows for us to continually invest in our employees ensuring a §long-term career§ here at EML.§§THE OPPORTUNITY§As part of our diverse team based in §Canberra§, you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.§The purpose of this role is to pro-actively manage the claims and injury management aspects of a caseload of significant workers’ compensation claims effectively within the legislation and achieve compliance on the performance measures. You will be an integral part of the§ Federal Self-Insurance team.§§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES§§Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as workers, employers and providers§Adopt a service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of all stakeholders§Undertake ongoing entitlement reviews in relation to weekly payments and medical expenses§Facilitate active participation of the injured worker and their employer in any return to work and recovery planning§Pro-actively manage rehabilitation providers and approval of rehabilitation plans§Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim cost§§ABOUT YOU§§Prior experience in claims management and/or allied health experience is highly desirable§Knowledge and previous experience working with the relevant ACT/Comcare worker’s compensation legislation and regulations is desirable§Effectively listen and understand the needs of the customer and what is important to them to enable their recovery and return to work§Tertiary studies in Business, Commerce or Allied Health (Occupational Therapy, Physiotherapy, Rehabilitation, Nursing, Psychology, Rehabilitation Counselling or Exercise Science) is advantageous§§§WHAT WE OFFER§§We stand together as equals.§ EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.§EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:§§Great work/life balance and flexibility§Onsite Learning and Development Team§End of Month Celebration Events§17.5% annual leave loading§1 Block away from Light Rail§10 min walk from the Canberra Centre§§We aim to attract top talent at EML, those who are looking for a rewarding career. If you’d like to speak to someone regarding our current recruitment process or this role, please contact§ Isabel Tran§ on §02 8098 6364§ or on email at §I.Tran@eml.com.au§. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Case Manager Job in South West Coast VIC - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50707778.txt	§Senior Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§Your Role§ §As a Senior Case Manager, you’ll work alongside your own team and the wider claims departments towards a single goal: guiding injured worker’s through the claims process and helping them to return to work and to life.§ § § §You’ll be a central point of contact for your own portfolio of injured workers at an integral part of their claims journey by ensuring the payment of weekly compensation, reviewing medical treatment compensation, and working with injured workers and their healthcare professionals to assist in their safe return to work. Our Senior Case Managers play a vital part in ensuring Injured Workers and Employers have a trusted partner in the claims process.§ § § §At GB, we foster long and meaningful careers for our Senior Case Managers through dedicated and ongoing training opportunities, and organisation-wide support. This position will be a launching pad for your successful work cover career and can lead to career pathways in Return to Work, Injury Management and Technical Claims Specialist roles. § § § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ §Providing a professional and customer focused Workers Compensation claims service through effective claims management § §Determining claims with increasing levels of risk within your portfolio, and strategizing for both current and potential liabilities on these claims§ §Delivering high quality customer service towards all parties, and demonstrating a commitment to learning and development § §Working in conjunction with both external parties such as medical professionals, treating health providers and employers, and internal teams such as your Injury Management and Technical teams to facilitate and influence a sustainable return to work and life for injured workers§ §Participating in Case Conferences and implementing strategies for effective cost management on claims § § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ §Case management experience, or studies within the Psychology, Legal, Social work or  Allied Health/Health Science disciplines (ideal, but not essential)§ §Recent work experience within a customer service focussed role§ §Exceptional time management and organisational skills and the ability to prioritise your tasks § §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a team-player attitude § §An aptitude for working within a dynamic, fast paced and challenging environment § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §Flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive bonus§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation § §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §The opportunity to work for an organisation that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ § §A brief overview on GB:§ § §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ § § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ § § §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ § § §To apply§If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ §Click on §Apply for this Job.§ § § §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognize the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§ § § §To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applyin§g.§ § § §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position§§§§
