Currently rated Australia’s Number 1 Platform for overall functionality and satisfaction, we provide wealth professionals with the technology required to efficiently manage and add value to their wealth portfolios.§        §We are committed to building our employee’s capabilities and you will be given plenty of opportunity to develop your career.  We strive to form teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills and who share our values of Curious, Courageous, Collaborative, Agile, Genuine and Optimistic. §        §The Opportunity:§        §The primary purpose of the Support and Solutions Officer is to utilise their technical expertise in support of their team/peers by responding to written and verbal enquiries across a range of functions. Of paramount importance is the delivery of service within designated timeframes and of a standard that presents and represents Netwealth professionally and exceptionally. §        §This role exists within Investor Services which is responsible for administering Netwealth’s Superannuation, Wrap Services and Global Specialist Series products, and is the primary point of contact for financial advisers, members and investors.§        §The incumbent will have the ability and skill to develop and foster close working relationships with team members, be the subject matter expert of processes and procedures and be proactive with improving efficiencies and effectiveness in our quest for superior customer service, across Investor Services but more particularly within the Communications team.§        §In this role you will be:§        §          §Staying abreast of any product, process, regulatory or legislative changes§          §Participating in multiple simultaneous projects with overlapping priorities§          §Assuming responsibilities and assisting with complex enquiries as escalated by peers§          §Responding to emails received into Zendesk in a timely, professional and accurate manner§          §Investigating and providing resolution to complaints, whilst adhering to deadlines and looking for efficiencies/improvements to better the overall client experience   § processes§        §        §We would love to hear from you if:  §        §          §You have strong attention to detail – with an in depth understanding of customer queries, seeking clarification and provide an appropriate, complete and qualitative response§          §You understand the importance of being well organised§          §You can develop customer relations by understanding and responding to customer needs and ensuring customer satisfaction§          §You are a subject matter expert on Netwealth's products and services§          §You can deal with a diverse customer base and sometimes challenging personalities§          §You have excellent communication skills (written and verbal, highly articulate)§          §You have sound problem solving and analysis skills§          §You have customer relations experience (developing and building relationships)§          §You have experience within the finance industry§        §        §Working at Netwealth is exciting, challenging and full of new experiences. It’s a great time to join our growing company and talented team. Are you curious about this opportunity? If you love working in a challenging and fast-paced environment, now is the time to tell us more about yourself.§        §How to apply:§        §Do you believe you have the skills and experience for this role? We'd love to hear from you as soon as possible so please §"Apply Now"§. § Attach your resume and write a covering letter telling us why you feel you are the perfect person to join our Investor Services team.§      §      §      §    §  §§§About us:§§Netwealth is an ASX listed financial services and technology company providing astute investors, financial advisers, private clients and high net worth firms with a way to §see wealth differently§. Along the way, you'll educate our customers on what will happen at every stage and support them with anything they will need to know about their claim§It's a role where you will be dealing with people experiencing hard times and difficulty, but your job is to deliver a positive customer experience - for people who love to help others, this role is highly rewarding.§You'll be responsible for: §§Supporting customers step by step through their recovery, developing personalised injury management strategies§Handling personal and confidential claims information discreetly and professionally§Nurturing excellent customer relationships and creating positive experiences§Welcoming and helpful written and verbal customer communication§Ensuring a fair and reasonable outcome for our customers§Driving service outcomes for internal and external customers§Adhering to all compliance and legislative requirements§§ I§deally you'll have:§§High-level conversational, written and listening skills§Solid problem solving and relationship building abilities§The ability to exercise sound judgement whilst handling multiple tasks§Excellent time management, resilience and agility when changes occur§A mindset which is supportive and allows you to ‘walk in our customer's shoes'§A desire to collaborate, participate and support your team§Ability to work under pressure and in a fast paced environment ‎§Year 12 equivalent education or a tertiary qualification is highly desired (Allied Health, Rehabilitation, Physiotherapy or Occupational Therapy qualifications will be viewed favourably)§§ §The Allianz career difference§As part of our team you'll join an organisation which values the health and well-being of every employee. jobText: TXT/50684045.txt	§Risk Officer - Enterprise Risk Advisory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk Officer - Enterprise Risk Advisory§§Advertiser: §VMIA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§Risk Officer - Enterprise Risk Advisory, Max Term 12 months§  § §  §VMIA is the Victorian Government’s insurer and risk adviser, covering the people, places and projects that help Victorians thrive. From iconic cultural institutions, major infrastructure, public schools and hospitals, to emergency services and not for profits, our clients are diverse but united in their ambition to make a positive impact in our community. We share this ambition.§  § §  §Your role§  §As our Risk Officer, your role will be to work with the Enterprise Risk Advisory team to deliver their program of work including client facing activities across the Victorian Public Sector and internal service development.§  §With support and coaching, you will be responsible for developing trusted relationships through an empathetic and supportive approach for the delivery of strategic advisory services to clients; supporting our clients to manage their risk by building risk management capability and risk maturity.§  §This great opportunity would suit someone who is enthusiastic about providing high level support and wanting to expand on their understanding of the enterprise risk portfolio. In this role you will also get the opportunity to work closely with our State-wide and Insurable Risk Advisory functions to ensure the best possible client experience, further strengthening the VMIA brand.§  § §  §Your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Provide relationship management support to our clients and contribute to account management and client service plan processes.§ §Support the end-to-end delivery of enterprise risk advisory service – including risk maturity assessment and services for our clients to embed the Victorian Government Risk Management Framework.§ §Provide background research to support engagements.§ §Write reports, desktop reviews, service proposals, preparation of client risk documentation, reports on workshop outputs and project related work.§ §Facilitate client learning sessions, support guiding conversations monitor client feedback and note taking.§ §Seek opportunities to for continuous improvement.§ § §  §What we’re looking for§ § §3 years’ experience in similar Risk Officer roles.§ §You have or are working towards a relevant tertiary qualification. You might also hold professional membership with a risk management, insurance or relevant organisation.§ §Previous experience of working in public sector, community or not-for-profit in a risk management role (advantageous) would be advantageous.§ §Previous experience of working in health sector (desirable).§ §Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Project, SharePoint and Visio.§ §Excellent organisation skills and no problems adapting to changing needs and deadlines.§ §Confidence to work with stakeholders of all levels.§ §Quality conscious with attention to detail.§ §Experienced with multitasking and prioritising tasks.§ §‘Can do’ attitude, active team player and supportive mindset.§ §Collaborative, flexible with a strong interest in learning and building on your risk management mindset and have a conceptual understanding of risk management practices.§ §Highly developed communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and negotiate mutually beneficial outcomes.§ § §  §We encourage people from all gender identities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures, with disabilities, and from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply§.§  §Please let us know of any accessibility needs to be considered during the recruitment process.§  § §  §Why work with us?§  §We’re known for our incredible culture and sense of community – and an § employee value proposition§ that makes our people proud.§  §We reward innovation, best practice thinking and collaboration. We are industry leaders in our diversity and inclusion work, are passionate about gender equality, and encourage and enable our people to bring their whole selves to work.§  §We were leaders in working flexibly even before COVID-19, and now operate successfully remotely, with a suite of events and activities to connect us even when we’re apart. In the future we’ll continue to work from where it makes sense to do so, in flexible working arrangements that works best for our people and our clients.§  §We offer programs, subsidies and leave options to support the wellbeing of our people as a top priority.§  §We invest in our people, ensuring your development and career growth is a priority.§  § §  §How to apply§  §If you’d like to help make Victoria an even better place to live, we’d love to hear from you.§ § §attach your resume§ §attach a cover letter addressing your suitability for this role and why a role at VMIA appeals to you (§applications without a cover letter will not be considered§).§ § §  §For more information, please see the § §position description§ §and contact Hanita Singh, Talent Acquisition Partner at §careers@vmia.vic.gov.au§, or visit our §careers page §  § §  §Applications close on COB Thursday 15 October 2020. §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Do you have minimum 3 years’ experience in similar Risk Officer roles?§Do you have previous experience of working in public sector, community or not-for-profit in a risk management role?§Do you hold professional membership with a risk management, insurance or relevant organisation.§§§

Additionally, you will be able to obtain satisfactory police and ASIC clearances.§ §You will also have the following qualities:§ § §Attention to detail and concern for quality;§ §A demonstrated strong work ethic and commitment to customer service;§ §The ability to work both independently and in a team environment;§ §A can-do attitude.§ §This position offers you a career opportunity with a vibrant and collaborative team of insurance professionals who care about their colleagues and clients.§ §Phone enquiries, including a request for a position description may be directed to Amy Rosman on §0883649400§.§ §Applications including a covering letter and CV should be sent to: §amy.rosman@elders.com.au§ §Applications close Tuesday 20th October 2020.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50693311.txt	§Scheduler§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Scheduler§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§About Us§We are an experienced and reliable accredited service provider for insurance claims and disaster relief across the eastern seaboard in relation property damage restoration services to commercial, industrial and retail properties, as well as historical buildings across Australia. We’re equipped to manage any disaster recovery effort including humidity control, the salvaging and restoration of contents, and decontamination and restoration of building materials and fittings.§ § § §The Role§The scheduling position provides an integral support function to the Remeed field staff nationally, ensuring that all works are booked for attendance, in a timely manner to prevent further loss. This will involve utilizing your exceptional communication and organisational skills to coordinate calendars, keep valued customers informed of progress when contacted and keep all systems updated. The role will require empathy and understanding of the needs of the customer in all communications. § §The scheduler will be responsible for liaising with key stakeholders, including but not limited to technicians; supervisors; brokers; real estate agents; homeowners and tenants.§ §Reporting directly to the Administration Manager, the scheduler will be customer focused and be highly motivated to meet set KPI. § §Due to the business offering services linked closely to major insurable weather events, there will be some afterhour’s requirements to assist with the increased workloads following major events.§ §Located in the inner-city suburb location (MILTON), we are close to all forms of public transport. §Remeed is looking for a Full Time scheduler, with rostered hours Monday – Friday 8:30am-5.00pm with a possibility of weekend work during busy periods.§BRING YOUR STRONG CAN DO ATTITUDE WITH A SIDE OF FUN!§ §Role and Responsibilities:§• Answer high volume inbound calls from Customers and Insurance Consultants.§• Monitor all new incoming jobs and make contact within KPI requirements; §• Create new jobs for clients where auto creation does not occur;§• Ensure that all booking information is updated across all system platforms;§• Schedule appointments for field staff ensuring their productivity levels remain at high levels. §• Follow and action all items within set KPI’s as directed§• Assist with the actioning of emails in inboxes §• Review daily checklists are completed by technicians/Supervisors for previous day bookings;§• Carry out general administrative duties as directed;§• Undertake other tasks as reasonably requested from time to time as required.§ §Ideal Candidate:§• Minimum 2 years’ experience in a high volume phone based role;§• Previous experience managing calendar bookings, scheduling appointments;§• Proven ability to manage multiple tasks in a highly dynamic and diverse environment;§• Strong work ethic and highly motivated;§• Strong time and organisational management skills with the ability to work autonomously;§• The ability to develop relationships with our clients;§• High level customer service skills;§• Ability to adapt to new systems and processes essential;§• Ability to work well in a team environment;§• You have a natural empathy to help our customers in need.§ §Skills & Experience:§• Highly competent in Microsoft applications: Outlook, Word, Excel.§• High Attention to detail.§• Fast & accurate data entry skills.§• Demonstrated customer service skills.§• Excellent communication skills.§ §If you believe you possess the above personality, skill set and drive please apply using a current resume and cover letter addressing your fit.§Residency Requirements§Australian Citizens and Permanent Residents only (inc. New Zealand Citizens)§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

 §Claims Advisor §      §        §The Role§        §We are looking for an experienced insurance professional to join our Canberra Workers Compensation claims team as a Claims Advisor in a permanent With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-50 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. (2018)§          §Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for sixth consecutive year (2014 - 2019)§          §Money§ magazine’s Bank of the Year and Business Bank for third consecutive year (2018 - 2020)§          §General Insurance Product Innovation of the Year (2018)§        §        §If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today.§        § §At Suncorp we build inclusion by providing an environment where everyone is able to be themselves and feel valued, involved and respected for their perspectives and contribution.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Role§We are looking for an experienced insurance professional to join our Canberra Workers Compensation claims team as a Claims Advisor in a permanent full-time role.§As a Claims Advisor managing a resolution portfolio you will be responsible for managing claims in line with ACT Workers Compensation legislation, to ensure that our injured workers receive the appropriate treatment and rehabilitation.§This busy and varied role will see you engaging with stakeholders including Brokers, Employers, Workers and Rehabilitation consultants to investigate Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§.§§Join us at a pivotal time as we integrate CommInsure Life (CMLAS Pty Ltd) into the AIA Australia family. Reporting through to the Head of Project Management Office, you will play a critical leadership enablement role to support the delivery of AIA’s Strategic delivery agenda.§Additionally, working closely with your peers, you will support the design and implementation of common project management methodologies (lean waterfall and agile), standards, supporting tools and policies and quality assurance controls and measures to drive and facilitate the successful delivery of projects. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§§Strategic priorities for this role §§Support by ensuring appropriate project methodology, processes, policies, standards and governance is followed across projects, programs and portfolio (including reporting)§Collaborating with colleagues, support the development of continuous framework enhancements and new policies, tools and process as well as the implementation and embedment of these§Make changes to existing policies, governance, processes and practices. Ensure adherence to standards set by AIA Group office§Maintain policies and procedures that govern Project, Program and Portfolio practices§Assist stakeholders with the adoption of project methodologies, governance, standards and tools to ensure consistent and efficient project delivery aligned to organisational strategic objectives§Help identify themes across projects of the portfolio at the earliest opportunity and proactively address through training or other collaborative means§Assist the Portfolio Master Scheduler to develop and roll out guidelines for portfolio and project scheduling management to ensure consistency across projects and flow on to portfolio§Provide governance and control support, ensuring project plan and associated deliverables are completed according to the PMO methodologies, standards and policies§Perform regular quality assurance: auditing the quality requirements and quality control results to ensure that appropriate quality standards are used and policies adhered to§§To be successful in this role you will have §§Relevant tertiary qualification in Business, Project Management, Human Resources, Information Systems or Engineering disciplines§PMO and/or Project management certification (PMI, Prince2, P3O etc.)§Agile Certification (desirable)§Strong experience working in a large PMO environment in a similar role. Experience in financial services/insurance industry§Previous experience and knowledge using project management tools (MS Project, Jira, Confluence, digital collaboration tools etc.)§Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills§Ability to deliver training in an engaging way that results in embedment of knowledge and skill§§Applications close Tuesday 20th October. §§Please contact §emily.vegas@aia.com§ with any enquiries (enquiries only, we are not accepting email applications).§Agencies please note: All AIA vacancies are managed by our internal Talent team and we will not accept any unsolicited resumes. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. jobText: TXT/50682120.txt	§Senior Ops & Business Rules Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Ops & Business Rules Consultant§§Advertiser: §United Super Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Superannuation§§§§§§As our Senior Operations & Business Rules Consultant, you’re across it all. You’ve got the technical super know-how to be a trusted subject matter expert - plus the skills to provide operational support to our Administration Operations team. This role will see you support our Stream Lead, Administration Operations, maximising operational delivery and standards across our fund as well as manage the Funds business rules.§ In this role, no two days are the same – you’re continually supporting change and incident management processes, communications and quality review activities. You act as one of the integral links to our administrator managing our adherence of contracted Service Level Standards (SLAs) while continually identifying, driving and implement operational process improvements. You’ll also own the management of the Fund’s existing Business Rule Framework and responsibility in developing new business rules as the fund continues to expand in product offering and size.§ We’re looking for a real go-getter. You’re able to draw upon your strong understanding and experience of the superannuation regulatory environment and familiarity with its regulators. Your reputation for achieving great outcomes in a superannuation operational experience/service delivery is outstanding. You have impeccable timing and an eye for detail collecting and analysing complex material – and the interpersonal skills to connect with the various audiences you present it to.§ Tertiary qualifications in a business-related discipline or equivalent aren’t essential – but would be an advantage. Exposure to incident management, compliance controls and use of GRC systems (particularly ARCHER) would be highly advantageous.§ §Why Cbus?§ You can be part of an award-winning organisation that is genuinely committed to delivering workplace diversity, inclusion and flexible working arrangements as an enabler of our purpose - to act in the best interest of our members and maximise their retirement outcomes.§   § Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website. You will also be able to download the full position description from website - www.cbussuper.com.au/about-us/careers.§   § §About Cbus§ Cbus is one of Australia’s largest industry superannuation funds and the national industry fund for the construction, building, infrastructure and allied industries. Established in 1984, Cbus provides superannuation benefits to over 780,000 members, has assets over $54 billion, and accepts contributions from more than 150,000 employers.§ § § § Applications Close: §19th October 2020.§   § Applicants must have current rights to work in Australia§   § §Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team.  Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

We are ASX listed and boast a significant number of underwriting agencies across a diverse portfolio, and are always on the lookout for energetic, talented in innovative people that want to help shape the future of the insurance industry.§ § § §Steadfast Underwriting Agencies - Miramar, a market leading underwriting agency focus on a progressive approach to underwriting. We source authorised local and overseas Insurers who assist us in providing the market with new ways to write risk. We seek a Property Renewal Underwriter to provide underwriting services to the broker market. To liaise with brokers and internal staff on policy terms and conditions and assist the company in marketing its brand to the broker network.§ § §About the role§ § §The major responsibilities of the role are as follows:§ § § §Client Relationship Management§ §Undertaking actions which meet and/or exceed client expectations, using communication styles and methods to ensure understanding and continuing client satisfaction.§Influences outcomes that maximise potential for long term relationships§Develops ideas and solutions with the client§Maintains and demonstrates sound knowledge of clients, businesses and industries§Facilitates open communication§Develops approaches to client opportunities§Identifies current and potentially important clients§Acknowledges and recognises others who take action to meet client's needs§ § § §Customer Service Orientation§ §Develops relationships by listening to and making efforts to understand the customer (both internal and external; e.g. clients, suppliers, agents as well as other team members)§Anticipates and provides solutions to customer needs, prioritising customer satisfaction§Assist with training staff in application of agreed systems and processes to daily work flow§Recognises and acknowledges the customer and clarifies customer's needs until fully understood§Confirms customers satisfaction with solution§Actively listens and empathises with customers§Takes responsibility for response and outcomes§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Skills and Competencies§ § § §Excellent written and verbal communication skills with exceptional attention to detail§Working effectively without supervision or close instruction; acting to achieve goals beyond minimum requirements whilst thinking constructively and presenting suggestions about improvements to the job and the workplace.§Demonstrating the ability to work effectively in a team/work group or those outside the formal line of authority (e.g. peers, senior managers) as a valued member who assists in building morale and makes extra effort to help the team reach organisational goals; taking actions that respect the needs and contributions of others§A high degree of organisational skills and the ability to adapt quickly to change§Ability to deal with multiple tasks whilst meeting reporting deadlines§Ability to communicate at all levels in a multiple stakeholder environment- liaison with clients, external service providers and other departments§ § § §Qualifications and Experience§ §Minimum 5 years' experience in Insurance/Underwriting required, with Property knowledge favourable.§Qualifications as determined by PS146 requirements from time to time in order to provide advice to the public and comply with any financial services legislation and regulation enacted by the Commonwealth of Australia or the States.§Office and Excel skills§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an underwriter?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have customer service experience in the insurance industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680911.txt	§Senior Manager - Corporate Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager - Corporate Insurance§§Advertiser: §Commonwealth Bank - Wealth Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§§Do work that matters:§ § Our Wealth, Deputy CEO and Program Delivery (WDP) Risk Management division is responsible for developing and deploying the risk frameworks to allow the Group to take conscious exposures to credit, market, operational, compliance and insurance risks within a Board-approved risk appetite. We ensure the Group has appropriate strategies and frameworks in place to identify, assess, manage and report on credit, market, operational, compliance, technology and insurance risks.§ § We currently have a §12 month contract opportunity§ available for a Senior Manager, Specialised Projects (Corporate Insurance) which will have accountability for supporting the General Manager, Specialised Projects for driving delivery of activities for the Corporate Insurance Substream of the CFS Separation Program, which will mainly focus on establishment of corporate insurance arrangements for the standalone CFS business for Day one.§ § §See yourself in our team:§ § You will lead the review and approval of proposal documents for Corporate Insurance arrangements for CFS and provide commercial insurance advice to Group and Business Unit teams, as well as aiding in the collation of data and preparation of corporate insurance proposal documents during this Project. The role involves significant senior stakeholder co-ordination, engagement and approval of corporate insurance proposals.§ § The Senior Manager will lead, coach, motivate and role model effective risk management behaviours and influence stakeholders to adopt similar practices and will adhere to the Code of Conduct which sets the standards of behaviour, actions and decisions we expect from our people, and will solve problems and make recommendations based on innovative and agile thinking, as well as actively participating in processes to capture and act on innovative ideas which improve the way WDP operates.§ § You will be required to engage, influence, and advise key internal and external stakeholders on the project regarding all relevant stakeholder engagement required and should be able to challenge and consult whilst maintaining excellent relationships.§ § Additional focus areas include:§ §Ensuring program governance requirements are completed with respect to the Corporate Insurance Substream.§ §Supporting the Executive Manager, Change and Communications to identify and manage interdependencies with other Substreams, and the broader CFS Separation Program.§ §Supporting your colleagues in WDP and ensuring an effective working relationship with other risk and compliance functions across the Group.§ § §We’re interested in hearing from people who have: §Degree in a business, financial, legal or risk management discipline§ §Minimum of 5 years of corporate insurance (eg. professional liability insurance, directors and officers liability insurance) knowledge and experience, preferably in the banking and finance sector or large professional services firm§ §Strong understanding of corporate insurance programs including policy terms & conditions and renewal processes§ §Strong relationship management and stakeholder engagement skills, including experience in dealing with senior management§ §Effective consulting and presentation skills and ability to provide strategic, commercial insurance advice§ §Proven personal and interpersonal skills in complex, high-pressure environments§ §Understanding of the financial services regulatory environment and current issues affecting the industry§ §Understanding of operational risk and compliance management principles, frameworks and generally accepted industry practices will be an advantage.§ §CBA has entered into an agreement with KKR to sell a 55% interest in its CFS superannuation and investments business for total cash consideration of $1.7billion (implying a total valuation of $3.3billion). CBA will retain a 45% shareholding in CFS.§ § §KKR is a leading global investment firm that manages multiple alternative asset classes, including private equity, energy, infrastructure, real estate and credit, with strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns for its fund investors by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and driving growth and value creation with KKR portfolio companies.§ § §The sale is expected to complete in the first half of 2021.§ §Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. §Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.§Here, you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.§We’re determined to make a real difference for Australia’s first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply.§ §If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.§§§§

Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§        § §        §The Opportunity at AIA§        §The position of Delivery Support Manager will be a key member in the Banca, Partnerships and Advice team reporting into the Senior Strategic Planning and Reporting Manager. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§        § §        § §        §The Delivery Support Manager is a critical role for Banca, Partnerships and Advice team, newly created, its purpose is to provide business development, partner on-boarding, project, admin, reporting and other support to the Banca, Partnerships and Advice Leadership Team.§        § §        §This is a stakeholder focused role, where your analytical background will play a key role in analysing and interpreting data and targets. If we require additional support, we will reach out to our preferred agency partners. Thank you.§        § §        §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. jobText: TXT/50695407.txt	§Claims Team Leader - North Sydney§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Team Leader - North Sydney§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§What is the role§Based in our North Sydney office, we are seeking our next Claims Team Leader for a 12 month contract. This pivotal opportunity will be responsible for leading and mentoring a team of claims professionals and utilising strong leadership skills to ensure the team gets the best outcomes possible for our clients. §The role will include:§•Workload management across multiple systems (ensuring SLA’s are met)§•Daily allocation of tasks§•Partnering with our brokers and clients§•Escalation contact for Claims Lodgements§•Managing the triage and allocation rules in response to changes in business§•Undertake quality performance reviews for lodgements (both onshore and offshore)§What are we looking for§To be successful in this role, you will have:§•Experience in claims and/or insurance industries §•The ability to lead people and drive the best results §•The ability to build strong relationships with our clients and brokers§•An innovative mind to look at ways to improve and find better client outcomes rather than just accepting the status quo§•Ambition and drive to be a part of Gallagher’s growth strategy§ §Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§What will we offer§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business. §Additional benefits:§•Competitive remuneration and incentive program§•Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances§•Salary sacrifice options including additional leave§•Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§•The opportunity to enrol in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to both invest in your future and share in the company's growth potential§How to apply§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50696909.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §EML§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive Package + RDO + 17.5% Leave Loading§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At EML we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19. As a business, we are migrating back to a work from office environment with new joiners commencing within the office environment for their onboarding period of 4 weeks. Part of our recruitment process, we may ask you to complete an online assessment as well as a series of video-based questions. §§A diverse and rewarding role supporting injured workers from the Emergency Services industry§§A background in allied health or customer service is highly sought after§§Comprehensive learning and development support§§EML is a leading §Workers Compensation§ and §Personal Injury Claims Management§ business. Our goal is to help people get their lives back through §ongoing support during their return to work journey§. Over the past two years, we have experienced continuous growth to now having over §2,400 dedicated employees§, alongside the opening of an §additional four offices§. jobText: TXT/50631800.txt	§Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§Your Role§ As a case manager, you’ll work alongside your own team and the wider claims departments towards a single goal: providing quality service and care for Injured Workers and our clients. § §You’ll be a central point of contact for your own portfolio of injured workers at an integral part of their claims journey, and provide guidance and expertise to a range of stakeholders relating to medical requests and entitlements. Our case managers play a vital part in ensuring Injured Worker’s and Employers have a trusted partner in the claims process.§ §At GB, we foster long and meaningful careers for our Case Managers through dedicated and ongoing training opportunities, and organisation-wide support. This position will be a launching pad for your successful work cover career. § §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§ §Taking ownership of your portfolio of Medical Expenses Only and closed-period Claims for injured workers§ §Providing Workers Compensation claims advice and customer service to all involved parties such as injured workers and their employers§ §Liaising with and providing a high level of customer service to injured workers directly with relation to their claim, as well as liaising and building rapport with providers and employers to monitor effective medical treatment programs for injured workers§ §Utilising and developing effective claims management tools and skills, and working with your wider team of claims management specialists to ensure the delivery of quality service for all§ § §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§ §Case management experience, or studies within the Psychology, Legal, Social work or  Allied Health/Health Science disciplines (ideal, but not essential)§ §Recent work experience within a customer service focussed role§ §Exceptional time management and organisational skills and the ability to prioritise your tasks § §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a team-player attitude § §An aptitude for working within a dynamic, fast paced and challenging environment § §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§ §Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer§ §Flexible work hours§ §Staff referral incentive bonus§ §Opportunities for ongoing education and development§ §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation § §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members§ §The opportunity to work for an organisation that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§ §A brief overview on GB:§ §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ §To apply§If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ §Click on §Apply for this Job.§ § §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognize the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§ §To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applyin§g.§ §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§ §§§§

We celebrate and commit to:§#Proud to be me – we value difference, not sameness§#Together – harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers & each other§#No boxes – it’s not about labels, boxes or categories. It’s about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do§IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. We own some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. § §Job description:§#CLOSER #BRAVER #FASTER§ §The Role§The purpose of this role and your unique contribution is to be part of the operational risk team responsible to drive efficient and effective management of operational risk in the Australian Division. The Consultant, Operational Risk provides risk identification management, review, mitigation and reporting alongside business owners aligned to the IAG Risk Management Strategy, Risk Management Framework and Risk Appetite Statement. This role is a visible advocate for driving risk maturity uplift and improvement in operational risk culture within the divisions. A critical success factor for the role is the ability to engage broadly and communicate effectively within IAG to influence a practical understanding of operational risk.§Key Responsibilities:§ §You will support the development and implementation of the Risk Management Strategy, Risk frameworks and methodology of Australia Division to increase operational risk maturity across business units.§ §You will provide assurance to the interactions we have with our customers to ensure they are receiving service aligned to the correct processes and policy information through associated risk activity.§ §You will uplift Risk Maturity via a business partnering model with the business unit risk reps to facilitate the taking of risk within appetite by risk owners.§ §You will participate and/or facilitate in risk profiling activity along with the operational risk leads and managers.§ §You will work with business owners to provide mitigations and plans, including coaching, workshops and other activities.§ §You will deliver risk-based reviews of business process to determine whether they are being execute and managed effectively, supporting a continuous improvement approach.§ §You will assess and identify whether the design and execution of controls are adequate and effective in mitigating risks, including establishing a robust control environment.§ §You will facilitate and support risk assessments and reporting for key business initiatives and projects and maintain effective systems and processes for receiving and implementing new regulatory obligations.§ §You will embed risk maturity in the business as well as a pro-active risk management culture.  § § §Skills & Experience§ §Experience in General Insurance or financial services industry, and exposure to risk management or compliance roles.§ §You will be an analytical thinker and have knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis.§ §You will have knowledge of issues, opportunities and challenges for conducting business in the international marketplace and have the ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.§ §You will have knowledge of the insurance industries trends, directions and major issues and regulatory considerations along with strong business acumen.§ §Tertiary qualification/s in Economics /Accounting / Finance / Law or related fields desired.§ §Relevant industry or specialism qualifications e.g.: ANZIIF, AS/NZS ISO 31000:2009 (Risk management -principles and guidelines)§ §Let’s Talk§Start your career journey with us and click §‘Apply’! § §In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts. § §We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply for this position.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50722443.txt	§Corporate Support Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Support Officer§§Advertiser: §MLC Life Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive package inclusive of 10% super. §§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Corporate Support Officer §      §        §MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it.§        §The Role§        §Our MLC Wealth and Corporate Partnerships team exist to effectively manage relationships for MLC Life Insurance. We are currently looking for a Corporate Support Officer to join the team for a 9 month fixed-term opportunity. §        §In this role, you will provide administrative assistance and general support to the Strategic Partnerships team. A key focus of this role is to help the team grow and retain our partnerships by ensuring we deliver outstanding customer service on all strategic matters.  §        §Your responsibilities will include:§        §          §Assist with preparing and managing account plans for clients, with a focus on business planning, organic growth, claims management & process efficiencies;§          §Resolve client requests on operational matters, including managing escalations;§          §Prepare materials for clients including presentations;§          §Provide data analysis support and monthly/quarterly reporting for clients;§          §Assist with new business and tenders;§          §Proactively ensure we manage risk and meet all compliance & regulatory requirements; and§          §Support the team on product initiatives, improving the member experience and engagement with clients.    §        §        §About You§        §To be successful in this role, you will:§        §          §Have previous experience working in Group Insurance; particularly around how it is structured and the key laws and regulations that impact it; §          §Advanced Excel skills with the ability to analyse data and present it via reports/presentations;§          §Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to communicate at all levels;§          §Exceptional attention to detail and time management skills;§          §Ability to work independently as well as collaborate to achieve business outcomes; and§          §Strong planning, organisation and execution skills. §        §        §Our Purpose§        §MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide almost 1.2 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night.§        §Our purpose is supported by §Our Values§ of §Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High§. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers, partners and each other that defines who we are. §        §Our Strategy§        §Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all of us to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution. §        §With more than 1500 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.§        §Why Choose Us?§        §At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:§        §          §work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality§          §enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution§          §embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer§          §access §CircleIn§ Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents§          §access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and§          §wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to §Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program§, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.§        §        §Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position.§        §.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it.§ §The Role§ §Our MLC Wealth and Corporate Partnerships team exist to effectively manage relationships for MLC Life Insurance. We are currently looking for a Corporate Support Officer to join the team for a 9 month fixed-term opportunity. § §In this role, you will provide administrative assistance and general support to the Strategic Partnerships team. A key focus of this role is to help the team grow and retain our partnerships by ensuring we deliver outstanding customer service on all strategic matters.  § §Your responsibilities will include:§ §Assist with preparing and managing account plans for clients, with a focus on business planning, organic growth, claims management & process efficiencies;§ §Resolve client requests on operational matters, including managing escalations;§ §Prepare materials for clients including presentations;§ §Provide data analysis support and monthly/quarterly reporting for clients;§ §Assist with new business and tenders;§ §Proactively ensure we manage risk and meet all compliance & regulatory requirements; and§ §Support the team on product initiatives, improving the member experience and engagement with clients.    § §About You§ §To be successful in this role, you will:§ §Have previous experience working in Group Insurance; particularly around how it is structured and the key laws and regulations that impact it; § §Advanced Excel skills with the ability to analyse data and present it via reports/presentations;§ §Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to communicate at all levels;§ §Exceptional attention to detail and time management skills;§ §Ability to work independently as well as collaborate to achieve business outcomes; and§ §Strong planning, organisation and execution skills. § §Our Purpose§ §MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide almost 1.2 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night.§ §Our purpose is supported by §Our Values§ of §Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High§. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers, partners and each other that defines who we are. § §Our Strategy§ §Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all of us to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution. § §With more than 1500 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.§ §Why Choose Us?§ §At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:§ §work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality§ §enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution§ §embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer§ §access §CircleIn§ Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents§ §access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and§ §wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to §Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program§, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.§ §Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. jobText: TXT/50721340.txt	§Investigative Data Analyst - Insurance Claims§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investigative Data Analyst - Insurance Claims§§Advertiser: §Suncorp§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Investigative Data Analyst - Insurance Claims §      §        §          §Detect and Deter unmeritorious and exaggerated claims in CTP NSW §          §Assist the Insurance team to effectively manage fraud risk§          §Sydney or Charlestown location§        §        §The Role:§        §The Investigative Data Analyst will drive the development and continual maturity of fraud prevention, detection and response to financial crime within the Insurance function; and will execute a program of work focused on assisting the Insurance function team to effectively manage fraud risk.§        §This is a 12-month contract role. §        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §Play a role in driving cultural change and an increased awareness of fraud management through successful interaction and relationship management with key stakeholders across the Insurance Function§          §Advise and challenge the Insurance function to ensure that claims fraud is appropriately managed§          §Provide technical knowledge and subject matter expertise on operational processes, procedures and business initiatives relating to fraud management including regulatory and group policy change§          §Undertake activities to provide assurance that management of fraud exists, and that fraud management and governance processes are implemented and operating as planned§          §Work in partnership with Intelligence Analysts to direct tactical operations in line with identified fraud risk areas§          §Make assessments and recommendations to the Insurance function in relation to areas where fraud management can be improved (gaps and opportunities)§        §        §Required qualifications/experience:§        §          §Background within Insurance§          §Experience in developing and implementing fraud controls§          §Experience in project delivery and workshop facilitation and building/designing content§        §        §Our Benefits §        §          §Discounts of up to 25% on our various Insurance, Banking & Superannuation products§          §Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§          §Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§          §We offer support and various programs for our people: (Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Employee Referral Program ($600), Facilities for nursing mothers, Years of Service Recognition)§        §        §Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.§        §Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers. and will execute a program of work focused on assisting the Insurance function team to effectively manage fraud risk.§This is a 12-month contract role. §§Key responsibilities:§§Play a role in driving cultural change and an increased awareness of fraud management through successful interaction and relationship management with key stakeholders across the Insurance Function§Advise and challenge the Insurance function to ensure that claims fraud is appropriately managed§Provide technical knowledge and subject matter expertise on operational processes, procedures and business initiatives relating to fraud management including regulatory and group policy change§Undertake activities to provide assurance that management of fraud exists, and that fraud management and governance processes are implemented and operating as planned§Work in partnership with Intelligence Analysts to direct tactical operations in line with identified fraud risk areas§Make assessments and recommendations to the Insurance function in relation to areas where fraud management can be improved (gaps and opportunities)§§Required qualifications/experience:§§Background within Insurance§Experience in developing and implementing fraud controls§Experience in project delivery and workshop facilitation and building/designing content§§Our Benefits §§Discounts of up to 25% on our various Insurance, Banking & Superannuation products§Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§We offer support and various programs for our people: (Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Employee Referral Program ($600), Facilities for nursing mothers, Years of Service Recognition)§§Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.§Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected.  We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers. jobTitle: Senior Clinical Adviser and Claims Auditor Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701621.txt	§Senior Clinical Adviser and Claims Auditor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Clinical Adviser and Claims Auditor§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Annual salary, perm role + 4 recharge days/year§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § §The Opportunity at AIA§ Join AIA’s Health team and make a real difference to peoples lives. Showcase your knowledge in this area and lead a team in this exciting role. § § §About the AIA opportunity § § §As the Senior Clinical Adviser and Claims Auditor you will be a senior leader of the Health team and work alongside the Head of Customer Service. This position can be based in either Melbourne or Sydney.§ § §Key responsibilities include§ § §In this role you will be responsible for measuring and testing procedures with an eye to improving overall efficiency.  You will drive the improvement of processes and systems, quality focus, and implement programs that will have continuing long-term benefits.  With a focus to ensure ongoing productive auditing of hospital, medical and ancillary claims as required you will also:§ §Ownership of Quality Assurance assessors and outcomes driving continuous improvement of processes and systems, ensuring accuracy and compliance§ §Develop and then maintain the AIA Audit Database to enable interrogation of claims data to check validity and identify provider outlier claims§ §Provide accurate advice on relevant clinical coding / DRG and relevant contracting matters to internal and external stakeholders to enable informed decisions to be made on hospital and medical claims payment issues§ §Partner with the Audit Manager to facilitate the audit function according to an agreed audit schedule, this includes priority focus areas, reviewed on a rolling twelve-month basis § § §To be successful in this position, you will have§ §Proven experience working with PHI Hospital and Ancillary claim data§ §Successful completion of recognized Medical Terminology course § §Sound knowledge of DRGs and Casemix funding/models§ §Coding experience with knowledge of ICD-10-AM (11th edition), ACHI & ACS§ §Knowledge of private sector funding models§ §Degree Qualification in Health Information Management (HIM)§ §Able to read and understand claims data and medical records with the ability to determine where inconsistencies and/or outliers have occurred§ §Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language§ §Practical experience with reporting tools (HIBIS, Casemix/Qlickview) and relational data concept§ § §In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:§ §Take your career into a new area§ §Access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills§ §Make a difference in someone’s life every day§ §Work for a business helping millions of Australians every year§ §Access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself§ §Work in a business with no dress code§ §Enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you§ §Work with supportive and inclusive people and managers.§ § §What’s next?§ §If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button!§ §Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.§ §Please note that applications close on Monday 12th October 2020§ § § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  §  § We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§  § We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§  § We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § §You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50716086.txt	§Claims Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Specialists§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Base + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Your Role§ Our Worker’s Compensation team is recruiting Claims Specialists to join our claims teams in a range of areas spanning to claims management to people leadership. We are looking for people with a broad range of skills and attributes to join our team and build a successful career in the personal injury industry with GB. We have both readily available opportunities on offer, as well as future areas of growth in specialised areas.§ §These roles include:§Senior Case Manager §Return to Work and/or Capacity specialists §Eligibility Officers §Team Manager§In these roles, you will be welcomed into our organisation through a comprehensive on-boarding and training program, and build upon your expertise to become a trusted worker’s compensation expert. We’ll work with you to understand your career goals in the areas of leadership, claims based knowledge and strategy, and the personal injury management industry.§ §You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:§Taking the lead in influencing and driving return to work on Worker’s Compensation cases identified at high risk of exceeding expected return to work outcomes §Providing advice and/or assistance to WCV claims staff, employers, workers and treating health practitioners to promote cost effective, durable Return to Work outcomes centred on a customer focused workers compensation claims service. §Liaising with and providing a high level of customer service to injured workers directly with relation to their claim, as well as liaising and building rapport with providers and employers to monitor effective medical treatment programs for injured workers §Utilising and developing effective claims management tools and skills, and working with your wider team of claims management specialists to ensure the delivery of quality service for all §Attending, facilitating and participating in Case Conferencing with GB team members, injured workers and employers §Completing review of entitlement and liability in both the initial liability process and throughout the life of the claim, and communicating a variety of claims based information and outcomes with Worker’s and Employers §Utilising and building upon your range of leadership skills to coach and mentor claims staff, as well as leading teams of claims experts to success in their day to day claims management §Understanding areas of focus and opportunity to build skills and capability within the claims management operation, with a focus on bettering claims management services in line with WorkSafe’s scheme goals and requirements§ §We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:§Work or study in the fields of the Psychology, Law, Social work and/or Allied Health/Health Science, or §Previous insurance or occupational rehabilitation experience §Recent work experience within a customer service focussed role §Exceptional time management and organisational skills and the ability to prioritise your tasks §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a team-player attitude §An aptitude for working within a dynamic, fast paced and challenging environment §If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, but on a day to day you will experience the following:§Staff benefits program with a wide range of discounts on offer §Flexible work hours §Staff referral incentive bonus §Opportunities for ongoing education and development §Service recognition awards to recognise your input to the organisation §Employee assistance program for yourself and your immediate family members §The opportunity to work for an organisation that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program§A brief overview on GB:§ §Gallagher Bassett is Australia’s largest Third Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.§ §Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, employing over 1000 staff.§ §GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!§ §To apply§If this sounds interesting to you – we want to connect!§ §Click on §Apply for this Job.§ § §GB is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as a member of the Diversity Council Australia, we recognize the importance of, and embrace diversity in the workplace.§ §To be considered for this opportunity you must have right to live and work in Australia when applyin§g.§ §Agency applicants will not be considered for this position.§ §§§§§
