jobTitle: Account Executive Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50722767.txt	§Account Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Executive§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§About the role§We are currently seeking an experienced Account Executive to manage a portfolio of corporate and commercial clients for a contractual period of 11 months.  This is a great opportunity to join our high performing Brisbane team with good working environment.  § §Key accountabilities include: §•Maintaining and developing business relationships with new and existing clients§•Describing insurable risk, designing appropriate insurance solutions and negotiating the best deal in the global insurance market§•Developing and maintaining meaningful working relationships with our underwriting partners§•Managing and maintenance of budget, business plan and debtors §•Building a long term pipeline to support New Business growth§§About you§To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate: §•Strong account management experience gained within corporate broking §•Tier 1 Insurance Broking qualification§•Pro-active approach to all aspects of account management and service delivery  §•Highly developed communication and negotiation skills§•Driven and professional disposition with a willingness to contribute to a team environment§ §Why Gallagher§Gallagher is one of Australia’s and the world’s largest insurance broking and risk management companies with over 30,000 employees globally.  We pride ourselves on being a socially responsible, ethical and collaborative organisation expressed through our shared values The Gallagher Way.  We are also proud to be named one of the 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere for the 9th consecutive time as well as being on the Forbes World’s Best Employers list as the only insurance brokerage.§What will we offer§In joining Gallagher, you will have the support of an established team with learning and development available to build your career pathway within our global business. §Additional benefits:§•Competitive remuneration and incentive program§•Salary Income Protection and discounted insurances§•Discounts to major retailers through our Gallagher Rewards scheme§•Flexible working options§How to apply§We encourage you to apply via our careers website. For further information, please contact Maria Siachico, Talent Acquisition Specialist, §+61 2 9424 1734§. §Any offer of employment and subsequent continuing employment is dependent upon the completion of relevant pre-employment background checks. All applicants are required to undergo employment screening through probity checks prior to commencing.§Gallagher is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to the principles of workplace diversity and inclusion. We welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50717028.txt	§National Claims Manager & National Marketing Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Claims Manager & National Marketing Officer§§Advertiser: §Sportscover Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§ §The Company§Sportscover is a world leading specialist sport, fitness and leisure insurer with 34+ years’ experience of providing insurance products specifically designed for sport, fitness and leisure, all backed by first class security.§Sportscover’s point of difference is that the Company and its people are genuinely invested in the health and success of Australian sport and of the sport, fitness and leisure sector. We were the only insurer to provide bushfire recovery grants to community sports clubs earlier this year and the first insurer to provide flexible insurance arrangements for clients impacted by C-19. §Our Company continues, too, to make a substantial contribution to the Australian sports system through our sponsorship and involvement in such strategic initiatives as the National Sports Integrity Forum, the Chairmen’s Round Table for Sport and sponsorship of the Sport Australia Hall of Fame.§The Opportunities§Two cracking opportunities have become available for two full-time, experienced and highly motivated professionals operating out of Sportscover’s Head Office in Mulgrave, Melbourne: National Claims Manager and National Marketing Officer. Be warned though: in addition to your insurance or marketing credentials, you will be assessed on your knowledge of and interest in sport, as these will be central to your attachment to our clients, our Company and the role.§National Claims Manager§Leading the Sportscover Claims Team, you will have significant experience within the insurance claims industry and a thorough understanding of PL, PA and Property claims management to complement your service focused performance. The preferred candidate will have a “can do” attitude, strong leadership and people skills and will appreciate the necessity for quality service and efficient claims settlements. §The challenge of this role is to utilise your exceptional claims and service skills whilst allocating and managing Team workloads to ensure the effective and timely management of claims consistent with Sportscover’s and our Lloyd’s partners’ business objectives, meeting agreed Code of Practice and Company requirements and timelines and within Sportscover’s cultural operating environment. §The primary responsibilities of this position are contained in the detailed PD, available upon request.§National Marketing Officer§This is a fabulous and enjoyable all-round role for a marketer with at least two-three years professional experience. Insurance sector knowledge will be well regarded to enable the appointee to frame and implement creative marketing programs and product campaigns in accordance with regulatory guidelines and compliance obligations.§The Marketing Officer will have prime carriage of Sportscover’s advertising activity and social media platforms. The role also requires a hands-on involvement in the Company’s client hospitality and sponsorship portfolio.§The primary responsibilities of this position are contained in the detailed PD, available upon request.§Ideal candidates for these roles will have:§A highly developed work ethic with a strong sense of achievement; §Be customer and outcomes focused and comfortable being accountable for their decisions;§Have superior written and verbal communication skills;§Be self-motivated and show initiative; and§Undertaken the insurance industry Code of Practice course (mandatory for the Claims role).§To obtain a copy of the relevant PD, please email your request to §simon.allatson@sportscover.com§ [link removed]. If you prefer to have a confidential chat about either role, insurance or sport (or all three), please call Simon on §0410 093 993§. Your resume and covering letter should be sent to the above email address by 31 October 2020.§Please note, applicants must be legally entitled to work in Australia. Agency submissions will not be entertained.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50723412.txt	§Return To Work Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Return To Work Specialist§§Advertiser: §Xchanging§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Workers' Compensation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Return To Work Specialist §    §      §        §About Xchanging§        §Xchanging has been specialising in workers’ compensation claims management for over 16 years and we have an impressive track record of excellence in service delivery and innovation. We aim to return people to work and health as quickly and effectively as possible.§        §By providing the right services at the right time, Xchanging gives employers the confidence they comply with legal and regulatory requirements, and injured workers the confidence they are being well cared for.§        §Xchanging is part of the DXC Technology group of companies, the world’s leading independent, end-to-end next-generation IT services company. DXC employs 155,000 staff globally, of which over 5,000 are insurance practitioners. We work with our customers to build a culture of performance with integrity.§        §About the Role§        §The Return to Work Specialist manages the interventions required to ensure high risk cases achieve the best possible recovery and return to work outcomes.§        §Working closely with case managers, the RTW Specialist will apply their advanced injury and return to work management skills, together with exceptional stakeholder management skills, to achieve optimal outcomes.  We are looking for RTW Specialists who can work out of our CBD or Burwood East offices.§        §To be successful in this role you will have‎:‎§        §          §The ability to gather information from a range of stakeholders to develop effective case management strategies§          §Experience in preparing and attending claims reviews and clinical case conferences to effectively facilitate outcomes§          §Well-developed problem solving and decision-making skills§          §High attention to detail§          §Advanced organisational and planning skills§          §Strong written and verbal communication skills§          §Resilience and perseverance§          §Strong customer service ethic§          §Negotiation and influencing skills§          §Initiative and an innovative approach to case management.§        §        §Required Expertise   §        §          §At least two years' claims management experience in the Victorian workers’ compensation scheme, ideally in return to work case management§          §Knowledge of medical and paramedical terminology and procedures, including the jobText: TXT/50677446.txt	§Claims Quality Assurance Assessor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Quality Assurance Assessor§§Advertiser: §AIA Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Annual salary + 4 recharge days/year§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§Bring your proven quality claims analytical skills to this role and be part of a dedicated team.§§About the AIA opportunity §§In this position as a Claims Quality Assurance Assessor you will be a senior member of the Health team reporting into and working alongside the Senior Manager Continuous Improvement - Health. This permanent position can be based remotely across Australia.§§Key responsibilities include§§As the Claims Quality Assurance Assessor, you will assist to optimize the quality of hospital claims handling and customer claims experience through conducting reviews against agreed standards, priorities and providing feedback to customer service team leaders and the other claims support functions for follow-up action.  This role will also see you: §Support the design and implementation for the ongoing management of a Hospital Claims Quality Framework§Partner with the claims support teams to ensure a consistent and cohesive approach to claims quality across AIA Australia§Support the set up and delivery of a feedback loop and mechanism to effectively communicate outcomes§Ensure quality of data is accurate within the pool of Hospital claims information contributing towards claims leakage focus§Identify and report potential risks identified through Hospital quality checking so that they can be added to the risk register§Ensure the integrity of Hospital claims operations standard letters by contributing to their creation and completing reviews of external communication and internal and external referrals§§To be successful in this position, you will have:§Previous experience within insurance or related industry, with high level of knowledge of product, Hospital claims, medical, system and legislation/regulations impacting private health insurance§Proven Hospital claims assessing experience§Understanding of claims management models and practices§PHI experience and HAMBS experience§Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to address trends in the best interests of the organization§Understanding of performance targets and measurements, and the ability to track and monitor delivery.§§In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:§Take your career into a new area§Access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills§Make a difference in someone’s life every day§Work for a business helping millions of Australians every year§Access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself§Work in a business with no dress code§Enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you§Work with supportive and inclusive people and managers.§§What’s next?§If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button! Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.§Please note that applications close Monday 19th October 2020§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§
